rows.Title: Proximity sensor is not working
rows.Problem: The proximity sensor is not working. If this problem is fixed by updating, then it needs to be updated.
rows.Summarized Problem: The proximity sensor is not working, indicating an abnormal distance sensing state that may be due to hardware damage.
rows.Severity Reason: The sensor failure prevents normal device operation (e.g., screen dimming during calls), making the device unusable in key scenarios.
rows.R&D Comment: According to the log, the distance sense state is abnormal, and the distance sense is suspected to be damaged

rows.Title: Studio App Keeps Stopping after save edit video
rows.Problem: The Studio App crashes when saving changes to a video after editing in the gallery app.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Studio App crashes when saving edited videos.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes during a core function (saving video edits), making it unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: We added defense code to prevent crash in this case. Please check it with app version 7.1.8.0 or later.

rows.Title: System's UI not responding
rows.Problem: System's UI not responding
rows.Summarized Problem: The system's user interface is not responding.
rows.Severity Reason: The UI is completely unresponsive, making the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: ANR occurs in SystemUI due to accessing telephonyManager API in MobileConnectionRepositoryImpl; a try-catch has been applied in UTAH branch (CL#30708369) and will reflect in B OS (OneUI 8.0).

rows.Title: AI generative icon not available in gallery
rows.Problem: unable to see AI generative logo between favorite and edit icon
rows.Summarized Problem: The AI generative icon is missing in the gallery interface, appearing only briefly after a factory reset.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a missing feature that appears intermittently after a reset, indicating partial malfunction rather than complete device failure.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by an unofficial Gallery Labs setting that may trigger app instability; users should avoid using it and reset the setting to disable the feature.

rows.Title: Eye comfort shield doesn't work
rows.Problem: Eye comfort shield doesn't work
rows.Summarized Problem: The eye comfort shield feature does not function while using Samsung Wallet.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature fails to work during use, but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The eye comfort shield is disabled during fingerprint authentication to prevent interference with the optical sensor; this is a known limitation and is addressed by temporarily turning off color modes during authentication.

rows.Title: Recyclebin issue with gallery
rows.Problem: When deleting an image, it does not delete and shows 'can move the file, please try again' with an error acquired message at the bottom of the screen
rows.Summarized Problem: Deleting an image in the gallery does not work and shows an error message instead of confirming deletion or removing the file.
rows.Severity Reason: The deletion function fails entirely, preventing users from removing files, which is a core functionality of file management.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause and countermeasure both point to a version compatibility issue with the My Files app; users must uninstall and reinstall the app to resolve the issue.

rows.Title: Camera issue
rows.Problem: Issue persists after reset and following all given information
rows.Summarized Problem: The rear wide (x1.0) camera is failing to function despite device reset.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera hardware is defective, leading to complete failure of the camera function, rendering a key feature unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: There is a hardware error in the rear wide (x1.0) camera module; please visit CS center to inspect the camera module or related hardware.

rows.Title: screen refresh rate feels unoptimized at 60Hz
rows.Problem: The 60Hz refresh rate is very unoptimized; when switching to 60Hz, it feels like the screen is set to 10-12Hz. It is highly unsatisfactory.
rows.Summarized Problem: The screen refresh rate appears unoptimized at 6sHz, giving a sluggish feel similar to 10-12Hz.
rows.Severity Reason: The user perceives a significant lag and poor responsiveness, making the screen feel unresponsive despite being set to 60Hz, which is a major usability issue.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: PIP Mode not working properly while rotating device
rows.Problem: Inconsistencies in auto rotate and PIP mode animations on a flagship level phone
rows.Summarized Problem: PIP Mode fails to function correctly during device rotation.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a major malfunction in a core display feature during device rotation, leading to inconsistent user experience and potential usability failure.
rows.R&D Comment: No further OS VER 14 release planned. Please check issue on latest OS VER 15 and update accordingly.

rows.Title: Overheating issue
rows.Problem: Phone heats abnormally after using Amazon UPI scan, glitching, and typing is difficult; internet switches from 5G to 24G
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone overheats during Amazon UPI scan usage, causing glitches and impaired typing, with internet connectivity issues.
rows.Severity Reason: The device overheats during specific app usage, leading to system glitches and impaired functionality, making it unusable for core tasks.
rows.R&D Comment: Overheating during Amazon UPI scan is caused by high CPU and network consumption, multiple app launches, and increased battery thermistor readings; countermeasure includes optimizing app resource usage and reducing background activity.

rows.Title: Battery drainage issue
rows.Problem: Battery level rapidly decreased from 7% to 3% without significant usage, dropping to 1% by 4:24 PM despite no major device usage.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences rapid battery drain without significant usage.
rows.Severity Reason: The battery drops to 1% in a short period without device usage, indicating a critical power management failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: AOD not working
rows.Problem: The Always on display is very dim and not visible in normal lighting conditions. When double-tapped to turn on, brightness increases, but otherwise it remains very dim.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Always On Display is too dim and not visible under normal lighting conditions, even when double-tapped to activate.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction of the AOD visibility under normal lighting, but the display still responds to user input and can be activated.
rows.R&D Comment: The AOD brightness is affected by overall display settings and ambient lighting; user can adjust brightness via display settings, but current behavior is suboptimal under normal lighting.

rows.Title: video recording problem
rows.Problem: Video stuttering occurs when switching from 1440P 60 HDR to 2160P 60 HDR; screen recording may not show the stuttering clearly due to playback issues.
rows.Summarized Problem: Video recording stutters when switching from 1440P to 2160P at 60fps, likely due to unsupported resolution playback on the device.
rows.Severity Reason: The device cannot support 2160P 60fps playback, causing visible stuttering that affects video quality and usability during recording.
rows.R&D Comment: The Exynos1380 chipset only supports UHD@30fps; 4K 60fps playback is not supported, and this issue has been reported to Google.

rows.Title: Wi-Fi isn't turning On
rows.Problem: Please check it
rows.Summarized Problem: Wi-Fi is not turning on and the device reports a PCIe link down error.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to establish Wi-Fi connectivity due to a hardware-level PCIe link failure, preventing basic network functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: PCIe link down has been failed with Wi-Fi and AP; customer should contact local service center for FPCB inspection.

rows.Title: Not able to use Notes Functions properly
rows.Problem: When trying to open the notes app and go to drawing option, it doesn't work and automatically reaches the home page
rows.Summarized Problem: The drawing feature in the Notes app fails and automatically returns to the home screen when accessed.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature fails to function entirely upon access, preventing user from using a core functionality of the app.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue fixed in new version. Please wait for the new version of Samsung Notes on market app update will release soon.

rows.Title: Auto restart device but not turn on
rows.Problem: Phone restarts automatically but does not turn on when power is held for longer than usual
rows.Summarized Problem: The device restarts automatically without turning on when the power button is held for an extended period.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to turn on after a restart, making it unusable during the boot process.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Unable to use Keep open Setting
rows.Problem: Unable to keep open more than one application in recent apps on Galaxy M35. This function works on other devices like Galaxy F15 and M53.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot keep more than one app open in recent apps on Galaxy M35, while the same feature works on other devices.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of a feature that works on other devices, indicating inconsistent behavior rather than complete failure or device unusability.
rows.R&D Comment: The current app keep-open limit is based on RAM size; the behavior is defined by system configuration and will be maintained as per existing standards.

rows.Title: Jitter and Lag while scrolling apps
rows.Problem: Scrolling apps causes stutter, jitters, or hangs that last for a second, occurring across all applications including Samsung apps.
rows.Summarized Problem: Scrolling applications causes noticeable jitters and stutters, with each scroll pause lasting one second.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes device unresponsiveness during app navigation, significantly impairing usability across all applications.
rows.R&D Comment: Request for CP silent logs to investigate root cause of scrolling stutter and hang.

rows.Title: Storage not updating after file deletion
rows.Problem: Storage display bug on Samsung M35 5G; storage shows incorrect size after file deletion, corrects after device restart
rows.Summarized Problem: Storage display shows incorrect size after file deletion and only corrects after device restart
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes inconsistent storage display but does not prevent device operation or cause crashes or data loss
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Tap & Pay feature unavailable in Samsung Wallet
rows.Problem: Tap & Pay feature unavailable in Samsung Wallet despite NFC capability
rows.Summarized Problem: The Tap & Pay feature is unavailable in Samsung Wallet despite the device having NFC capability.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely unavailable, preventing a core payment function from working on a device with NFC capability.
rows.R&D Comment: The device lacks DRK support, so Pay card functionality is not supported; the current behavior of the Mini version of Samsung Wallet is maintained as expected behavior.

rows.Title: Device lags while playing any game
rows.Problem: Device lags during gameplay, even with small games like Shadow Fight 4, despite having ample RAM and enabled RAM Plus. Performance degrades under gaming load, especially in multiwindow mode.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device lags significantly when playing games, even small ones, despite having sufficient RAM and performance settings enabled.
rows.Severity Reason: Gameplay lags severely under normal usage, making the device unusable for gaming, which is a core user experience function.
rows.R&D Comment: Device temperature rises during gaming, especially in multiwindow mode; recommend disabling alternate game performance management and playing in cool, well-networked environments.

rows.Title: Battery reducing rapidly
rows.Problem: Battery is reducing by 1 percent every 30 seconds. No apps are running in background, memory is cleaned, device care shows great condition, yet battery is still decreasing.
rows.Summarized Problem: Battery is draining rapidly despite no background apps and clean memory usage.
rows.Severity Reason: Device becomes unusable as battery depletes quickly, leading to sudden shutdowns.
rows.R&D Comment: Voltage has dropped below 3.4V with observed fluctuations; device needs hardware inspection for SOC-voltage mismatch.

rows.Title: Network fluctuating
rows.Problem: Losing signal while using 5G mode and making calls, intermittent connection and data usage issues
rows.Summarized Problem: Users experience intermittent signal loss and connection drops while using 5G mode and making calls.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes frequent disconnections during calls and data usage, leading to device unusability in real-time communication scenarios.
rows.R&D Comment: Require CP silent logs to identify root cause and verify network registration behavior.

rows.Title: Network Issue
rows.Problem: VoLTE not working on A23 4G with BSNL SIM, downgrading to 2G during calls, no internet available. VoLTE works on A14 with BSNL SIM2, but not on A23 with BSNL SIM1. Works when BSNL SIM2 is inserted into A23, fails when BSN or SIM1 is used in A23.
rows.Summarized Problem: VoLTE is not functioning on the A23 device with BSNL SIMs, resulting in downgrade to 2G and loss of internet during calls, despite working on other devices and SIMs.
rows.Severity Reason: VoLTE failure leads to complete loss of internet and call quality, rendering the device unusable for communication and data services during calls.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Bug report Captured popup appeared in watch repeatedly
rows.Problem: Error reports appear repeatedly on Galaxy Watch4 indicating the report will be sent to mobile, but it is not actually sent. User experience with Samsung support is poor.
rows.Summarized Problem: A popup appears repeatedly on the Galaxy Watch4 indicating a bug report will be sent to mobile, but the report is not actually sent.
rows.Severity Reason: The popup appears repeatedly and misleads users about report status, but does not cause device malfunction or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The popup is part of normal behavior when sending accessory logs from Samsung Members; it is a normal display during log acquisition.

rows.Title: GPS is not working
rows.Problem: GPS is not working. I tried all the troubleshooting steps, but no success.
rows.Summarized Problem: GPS functionality is not working after last month, despite attempted troubleshooting.
rows.Severity Reason: GPS failure prevents core navigation and location-based features, making the device unusable for essential functions.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause and countermeasure both point to the need for CP silent logs for further investigation.

rows.Title: Suttle vibration when increasing or decreasing volume
rows.Problem: Suttle vibration when increasing or decreasing volume to extreme high or low, which sometimes does not work after December update on A55. Cannot provide video proof as vibration is not visible in recordings.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users experience subtle vibration when adjusting volume to extreme levels, with the issue intermittently failing after the December update on A55.
rows.Severity Reason: The vibration issue occurs during volume adjustment but does not completely disable functionality, and is intermittent rather than causing device failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is linked to missing logs during volume extremes; if it reoccurs, users must provide logs immediately after the event to enable further analysis.

rows.Title: haptic feedback vibration is low
rows.Problem: the haptic feedback vibration on my s21fe exynos is very low as compared before the update
rows.Summarized Problem: The haptic feedback vibration on the device has become significantly weaker after a recent software update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects a core sensory feedback function but does not cause device failure or data loss, and is partially mitigated by software updates.
rows.R&D Comment: Logs show no abnormalities; likely hardware motor defect. Recommend checking and replacing the haptic motor.

rows.Title: Poor Network warnings popup during online gaming
rows.Problem: Ping issues occur during online games like Free Fire and BGMI, despite stable network connection and good ping on other devices. Game shows 'Poor Network' warning even when actual network performance is good.
rows.Summarized Problem: Online games show 'Poor Network' warnings despite stable and low ping, indicating a discrepancy between actual network performance and the device's network assessment.
rows.Severity Reason: The device incorrectly flags network conditions as poor during gameplay, leading to user frustration and disruption of gaming experience, which is a critical function for users.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Camera Failed popup
rows.Problem: please find pic of the issue along with system log
rows.Summarized Problem: A failure popup appears when using the camera.
rows.Severity Reason: The popup indicates a critical hardware error during video operation, causing device malfunction.
rows.R&D Comment: Hardware error logs show failure in dqbuf video operation; further investigation needed

rows.Title: Screen freeze error
rows.Problem: Screen freezing occurs even after reset, cache clearing, and storage deletion; no third-party apps installed.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device screen freezes despite device reset, cache clearing, and storage deletion.
rows.Severity Reason: The screen freezing prevents normal device operation, making the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Touch I2C signal failure likely due to defective OCTA panel or main board; recommend replacing OCTA first, then main board if symptoms persist.

rows.Title: Sound not coming in recorded video
rows.Problem: Unable to hear sound after recording video
rows.Summarized Problem: No sound is heard during video recording
rows.Severity Reason: The user cannot hear any audio during video recording, which renders the recording function incomplete and unusable
rows.R&D Comment: Modify the "va-mic-mono-lpi" and "speaker-dmic-endfire" controls to make them compatible

rows.Title: Lagging during game play in low graphics
rows.Problem: Lag and heat issue on Samsung phone while playing short term games in low graphics, resulting in choppy, slow performance and overheating
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences lag, choppiness, and overheating when playing short-term games in low graphics settings.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes unresponsive and overheats during gameplay, leading to performance degradation and potential instability.
rows.R&D Comment: Lag and overheating occur due to high initial temperature and voice call usage during gaming; mitigation includes cooling the device and managing background apps and in-game voice chat.

rows.Title: Can't change the password of App timer in digital wellbeing application
rows.Problem: I can't change the password of "App timer" in digital wellbeing application because I forgot the password. There's no option to re-set it, all it's showing is to contact the customer care service. But the customer care service is asking to go on a physical Samsung service centre.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot reset the password for the App Timer feature in the Digital Wellbeing app due to lack of a password recovery option.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents password reset but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss; users are directed to a physical service center, indicating a workaround exists.
rows.R&D Comment: Users can use the master pin code (51028 for version 5.1.02.8) to access the app; a password retrieval function is planned for the next version.

rows.Title: Fast charging stop working
rows.Problem: Phone does not detect charger initially, only detects after multiple plug-in attempts, and charges slowly taking about 4 hours to fully charge.
rows.Summarized Problem: Fast charging fails to initiate and only works after multiple plug-in attempts, resulting in slow charging.
rows.Severity Reason: Device fails to detect charger properly and charges extremely slowly, making it unusable for daily use.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause and countermeasure both indicate that the phone does not log charger connection events; guide customer to collect logs during charging to diagnose issue.

rows.Title: usb device not recognise error during call
rows.Problem: usb device not recognise error during call. After making a call, usb device not recognise error occurs. After cutting the call, ethernet adapter works again. Please fix in s23
rows.Summarized Problem: USB device fails to recognise during calls, working normally when not in a call.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue occurs during active calls, rendering a key peripheral function inoperable during use, which disrupts user experience and device usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause and countermeasure both state that no further OS VER 14 release is planned, and users should check latest OS VER 15. This indicates a software compatibility issue requiring OS update validation.

rows.Title: Drawing does not work in notes app widget
rows.Problem: Drawing does not work in notes app widget. This happens always.
rows.Summarized Problem: Drawing functionality is not working in the notes app widget and occurs consistently.
rows.Severity Reason: The drawing function is completely non-functional and fails every time, making the feature unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue fixed in new version. Please wait new version of Samsung Notes on market app update will release soon. Thank you

rows.Title: Photo Editor Not Functioning Properly
rows.Problem: Issue with Samsung Photo Editor Not Functioning Properly
rows.Summarized Problem: The photo editor fails to function properly due to issues during the restoration of analyzed photo data when switching devices.
rows.Severity Reason: The photo editor does not work correctly during device switching, but it is not completely non-functional or causing device crash or data loss.
rows.Resolve Type: Issue Fixed(Fixed automatically by Main branch)
rows.R&D Comment: The issue during restoration of analyzed photo data has been resolved; users are advised that analyzed information is not automatically deleted upon device switch.

rows.Title: Rear camera slow to start
rows.Problem: Rear camera is slow to start after recent update; front camera works fine
rows.Summarized Problem: The rear camera is slow to start after a recent software update, while the front camera functions normally.
rows.Severity Reason: The rear camera fails to start promptly, which is a major functional failure impacting core device usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Camera initialization timeout due to failed Fast AEC and connection timeout. Countermeasure: User should clear camera data/cache and reset settings; if issue persists, share boot-time logs for further analysis.

rows.Title: No network problem occurs in device after recent update
rows.Problem: After my recent system update, my phone faces no network and no SIM for 1-3 minutes, and this repeats 4-5 times per hour
rows.Summarized Problem: The device fails to register network and SIM after a system update, with repeated occurrences every hour.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes the device to lose network connectivity repeatedly, making it unusable for basic communication functions.
rows.R&D Comment: Provide CP silent logs for the issue to identify root cause and verify network registration failure.

rows.Title: Mobile phone is still lagging or froze
rows.Problem: Phone getting slow and suddenly restarting. Then heating up. Cpu temperature going around and above 70°C
rows.Summarized Problem: The mobile phone is experiencing lag, sudden restarts, and overheating due to high CPU temperature.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is freezing and restarting, leading to instability and potential data loss or hardware damage.
rows.R&D Comment: There are multiple kernel panics on different call stacks, requiring hardware inspection.

rows.Title: Video player is unresponsive when trying to generate slow-motion video
rows.Problem: My Galaxy Tab S10 video player is unresponsive when attempting to generate slow-motion video clips from existing footage
rows.Summarized Problem: The video player crashes or becomes unresponsive when trying to generate slow-motion video clips.
rows.Severity Reason: The device crashes during video encoding, making the feature unusable and preventing users from completing the task.
rows.R&D Comment: Invalid memory access in buffer copying during video encoding causes crash; further investigation needed

rows.Title: latency between video and sound on every app
rows.Problem: When playing something while connected to Bluetooth headphones, there is latency between video and sound on every app, with videos lagging for a second and audio delay starting. The issue persists after wiping system cache and performing factory reset on both device and headphones. Headphones work fine on other devices.
rows.Summarized Problem: There is a noticeable latency between video and audio on all apps when using Bluetooth headphones.
rows.Severity Reason: The latency causes a mismatch between video and audio playback, making content playback unusable and disrupting user experience across all apps.
rows.R&D Comment: A2DP delay observed in logs; recommend checking Bluetooth Metronome settings in SoundAssistant app.

rows.Title: Wrist detection on Watch 4 is broken
rows.Problem: Wrist detection on the Watch 4 device is broken after the One UI 6 update
rows.Summarized Problem: Wrist detection on the Galaxy Watch 4 is no longer functioning after the One UI 6 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to detect wrist presence, which is essential for basic functionality like wake-up and notifications, making it unusable without proper wear detection.
rows.R&D Comment: Wrist detection failure is due to non-contact of electrode sensor; recommend checking for foreign matter or visiting a service center for electrode sensor inspection.

rows.Title: camera captured blurry image with poor focus while scanning documents
rows.Problem: camera captures blurry images with poor focus when scanning documents, affecting image clarity and accuracy
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera produces blurry and poorly focused images when scanning documents.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera fails to capture clear images of documents, making scanning functionality unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: When capturing close and slanted objects with a large image sensor, lens design can lead to poor focus; customers should be guided to stay farther away and use zoom.

rows.Title: Pro video mode 9:21 ratio results in elongated video
rows.Problem: When using pro video mode with 9:21 ratio and UHD 60fps, the recorded video appears elongated, making objects look stretched (e.g., 5cm appears as 8cm), which degrades video quality.
rows.Summarized Problem: Video recorded in pro video mode with 9:21 ratio appears elongated, distorting object sizes and degrading video quality.
rows.Severity Reason: The distortion causes significant visual degradation, making the video unusable for accurate representation.
rows.R&D Comment: Margins not calculated properly for UHD60 9_21 mode; further investigation needed

rows.Title: Unable to change wallpaper
rows.Problem: Unable to change lock screen
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot change their lock screen wallpaper.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is partially non-functional, preventing users from customizing their lock screen but does not cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause and countermeasure both indicate no further OS 14 release planned; recommend checking on OS 15 for resolution.

rows.Title: TITLE not showing while playing the video
rows.Problem: After updating the app, the video title is not showing while playing the video. Previously it was working normally without any issues. After the latest updates, many problems occurred.
rows.Summarized Problem: The video title does not appear when playing videos, especially when the video is not accessed through Gallery or MyFiles on Android 14.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects video playback functionality but does not prevent the video from playing or cause device crash or data loss, only impacting metadata visibility.
rows.R&D Comment: The video title is not shown when not called by Gallery or MyFiles from Android 14; further investigation needed

rows.Title: frame drop issue when switch to 2160p hdr 60 fps on youtube
rows.Problem: frame drop issue when switch to 2160p hdr 60 fps on youtube
rows.Summarized Problem: YouTube experiences frame drops when switching to 2160p HDR at 60fps playback.
rows.Severity Reason: The device cannot support 2160p at 60fps due to chipset limitations, causing frame drops that make video playback unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by YouTube selecting an unsupported 4K 60fps resolution; the device supports only UHD at 30fps, and this is a YouTube-side defect reported to Google.

rows.Title: Camera captured hazy effect image on 10X zoom
rows.Problem: Camera on 10x zoom shows hazy effect, very irritating. Send photo to camera developers to fix.
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera produces a hazy image when using 10x zoom, affecting image clarity and user experience.
rows.Severity Reason: The hazy image at 10x zoom significantly degrades image quality, making photos unusable and causing user frustration.
rows.Resolve Type: Product Requirement, UX Guide, Standard Technical Specification
rows.R&D Comment: The hazy effect during 10x zoom is due to reduced angle of view and light variation; the issue persists across lens conditions and color monochromatic images, requiring a camera module and lens optimization.

rows.Title: Phone battery is draining fast
rows.Problem: My phone battery is draining fast than before after installing the december software update
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone's battery is draining faster than before after the December software update.
rows.Severity Reason: The battery drain is noticeable but not causing device failure or complete malfunction, and it is triggered by a software update.
rows.R&D Comment: Device log is insufficient for analysis; further tracking and logs needed to confirm root cause.

rows.Title: Phone getting lags
rows.Problem: Phone has input lags, app loading time delays, jitters and stutters during normal usage.
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone experiences significant input lag, jitters, and stutters during normal usage, affecting overall responsiveness.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes unresponsive and difficult to use due to severe input lag and stutters, which impair basic functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Lag caused by power saving mode and third-party VPN app ANR; countermeasure is to disable the VPN and disable power saving mode.

rows.Title: 5G network takes considerable time to connect after turning on the mobile data
rows.Problem: 5G network takes considerable time to connect after turning on the mobile data
rows.Summarized Problem: The device takes a long time to connect to 5G after turning on mobile data.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a delay in 5G connection, which affects usability but does not cause device crash or complete failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Lag While Recording video
rows.Problem: Lag while recording video happening in every s23 i own after the november patch update
rows.Summarized Problem: Video recording experiences lag after the November patch update on all S23 devices.
rows.Severity Reason: The lag during recording prevents smooth video capture, which is a core camera function and affects usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause and countermeasure both point to the need for CP silent logs for further investigation.

rows.Title: wifi Calling not working
rows.Problem: I tried all the options you suggested. Nothing has helped. I am uploading video of issue. Please have a look. This is consistent issue and causing lot of inconvenience.
rows.Summarized Problem: WiFi calling is not working on the device and has caused significant user inconvenience.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents a core communication function from working, making the device unusable for calls in certain scenarios.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Imobile app keep crashing
rows.Problem: iMobile app crashes every time when trying to login, started after last security patch update on Samsung Galaxy S23
rows.Summarized Problem: The iMobile app crashes repeatedly during login attempts on Samsung Galaxy S23 after a security patch update.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes during login, which is a critical function, making the user unable to access banking services.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by the third-party iMobile app and requires action from the app developer; no root cause is identifiable in the Samsung framework.

rows.Title: Camera zooming produces painted or crayon-like images
rows.Problem: Photo quality appears painted or like crayons when zooming out
rows.Summarized Problem: Camera produces painted or crayon-like images when zooming in.
rows.Severity Reason: The image quality issue during zooming severely affects user experience and makes photos unrecognizable, rendering the camera function unreliable.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Zoom function introduces texture artifacts; Countermeasure: Improve image processing algorithm during zoom to reduce painted/crayon-like appearance.

rows.Title: Home Page getting changed Automatically
rows.Problem: Customer upgraded the OS to the latest version, which is Jan 2025, but the issue still persists. I've attached a screen recording and logs for the same which was taken within 5-10 mins of the occurrence of the issue. Please let me know if any further details are needed.
rows.Summarized Problem: The home page is changing automatically after OS upgrade, disrupting user experience.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a functional malfunction in the home screen behavior, but does not cause device freeze or data loss, and is triggered by OS upgrade rather than critical failure.
rows.Resolve Type: Product Requirement, UX Guide, Standard Technical Specification
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is due to the 'Add to Home' UX concept not placing apps on the home page when space is available; the same concept is proposed as a countermeasure.

rows.Title: Unable to update S wallet App
rows.Problem: Samsung wallet couldn't update and there are so many bugs in it
rows.Summarized Problem: Samsung Wallet app fails to update and has multiple bugs.
rows.Severity Reason: The app fails to update and has multiple bugs, which prevents proper functionality of a core payment feature.
rows.R&D Comment: User installed Samsung Pass manually on a device that does not support it; recommend uninstalling related apps to resolve the issue.

rows.Title: Tap biometric option in security and privacy causes phone restart
rows.Problem: Touching biometric option in security and privacy causes phone to restart multiple times
rows.Summarized Problem: Tapping the biometric option in security and privacy triggers repeated phone restarts.
rows.Severity Reason: The device restarts repeatedly, making it unusable during the interaction with the biometric feature.
rows.R&D Comment: Root cause not identifiable with current logs; requires complete RDX logs for analysis.

rows.Title: system UI stop popup occur in device
rows.Problem: automatically stopped
rows.Summarized Problem: The system UI frequently stops and shows a popup on the device.
rows.Severity Reason: The system UI crashing leads to device instability and disrupts core device functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: ANR occurs in SystemUI due to accessing telephonyManager API in MobileConnectionRepositoryImpl; a try-catch has been applied in UTAH branch, but not in PROD_UTAH due to critical patch policy; changes will reflect in B OS (OneUI 8.0).

rows.Title: Unable to access document session in My Files
rows.Problem: Unable to access the document session within My Files
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot access document sessions stored in My Files, particularly when loading files from Google Drive.
rows.Severity Reason: The error causes a crash during file loading from Google Drive, preventing users from accessing their documents, which renders a core functionality unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Error occurs during Google Drive file loading; quick fix involves signing out and back in or disabling cloud file categorization; update will include a code fix.

rows.Title: Camera stop working
rows.Problem: Camera is not working suddenly
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera has suddenly stopped working, likely due to a hardware failure in the sensor or connection.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera is a core functionality that suddenly stops working, making the device unusable for basic operations.
rows.R&D Comment: Power on camera failed; sensor open failure indicates hardware fault. Recommendation: Reboot device and, if issue persists, send to SS center for hardware inspection.

rows.Title: Fingerprint sensor not working
rows.Problem: After updating to UI 6.1, the fingerprint sensor is not working. The user has tried registering the fingerprint multiple times but still cannot use it.
rows.Summarized Problem: The fingerprint sensor is not working after a software update to UI 6.1.
rows.Severity Reason: The user cannot authenticate using biometrics, which is a core security function, making the device unusable for access control.
rows.R&D Comment: Fingerprint recognition may fail due to poor quality caused by protective films or thick, directional patterns affecting light transmission.

rows.Title: Wifi & Hotspot is Not working in device
rows.Problem: When I click on the wifi or Hotspot to turn it on, it brightens up a little and then stops. Long pressing and going to settings also causes it to stop in the middle. Same behavior with Bluetooth.
rows.Summarized Problem: WiFi and Hotspot fail to turn on and freeze mid-operation, with the same issue observed on Bluetooth.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to establish WiFi connection and freezes during initialization, preventing basic connectivity functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: WLAN driver loading failure suspected to be a hardware issue within the WiFi chipset; requires HW inspection at a CS center.

rows.Title: Drag and drop for text from browser not working
rows.Problem: Drag and drop for text from browser not working
rows.Summarized Problem: Drag and drop functionality for text from browser is not working.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is partially malfunctioning as text drag and drop only fails in specific third-party apps, not affecting overall device usability.
rows.R&D Comment: This issue is caused because Google Docs does not accept text drop from Samsung Internet. This is a third-party app issue. Please maintain current status.

rows.Title: Fingerprint sensor not working
rows.Problem: Fingerprint sensor not working
rows.Summarized Problem: The fingerprint sensor is not functioning properly due to poor image quality, possibly caused by a thick protective film.
rows.Severity Reason: The fingerprint sensor is a critical biometric function; failure prevents secure device access and renders the device unusable for authentication.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by poor image quality from the fingerprint sensor, likely due to thick protective film; a countermeasure is to advise customers to check the sensor at service centers without protective film.

rows.Title: Unable to connect eSIM in watch
rows.Problem: Please check screen recording
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot connect to eSIM on the watch, with no profile downloaded or detected in device logs.
rows.Severity Reason: The device shows no eSIM profile and has never attempted to download one, making eSIM functionality completely unavailable.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause and countermeasure both indicate that the user did not download an eSIM profile; the issue is user-side operation, not device malfunction.

rows.Title: Camera is not working
rows.Problem: Front and back camera including torch is not working; torch shows cannot turn on because light is being used by another app
rows.Summarized Problem: The front and back camera systems and torch are not functioning, with the torch unable to activate due to another app using the light.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera system is completely non-functional, including the torch, which prevents core device usage and interaction.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause and countermeasure both point to the need for CP silent logs for further investigation.

rows.Title: Mouse cannot resize any apps in multi-window mode
rows.Problem: The Mouse cannot resize any apps in multi-window mode. The click instead registers on the app/objects in the background. This causes major inconvenience when working with multiple apps. This issue happens with all apps. There is no issue with the window buttons and moving the entire window. A screen recording is attached where it clearly shows any attempts to resize the window fail, and instead the home screen scrolls.
rows.Summarized Problem: The mouse fails to resize apps in multi-window mode, with clicks instead registering on background elements and causing the home screen to scroll.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents effective app management in multi-window mode, rendering the feature unusable for practical tasks.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue has been fixed in the latest binary.

rows.Title: Captured Images look dull and there is lack of focus in the photo
rows.Problem: Photos taken on Samsung f55 look dull and lack focus compared to Redmi k50i, under same lighting and distance. Dullness is visible in pink and brown colors of headphone.
rows.Summarized Problem: Photos taken on the Samsung f55 appear dull and lack focus, especially in pink and brown colors, under consistent lighting and distance conditions.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects image clarity and color accuracy, but does not cause device malfunction or crash, and is visible only in specific color tones under standard conditions.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Color rendering and focus issues in camera sensor; Countermeasure: Normal phenomenon as per existing documentation.

rows.Title: Dolby Atmos sound has broken after update
rows.Problem: Dolby Atmos sound has broken after the 6.1.1 AI update on S23 Ultra. Before the update, the sound felt excellent; after the update, it is noticeably weaker and not as loud as before. Many users are reporting this issue, and no fix has been provided despite customer outreach.
rows.Summarized Problem: Dolby Atmos sound quality has degraded after the 6.1.1 AI update on S23 Ultra, resulting in significantly weaker audio output compared to pre-update performance.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects audio performance but does not cause device crash or data loss, and users can still use other sound modes.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is due to a change in Dolby Atmos effect settings; customers can now select their preferred mode (Dolby Auto/Movie/Music or Dolby Off) to restore sound experience.

rows.Title: Google play system update failed
rows.Problem: Google play system update failed error
rows.Summarized Problem: The Google Play system update fails and prompts the user to re-enter credentials.
rows.Severity Reason: The update failure causes the device to require repeated credential entry, potentially leading to device unusability or lockout.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Sound Picker keeps stopping
rows.Problem: Not solved my problem
rows.Summarized Problem: The sound picker feature keeps stopping unexpectedly.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes with a NullPointerException, preventing users from accessing sound settings, making the feature unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause and countermeasure both indicate a NullPointerException in sound picker fragment; solution applied in V OS via CL#30191070.

rows.Title: Lines appear while taking video
rows.Problem: 2 lines appear while taking video
rows.Summarized Problem: Lines appear during video recording.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue occurs during video recording, which is a core functionality, and involves visible visual artifacts that impair user experience.
rows.R&D Comment: The failure is due to a camera sensor hardware fault; please visit nearest Samsung support center for further help.

rows.Title: Mobile Data is Not working
rows.Problem: Mobile data is on but no network symbol. Tried phone restart, network reset, airplane mode, sim tray eject and insert, but no network connection. Same issue occurred previously with new sim and same number.
rows.Summarized Problem: Mobile data is active but shows no network symbol, despite multiple troubleshooting steps.
rows.Severity Reason: Device fails to establish a network connection, rendering mobile data unusable despite being enabled.
rows.R&D Comment: No disconnection observed in logs; data call response indicates connection, but no network symbol — suggests a UI or radio layer inconsistency; further investigation needed

rows.Title: Unable to Update sleep tracking
rows.Problem: Sleep tracking is gone haywire with missing hours and incorrect start and end times. Heart rate data is also missing. Actual sleep start at 2:30am but watch detects at 4:00am. End time is off by 30 minutes.
rows.Summarized Problem: Sleep tracking is inaccurate with incorrect start and end times and missing heart rate data.
rows.Severity Reason: The sleep tracking function is completely off, leading to incorrect data and potential misinterpretation of user health metrics.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: AI chat assistance is not working
rows.Problem: AI chat assistance is not working on Samsung Messages after an update. Tried clearing cache and restarting, but issue persists.
rows.Summarized Problem: AI chat assistance in Samsung Messages is not working after an update, despite attempts to clear cache and restart the device.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely non-functional after an update, preventing users from using a core assistant function, making the device less usable.
rows.R&D Comment: No further OS VER 14 release planned. Please check issue on latest OS VER 15 and update accordingly.

rows.Title: Unable to find Good Lock App in Galaxy Store
rows.Problem: I can't find Good Lock app on the Galaxy Store. I want to use it as it is very useful and as a Samsung user I would love to use the features which Good Lock app holds. But when I search for it on the Galaxy Store it's not available there. Please fix this problem.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Good Lock app is not available on the Galaxy Store for the user's region.
rows.Severity Reason: The app is missing from the store due to regional restrictions, which prevents users from accessing a useful feature, but does not cause device malfunction or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The Good Lock app is not available in the user's region due to regional restrictions, and the team plans to expand availability globally in the future.

rows.Title: Network reception issue with BSNL 4G
rows.Problem: Samsung Galaxy S24 FE has poor 4G network reception on BSNL SIM, while other brands like iPhone and Motorola offer better reception at the same location and same SIM.
rows.Summarized Problem: Samsung Galaxy S24 FE has poor 4G network reception on BSN
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial network performance failure, not complete device malfunction or data loss, but affects user experience in a specific network condition.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Battery drain in normal usage
rows.Problem: Battery usage summary shows 53% consumption in a day, but sum of individual app battery usage adds up to only 29.3%. This suggests unlisted background processes or activities are causing additional drain.
rows.Summarized Problem: The battery usage summary shows a significant discrepancy between total consumption and sum of individual app usage, indicating unlisted background processes are causing excessive drain.
rows.Severity Reason: The discrepancy suggests partial malfunction in battery usage reporting, but device remains functional and user can still use the device normally.
rows.R&D Comment: Battery usage may differ from the sum of individual app usage due to unlisted system processes and low-usage apps; this is normal operation based on concept.

rows.Title: Camera quality degraded after Update
rows.Problem: Camera photos show poor quality, especially in low light with zoom, due to night mode algorithm reducing noise which causes stars to appear shaky and misaligned.
rows.Summarized Problem: Camera photos degrade in low light with zoom due to night mode algorithm causing stars to appear shaky and misaligned.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects photo quality in specific conditions but does not cause device crash or complete failure, and is tied to a specific feature setting.
rows.R&D Comment: Night mode algorithm in low-light zoom causes star shake due to noise reduction; countermeasure is already proposed in customer response.

rows.Title: Volte does not latch in BSNL SIM
rows.Problem: No composer or file upload option available, but background logging occurs. VoLTE works with 4G BSNL SIM but fails with 5G BSNL SIM. Flight mode toggling does not resolve the issue.
rows.Summarized Problem: VoLTE fails to register on BSNL 5G SIM but works on 4G SIM, indicating a network registration issue specific to 5G.
rows.Severity Reason: VoLTE is a core network function; failure to register renders voice calls unusable on 5G, impacting primary communication capability.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause and countermeasure both point to the need for CP silent logs to diagnose the registration failure.

rows.Title: Camera not working
rows.Problem: Camera is not working after device update
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera is not working after a device update.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera is a major function that is completely non-operational after an update, rendering the device unusable for key tasks.
rows.R&D Comment: There are not enough logs to find root cause for this issue. Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Unable to Add Phone Number in Profile Sharing Card
rows.Problem: The phone number cannot be added for profile card sharing
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot add phone numbers when sharing profile cards.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents phone number input during profile sharing but does not completely disable the feature or cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: USIM information is incorrect, leading to failure in retrieving phone numbers; need to verify USIM status.

rows.Title: Phone heats up after rough usage of camera
rows.Problem: Phone heats up during camera usage, especially with continuous on/off cycling, 5G data usage, and package usage. Temperature rises to 39-40 degrees, which is under spec. Thermal management system is working fine.
rows.Summarized Problem: Phone heats up during continuous camera usage due to on/off cycling and high data usage, with temperature rise under specified limits.
rows.Severity Reason: Temperature rise is within specifications and thermal management system is functioning properly, indicating no device-wide instability or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Thermal management system is working fine; temperature rise under spec due to camera on/off and 5G usage.

rows.Title: Not able to play 4k content on phone
rows.Problem: Using Z Fold 5 with Netflix 4K UHD plan but unable to play 4K content despite software and app updates
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot play 4K content on their phones even with a 4K UHD Netflix plan and updated software.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to render 4K content, which is a core functionality for media consumption, making the experience unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue is irreproducible on our end; no widevine errors in logs. Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Theme not applying fully in dark mode
rows.Problem: Theme does not apply fully when dark mode is enabled or disabled; user reports inconsistent theme display and long wait time for resolution
rows.Summarized Problem: The theme does not apply fully when dark mode is enabled or disabled, resulting in inconsistent appearance across the device.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents consistent user experience and visual functionality across the device, making the interface appear incorrect or broken.
rows.R&D Comment: When dark mode is applied, theme resources are not applied; users cannot apply dark mode and theme resources together, and guidance is needed to avoid this conflict.

rows.Title: Network reception issue
rows.Problem: Device has network reception issue with 4G frequency bands 700MHz and 2100MHz; Samsung models show this issue, while other brands like Motorola and iPhone have better software-based network reception; suggests software fix needed.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device has poor network reception on 4G frequency bands 700MHz and 2100MHz, indicating a software-related issue that needs correction.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects core network functionality and is present across multiple Samsung models, impacting device usability in real-world conditions.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue caused by device operating in LTE RAT; requires modem logs for detailed analysis to determine root cause and software fix.

rows.Title: Both Front and Back Camera not working
rows.Problem: My camera isn't functioning (both front and back) since the last few hours. I have tried all the necessary methods such as clearing the storage data, restarting, etc., but to no avail.
rows.Summarized Problem: Both front and back cameras are not functioning after several attempts to resolve the issue.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera function is completely failed across both front and back cameras, rendering the device unable to capture images or video.
rows.R&D Comment: Camera module fault detected in logs; requires hardware inspection and repair.

rows.Title: unable to draw small circles using capacitive stylus
rows.Problem: Cannot draw small circles using capacitive stylus. It reads as a dot or a long press. There is also excessive touch lag. The stylus works fine with all other devices. Small dots in video are attempts to draw small circle.
rows.Summarized Problem: The capacitive stylus fails to accurately draw small circles, instead registering as dots or long presses, with noticeable touch lag.
rows.Severity Reason: The stylus fails to perform basic drawing functionality, which is essential for note-taking, leading to a major usability issue.
rows.Resolve Type: Product Requirement, UX Guide, Standard Technical Specification
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Unable to add widgets
rows.Problem: Unable to add widgets attaching recording
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot add widgets, specifically when attaching recording functionality.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from adding widgets, which is a core functionality in the device interface, leading to a major usability failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Launcher code has been updated and fix to prevent NameNotFoundException when loading application info in widget list

rows.Title: No Compatible display error occurs while trying to connect via dex
rows.Problem: Here is the screen recording you asked
rows.Summarized Problem: Users encounter a 'no compatible display' error when attempting to connect their device via Samsung DeX.
rows.Severity Reason: The error prevents successful display connection but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss; it is a partial malfunction during setup.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Unable to Set Routine Wallpaper
rows.Problem: Unable to set routine-based wallpaper in the Modes & Routines app, despite trying updates, restarts, and permission checks.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot set a routine-based wallpaper in the Modes & Routines app.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of a key feature (routine wallpaper), preventing full functionality but not rendering the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by an error in data management during wallpaper application and restoration, and has been addressed in the Wallpaper & Style app version 2.5.29 with a data clearing recommendation.

rows.Title: Can't open RINGTONES to change it
rows.Problem: I did everything you said but I'm still facing the same issue: Can't open RINGTONES to change it
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot open the RINGTONES section to modify sound settings.
rows.Severity Reason: Users are unable to access a core sound setting, preventing them from personalizing device functionality, which renders the feature unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Fixed with commit id a3603c2d8e9abab65545a5b9c6142f500019a680; NullPointerException was thrown while accessing internal routine, prevention code added and delivered with V OS deployment.

rows.Title: Game Performance Lag
rows.Problem: Lag and frame drops during game play, with slow touch responses
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences lag, frame drops, and slow touch responses during gameplay.
rows.Severity Reason: Gameplay is severely impacted by lag and unresponsive touch, making it difficult to use the device for gaming.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue reproduction and logging required to identify root cause; further investigation needed

rows.Title: Unable to upload images to any website using chrome browser
rows.Problem: Images are greyed out and unable to select images or files to upload. Unable to download files or pdfs using native download manager from any app it says download unsuccessful.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot select images to upload or download files using the native download manager.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial functionality failure in media selection and download, but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: We are unable to reproduce the issue. Further analysis is difficult without timely logs and reproduction. Requesting user to clear app data and retry on a stable network.

rows.Title: Video in YouTube going back to portrait mode after leaving
rows.Problem: Video in YouTube going back to portrait mode after leaving the app, even when landscape is set.
rows.Summarized Problem: YouTube video orientation resets from landscape to portrait when the user leaves and returns to the app.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes inconsistent behavior in video playback orientation but does not render the app unusable or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: We have checked the issue in the latest binary, but the issue didn't reproduce at our end. The exact root cause is not clear from the provided logs.

rows.Title: Wallpaper freezing when phone is open
rows.Problem: Wallpaper freezes when phone is completely open and restores when opened or closed
rows.Summarized Problem: The wallpaper freezes when the phone is open and returns to normal when the phone is opened or closed.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes intermittent display malfunction but does not prevent device usage or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue occurs on OS VER 14; recommend checking on latest OS VER 15 and update accordingly.

rows.Title: phone got automatically reset
rows.Problem: My phone was getting reset multiple times from last 2 days my phone got automatically reset 30 to 40 times. While opening and using phone .
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone is experiencing frequent automatic resets, occurring up to 40 times in two days, during normal use.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is resetting repeatedly, which renders it unusable and indicates a critical system failure or hardware defect.
rows.R&D Comment: Hardware defects such as AP can cause these problems; it is necessary to check for hardware defects.

rows.Title: Secure folder not working
rows.Problem: Security policy prevents installation of secure folder; device is provisioned as device owner
rows.Summarized Problem: The secure folder cannot be installed or used because the device is provisioned as a device owner.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is provisioned as a device owner, which prohibits secure folder creation, making the feature completely non-functional and preventing user access to a core security function.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by device being provisioned as device owner; resolution requires user to remove device from provisioning as device owner via admin.

rows.Title: Device getting freeze and restart suddenly
rows.Problem: My phone is freezing up sometimes and reboots all of a sudden
rows.Summarized Problem: The device frequently freezes and restarts unexpectedly.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes unusable due to sudden freezing and restarts, which disrupts normal operation.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by UFS link layer errors, indicating a hardware-level problem involving the AP or UFS component; the recommended countermeasure is to inspect the hardware board, signal integrity, and power integrity, and guide the user to visit customer service for inspection.

rows.Title: Camera stop working and Camera failed popup occurs
rows.Problem: When opening the camera app, the camera is not working and a message shows that camera failed to open
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera app fails to open and displays a 'camera failed to open' message when launched.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera is a core functionality that fails to operate upon launch, rendering the device unable to perform a basic task.
rows.R&D Comment: Several HSI2C error logs indicate a hardware issue; recommend checking the camera module at SS center.

rows.Title: Dailer got stuck between dark and light mode
rows.Problem: The dailer got stuck between dark and light mode and is not working normally
rows.Summarized Problem: The dialer is stuck between dark and light modes and does not function normally.
rows.Severity Reason: The dialer is completely non-functional, preventing basic user interaction.
rows.R&D Comment: No further OS VER 14 release planned. Please check issue on latest OS VER 15 and update accordingly.

rows.Title: camera is keep crashing
rows.Problem: My camera is keep crashing it self and I am not able to click pictures
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera application keeps crashing, preventing users from taking pictures.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera crashes repeatedly, making it impossible to use the primary function of taking pictures, which renders the device unusable for basic photography tasks.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Camera not working properly
rows.Problem: The first picture is portrait which is working properly, the second is main camera which shows warning, and the third is video which shows security policy prevents use of camera. Selfie camera works fine. Diagnosis shows rear camera works well.
rows.Summarized Problem: The main camera displays a warning and video recording is blocked by a security policy, while the selfie camera functions normally.
rows.Severity Reason: The main camera function is partially impaired and video recording is blocked by a security policy, but the selfie camera works, indicating a partial malfunction.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause and countermeasure both indicate that turning off a security policy in Settings > Biometrics and Security > Other Security Settings resolves the issue.

rows.Title: Apps are crashing while scanning and uploading QR from storage
rows.Problem: Apps are crashing when scanning and uploading QR from storage
rows.Summarized Problem: Apps crash when scanning and uploading QR codes from storage.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes all apps to crash, making the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: The problem occurred in mediaProvider, Google mainline module. We reported this issue to Google.

rows.Title: Device not compatible for this application popup occurs while try to install Watch7 Plugin App
rows.Problem: device not compatible for this application. This one need to install
rows.Summarized Problem: Devices are not compatible with the Watch7 Plugin App, resulting in a popup during installation.
rows.Severity Reason: Users cannot install the required app, which prevents functionality of the Watch7 Manager.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is due to Samsung phone limitations in Play Store installation; the Watch7 Manager can be controlled via GW app or Samsung Galaxy Store.

rows.Title: Samsung Note frequently flash
rows.Problem: Samsung Tab S9 FE Plus notes not working properly
rows.Summarized Problem: Samsung Note app on Tab S9 FE Plus frequently flashes and fails to function properly.
rows.Severity Reason: The app fails to function properly, leading to device usability issues.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by a mutual exclusion deadlock between UI and recognition threads; the countermeasure is to prevent the recognition thread from accessing the UI-closed high-level module.

rows.Title: Background wallpaper rotates between portrait and landscape in landscape mode
rows.Problem: Background wallpaper goes to portrait and then rotates to landscape while using phone in landscape mode even with auto rotate turned on
rows.Summarized Problem: The background wallpaper incorrectly rotates from portrait to landscape when the phone is in landscape mode, despite auto-rotate being enabled.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes inconsistent display behavior and user confusion, disrupting the expected visual experience during normal use.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Sound quality with Dolby Atmos turned on is very poor
rows.Problem: The sound quality of my s23 with Dolby Atmos turned on is very poor. When Dolby Atmos is turned off, it is just okay. The issue started after updating the phone to one UI 6.1.1. Before that, the sound quality was superb. It is a widespread issue among s23 series. I have shared a screenshot and reported the issue multiple times but still no official statements. Please fix it.
rows.Summarized Problem: Sound quality is significantly poor when Dolby Atmos is enabled on the Samsung Galaxy S23, with a noticeable drop in audio performance compared to when it is disabled.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a major degradation in audio experience, which is a core functionality of the device, and affects usability when using media content.
rows.R&D Comment: Dolby Atmos has been adjusted to provide richer effects, but the current implementation results in poor sound quality; customers should be guided to select their preferred mode among Dolby Auto/Movie/Music or Dolby Off.

rows.Title: Secure Folder not working
rows.Problem: Secure Folder stopped working after initial 1 to 2 months of use; attempting to open it results in a message stating 'due to security privacy secure folder doesn't work'
rows.Summarized Problem: The Secure Folder feature is no longer functional and displays a privacy-related error message when attempted to be opened.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of a core security feature, preventing reliable access but not causing device crash or total failure.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by device owner mode being enabled, which restricts secure folder creation; the system behavior is intended, and no countermeasure is needed beyond maintaining current status.

rows.Title: Multi-photo carousel display overlap
rows.Problem: When viewing or posting a multi-photo carousel, parts of the first photo overlap onto the second
rows.Summarized Problem: Parts of the first photo in a multi-photo carousel overlap onto the second photo during view or post.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a visual inconsistency in photo carousels but does not prevent device usage or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: This is Facebook's UI concept. Samsung cannot modify this policy or concept. Please keep current status as 3rd party app behavior.

rows.Title: USB connected disconnected flash message popup repeatedly
rows.Problem: The USB connector connected option shows up again after a long interval of weeks, with the message popping up over 1000 times, indicating a constant issue that can only be temporarily suppressed by snoozing notifications. The issue recurs despite using smart switch and customer care, and was previously resolved only temporarily.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device repeatedly shows a USB connection and disconnection notification, indicating a persistent issue with USB recognition that is not resolved by software fixes.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a constant flood of notifications, disrupting user experience and suggesting potential hardware damage that may lead to device instability.
rows.R&D Comment: The repeated USB recognition and unrecognition are likely due to hardware damage on the USB connector; users should visit a service center for hardware inspection and repair.

rows.Title: front camera video is very dull and not clear
rows.Problem: The front camera is still the same even after following the steps you suggested. The mobile is standard, no extra screen guard or anything
rows.Summarized Problem: The front camera produces dull and unclear video footage.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of the camera's video output, which is not fully resolved by simple steps but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The blur is likely due to fingerprints or foreign substances on the camera lens; cleaning the lens resolves the issue if the problem persists, otherwise camera module replacement is needed.

rows.Title: Ultra-wide video quality becomes blurred while zoom in and slight shaking
rows.Problem: The ultra-wide video quality on my Samsung A55 5G becomes blurred when zooming in and has slight shaking, with loss of detail. The footage does not meet expectations.
rows.Summarized Problem: The ultra-wide video on the Samsung A55 5G becomes blurred and shaky when zoomed in, with loss of detail.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes significant degradation in video quality, making footage unusable during zoom, which is a major function failure.
rows.R&D Comment: The UW camera is a fixed focus type camera with a 1M focusing distance; blur and shaking at close distances occur due to lens focus removal outside the hardware guarantee range, and it is necessary to verify performance within the guaranteed distance.

rows.Title: Galaxy AI feature not working in keyboard
rows.Problem: Samsung AI keyboard (chat assist, writing style, spelling and grammar) features are not working properly on my Galaxy S24Ultra, Kindly fix it
rows.Summarized Problem: The AI features in the Samsung keyboard on Galaxy S24 Ultra are not working properly.
rows.Severity Reason: The AI features such as chat assist, writing style, spelling, and grammar are not functioning, which prevents effective text input and user productivity.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Galaxy Store App not open Properly
rows.Problem: Galaxy Store and themes app not working since last update. Cleared data and tried other tricks, but apps still not opening even with good network connection
rows.Summarized Problem: Galaxy Store app fails to open after a recent update, despite data clearing and good network connection.
rows.Severity Reason: The app is not opening, which affects user experience, but does not cause device crash or data loss, and can be resolved via user-guided steps.
rows.R&D Comment: User should uninstall updates and reinstall Galaxy Store to resolve the issue.

rows.Title: App Info popup Screen Not remove while swipe home Screen page
rows.Problem: I found a lil bug while sliding the lower bar
rows.Summarized Problem: The app info popup does not disappear when swiping the home screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a minor malfunction during normal navigation but does not prevent device usage or cause crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Notifications stopped working for Snapchat app
rows.Problem: Notifications stopped working for Snapchat app after reinstallation. All permissions were granted.
rows.Summarized Problem: Snapchat app notifications are not working after reinstallation despite all permissions being granted.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of notification functionality after app reinstallation, but the device remains usable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Not getting proper internet speed
rows.Problem: User is unable to complete payment due to near-zero download speed in open areas, despite having Jio SIM. Others nearby can connect and pay successfully, indicating issue is not with user or SIM, but with device signal reception or network handling.
rows.Summarized Problem: Device fails to achieve proper internet speed in open areas, preventing successful payment transactions despite having a valid SIM.
rows.Severity Reason: The device cannot complete essential transactions (payment) due to zero download speed, making it functionally unusable in real-world scenarios.
rows.R&D Comment: Provide CP silent logs for the issue to identify root cause of poor signal reception.

rows.Title: Battery life is very poor
rows.Problem: Battery life is very poor. I get around 3-4 hrs of screen on time with 100% battery
rows.Summarized Problem: The device has very poor battery life, lasting only 3-4 hours of screen on time with a full charge.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to maintain battery life under normal usage, resulting in rapid discharge and making the device unusable for extended periods.
rows.R&D Comment: Battery drain metrics show normal screen-on and screen-off consumption; further investigation needed to identify root cause of reported poor battery life.

rows.Title: Galaxy Store not working
rows.Problem: Galaxy Store shows server not working in your country and gives error
rows.Summarized Problem: Galaxy Store fails to load due to server error indicating issue in the user's region.
rows.Severity Reason: The app fails to load with a regional server error, preventing access but not rendering the device unusable or causing data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: User has sales code INS and MCC 402 (Bhutan); guide to uninstall Galaxy Store updates and reinstall.

rows.Title: Captured image gets darker after processed
rows.Problem: Processed image gets darker and skintone gets brownier when taking normal daylight photos, even after disabling auto HDR and scene optimizer and clearing app data.
rows.Summarized Problem: Camera image processing results in darker images and brownish skintones after processing, especially in daylight conditions.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects image quality significantly, leading to distorted skin tones and darkened images, which compromises user experience and photo reliability.
rows.R&D Comment: Brightness and color may be photographed differently depending on the environment or conditions in which you are photographing. This is a common characteristic of the camera.

rows.Title: Routine not working
rows.Problem: No routines are working since the last update.
rows.Summarized Problem: Routines are not functioning after the last update.
rows.Severity Reason: No routines working means core device functionality is impaired, rendering user-defined automation ineffective and disrupting usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: One UI home isn't responding
rows.Problem: One UI home isn't responding
rows.Summarized Problem: The One UI home screen is not responding to user input.
rows.Severity Reason: The home screen fails to respond to input, making it unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: device automatically switches between Super Fast Charging and Fast Charging while plugged in
rows.Problem: The device automatically switches between Super Fast Charging and Fast Charging while plugged in.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device automatically switches between Super Fast Charging and Fast
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to maintain a consistent charging mode, causing inconsistent charging performance and potential user confusion or device instability.
rows.R&D Comment: There is no kernel log at the time of the problem. Please secure the log immediately with the charger connected at the time of the problem.

rows.Title: Secsoundpicker is stopping
rows.Problem: Secsoundpicker is stopping me to change my ringtone
rows.Summarized Problem: The sound picker stops functionality when the applied ringtone file is not found, preventing users from changing their ringtone.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes when a ringtone file is missing, preventing users from changing their ringtone entirely, making a core feature unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Crash in sound picker occurs when the applied ringtone file is not found; fixed in OneUI 6.1.1 with CL# 29021157, users should check next upgrade.

rows.Title: DeX app displays a blank screen
rows.Problem: Connecting Samsung DeX to Windows 11 laptop results in a blank screen despite successful connection, both wired and wireless.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Samsung DeX app shows a blank screen after connecting to a Windows 11 laptop, even when the connection is established.
rows.Severity Reason: The device interface is completely unresponsive, preventing user interaction with the DeX environment, rendering it unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is related to the PC app interface; both phone and PC logs are needed for analysis. Users must collect logs from both devices to diagnose the root cause.

rows.Title: app widget disappear after exit from safe mode
rows.Problem: App widget disappears after exiting safe mode, while preloaded apps like Google and Samsung Clock remain visible in safe mode. This behavior is inconsistent and unexpected, as safe mode disables third-party apps but widgets still appear initially and vanish upon exit.
rows.Summarized Problem: App widgets disappear after exiting safe mode, despite appearing during safe mode.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of app widget behavior under specific conditions, not causing device failure or data loss, but affecting user experience.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue not reproducible in latest OS version; no ANR or crash found. Recommend checking in latest OS with fresh logs and video if issue persists.

rows.Title: Secsound speaker keep stopping
rows.Problem: Same problem repeated. Cx faces sec sound speaker issue
rows.Summarized Problem: The speaker keeps stopping unexpectedly.
rows.Severity Reason: The speaker stopping repeatedly makes the device unusable for audio functions.
rows.R&D Comment: Crash in sound picker occurs when ringtone file is not found; fixed in OneUI 6.1.1 with CL# 29021157. Please check next upgrade.
