rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a partial malfunction in the task changer interface, affecting user experience but not rendering the device unusable or causing data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue stems from improper view update during recents transition; a fix will be implemented in OneUI8, with recovery steps including reboot or navigation bar change.

rows.Title: Keyboard disconnects intermittently
rows.Problem: Samsung Tab S9 Ultra original keyboard disconnects intermittently, leading to repeated keystrokes and other disruptions. The problem stops if touchpad is turned off. I have tried the solutions posted online and on members community and didn't solve the issue.
rows.Summarized Problem: The physical keyboard on the Samsung Tab S9 Ultra disconnects intermittently, causing repeated keystrokes and disruptions, and the issue resolves when the touchpad is turned off.
rows.Severity Reason: The keyboard disconnects intermittently, disrupting input but does not completely prevent device operation or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Font size on homescreen and app screen is very small in default option
rows.Problem: Font is really small compared to other places on homescreen and app screen in default option
rows.Summarized Problem: The font size on the homescreen and app screen appears very small in the default setting.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue is a cosmetic display problem affecting font size, not impacting device usability or core functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: No Network
rows.Problem: The phone's network is not coming after the last update.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device fails to register with the network after an update, resulting in no network connectivity.
rows.Severity Reason: The device cannot connect to any network, making it unusable for basic communication functions.
rows.R&D Comment: No SIM card was detected; possible SIM or device defect. Users should contact their mobile operator or service center to verify the SIM and device status.

rows.Title: Application launch and closure times going slow
rows.Problem: Samsung S24 Plus application launch and closure times are exhibiting performance issues. Battery drain is excessive.
rows.Summarized Problem: Application launch and closure times are slow, leading to excessive battery drain.
rows.Severity Reason: The device exhibits sluggish performance during app launch and closure, causing excessive battery drain, which impacts usability and device responsiveness.
rows.R&D Comment: The app is launching very briefly in repeated cycles, leading to excessive battery drain. This is due to normal battery discharge based on user usage.

rows.Title: Camera Pro mode not working properly
rows.Problem: After updating to one UI 7, the PRO VIDEO & PRO PHOTO mode is not working properly. The camera shows an upside down screen in both modes, while normal photo and video functions work fine.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Pro Video and Pro Photo modes display an upside down screen and do not function correctly after the one UI 7 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects specific camera modes but does not prevent overall device operation or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The problem is caused by the DOF adapter calibration setting being enabled; users should disable it in the Camera Assistant app when not using a DOF adapter.

rows.Title: Folder background color cannot be changed
rows.Problem: The folder background color cannot be changed in UI 7. There is no option to change folder color anywhere in S24.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot change the folder background color in the device's UI.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing from the interface, preventing users from customizing folder appearance, but does not cause device malfunction or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Messages app briefly flashes before loading properly
rows.Problem: Messages app briefly flashes or blinks every time it is opened before loading properly
rows.Summarized Problem: The Samsung Messages app briefly flashes or blinks before loading properly upon opening.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a brief visual interruption during app launch but does not prevent the app from functioning or result in data loss or crash.
rows.R&D Comment: The blinking occurs due to a Google Consent Activity error returning result code 0, which suppresses the ToS reprompt; Google needs to investigate and fix the result code handling.

rows.Title: Phone rings notification tone even when there is no notification
rows.Problem: Phone rings notification tone and vibration without receiving any notification, even when notification sound is disabled for most apps
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone emits notification tone and vibration without any actual notification being received, even when notification sounds are disabled for most apps.
rows.Severity Reason: The device produces audible and vibrational feedback without any actual notification, making it functionally misleading and potentially disruptive to user experience.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue occurs during notification playback; logs show only media playback from YouTube, no vibration during notification events; request user to capture logs immediately after reproduction.

rows.Title: Software Update Stuck at 50% Downloading
rows.Problem: Stuck at 50% downloading, tries many times but same error
rows.Summarized Problem: The software update gets stuck at 50% downloading and fails repeatedly despite multiple attempts.
rows.Severity Reason: The update process fails at a critical stage, preventing the device from completing the update, which renders the device non-functional until resolved.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Software Update stuck on 18%
rows.Problem: Software update stuck at 18% after restart and power cycle attempts
rows.Summarized Problem: The software update is stuck at 18% and does not progress despite restarts and power cycles.
rows.Severity Reason: The update process is completely stalled, preventing the device from completing the software installation, which is essential for device functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: It seems there is a network issue; further investigation needed

rows.Title: Additional option getting out of screen
rows.Problem: When a user long presses a message in the Messages app, an additional option appears alongside the emoji section and hides, going out of screen. The option is scrollable when dragged to the left, and this behavior is currently expected.
rows.Summarized Problem: An additional option in the message reaction menu goes out of screen when long pressed and is not properly contained.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of the message interaction interface, but does not prevent device usability or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The behavior is expected when scrolling; further investigation needed

rows.Title: Cannot perform more than 1 file operation at once
rows.Problem: Why it is happening even when the background apps were closed or there was no file operation was going on other than that?
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot perform more than one file operation at the same time, even when no other operations are running.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to support concurrent file operations, which prevents users from performing basic file tasks, making the system unusable for multi-step operations.
rows.R&D Comment: A146 is a lite model and MyFile does not support multi-operation at once; logs confirm multiple operations are executing simultaneously, leading to operation conflicts.

rows.Title: Sound of any video goes silent abruptly
rows.Problem: Audio of any video being played abruptly becomes silent despite maximum volume after the last system update
rows.Summarized Problem: Video audio suddenly becomes silent during playback despite maximum volume settings after a system update.
rows.Severity Reason: The audio stops completely during video playback, making content inaccessible and rendering the device unusable for media consumption.
rows.R&D Comment: Root cause identified in third-party app (X.com.twitter.android) altering device volume; countermeasure is to request app developer to fix the issue; no source code available for analysis.

rows.Title: Bluetooth not connecting
rows.Problem: Bluetooth does not connect easily to available devices; requires deregistration and re-registration to pair. Once paired, there is significant audio/media disturbance. Phone restart is needed to resolve.
rows.Summarized Problem: Bluetooth connection is unstable and causes audio disturbances after pairing, requiring device restart to recover.
rows.Severity Reason: Bluetooth connection instability leads to audio/media disturbances and device restarts, making the feature unusable during operation.
rows.R&D Comment: Bluetooth connection instability and audio disturbances observed; require silent logs for deeper analysis.

rows.Title: Fingerprint not working
rows.Problem: fingerprint doesn't work properly
rows.Summarized Problem: The fingerprint sensor is not working properly.
rows.Severity Reason: The fingerprint sensor failure prevents proper authentication, making the device unusable for secure access.
rows.R&D Comment: Fingerprint sensor not working; recommend CS center inspection and sensor check.

rows.Title: Not getting complete signal strength
rows.Problem: After February update, there is a problem with getting good signal for both WiFi and mobile networks. WiFi shows full strength only when within 1 meter of the modem. Mobile networks show only 5G or good 4G outside of buildings. This issue has been occurring for the past two months.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users are unable to maintain consistent mobile and WiFi signal strength, with poor connectivity only when indoors or near the modem.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects signal stability but does not cause device crash or data loss; it is intermittent and impacts usability under specific conditions.
rows.R&D Comment: We observed many networks being filtered due to low signal strength; further investigation needed to determine root cause.

rows.Title: Update your phone notification when software is up to date
rows.Problem: Phone shows "Update your phone" notification despite being up to date
rows.Summarized Problem: The device displays an 'Update your phone' notification even when the software is already up to date.
rows.Severity Reason: The notification is misleading but does not cause device malfunction or data loss, only a partial malfunction of the update status display.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Battery charging speed slowed
rows.Problem: Battery charging speed slowed after oneui 6 update
rows.Summarized Problem: Battery charging speed has slowed down after the OneUI 6 update, especially when used with apps like WhatsApp and TrueCaller while charging.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of charging performance under specific usage conditions, affecting user experience but not rendering the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Charging limits are applied during device boot to prevent overheating when screen is on, and full current is passed during screen-off charging, leading to temperature rise after reboot.

rows.Title: Dual Messenger showing system-level and background apps
rows.Problem: Dual Messenger is showing system-level and background apps like Chrome, Android System WebView, Meta App Installer, Settings, Android Switch, Messenger in the list, even though these apps are not meant to be cloned.
rows.Summarized Problem: Dual Messenger incorrectly displays system-level and background apps in its list, violating expected app cloning behavior.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature shows unintended system apps, which may mislead users but does not cause device crash or complete failure of core functions.
rows.R&D Comment: The display of default system packages in Dual Messenger is by design to support a separate user profile; no action needed.

rows.Title: Phone is on silent but still vibrates on notifications
rows.Problem: Notification vibration setting is on silent but still vibrates when notifications come
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone vibrates when notifications come even though vibration is set to silent in the settings.
rows.Severity Reason: The device vibrates despite being set to silent, which is a partial malfunction of the vibration setting functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Unstable 5G
rows.Problem: 5G support is available in my area and everything appears normal, but 5G connection is unstable.
rows.Summarized Problem: 5G connection is unstable despite being available and supported in the area.
rows.Severity Reason: The 5G connection is not fully reliable but does not cause device failure or data loss, only intermittent instability.
rows.R&D Comment: Require CP silent logs to investigate root cause of 5G instability.

rows.Title: Lag and low fps in playing game
rows.Problem: Low fps in game and lags while using keyboard
rows.Summarized Problem: Users experience low frame rate and lag during gameplay and keyboard usage.
rows.Severity Reason: Game performance is severely degraded, leading to unresponsive gameplay and lag during critical interactions.
rows.R&D Comment: This is a system limitation due to high device temperature; user is advised to allow device to cool down and provide logs and video if issue persists.

rows.Title: Device overheating
rows.Problem: My device always gets hot when I'm using any application
rows.Summarized Problem: The device overheats during application usage.
rows.Severity Reason: The device overheats during normal use, which can lead to performance degradation or safety risks.
rows.R&D Comment: The thermal performance has been optimized by adding graphite area; please check TR.

rows.Title: Audio crackling issue
rows.Problem: Audio crackling or distortion occurs when using headphones on Galaxy Tab A9 in DRM-based educational apps like Marrow, Prepladder, Cerebellum. Works fine on speakers and non-DRM apps. Issue persists after factory reset, cache wipe, and latest update. Samsung support attributes it to third-party apps, but it affects multiple apps.
rows.Summarized Problem: Headphones cause audio crackling and distortion in DRM-based educational apps on Galaxy Tab A9, despite working on speakers and non-DRM apps.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue occurs during core functionality (audio playback) in multiple educational apps and persists after device resets, making it critical for usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: System audio routing fails randomly
rows.Problem: System audio routing fails randomly. When setting or previewing an alarm sound in the Clock app, the error 'Unable to play during call' appears even without an ongoing call. Bluetooth audio connection works but playback fails after connection.
rows.Summarized Problem: System audio routing fails randomly, causing alarm sounds and media playback to be blocked even without active calls or microphone usage.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents essential audio functionality like alarms and media playback, rendering core device features unusable during normal operation.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by WhatsApp setting the device to ringtone mode during calls and not resetting it, leading to audio routing failures. Countermeasure: Recommend contacting WhatsApp app support or Play Store for resolution.

rows.Title: Camera Colour shift and pinkish tone in photos
rows.Problem: Photos have colour shift and pinkish tone, and require clearing camera app data and cache to improve dynamic range, though the colour issue persists after clearing data
rows.Summarized Problem: Photos exhibit a colour shift and pinkish tone that persists despite clearing camera app data and cache.
rows.Severity Reason: The colour shift in photos affects image accuracy and appearance, leading to inconsistent and unprofessional results, making the camera functionality unreliable for users.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Colour shift persists despite data clearing; Countermeasure: Normal phenomenon (as per resolution).

rows.Title: Unable to cut or edit song on photo editor
rows.Problem: Cannot edit or cut voice or songs backward in photo editor; only able to use whole songs from third-party apps.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot cut or edit audio tracks (songs or voice) within the photo editor, limiting flexibility in video editing.
rows.Severity Reason: Users can only use full songs, not partial clips, leading to partial functionality but not complete failure of core operation.
rows.R&D Comment: Studio is based on video/photo as main track; audio is linked to clip, and no separate audio track support exists.

rows.Title: Google Chrome's top tab always getting blocked while opening for the first time
rows.Problem: Google Chrome's top tab always getting blocked while opening for the first time
rows.Summarized Problem: Google Chrome's top tab is blocked when opening for the first time.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents the browser from loading a tab, which is a core functionality and blocks user access to web content.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: unable to unfollow teams from sports from Google in Now bar
rows.Problem: After the recent security update, the live notification bug persists. Users cannot unfollow teams; the default setting is all teams, but users must select which to follow, which is the opposite of intended behavior. A useful feature is disabled on the device and possibly others.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot unfollow sports teams in the Now Bar, and the default setting is incorrectly configured, making the feature unusable.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely broken and contradicts user expectations, rendering a core functionality unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Unable to edit SMSC number due to un-editable space
rows.Problem: Unable to send SMS via mobile. All steps have been followed multiple times including resetting the mobile. Unable to update SMSc number as the space is uneditable.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot update the SMSc number because the field is uneditable.
rows.Severity Reason: Users cannot send SMS due to a critical field being uneditable, preventing essential functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: allowEditingSmscAddress=false; operator restriction. Countermeasure: Provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Samsung Messages Chat Features Missing
rows.Problem: Chat Features (RCS) no longer appear or register on SIM 1, despite working previously. The option vanishes and fails to register. Chat Features work on SIM 2 and via Google Messages on SIM 1. SIM 1 has no VoLTE option in settings, while SIM 2 does. Both SIMs are on VoLTE-supported networks. Tried clearing data, removing SIM 2, switching to mobile data, etc. No resolution found.
rows.Summarized Problem: RCS chat features are no longer available or registering on SIM 1 in Samsung Messages, despite working previously.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely missing on one SIM, preventing users from using RCS, which is a core messaging functionality, making communication unreliable.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Sound gets muted on any call
rows.Problem: When receiving a phone or WhatsApp call, the sound gets muted. Alarms and WhatsApp calls show on screen but do not ring. After device optimization, alarms ring again but WhatsApp calls still do not ring. The incoming call is displayed, but sound is muted. The issue persists after reset, notification settings adjustment, and restart.
rows.Summarized Problem: Call audio is muted during incoming calls, including WhatsApp calls, despite visual indication of incoming call.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to produce audible sound during calls, making it impossible to hear incoming calls, which is essential for usability.
rows.R&D Comment: It is a known issue of WhatsApp where call audio remains muted after disconnection; further investigation needed

rows.Title: battery draining
rows.Problem: I have been facing battery draining for quiet some time. I am hardly getting 4-5 hours of screen on time. This has been happening since one of the updates. There is no exceptional usage that I can find from the usage report. Please resolve.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device is experiencing significant battery drain, resulting in only 4-5 hours of screen on time despite no identified abnormal app usage or background activity.
rows.Severity Reason: The battery drains rapidly over 12 hours, reducing from 99% to 21%, and is attributed to high data usage and poor signal strength, making the device unusable for extended periods.
rows.R&D Comment: Battery drain is caused by high data usage and poor signal strength; countermeasure aligns with observed usage patterns.

rows.Title: Picture is blur when clicked in portrait mode
rows.Problem: Attached portrait mode image is incorrect; original images show space, final image is normal
rows.Summarized Problem: The portrait mode camera produces blurry images, especially when capturing thin subjects or backgrounds with repetition.
rows.Severity Reason: The blur effect fails in critical scenarios, leading to incorrect image output and degraded user experience in a core camera function.
rows.R&D Comment: Depthmap errors occur when feature matching between two cameras is difficult, particularly with thin subjects or repetitive backgrounds; this issue is consistent across multiple cases and affects core image quality.

rows.Title: sound quality get decreased including bass
rows.Problem: After april security patch update, sound quality has decreased including bass. The update seems to have reduced audio performance, despite the device's capability.
rows.Summarized Problem: Sound quality has decreased after the April security patch update, particularly in bass.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects audio performance but does not cause device failure or complete loss of function, and is not critical to core usability.
rows.R&D Comment: No abnormal behavior found in logs; device defect may need to be ruled out via service center inspection.

rows.Title: Unable to connect watch 7 lte to samsung galaxy s23
rows.Problem: Unable to connect my watch 7 lte to my samsung galaxy s23. My network is airtel. I have reset both devices and activated esim on the phone. I end up in an attached screen.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot connect their watch 7 lte to the galaxy s23 smartphone, resulting in a stuck screen after attempts to pair.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents full functionality of wearable pairing but does not cause device crash or data loss, and can be resolved with user action (updating software and retesting).
rows.R&D Comment: Root cause not traceable due to insufficient logs; recommend user update latest version and retest with new logs if issue persists.

rows.Title: Watch 7 lte 40mm sometimes got discharge instead of charging
rows.Problem: My watch 7 lte 40mm sometimes got discharge instead of charging
rows.Summarized Problem: The Galaxy Watch 7 LTE 40mm occasionally shows discharge instead of charging, indicating a malfunction in the charging process.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is showing discharge instead of charging, which renders it unable to maintain battery life and may lead to unexpected shutdowns or device failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue related to watchface rendering; hard to reproduce and fix; recommend checking latest watchface version and capturing logs if issue recurs.

rows.Title: Reminder setting in calendar gets automatically changed
rows.Problem: The reminder setting in Calendar gets changed on its own when set for event reminder more than 4 weeks before event. This problem was reported earlier. I was told a fix will be sent. However, I not received any fix.
rows.Summarized Problem: Event reminders set more than 4 weeks in advance are automatically changed without user input.
rows.Severity Reason: Users cannot control reminder settings for events set more than 4 weeks in advance, leading to unintended changes and potential disruption of user planning.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by Google's logic modifying settings beyond 4 weeks; the solution is to block input for reminders set more than 4 weeks in advance in the OS version.

rows.Title: Ear buds connected but no media sound
rows.Problem: Bluetooth earbuds show as connected and button clicks are heard, but no media sound plays from apps like Facebook, Instagram, or YouTube. No error messages displayed.
rows.Summarized Problem: Bluetooth earbuds connect successfully but do not play media sound from apps like Facebook, Instagram, or YouTube.
rows.Severity Reason: Media playback is completely blocked in apps, making audio functionality unusable for core user activities.
rows.R&D Comment: Audio mode set to ringtone by WhatsApp prevents media playback; further investigation needed for countermeasure.

rows.Title: Unable to update Google Play Store
rows.Problem: I haven't received my Google Play system since 2024 help me out
rows.Summarized Problem: Users are unable to update the Google Play Store due to authentication failures and experiment package update issues.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes or fails to update due to authentication errors, preventing users from accessing essential app updates and services.
rows.R&D Comment: Authentication failure occurs during token retrieval; experiment package update is triggered but fails, requiring user re-authentication.

rows.Title: Locking the screen slow
rows.Problem: Locking the screen slow. Cannot attach a video as locking the device stops video recording
rows.Summarized Problem: The screen takes a noticeable delay to lock when using either the side button or double tap.
rows.Severity Reason: The delay affects user experience but does not prevent device operation or cause device failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Contacts stuck on Updating contacts
rows.Problem: Contacts are stuck on "Updating contacts" after updating to One UI 7, despite restarts, cache clearing, and sync toggling.
rows.Summarized Problem: Contacts are stuck in an updating state due to a prolonged database index rebuild during system upgrade.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is unable to access contacts, preventing normal functionality of contact-based features like calls and messaging.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by a database index rebuild timeout during system upgrade, and the same root cause is observed in messaging apps like Viber, WhatsApp, and Telegram.

rows.Title: Wallpaper disappeared after Android 15 update
rows.Problem: Default wallpapers disappeared after updating to Android 15. Only a portion of the wallpaper is now visible. How to fix this issue?
rows.Summarized Problem: Default wallpapers have disappeared after Android 15 update, leaving only partial visibility.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial loss of functionality (only partial wallpapers visible), but the core system remains usable.
rows.R&D Comment: The change in OneUI 7 Wallpaper Library UI now hides featured wallpapers outside the featured category; users must navigate to 'Variations' in the editor to access all system wallpapers.

rows.Title: fonts are so inconsistent throughout the entire phone
rows.Problem: the fonts are so inconsistent throughout the entire phone. For example, the settings panel shows one font style, but the battery percentage in the pill uses Roboto
rows.Summarized Problem: The font styles are inconsistent across the device, with different apps and UI elements using different fonts.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visual consistency in the UI but does not prevent device operation or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Samsung is working with Google to allow Android to use one default font for the entire device unless otherwise designed by apps.

rows.Title: Now Bar do not appear on lock screen
rows.Problem: Now Bar do not appear on lock screen
rows.Summarized Problem: The Now Bar does not appear on the lock screen despite proper settings being enabled.
rows.Severity Reason: The Now Bar fails to appear on the lock screen even when all required settings are enabled, indicating a core functionality failure that prevents user access to smart suggestions.
rows.R&D Comment: The intent to create Now bar is not received during the log duration, and Now bar card creation requires user interaction that was not performed.

rows.Title: Dark Mode not applied in Keyboard
rows.Problem: Autocorrect popup is light colored with white text in Dark Mode; should be dark colored with white text
rows.Summarized Problem: The autocorrect popup in the Samsung keyboard appears light-colored with white text instead of dark-colored when Dark Mode is enabled.
rows.Severity Reason: The popup fails to apply Dark Mode styling, making it visually inconsistent and potentially confusing for users in a dark theme environment, leading to a poor user experience in a core UI feature.
rows.R&D Comment: This is a problem from org.thoughtcrime.securesm app side. App developer need to fix this issue.

rows.Title: Now bar isn't showing any live updates
rows.Problem: My now bar isn't showing any live updates other than music and alarm grouping isn't working
rows.Summarized Problem: The Now Bar on the Lock Screen is not displaying live updates.
rows.Severity Reason: The Now Bar fails to show live updates beyond music and alarm grouping, indicating partial malfunction of a key feature.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Wallpaper changes from cinematic to portrait view after minimizing
rows.Problem: After the update, when minimizing the screen after playing videos or games in landscape, the wallpaper takes a fraction of seconds to change from landscape to portrait. All other functions remain intact, but the wallpaper transitions to portrait after a brief delay.
rows.Summarized Problem: The wallpaper briefly transitions from cinematic landscape to portrait view when the screen is minimized, after an update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of the display behavior during screen minimization, affecting visual consistency but not causing device freeze or crash.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Front camera blinks when creating social media video
rows.Problem: Video blinking problem appears during Instagram video creation
rows.Summarized Problem: The front camera blinks during Instagram video creation.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue occurs intermittently during video recording and has not been consistently reproduced, indicating partial malfunction.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Device is overheating after One UI 7 update
rows.Problem: My Samsung S24 Plus is overheating after the One UI 7 update
rows.Summarized Problem: The device is overheating after the One UI 7 update, particularly during boot and app usage.
rows.Severity Reason: Overheating can lead to device instability, performance degradation, or potential damage, especially during high CPU usage or boot sequences.
rows.R&D Comment: Overheating is caused by high CPU usage during boot and app launches; no effective countermeasure provided.

rows.Title: charging speed slowed down
rows.Problem: My S24 charging speed slowed down after the January security update. The phone currently runs on One UI 7 with the April security update, but the issue persists. I use a proper 45W charger and do weekly restarts, but the problem remains. The phone charges at 16W, showing Super Fast Charging 2.0, which is significantly slower than expected.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device's charging speed has been significantly reduced to 16W despite being capable of Super Fast Charging 2.0.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is unable to achieve its intended charging speed, resulting in a major functional degradation that impacts user experience and device performance.
rows.R&D Comment: Input current limited by aicl; check TA or cable, and if issue persists, visit service center for hardware inspection.

rows.Title: Call vibration not working
rows.Problem: No vibration when a call connects or disconnects. Issues persist after cache clearing and factory reset.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device does not vibrate when a call connects or disconnects.
rows.Severity Reason: The call vibration feature is completely missing, making the device unusable for basic phone functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Call background not working
rows.Problem: After one UI 7 update, call background not working. It's showing a blue plan color.
rows.Summarized Problem: The call background feature is not functioning correctly after UI 7 update, displaying a solid blue color instead of the intended background.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a partial malfunction of the call interface, where the background does not display properly, but the call function remains usable.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Show contact photo background when contact photo is not saved. Countermeasure: Fix to show default background in this case and include in next MR version.

rows.Title: Loudness of unlock and lock sound going decreases
rows.Problem: The loudness of unlock and lock sound in today's S24 OneUI 7 is very low. Before, in older software it was louder. System sound is at full volume. Please take action as soon as possible.
rows.Summarized Problem: The unlock and lock sound on the Lock Screen is significantly quieter than before, despite system volume being at maximum.
rows.Severity Reason: The sound is noticeably reduced but still audible and system volume is confirmed at full level, indicating a partial malfunction rather than complete failure or device unusability.
rows.R&D Comment: Check the log; the system volume is at max, and no abnormal point is found. The lock and unlock tone is played too low to hear. Please record volume for further analysis.

rows.Title: camera jitter when using 3X
rows.Problem: Since the latest update, I’ve noticed consistent camera jitter when using 3X. This wasn’t an issue before and switching to other frame rates seems to fix it.
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera exhibits consistent jitter when using 3X zoom, which is not present at other frame rates.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects functionality under specific conditions but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The camera module is estimated to be defective; service center guidance for replacement is recommended.

rows.Title: Pointer size is huge and does not translate on tab
rows.Problem: Pointer size is huge and does not translate on tab. Also the pointer looks pixelated.
rows.Summarized Problem: The pointer size is excessively large and does not translate properly when moving between tabs, with a pixelated appearance.
rows.Severity Reason: The pointer malfunction affects usability during navigation but does not cause device crash or data loss, and functionality remains partially available.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by incorrect pointer size settings in Settings > General management > Mouse and trackpad > Pointer size and color > Pointer size. A countermeasure is to guide users to adjust pointer size in the settings menu.

rows.Title: Device hangs
rows.Problem: my samsung a15 5g hangs even it has 256 gb rom and 8 gb ram, when only nearly 75 gb rom is filled i follow most of the activities that you suggested but still it hangs
rows.Summarized Problem: The Samsung A15 5G device hangs despite having sufficient RAM and storage, even when only 75 GB of storage is used.
rows.Severity Reason: The device hangs, which is a critical system-level issue that prevents normal operation and may lead to instability or crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Network stuck on 2g
rows.Problem: Network automatically stuck on 2g. After restart, works for 1 to 2 days then repeats. Device shows 5g/4g but no internet connection occurs two to three times daily. VoLTE turns off and requires restart.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device repeatedly gets stuck on 2G network with no internet connectivity, despite showing 5G/4G signal, and VoLTE turns off.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to establish internet connectivity and shows incorrect network signal status, rendering basic functionality unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Contact vanishes after clicking and opens wrong call menu
rows.Problem: When you click on a contact after searching it vanishes and goes to the top, opens the call menu of the contact below it, and when you call that contact it calls the original contact only.
rows.Summarized Problem: After clicking a contact in search, it vanishes and displays the wrong contact's call menu, leading to incorrect calls being made.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes incorrect calls to be made, resulting in user confusion and potential misuse of communication functions.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: weather widget not updating periodically
rows.Problem: Widgets added in the lock screen via lockstar are not updating periodically. This is annoying.
rows.Summarized Problem: The weather widget added to the lock screen is not updating periodically.
rows.Severity Reason: The widget fails to update regularly, leading to outdated information, but the device remains usable and no critical function is disabled.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Status bar icons got duplicated
rows.Problem: While receiving a call, the status bar icons got duplicated - both on the call screen and the homescreen
rows.Summarized Problem: Status bar icons duplicate during phone calls on both call screen and home screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes visual duplication of critical status icons during calls, potentially leading to user confusion and device usability problems.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: WiFi Not connecting
rows.Problem: System tries to connect to available home WiFi but takes one minute with multiple failed attempts. Despite earlier concerns, support staff provided irrelevant information. Issue arose after recent software update.
rows.Summarized Problem: WiFi fails to connect to home network after a one-minute period of multiple failed attempts, resulting in no IP assignment due to DHCP failure.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to establish a basic network connection, preventing the user from using core device functions such as internet access or app usage.
rows.R&D Comment: DHCP failure causes WiFi disconnection; require silent logs for deeper analysis.

rows.Title: delay when customizing lock screen settings
rows.Problem: a dialogue box appears after clicking contact information box and remains visible for a second after the phone is turned off; similar delay occurs when using multi window, with minimized windows closing after a delay; generally there is a delay between turning off the phone and the screen actually turning off
rows.Summarized Problem: A delay occurs when customizing lock screen settings, causing dialogue boxes and minimized windows to remain visible after the phone is turned off.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of lock screen functionality during customization and multi-window use, but does not prevent device operation or result in data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Device getting Heatup even in normal use
rows.Problem: Galaxy M33 5G feels hot during normal use after latest security patch update, despite factory reset, minimal app usage, and Google Play System update. No heavy apps or gaming involved.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device overheats during normal use despite minimal app usage and factory reset.
rows.Severity Reason: The device overheats under normal usage conditions, which can lead to performance degradation or potential damage, making it unusable in daily scenarios.
rows.R&D Comment: Overheating is caused by frequent package launches, fast charging, weak signal areas, 5G network, and hotspot usage; these are expected in heavy scenarios but occur during normal use.

rows.Title: Screen freezes
rows.Problem: Screen freezes and need to force restart the phone
rows.Summarized Problem: The screen freezes and requires a force restart to resume operation.
rows.Severity Reason: The screen freezing prevents normal device usage and requires a force restart, making the device unusable until resolved.
rows.R&D Comment: GPU errors are occurring continuously, highly suspected as a hardware defect; recommend customer hardware inspection.

rows.Title: Delay in screen off while locking the phone
rows.Problem: Delay in screen off while locking the phone. When I press lock button or double tap for lock, it takes some time to get screen off. It is not getting screen off instantly. This happens every time after the UI7 update. The lock screen animation on OneUI7 takes a second to lock the screen when the phone is in FHD+. Once I switch it to QHD, the problem no longer persists. This issue happens every time I lock my screen.
rows.Summarized Problem: The screen takes a significant delay to turn off when locking the phone, especially on FHD+ display, and this issue persists after the UI7 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a noticeable delay in screen off but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss, and it is intermittent or context-dependent (display resolution related).
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Display blinking when open apps
rows.Problem: Whenever I open one application it keeps on blinking
rows.Summarized Problem: The display blinks when an application is opened.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue occurs during app launch but does not prevent device usage or cause crashes or data loss, only affecting visual feedback during app opening.
rows.R&D Comment: This issue belongs to a third-party application; no source code available, requires app owner to verify and update to latest version.

rows.Title: Frame skips in app opening animations
rows.Problem: Frame skips in app opening animations for all apps and occasional UI lag
rows.Summarized Problem: App opening animations experience frame skips and occasional UI lag across all apps.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of app launch animations and intermittent UI lag, but does not prevent device usability or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: We have checked the issue in the latest binary, but the issue didn- t reproduce at our end. The exact root cause is not clear from the provided logs. If the issue persists, please raise a new issue with logs and video.

rows.Title: Bluetooth audio not audible during media playback
rows.Problem: Bluetooth audio not audible during media playback
rows.Summarized Problem: Bluetooth audio is not audible when playing media, but works during calls.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects media playback functionality but does not cause device crash or complete unavailability of audio.
rows.R&D Comment: Audio mode is set to ringtone by WhatsApp, causing media playback to fail on Bluetooth; further investigation needed

rows.Title: Error on opening Home Up from Good Lock
rows.Problem: When opening Home Up from Good Lock, an error occurs
rows.Summarized Problem: An error occurs when attempting to open Home Up from the Good Lock screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The error prevents smooth navigation but does not cause device crash or data loss, and can be resolved with a simple update.
rows.R&D Comment: We are preparing the Home Up for Fold and Tablet of OneUI 7.0; a download of the Good Lock Home Up will be provided soon.

rows.Title: Eye comfort shield is not working
rows.Problem: Eye comfort shield works only in maintenance mode and not in normal use. Turning it on or off and restarting the phone results in the setting being applied only after restart.
rows.Summarized Problem: The eye comfort shield feature does not function properly in normal use and only works in maintenance mode.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature fails to operate in normal usage, affecting user experience but does not cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: V OS Ver 15 is already planned for this model; behavior needs to be confirmed in the upcoming OS version.

rows.Title: Serious software issue detected pop up occur after updating google play system
rows.Problem: Sometimes this appears since 1st of April
rows.Summarized Problem: A serious software issue popup appears intermittently after updating Google Play system.
rows.Severity Reason: The popup is serious and occurs after a system update, potentially disrupting user experience and device usability.
rows.R&D Comment: V OS Ver 15 is already planned for this model; further investigation needed on behavior and reproduction

rows.Title: Bixby not taking voice commands
rows.Problem: Bixby responds to 'turn off' with 'Shall I turn it off?' and behaves abnormally when given replies like 'wait', 'oh no', or 'hello', triggering unexpected responses such as 'You don't have any relevant notifications' or taking a screenshot after 'Oh, no'
rows.Summarized Problem: Bixby fails to properly process voice commands and responds abnormally to user replies, leading to unexpected behavior and potential unintended actions.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes abnormal behavior but does not result in device crash or complete failure of core functionality, and user can still interact with Bixby in some cases.
rows.R&D Comment: V OS Ver 15 is already planned for this model; further investigation needed to confirm behavior and validate impact.

rows.Title: Icons in a folder would be displayed as Grayed out
rows.Problem: Icons in a folder would be displayed as Grayed out Icons. This usually happens when I move out of a work mode which has these apps disabled for use.
rows.Summarized Problem: Icons in folders appear grayed out after exiting work mode.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects functionality but does not cause device crash or data loss; icons are only grayed out, not fully non-functional.
rows.R&D Comment: V OS Ver 15 is already planned for this model. Behavior on V OS needs to be shared for validation.

rows.Title: Device getting overheated
rows.Problem: Device always overheats, despite software updates, resets, and restorations. User reports this issue persists for 10 days and claims it is unacceptably normal under policy.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device consistently overheats despite software updates and factory resets, with users claiming it is unacceptably normal.
rows.Severity Reason: Overheating can lead to device instability, performance degradation, or even permanent damage, making it a critical usability and safety issue.
rows.R&D Comment: Overheating is caused by continuous WhatsApp video calls and multi-window usage; thermal management system is functioning correctly but user behavior exacerbates heat buildup.

rows.Title: Color by Keyword function is not working
rows.Problem: The keyword is not getting colored
rows.Summarized Problem: The keyword colorization function in the Samsung keyboard is not working.
rows.Severity Reason: The function fails to apply color to keywords, rendering the feature unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Server error is frequent
rows.Problem: Server error is frequent and annoying. Everything done. Data cleared, cache reset. Running one ui 7.0 final version
rows.Summarized Problem: Frequent server errors occur, causing data loss and disrupting user operations.
rows.Severity Reason: The errors lead to data clearing and cache reset, indicating a major function failure that impacts usability.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is likely due to app-based server problems; a reduction in background current operation has been implemented in V OS, but the exact error source remains unclear.

rows.Title: Bluetooth icon missing in status bar
rows.Problem: Bluetooth icon is missing in status bar
rows.Summarized Problem: The Bluetooth icon is missing from the status bar.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a missing UI element in the status bar, which affects visibility but does not prevent device operation or cause crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Call transcript feature not showing
rows.Problem: Call transcript feature not showing
rows.Summarized Problem: The call transcript feature is not displaying on the device.
rows.Severity Reason: The call transcript feature is completely missing, which prevents users from viewing call records, a core functionality for communication.
rows.R&D Comment: The device lacks support for voice call recording, which is a prerequisite for the call transcript feature; no recording capability means the transcript cannot be generated or displayed.

rows.Title: picture takes lots of grains quality
rows.Problem: pictures take lots of grains quality issue than previous with faster processing time
rows.Summarized Problem: Camera images have excessive graininess due to low quality optimization setting.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of image quality, not rendering the device unusable or causing data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The quality optimization setting is set to minimum, causing degraded image quality; users should adjust it to maximum.

rows.Title: Drop in battery performance related to the AOD feature
rows.Problem: A noticeable drop in battery performance has occurred with the Always On Display feature, increasing from 0.7% to 4% battery usage, which significantly impacts device battery life for users relying on this feature daily.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Always On Display feature is now consuming significantly more battery power than before, leading to a noticeable drop in overall battery performance.
rows.Severity Reason: The increased battery consumption is substantial and directly affects device usability for users who depend on the feature throughout the day, potentially leading to frequent recharging.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Device is hanging
rows.Problem: After updating to UI 7, phone hangs frequently. Apps do not open. System UI and apps are unresponsive. Cannot open members app. Gallery crashes when adding photos. Device stops working and requires restart.
rows.Summarized Problem: Device hangs frequently after UI 7 update, causing apps and system UI to become unresponsive and requiring restarts.
rows.Severity Reason: Device hangs severely, preventing normal operation and app usage, making it unusable until restart.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Device getting heated
rows.Problem: Device is getting increasingly heated after recent software updates, especially during video calls using WhatsApp, despite prior battery reading issues being resolved by factory reset.
rows.Summarized Problem: Device overheats during WhatsApp video calls due to high CPU consumption from the camera service.
rows.Severity Reason: Heating during active video calls can cause device instability, performance degradation, and potential damage if prolonged.
rows.R&D Comment: Heating caused by WhatsApp video calls using camera service; recommend investigation into camera service CPU usage and optimize for reduced load during calls.

rows.Title: app tray lags
rows.Problem: tapping a folder in the app tray lags slightly before opening when using vertical setup
rows.Summarized Problem: The app tray lags when tapping a folder in the vertical setup.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction in the app tray interaction, causing a delay during folder opening but not rendering the device unusable or causing data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The lag occurs after touch up when opening a folder; animation timing is affected by screen size, and further investigation is needed if lag persists beyond this interaction.

rows.Title: Home UI Crash
rows.Problem: After updating to UI 7, the home UI crashes after opening an app once.
rows.Summarized Problem: The home screen crashes after opening an app once following a UI 7 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The home screen crashes after app opening, making the device unusable immediately after launching apps.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue is not reproducing in the latest ONEUI Home; will be fixed in Homescreen Version 16.0.09.13 or above.

rows.Title: Sluggish in notes app
rows.Problem: Issue following up on previous query
rows.Summarized Problem: The notes app becomes sluggish whenever a new app is installed.
rows.Severity Reason: The app performance degrades under specific conditions, affecting usability but not rendering the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Unable to image search in photos
rows.Problem: Only one face is detected in photos, despite 30-50 faces in gallery. On plant search, only one photo is shown. On fruit search, no results appear despite multiple fruit photos.
rows.Summarized Problem: Image search in photos fails to detect multiple faces or return relevant results for fruits and plants.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature fails to detect multiple faces or return expected results, leading to a complete failure in image search functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Image analysis Service operates as a background service and only works when the device is idle with the screen off and (nearly) fully charged. Users should ensure device is fully charged and battery protection is turned off to allow proper analysis.

rows.Title: Wellbeing widget not updating
rows.Problem: Wellbeing home screen widget is not updating actual time; shows last state until user navigates in and out. This issue occurs after UI 7 update, was previously working correctly.
rows.Summarized Problem: The wellbeing home screen widget is not updating in real time and displays the last known state until the user navigates away and back.
rows.Severity Reason: The widget fails to update in real time, causing a partial malfunction of a feature that users rely on for timely information, but the device remains usable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Glitch in the charging message
rows.Problem: Charging message is not displaying properly; shows "Charging will start at 9:59" instead of "Charging will complete/finish at 9:59"
rows.Summarized Problem: The charging message displays incorrectly, showing 'Charging will start at 9:59' instead of 'Charging will complete/finish at 9:59'.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects message accuracy but does not cause device crash or major functionality failure, only a minor display inaccuracy.
rows.R&D Comment: The message is a normal behavior under Adaptive Battery Protection; no modification required.

rows.Title: Sluggishness in top-right dropdown settings
rows.Problem: The "Play Last Song" button in the top-right dropdown settings flickers and exhibits erratic behavior, suggesting a software bug. This issue, occurring after the One UI 7.0 update, results in an unsmooth user experience and is highly disruptive.
rows.Summarized Problem: The 'Play Last Song' button in the top-right dropdown settings flickers and behaves erratically after the One UI 7.0 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The button flickering and erratic behavior disrupts user interaction and creates an unsmooth experience, making it difficult to use the feature reliably.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Fastcharging not working
rows.Problem: Fastcharging not working sometimes
rows.Summarized Problem: Fastcharging intermittently fails and the exact timing of the issue is unclear.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves intermittent failure of a major function, but does not result in device unusability or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The cause and countermeasure both point to an unclear reproduction route and the need for logs when the issue occurs.

rows.Title: Cannot play multi player game
rows.Problem: I can't play multi-player games but can login and also can play other online games; when I play multi-player modes my ping goes high, I tried all steps but still it's useless
rows.Summarized Problem: Multi-player game performance is severely degraded due to weak network signal, causing high ping and unplayable experience.
rows.Severity Reason: The game becomes unplayable during multi-player modes due to high ping, making it functionally unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Weak signal strength (RSRP below 110) is causing poor game performance; recommend user to connect to a strong network.

rows.Title: Galaxy Store faces issue
rows.Problem: Samsung Store app keeps asking for terms and conditions every time it is opened, instead of only showing it once or after an update. This issue occurs on mobiles with OneUI 6 and 7, but not on tablets.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Samsung Store app repeatedly prompts users to accept terms and conditions upon opening, even after initial acceptance.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes inconvenience but does not prevent core functionality or lead to device failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: User did not click continue after accepting terms; pop-up persists until action is taken. The behavior is expected only on first open or after update, suggesting a UI flow issue in app initialization.

rows.Title: Note application gets auto restart while using
rows.Problem: Screen freeze in note app and system auto discards recording, user cannot see recording. Issue persists since device purchase.
rows.Summarized Problem: The note app freezes and automatically discards recordings, preventing users from viewing their recordings.
rows.Severity Reason: The app freezes and discards recordings, making the core functionality of the note app unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: The attached log lacks timing information; reproduction requires video and operation logs at the time of occurrence.

rows.Title: Key cafe theme is not working with the keyboard
rows.Problem: Key cafe theme is not working with the keyboard
rows.Summarized Problem: The Key Cafe keyboard theme is not functioning properly with the keyboard interface.
rows.Severity Reason: The theme fails to work with the keyboard, resulting in a partial malfunction of the interface functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Animator Scale 0 causes color tone not to work in Camera Pro/ProVideo
rows.Problem: When Animator Scale is set to 0, color tone does not work in Camera Pro or ProVideo; when Animator Scale is above 0, color tone works and screen recording sends.
rows.Summarized Problem: Color tone fails to work in Camera Pro and ProVideo when Animator Scale is set to 0.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature fails to function entirely when a key setting is zero, rendering color tone adjustment unusable in critical camera modes.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Edge panel immersive mode isn't working
rows.Problem: Edge panel immersive mode isn't working. Can't use edge panel in full screen mode of all the apps. Kindly fix it.
rows.Summarized Problem: The edge panel does not function in immersive full-screen mode across all apps.
rows.Severity Reason: Users cannot use the edge panel in full-screen apps, which is a core interactive feature preventing normal app usage.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: System UI constantly accesses device location
rows.Problem: System UI constantly accesses device location leading to excessive battery drain
rows.Summarized Problem: The System UI continuously accesses device location, causing excessive battery drain.
rows.Severity Reason: The constant location access leads to significant battery drain, making the device unusable for extended use.
rows.R&D Comment: GMS log analysis shows high DNS error rates during location access; further investigation needed

rows.Title: Quick panel control splashes while scroll down
rows.Problem: The quick panel control splashes for a moment before the smooth animation begins when swiping down after unlocking the phone
rows.Summarized Problem: The quick panel control splashes briefly before the animation starts when swiping down after unlocking the phone.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue is a visual glitch during animation, not affecting device usability or core functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Camera consistently going to unresponsive state
rows.Problem: Camera is not working and consistently going to unresponsive state
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera consistently becomes unresponsive and fails to function properly.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera is repeatedly going to an unresponsive state, rendering a major functionality unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: There is a hardware error in the Rear Tele(x5.0) camera module; request CS center to inspect the hardware.

rows.Title: Sticker showing on Quick Panel while swipe down
rows.Problem: Swipe down notification screen is showing stickers that were created and kept on lockscreen
rows.Summarized Problem: Stickers created on the lock screen are displayed in the quick panel when swiping down.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of the quick panel display, showing unintended content from the lock screen.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue occurs during specific device states after LockStar installation and is temporary; device-level fix planned.

rows.Title: Portrait photos taken at 2x zoom with studio effect turned into green screen after processing
rows.Problem: Portrait photos taken at 2x zoom with studio effect turned into green screen after processing. This happened three times. After taking a normal photo in normal mode, portrait captures appear fine.
rows.Summarized Problem: Portrait photos taken at 2x zoom with studio effect result in green screen after processing.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes complete failure of a key camera feature under specific conditions, resulting in unusable output.
rows.R&D Comment: Bug in image copying during studio effect failure has been identified and fixed, with update to be released.

rows.Title: Samsung app not working
rows.Problem: Samsung app not working even after reinstalling
rows.Summarized Problem: The Samsung app is not functioning properly even after reinstallation.
rows.Severity Reason: The app is completely non-functional after reinstallation, preventing user access to core features.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: One contact it automatically shift to another contact
rows.Problem: Contact app issue, when I click on one contact it automatically shift to another contact. Screen recording attached. it is happening after one ui 7 update
rows.Summarized Problem: Clicking on a contact automatically shifts to another contact in the contact app.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature fails to correctly identify and display the selected contact, causing user confusion and potential data misrepresentation.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Charging speed is slow
rows.Problem: Charging speed is slow compared to one ui6. Everything was fine before the update. All troubleshooting for charger and cable has been done, and they are original and working on another Samsung device. Turning off everything speeds up charging, which suggests the issue is related to the device's charging system.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device charges slowly compared to a similar model, and the issue persists even after checking hardware and cables.
rows.Severity Reason: The charging speed is significantly slower than expected, and turning off all devices improves performance, indicating a core charging system malfunction that affects usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Input current limited by AICL; if external TA voltage is abnormal, charger IC drops input current. Check TA or cable; if issue persists, hardware inspection required.

rows.Title: Videos not fully playing in Gallery App
rows.Problem: Some videos do not fully play when opening in the Gallery app
rows.Summarized Problem: Some videos fail to play fully when opened in the Gallery app.
rows.Severity Reason: Video playback ends immediately upon start, indicating a critical failure in media playback functionality that prevents full video viewing.
rows.R&D Comment: Video playback ends immediately upon start; recommend checking video compatibility on other devices or PCs and attaching the video file for analysis.

rows.Title: screen mirror and mode icon overlap in quick access panel
rows.Problem: screen mirror and mode icon overlap in quick access panel
rows.Summarized Problem: The screen mirror and mode icons overlap in the quick access panel.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a visual overlap but does not prevent device usage or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: A timing issue in view drawing was identified and resolved by synchronizing context drawing.

rows.Title: Recent button doesn't seem to work oftenly
rows.Problem: Recent button doesn't seem to work oftenly i have to restart it to work so fix this bugg
rows.Summarized Problem: The Recent button frequently fails to function and requires a restart to work.
rows.Severity Reason: The button failure causes repeated restarts, disrupting normal device usage and rendering a key feature intermittently non-functional.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Not showing animations on homescreen
rows.Problem: S23 is not showing animations on homescreen when opening or closing apps
rows.Summarized Problem: The home screen animations are missing when opening or closing apps on the S23.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of the home screen interface but does not prevent device usage or cause crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: V OS Ver 15 is already planned for this model; behavior needs to be shared and reported if reproduced.

rows.Title: One UI home keeps stopping
rows.Problem: UI one home keeps stopping
rows.Summarized Problem: The One UI home screen keeps stopping unexpectedly.
rows.Severity Reason: The home screen repeatedly stops, making the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: The analysis from provided logs is not sufficient. Please help to update to latest OS.

rows.Title: Delay in opening quick panel and WiFi panel space is mismatched
rows.Problem: Space mismatch occurs when accessing the quick panel and selecting the WiFi panel; alignment is off on first click but corrects on second click; the issue persists and affects UI alignment
rows.Summarized Problem: UI alignment mismatch occurs when accessing the WiFi panel in the quick panel, with incorrect positioning on first click that persists despite correction on second click.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes intermittent UI misalignment but does not prevent device operation or cause functional failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Fix has been identified and will be included in the next OS release.

rows.Title: Battery percentage icon showing while device not on charging
rows.Problem: Battery percentage icon showing while device not on charging
rows.Summarized Problem: The battery percentage icon appears on the device even when it is not charging.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of the battery display, where the icon shows under non-charging conditions, but does not prevent device usage or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The battery percentage value is shown based on the 'Show battery percentage' setting in settings; the issue is not clear from the description, and further details or video evidence are needed.

rows.Title: Device's processor hits 40+ on using Whatsapp, Instagram
rows.Problem: I have kept most of the apps in my phone are in deepsleep.... pls do optimize the os
rows.Summarized Problem: The device's processor temperature rises significantly when using WhatsApp and Instagram, causing performance issues.
rows.Severity Reason: The processor reaching 40+ degrees indicates excessive CPU usage, which can lead to device overheating and potential instability or crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue appears to be temporary; recommend clearing app cache and updating apps to resolve.

rows.Title: Battery backup reduced and phone heating up unexpectedly
rows.Problem: Battery backup reduced after One UI 7 upgrade, phone heats up unexpectedly during normal use, last 5% drains in 5 minutes, notification panel shows quick apps button from lock screen
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone experiences significant battery drain and unexpected overheating even during normal use, with last 5% draining in just 5 minutes.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is overheating and losing battery charge rapidly, which can lead to device instability or failure to operate normally.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Sim Call Disconnection and Slot Misidentification
rows.Problem: When making a call using a physical SIM, the phone disconnects immediately and shows "Mobile network unavailable", while mobile data over the same SIM works fine.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device disconnects during SIM-based calls, despite mobile data functioning normally on the same SIM.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to maintain a call connection, rendering a key communication function unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: In provided logs, a 5-minute call from SIM2 was recorded, but logs were collected 10 minutes before the event; further investigation needed.

rows.Title: Talk back action button not working
rows.Problem: Talk back action button is not working properly when double tapped; action is visible but no action is performed
rows.Summarized Problem: The Talk Back action button does not perform any action when double-tapped, although the action is visually indicated.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature appears to function visually but fails to execute the intended action, resulting in partial malfunction.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is due to a UI feedback loop in Talk Back; users should be guided to update to One UI 7.0 for improved functionality.

rows.Title: Voice cracks during calls
rows.Problem: Voice crackling sound during calls
rows.Summarized Problem: Users experience voice crackling during phone calls, with continuous speech delivery and high noise patterns on both transmit and receive sides.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes audible noise during calls, making communication difficult and potentially impacting user experience significantly.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue likely stems from receive-side high gain and transmit-side noise; further investigation needed to identify root cause and validate with voice call recordings.

rows.Title: Auto-recording the calls
rows.Problem: Calls are auto-recording even when set to not record calls from specific numbers in the Samsung dialer app
rows.Summarized Problem: The Samsung dialer app auto-records calls even when users have set it to exclude specific contacts, despite the setting being configured to disable recording.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is actively recording calls when it should not, violating user configuration and potentially leading to unintended data capture and privacy issues.
rows.R&D Comment: The auto-record setting is incorrectly set to 'record all calls except specific numbers' in logs, but specific numbers are missing due to privacy; provide CP silent logs to verify actual configuration and recording triggers.

rows.Title: Alphabets not visible on the keyboard
rows.Problem: Two alphabets are now invisible on the keyboard. When tapped, they appear in the top left corner. This issue persists after updates.
rows.Summarized Problem: Two alphabets on the keyboard are missing and appear only when tapped in the top left corner.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects usability but does not cause device crash or complete failure; functionality is partially impaired.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: My contacts and phone app not opening
rows.Problem: I have just now updated to office one ui 7. My contacts and phone app not opening. Crashing again and again I open.
rows.Summarized Problem: The contacts and phone apps are crashing and failing to open after updating to Office One UI 7.
rows.Severity Reason: The apps crash repeatedly upon opening, making them unusable and preventing core functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: The system is stuck in an 'Updating contacts' state due to a database index rebuild timeout, causing persistent crashes and failure to launch.

rows.Title: Unstable network issue
rows.Problem: Network instability occurs on Samsung S24 Ultra after One UI 7 and Android 15, with frequent switching from 5G to 4G, despite other devices working fine on 5G. The issue reoccurs after disabling power saving and updates. Device shows no service state and remains in LTE after errors.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device frequently switches from 5G to 4G and fails to maintain 5G connectivity, eventually falling into no service and staying in LTE.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes device to lose 5G connectivity and remain in LTE, making network access unreliable and potentially unusable for core functions like calls and data.
rows.R&D Comment: The root cause is TRM failure leading to no resource errors and RLFs during 5G attachment; UE fails to register to 5G and remains in LTE. Without CP logs, full diagnosis is impossible. Users must visit an authorized service center to collect logs.

rows.Title: Issue in playing video on 4KHDR on YT, Netflix and Samsung Native App
rows.Problem: A53 struggles to play 4KHDR video on YouTube, Netflix, and Samsung Native App, despite A52 and earlier models being capable. The device performs poorly compared to lower-priced models, suggesting a downgrade in performance despite being an upgrade. Hardware codec limitations prevent 4KHDR playback.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device fails to play 4KHDR videos on YouTube, Netflix, and Samsung Native App due to hardware codec limitations.
rows.Severity Reason: The device cannot play 4KHDR content, which is a core media function, making it unusable for users expecting high-quality video playback.
rows.R&D Comment: Hardware codec limitations of Exynos 1280 do not support VP9 and AV1, and software decoding cannot handle 4KHDR playback.

rows.Title: Notification panel not updated after latest software
rows.Problem: Notification panel remains solid and not transparent on S24 Ultra after OneUI 7 update, even when set to 0% transparency. Preview shows blur but actual panel appears solid after applying Quickstar settings.
rows.Summarized Problem: The notification panel on the device displays a solid color instead of being transparent, despite settings and preview indicating otherwise.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from seeing notification content, making the interface unusable and affecting core device functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Charging issues
rows.Problem: Here are the screenshots of my problem as I told you before
rows.Summarized Problem: Users experience charging issues when using certain cables or power adapters, possibly due to a faulty cable or TA, or a problem with the device's charging port.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction of the charging function, where the device may not charge properly with specific cables or adapters, but does not completely fail or cause device unavailability.
rows.R&D Comment: When AICL is detected by the charger IC, it may indicate a problem with the charging cable or TA; guide users to try different cables and TA, and if the issue persists, refer them to a service center for detailed inspection of the charging port.

rows.Title: Yellowish or grayish color appears when opening a black image
rows.Problem: A yellowish or grayish color appears instead of black when a black image is displayed on the screen.
rows.Summarized Problem: A yellowish or grayish discoloration appears instead of black when displaying a black image on the screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects image display accuracy but does not cause device failure or crash, and is not fully reproducible without visual evidence.
rows.R&D Comment: The phenomenon is difficult to confirm due to insufficient visual evidence; users are advised to visit a service center for diagnosis.

rows.Title: Device becomes unresponsive while sharing
rows.Problem: Unable to send photos or videos; device becomes unresponsive on rare occasions during sharing
rows.Summarized Problem: Device becomes unresponsive during rare sharing events, preventing users from sending photos or videos.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes unresponsive during sharing, which renders core functionality unusable and may lead to data loss or user frustration.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue likely caused by Twitter app sharing workflow; countermeasure involves clearing app data or re-reporting the issue.

rows.Title: Camera distorts in low light
rows.Problem: Camera distortion in low light, especially with 1st 50mp and 2nd 12mp sensors; 4th and 5th 12mp ultra-wide are good
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera distorts in low light conditions, particularly on the 50mp and 12mp sensors.
rows.Severity Reason: The distortion in low light significantly affects image usability, making it difficult to capture clear photos in common lighting conditions.
rows.R&D Comment: The distortion is attributed to sensor performance under low light; normal phenomenon as per current design.

rows.Title: Power off using side key
rows.Problem: Power off using side key takes longer than before and is increasingly irritating
rows.Summarized Problem: Power off function via side key is slow and increasingly frustrating to use.
rows.Severity Reason: The function is delayed and becomes progressively irritating, but still allows basic operation.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Back gesture indicator icon loses some part after being pulled
rows.Problem: The back gesture indicator icon loses some part after being pulled
rows.Summarized Problem: The back gesture indicator icon becomes incomplete when the user pulls it.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of gesture feedback, but does not prevent device operation or cause crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Home UI crashing while opening Google widget
rows.Problem: Home UI crashes every time the Google song search widget is selected
rows.Summarized Problem: The Home UI crashes when the Google song search widget is selected.
rows.Severity Reason: The UI crashes on widget interaction, making the home screen unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Flickering issue while using camera
rows.Problem: Flickering issue after updating new software
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera's AF drive unit is damaged due to impacts or vibrations, causing difficulty in focusing and capturing clear photos.
rows.Severity Reason: The device cannot properly focus during photography, leading to poor image quality and rendering the camera function largely unusable.
