rows.Problem: When Bluetooth is connected, the icon is not displayed on the top right corner and only appears when dragging down the notification panel. The vibration icon becomes unstable when attempting to add the Bluetooth icon.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Bluetooth icon fails to display on the lock screen when connected, and becomes unstable when manually added.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents immediate visibility of Bluetooth status on the lock screen, affecting user experience, but does not cause device failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Side Key Button Not Work Properly
rows.Problem: When the side button long press option is set to Bixby, pressing the power and volume up buttons simultaneously shows a microphone icon on the status bar even though no command is assigned to that combination.
rows.Summarized Problem: The side button long press function triggers unintended microphone icon display when power and volume up buttons are pressed simultaneously, despite no command being assigned.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes an unintended UI response but does not prevent device operation or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Caller background picture gets blurred out
rows.Problem: When lifting a call, the caller background picture blurs. Previously, it was a mixed color background (green and black, pink and black) which looked premium. Now it's a plain color and blurs. User wants the original background effect and wants to prevent blurring. The setting to change the background is not working.
rows.Summarized Problem: The caller background picture blurs during a call and defaults to a plain color instead of a premium mixed color background.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects the visual experience during calls but does not cause device crash or data loss, and the background can still be customized via contact settings.
rows.R&D Comment: Fix to show default background when contact photo is not saved; the blur effect is now part of a design change since version 7.X, and users can customize background via contact profile or call settings.

rows.Title: Unsupported video plays audio but not the video
rows.Problem: Unsupported video plays audio which is ok but there is lags in display
rows.Summarized Problem: Unsupported video formats play audio but suffer from display lag during playback.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes noticeable lag in video display, which impacts user experience and may lead to poor performance during media consumption.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue not reproducible under current conditions; requires detailed reproduction path and recorded video to confirm and investigate further.

rows.Title: Device gets unresponsive & stuck while restarting
rows.Problem: Device shows 'One UI - Optimizing Apps' screen, loads to 100%, screen dims, then becomes unresponsive and stuck. Power button press yields no response. User must perform hard restart.
rows.Summarized Problem: Device becomes unresponsive and stuck during restart, failing to boot properly after showing the 'One UI - Optimizing Apps' screen.
rows.Severity Reason: Device fails to complete boot process and becomes unresponsive, rendering it unusable until a hard restart is performed.
rows.R&D Comment: User likely performed app uninstalls via shell, triggering system instability; countermeasure involves verifying app removal procedures and advising against debloating.

rows.Title: Unable to make normal call during WhatsApp call from secure folder
rows.Problem: After UI 7 update, unable to make normal calls from phone dialer while on a WhatsApp call from secure folder
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot make normal calls from the phone dialer while on a WhatsApp call originating from the secure folder.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from making calls entirely during an active call, rendering a key functionality unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Active call and intended call use different phone account handles. Countermeasure: Users must terminate the active call to make a new one; Google's AOSP implementation restricts this behavior in multi-user and simultaneous call scenarios.

rows.Title: Device becomes unresponsive while listening to Spotify
rows.Problem: Spotify continues playing after mobile data finishes, then stops suddenly. Music notification does not respond when tapped. Spotify app does not open when tried multiple times. Spotify's UI appears in place when swiping up to app drawer and returning to home screen.
rows.Summarized Problem: Device becomes unresponsive after mobile data ends while Spotify is playing, with the app failing to respond to user interactions and showing a stale UI.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes unresponsive and fails to respond to app interactions, indicating a critical system failure that disrupts core functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue occurs during audio playback after data exhaustion, with no evidence of memory or CPU contention; further investigation needed to determine root cause.

rows.Title: Unable to use bluetooth headphones for calls
rows.Problem: After the latest OneUI 7 (Stable) update on my galaxy S23 Ultra, I can't use my bluetooth headphones while on a call. I have Galaxy buds 2 pro and having this issue since I updated my phone to the latest software. Saw a few posts that a few people were having the same issues with the 2nd Beta update.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot use Bluetooth headphones during phone calls after the OneUI 7 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents a core functionality (voice calls with headphones) from working, rendering the device unusable for basic communication.
rows.R&D Comment: Connection is failing due to page timeout; ensure remote device is powered on and in pairing mode, and verify with other devices or OTA logs if remote device is sending packets.

rows.Title: Loud read notifications not working
rows.Problem: Loud read notifications in Modes and Routines are not working after updating to One UI 7.0
rows.Summarized Problem: Loud read notifications are not functioning in Modes and Routines after the One UI 7.0 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is partially malfunctioning after an update, affecting user experience but not rendering the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Battery percentage not showing
rows.Problem: I cannot see the battery percentage after updating to One UI 7
rows.Summarized Problem: The battery percentage is not visible on the device after the One UI 7 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The user cannot see battery level, which is essential for device usage and monitoring.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Installed apps overlapping with existing widgets
rows.Problem: After updating to oneui 7, when installing applications from playstore or galaxy store, the app overlaps with existing widgets. Users can move widgets and place them, but overlap occurs.
rows.Summarized Problem: Newly installed apps are overlapping with existing widgets on the home screen after updating to OneUI 7.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction of widget positioning, allowing overlap despite user ability to reposition widgets.
rows.R&D Comment: The overlap is a known behavior of the DIY Home feature in HomeUp; users should disable this feature to prevent overlap.

rows.Title: Inconsistent battery percentage readings
rows.Problem: After updating to One UI 7, the phone shows inconsistent battery percentage readings. The battery drains to 1% and then jumps to 39% after charging, drops to 7–8% after removing the charger, and stays stuck at 37–39% even after overnight charging. The reading corrects to 84% after a restart. This affects user experience and makes battery usage unreliable.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device displays inconsistent and unstable battery percentage readings after an OS update, leading to unreliable battery usage information.
rows.Severity Reason: The battery percentage readings are erratic and untrustworthy, causing significant user confusion and undermining core device functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Battery performance has degraded due to aging; recommend replacing the battery.

rows.Title: Delay in app launch/close
rows.Problem: Animation test of opening and closing apps is not smooth on the S23 Ultra with One UI 7 stable version. Gesture tuning on Home-up from Good Lock apps has issues responding.
rows.Summarized Problem: App launch and close animations are not smooth on the S23 Ultra with One UI 7.
rows.Severity Reason: The animation issue affects usability but does not cause device malfunction or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Keep all animation scales at 1. (Window animation scale, Transition animation scale, Animator duration scale)

rows.Title: Smiley option missing from keyboard
rows.Problem: Smiley option and other tab bar not showing on keyboard after recent security patch update
rows.Summarized Problem: The smiley option and tab bar are missing from the Samsung keyboard after a recent software update.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is partially missing, affecting usability but not rendering the device unusable or causing crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause and countermeasure both indicate that the keyboard toolbar was turned off; users need to enable it in settings.

rows.Title: Game Plugins not supported in V-OS
rows.Problem: Game plugins are no longer supported in the latest software update, with some functions moved to GameBooster and others to Goodlock app.
rows.Summarized Problem: Game plugins are no longer supported in V-OS, with functionality migrated to GameBooster and Goodlock apps.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial migration of functionality rather than a complete failure or device malfunction.
rows.R&D Comment: GamePlugin is no longer supported by GameBooster UX simplification policy in Android V-os. Some functions of GamePlugin have been added as the main function of GameBooster, and the rest will be additionally supported through the Goodlock app. Please keep the current status.

rows.Title: Operating advance features in Home up is not smooth
rows.Problem: Phone is not smooth when using advanced animations in HomeUp, such as icon scale, icon tracking, wallpaper, and home screen interpolators, despite latest One UI 7 update
rows.Summarized Problem: Home screen animations are not smooth and fail to respond properly to advanced visual features like icon scaling and transitions.
rows.Severity Reason: The device's responsiveness is significantly degraded during normal use, affecting core user experience with visual feedback and app transitions.
rows.R&D Comment: Optimized the performance of animation and fixed the animation related issues

rows.Title: Front camera not working in third-party apps
rows.Problem: Front camera stopped working in third-party apps like WhatsApp and Google Meet after updating to One UI 6.1, though it works in the default Samsung Camera app.
rows.Summarized Problem: The front camera fails to function in third-party apps after a software update, despite working in the default Samsung Camera app.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects functionality in multiple apps but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause and countermeasure both indicate insufficient log and video synchronization; users should update apps and retest with synchronized logs.

rows.Title: Constant switching of network from 5G to 4G
rows.Problem: The hotspot switches from 5G to 4G after a few minutes when sharing network with devices like laptop or PlayStation 5, despite strong 5G signal. It works for only 2 minutes before switching, and this behavior is sudden and inconsistent.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device intermittently switches from 5s to 4G when sharing 5G hotspot, despite strong 5G signal, and only works for about two minutes before failing.
rows.Severity Reason: The device drops 5G connectivity, causing a loss of high-speed network sharing, which renders the hotspot function unusable for most users during active use.
rows.R&D Comment: Device temperature is high, leading to thermal drop of 5G signal; further investigation needed

rows.Title: App names come written in dark color instead of white
rows.Problem: App name is marked in dark colour, I tried changing to dark mode and bright no use, help me change this to white colour
rows.Summarized Problem: App names are displayed in dark color instead of white, regardless of dark or bright mode settings.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visual consistency but does not cause device malfunction or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Device getting overheated
rows.Problem: Device overheats during regular use, especially when using 5G/WiFi, AC USB charging, and running Android Auto, camera, and SNS apps simultaneously.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device overheats during normal usage due to combined load from 5G/WiFi, AC charging, and multiple apps.
rows.Severity Reason: Overheating occurs under normal usage conditions and is caused by combined app and network loads, potentially leading to device instability or performance degradation.
rows.R&D Comment: Overheating is caused by combined load from 5G/WiFi, AC charging, and multiple apps; mitigation requires optimizing background app and network load management.

rows.Title: not able to open any application for 2-3 seconds after closing incognito tab notification
rows.Problem: after closing incognito tab notification, unable to open any app for 2-3 seconds, tapping on app results in 'PROCESSING NOTIFICATION' alert
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot open any applications for 2-3 seconds after closing an incognito tab notification, resulting in a 'PROCESSING NOTIFICATION' alert when attempting to launch apps.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from launching applications, making the device unusable for basic functionality during that period.
rows.R&D Comment: This is a Chrome-based issue; reported to Crbug with ID 416181574. Google will address it in future Chrome updates.

rows.Title: Unable to launch camera
rows.Problem: camera is unable to open
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera app fails to launch and cannot open.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera cannot open, preventing basic device functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Glitch in the homepage
rows.Problem: After adding some pages in the homescreen, when trying to delete the pages by swiping inwards and opening the home screen settings page, there is no option to delete the page which appears at the top.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot delete pages at the top of the home screen after adding them.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction in page deletion functionality, affecting user interaction but not rendering the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: HomeUp not working on Lock Screen
rows.Problem: Home Up feature of Good Lock not working after UI 7 update. Every time clicking Home Up shows a pop-up.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Home Up feature on the Lock Screen is not working after UI 7 update and shows a pop-up every time it is clicked.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature fails to function properly and consistently displays a pop-up, making it unusable and disrupting user interaction.
rows.R&D Comment: The Home Up feature is incompatible with the current launcher version due to version mismatch; update Home Up to version 16.x.x to resolve.

rows.Title: Game booster feature in good lock is not available
rows.Problem: Game booster feature in good lock is not available even after One UI 7.0 Update in my Samsung S24FE device. It is very worse than, with One UI 7.0, i lost Game Plugins features which were super awesome in One Ui 6.0 and now I feel like getting One Ui 6.0 back with gaming features.
rows.Summarized Problem: The game booster feature is not available in the good lock screen after the One UI 7.0 update, resulting in loss of gaming plugins functionality.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely missing post-update, impacting core gaming functionality and user experience significantly.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: 5G network not latching in device
rows.Problem: After removing and reinserting the SIM card, the device does not show 5G signal, even though the user has a 5G plan and the area supports 5G. The device previously detected 5G before the UI update.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device fails to maintain 5G network connection after SIM removal and reinsertion, despite having a 5G plan and network support in the area.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to register 5G network after basic operations, which is a core connectivity function required for usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: swipe up gesture not working for multi window
rows.Problem: The swipe up gesture for multi window isn't working and the button is freeze
rows.Summarized Problem: The swipe up gesture for multi window is not working and the button freezes after the update.
rows.Severity Reason: The gesture freeze prevents users from accessing multi-window functionality, making the device unusable for key tasks.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Test menu doesn't appear on entering *#0011#
rows.Problem: The test menu does not appear when dialing *#0011# and typing Q0000. It shows an error, and although it sometimes appears after clicking SIM 1, no options work.
rows.Summarized Problem: The test menu fails to appear when accessing via *#0011# and key input, and when it appears, no options are functional.
rows.Severity Reason: The test menu is inaccessible and non-functional, preventing users from performing basic system diagnostics, rendering a key feature unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by the Auto Blocker being ON, which blocks keystrings; countermeasure is to provide CP silent logs for keystring failure scenarios.

rows.Title: Color Banding shown in captured Images
rows.Problem: Color banding persists in darker tones like red, green, and gray, especially when using certain apps, despite adjusting brightness, updating software, and performing a full factory reset.
rows.Summarized Problem: Color banding persists in dark tones during image capture, even after software updates and factory reset.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects image quality in critical tones and persists despite full device reset and software updates, rendering captured images visually defective.
rows.R&D Comment: Requires a defective device for analysis; display module inspection needed to identify root cause.

rows.Title: Doesn't follow up completely and misinterprets
rows.Problem: Gemini voice assistant never properly catches my voice and always misinterprets it, sometimes leaving hearing in just halfway. This happens every time, regardless of attempts.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Gemini voice assistant fails to properly recognize user voice and frequently misinterprets input, resulting in incomplete or incorrect responses.
rows.Severity Reason: The assistant consistently fails to capture user voice, leading to major functional failure in voice interaction, which is essential for usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Retrain voice model in Gemini app settings to improve voice recognition; further investigation needed if issue persists.

rows.Title: device lags while accessing control and notification panel
rows.Problem: After one ui 7 update the phone ui became so laggy showing shutters when accessing control and notification panel and overall there are minor lags and frame drops throughout usage. There is som much space for optimization
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences lag and frame drops when accessing the notification panel and control panel after the UI 7 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction of the notification and control panel functionality, leading to noticeable but not complete system failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Black line appears on home screen while closing the device by double tap
rows.Problem: After locking the screen, black marks appear on the home screen. This issue occurs after a software update.
rows.Summarized Problem: Black marks appear on the home screen after locking it, following a software update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects screen display but does not completely disable device functionality or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is likely related to software rendering during screen lock; recommend checking screen driver or idle state handling in the software update.

rows.Title: Dark mode doesn't turn off at scheduled time
rows.Problem: Dark mode does not switch off at its scheduled time and must be manually disabled. Sleep mode also requires manual switching off when it should turn off automatically.
rows.Summarized Problem: Dark mode fails to turn off at its scheduled time and must be manually disabled, with sleep mode also requiring manual intervention.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents automatic system behavior, making the device unusable in expected modes without manual intervention.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Device still rings on getting calls despite being on silent
rows.Problem: Phone is on silent mode but still plays a ringtone when receiving calls or notifications
rows.Summarized Problem: The device plays a ringtone when on silent mode, despite being set to silent.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is functioning incorrectly in a basic mode (silent), causing audible alerts that contradict user expectations and may lead to confusion or misuse.
rows.R&D Comment: The ringtone volume is set to 15 every time the user receives a call. Please check whether there is a policy for setting the ringtone volume. setting->Modes and Routines->Routines

rows.Title: sluggish in opening the app from notification panel
rows.Problem: The notification bar was not working properly
rows.Summarized Problem: The notification panel takes a long time to open when launching an app from the notification panel.
rows.Severity Reason: The app launch from the notification panel is delayed, causing a noticeable performance issue but does not result in a complete failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Lock screen widgets appear on notification panel
rows.Problem: Lockscreen widgets appear whenever I open the notification drawer
rows.Summarized Problem: Lockscreen widgets appear when the notification drawer is opened.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of the notification interface, preventing users from accessing notifications without interference from lockscreen widgets.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue not reproducible in latest binary; further investigation needed

rows.Title: Weather app showing wrong location
rows.Problem: Samsung Weather app shows incorrect location, displaying Balekuppam instead of the correct and recognized area name Ponnai
rows.Summarized Problem: The Samsung Weather app incorrectly displays location data, showing Balekuppam instead of the correct area name Ponnai.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes confusion in location accuracy but does not prevent device operation or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Bluetooth option disappear in Notification Panel
rows.Problem: When I open my Bluetooth panel from notification window, once I select my Bluetooth and click on popup, the Bluetooth option disappears from the top panel. It shows an overlay though. This is irritating.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Bluetooth option disappears from the notification panel after selecting and clicking on it, leaving only an overlay.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of the Bluetooth settings interface, disrupting user interaction but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Setting panel opens with notification panel
rows.Problem: When trying to open the setting panel, the notification panel opens instead.
rows.Summarized Problem: The setting panel opens with the notification panel appearing instead.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of the settings interface, but the device remains usable.

rows.Title: Battery drain
rows.Problem: Battery logs show increased current consumption during screen on, especially with Instagram, medium brightness, and speaker volume at 8, with data usage around 70-800MB during video viewing. Device feels faster draining than normal, especially during screen-on activities.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences increased battery drain during screen-on activities, particularly when using Instagram with medium brightness and speaker volume at 8, and during video viewing.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction during specific usage scenarios, leading to noticeable but not complete battery drain, affecting user experience without rendering the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Battery drain is observed during screen-on activities, especially with media use; further investigation needed to determine if due to software behavior or hardware aging.

rows.Title: Call type space is blank
rows.Problem: The call type field is blank when reporting a call, despite previously showing options like fraud, spam, robo.
rows.Summarized Problem: The call type field is blank when users report a call, preventing identification of call type.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature partially malfunctions as it fails to display call type options, but the core functionality of reporting calls remains available.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Brightness not working properly
rows.Problem: Phone display brightness drops in sunlight, then improves, then drops again, making it hard to see
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone's display brightness fluctuates in sunlight, causing visibility issues.
rows.Severity Reason: The brightness function is unstable and intermittently fails, making the device unusable in bright conditions.
rows.R&D Comment: The brightness limit is incorrectly set to 0 in high ambient light; users should update to the latest version to apply the correct array value.

rows.Title: DIY Home feature not available in Home UpApp
rows.Problem: After updating to One UI 7 on S23 and updating the Home Up module, the DIY Home feature is not visible.
rows.Summarized Problem: The DIY Home feature is missing in the Home UpApp after updating to One UI 7 on S23.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing but still available in beta; users may need to update the app to restore access.
rows.R&D Comment: The DIY Home feature was initially released as a beta version; users are advised to update the Home Up app to access it.

rows.Title: When searching for a name in contact list, it automatically goes on top of the list
rows.Problem: After updating UI7 in S23 Ultra, selecting a contact from the contact list and searching their name or number causes it to automatically move to the top of the list. With many contacts starting with the same alphabet, the contact becomes invisible after touching the list.
rows.Summarized Problem: When searching for a contact, the result automatically moves to the top of the list and becomes invisible when there are many contacts with the same starting letter.
rows.Severity Reason: The contact disappears from view after interaction, making it unusable in scenarios with many contacts, leading to a significant usability issue.
rows.R&D Comment: When contact expands, the list is redrawn due to order changes from Samsung Search's frequently searched contacts, causing items to vanish. The solution is to redraw only when actual data changes or during explicit refresh, not on real-time updates.

rows.Title: battery drain
rows.Problem: battery drain and heating reported
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences significant battery drain and heating, especially during YouTube streaming with high speaker volume.
rows.Severity Reason: Battery drain and heating during active usage make the device unusable under normal conditions, leading to rapid power loss and potential overheating.
rows.R&D Comment: Battery drain is primarily caused by YouTube streaming with high speaker volume; no abnormal log behavior observed.

rows.Title: Display UI Home Screen Widgets are not displayed properly in Landscape mode
rows.Problem: In landscape mode, widgets are not displayed properly after one ui 7
rows.Summarized Problem: Widgets are not displayed properly on the home screen in landscape mode.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects widget display in a specific orientation but does not cause device crash or complete failure of core functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue has been fixed after sync up with launcher code.

rows.Title: Unable to connect with Mobile NW
rows.Problem: Still the error found
rows.Summarized Problem: Users are unable to connect to mobile networks due to persistent error messages.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to establish a network connection, which is essential for basic functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause and countermeasure both point to the need for CP silent logs to diagnose the issue.

rows.Title: SMS Verification Messages Failing Due to Auto-Appended Characters
rows.Problem: SMS verification messages automatically append two equal signs (==) at the end of the text, causing the verification to fail when receiving systems expect an exact message format. This does not occur with regular SMS messages.
rows.Summarized Problem: SMS verification messages are automatically appended with two equal signs, causing the verification to fail.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents successful authentication during banking app verification, rendering the feature unusable in critical scenarios.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue is not clear. Video and logs are missing; further investigation needed

rows.Title: Battery drain observed in the device
rows.Problem: Massive and quick battery drain after Ome UI 7 update on My S23 Ultra, screen on time is very low, settings do not support battery saving, 5G cannot be turned off in battery saving mode, battery drains even in light performance mode. One UI 7 was supposed to increase battery performance but instead causes severe drain.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences massive and rapid battery drain after the Ome UI 7 update, even in light performance mode, with no battery saving options and 5G remaining on in battery saving mode.
rows.Severity Reason: The battery drain is severe and undermines core device usability, making the device impractical for daily use.
rows.R&D Comment: Background apps like Instagram and WhatsApp are running excessively; clearing their cache and optimizing background app management is recommended.

rows.R&D Comment: Cause and countermeasure both point to the need for CP silent logs for further investigation.

rows.Title: Mouse cursor type icon appears on centre of display

rows.Severity Reason: The feature fails to function as scheduled, requiring daily manual intervention, which disrupts user experience and renders the feature ineffective.
rows.R&D Comment: We have checked the issue in the latest binary but it didn't reproduce at our end. The exact root cause is not clear from provided logs. If the issue persists, please raise a new issue with logs and video.

rows.Title: Unable to log in to the Game Plugins
rows.Problem: Unable to log in to the Game Plugins app after the UI 7.0 update. It does not open or appear on the device.

rows.Severity Reason: The app fails to open or appear after a system update, rendering a key gaming feature inaccessible and impacting user experience significantly.
rows.R&D Comment: Game plug-ins are no longer supported in Android V-os; functionality has been integrated into GameBoosterPlus and Goodlock.

rows.Title: Bixby removed from Digital Assistant App choices

rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing from a key user interface option, but the absence is not causing device malfunction or data loss, and users can still use other assistants.
rows.R&D Comment: Bixby is intentionally placed at the same level as digital assistant settings, not under it; current status is by design.

rows.Title: Blur engine not working correctly on widgets
rows.Problem: Blur engine not working correctly on widgets, widgets become transparent, blur applied only when moved to the left, all other widgets now transparent without blur
rows.Summarized Problem: The blur engine fails to apply correctly on widgets, causing them to appear transparent.
rows.Severity Reason: Widgets become transparent, which significantly impacts UI usability and user experience.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Bitmap conversion fails when window size does not match during screenshot processing. Countermeasure: Modify bitmap transformation to match window bounds and log intermediate results.

rows.Title: Media sound has become very low
rows.Problem: Media sound output very low after one ui 7 update

rows.Severity Reason: The feature is not functioning as intended but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss; it is a partial malfunction in a specific use case.

rows.Title: Call background shows random color instead of saved background

rows.Title: Telegram App Crashes During Audio/Video Calls
rows.Problem: Telegram App Crashes During Audio/Video Calls

rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes immediately during calls, leading to complete loss of call functionality, which renders a key communication feature unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Native crash in org.telegram.messenger due to SIGSEGV indicating memory access error; likely a code or library issue in the call module.

rows.Title: AUTO RESTART
rows.Problem: Phone is restarting at random times during tasks, showing app optimization progress at 85% before restarting after completion. This started after the UI 7 update and has occurred twice in the past four hours.
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone randomly restarts during tasks, showing an app optimization progress bar at 85% before rebooting.
rows.Severity Reason: The device restarts mid-task, disrupting user workflow and potentially causing data loss or instability.
rows.R&D Comment: SYSMMU fault occurred with no debugging info due to MFC driver recovery failure; patches released to dump debug info and disable async_fault in MFC sysmmu.

rows.Title: Cant reply WhatsApp msg from notification bar in landscape mode

rows.Title: Lockscreen clock size gets small
rows.Problem: Lock screen clock size is small and becomes normal after restart
rows.Summarized Problem: The clock on the lock screen appears small and only returns to normal after a device restart.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects functionality intermittently and requires restart to resolve, but does not prevent device usage or cause crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Battery drain
rows.Problem: Battery draining very fast after UI7 update
rows.Summarized Problem: The device's battery is draining very fast after the UI7 update, likely due to high network usage by apps.
rows.Severity Reason: The battery drains rapidly, which makes the device unusable without frequent charging, indicating a major functional failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Battery drain
rows.Problem: Battery drains very fast, faster than expected for a 5000mAh device, lasting less than 8 hours.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device battery drains rapidly, significantly shorter than expected for a 5000mAh capacity.
rows.Severity Reason: The battery drains extremely fast, indicating a major performance issue that compromises device usability.
rows.R&D Comment: The app 'YouTube Music' (UID 10361) is consuming excessive background power, causing significant battery drain; recommend optimizing background activity in the app.

rows.Title: Battery drain
rows.Problem: After the New Update 7 my phone's S23 5g battery getting drain fast
rows.Summarized Problem: The device's battery is draining rapidly after the latest software update.
rows.Severity Reason: The battery drains quickly, which makes the device unusable for normal usage.
rows.R&D Comment: Battery drain issue observed; insufficient log duration and screen-off discharge data suggest incomplete monitoring; request for extended log capture to validate behavior.

rows.Title: Slow charging and sluggish battery percentage
rows.Problem: Phone charges slowly, showing battery percentage that jumps from 1-5% to 90% or higher after restart, and battery drains quickly even when not in use, especially after updating to One UI 7.
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone charges slowly and displays inaccurate battery percentage, with rapid battery drain even when not in use.
rows.Severity Reason: The device shows inaccurate battery readings and drains rapidly, leading to unexpected power loss and reduced usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Battery consumption during screen-off appears similar to pre-update levels; further investigation needed if inactivity-related drain reoccurs.

rows.Title: Circle feature not working
rows.Problem: Circle to search is not working and has some lag
rows.Summarized Problem: The circle search feature is not working and exhibits lag after updating to ONE UI 7.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is partially malfunctioning with lag, but still allows some functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Logs are not in sync with video; require synchronized logs and video for analysis.

rows.Title: Frame drop during video recording
rows.Problem: Significant frame drop issue during video recording in both 60 FPS and 30 FPS, persists even after factory reset. Video shows drop between 1-4 seconds.
rows.Summarized Problem: A significant frame drop occurs during video recording in both 60 FPS and 30 FPS modes, persisting after factory reset.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes visible frame drops during recording, impairing video quality and usability, which is a major function failure.
rows.R&D Comment: The logs lack video usecase runtime data; provide CP silent logs for further investigation.

rows.Title: Wi-Fi turns off automatically
rows.Problem: Icons marked in status bar are missing in normal home screen look
rows.Summarized Problem: Wi-Fi turns off automatically and status bar icons are missing on the home screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial functionality of Wi-Fi and status bar display, which affects user experience but does not render the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Device gets overheated even in normal use
rows.Problem: Device overheats during normal use, despite logs showing no abnormal heating; user reports heat after reboot due to high system load
rows.Summarized Problem: The device overheats during normal use, particularly after reboot, due to high system load and current consumption.
rows.Severity Reason: The device overheats during normal operation, but not to a point of crash or data loss; heating is linked to system boot and load, not a complete failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Overheating observed during reboot due to high system load; recommend user to report usage scenarios and logs when heat is felt.

rows.Title: Status bar dot cannot be removed to display app icons
rows.Problem: On the left side of the status bar next to the time, a dot appears after three app notification icons. In previous versions, users could remove this dot to show all app icons, but that option is missing in the current version. The settings have been thoroughly checked with no option available to modify this.
rows.Summarized Problem: A dot appears after app icons in the status bar and cannot be removed, preventing full visibility of app icons.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents full visibility of app icons but does not cause device malfunction or crash.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Loss of 5G network
rows.Problem: Often losing 5G network after UI 7 update on Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra
rows.Summarized Problem: Users frequently lose 5G network connectivity after updating to UI 7 on Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes complete loss of 5G connectivity, which is a major functional failure impacting core network performance and device usability.
rows.R&D Comment: SA disabled; device enters NR5G_RRC_DEACTIV state, indicating 5G deactivation; countermeasure suggests overheating, but logs show network deactivation, pointing to deeper software configuration issue.

rows.Title: Exposure setting in camera quick tool not visible
rows.Problem: After one UI 7 update, the exposure setting in camera quick tools is not visible as advertised. User has tried restart and troubleshooting but no resolution. User experience is affected. This is a major bug or flaw.
rows.Summarized Problem: The exposure setting in the camera quick tools is missing after UI 7 update, contradicting user expectations and affecting user experience.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing entirely and was advertised, leading to a major user experience failure and device usability issue.
rows.Resolve Type: Product Requirement, UX Guide, Standard Technical Specification
rows.R&D Comment: The exposure setting is intended for flagship and V OS models only; S23FE runs T OS initially, so the setting is not available. This behavior is normal on S23FE with OneUI 7.

rows.Title: Now bar comes in the middle of the screen
rows.Problem: Now bar is in the middle of the lock screen
rows.Summarized Problem: The Now bar appears in the middle of the lock screen instead of its intended position.
rows.Severity Reason: The Now bar is misplaced on the lock screen, causing a partial malfunction of the interface layout.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: AI Selection feature is slow
rows.Problem: The new AI selection feature is much slower than smart select. Kindly bring back that or make this one faster
rows.Summarized Problem: The AI selection feature is significantly slower than the smart select feature and needs to be improved or replaced.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is slower than an existing option, leading to a partial malfunction in user experience, but does not cause device failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Unable to setup samsung pass
rows.Problem: Unable to setup samsung pass in new S24 ULTRA. Tried clearing cache and data. Needs a fix. Preparing Samsung Pass... Samsung Wallet is temporarily not available. Try again later.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot set up Samsung Pass on the S24 Ultra due to a temporary wallet unavailability during setup.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial failure in the setup flow but does not prevent full device usage or lead to data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: This issue occurred when the PPP information was overwritten with a zero value during KnoxMatrix EscrowVault registration; further investigation needed for logs to validate.

rows.Title: Unable to run GOS lite error on launching Game plugin
rows.Problem: Game booster not working properly and game plugin not working after updating to one ui 7, showing error 'Unable to run GOS lite'
rows.Summarized Problem: The game plugin fails to launch due to an error indicating 'Unable to run GOS lite'.
rows.Severity Reason: The error prevents the game plugin from launching, rendering a key feature unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Game plug-ins are no longer supported in Android V-os; functionality is now integrated into GameBoosterPlus and provided via Goodlock.

rows.Title: Portrait mode blur inaccurate
rows.Problem: Portrait mode blur is inaccurate after One UI 7 update. Edges around headset and face are not processed cleanly.
rows.Summarized Problem: Portrait mode blur is inaccurate, with edges around the headset and face not processed cleanly.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes significant visual distortion in portrait mode, affecting user experience and image quality, making the feature unusable for face and headset-related content.
rows.R&D Comment: Depthmap errors occur when feature matching between two cameras is difficult, especially with thin subjects or repetitive backgrounds.

rows.Title: Battery drain
rows.Problem: Phone battery drains quickly after UI 7 update, requiring charging 3-4 times a day
rows.Summarized Problem: The device battery drains quickly after the UI 7 update, requiring frequent charging.
rows.Severity Reason: Frequent charging makes the device unusable for daily use, indicating a major functional failure.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is related to the Instagram app excessively consuming CPU in the background. The issue has been reported to Meta and is under investigation; once fixed, it will be updated via the Play Store.

rows.Title: Battery drain
rows.Problem: Battery draining too fast after UI 7 update
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences rapid battery drain after the UI 7 update, likely due to excessive data usage by media streaming apps in poor network conditions.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes unusable quickly due to rapid battery drain, which impacts core functionality and user experience.
rows.R&D Comment: Excessive data usage by Instagram and Amazon MP3 apps in poor network environments causes prolonged battery drain; countermeasure is to limit background streaming and optimize app behavior in low-connectivity scenarios.

rows.Title: Youtube music multiple instances in recent app tray
rows.Problem: YouTube Music remains open after being locked and shows multiple instances in the recent app tray
rows.Summarized Problem: YouTube Music displays multiple instances in the recent apps tray after being locked.
rows.Severity Reason: The app remains open and shows multiple instances, which is a partial malfunction affecting user experience but does not cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue will be fixed in Homescreen version 16.0.09.13 or above.

rows.Title: No missed call alert received when device is in flight mode
rows.Problem: Missed call alert is not received when phone is in flight mode. The same SIM works on other devices, indicating the issue is with phone settings. User has tried various YouTube solutions without success.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users do not receive missed call alerts when the device is in flight mode, despite the SIM being functional on other devices.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects call notification functionality but does not prevent device operation or cause crashes or data loss; it is a partial malfunction of a feature.
rows.R&D Comment: Missed call notifications are not sent by telecom when in airplane mode; this is a telecom-side behavior, not a Samsung software issue.

rows.Title: Multiple issue observed in the device
rows.Problem: Battery life has deteriorated significantly. The "Enter Pin" caption, number pad on Lockscreen, and fingerprint screen have gone black and cannot be turned white except for the number pad. Users can no longer bypass the OK button after entering a PIN, unlike before when deleting the last two digits would allow bypassing without pressing OK.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device's battery life has significantly deteriorated, and users can no longer bypass the OK button after entering a PIN.
rows.Severity Reason: The device's battery life has deteriorated significantly and a critical user interaction (bypassing OK button) is no longer functional, making the device unusable in certain scenarios.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Notification panel not going up when swiped up from bottom of the screen
rows.Problem: Notification panel not going back by swiping from the bottom of the screen, making it feel like the phone is stuck at one screen
rows.Summarized Problem: The notification panel fails to respond to swipe-up gestures from the bottom of the screen, creating a perception that the device is stuck.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from accessing notifications, rendering a core interactive function unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Wifi call not available sometimes
rows.Problem: Wifi calling is not available sometimes. After the update, the wifi calling option shows only when dragging the notification panel, not on the home screen.
rows.Summarized Problem: Wifi calling is intermittently unavailable and only appears when the notification panel is dragged down, not on the home screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial functionality failure in a key feature, but does not prevent device usage or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue has been identified and a fix is planned for the next OS release.

rows.Title: watch doesn't have esim option
rows.Problem: watch doesn't have esim option. even though it is an LTE version, it is not able to connect to service provider. customer requests fix or exchange or refund
rows.Summarized Problem: An LTE watch model lacks ESIM support and cannot connect to service providers, especially when using a prepaid SIM.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to connect to service providers, which renders it unusable for core functionality like connectivity and service access.
rows.R&D Comment: Customer needs a postpaid Airtel number with 4G service; device pairing only works with postpaid SIMs, not prepaid ones.

rows.Title: Text on Now Bar not visible clearly
rows.Problem: No solution provided
rows.Summarized Problem: The text on the Now Bar is not visible clearly.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visibility of content on the Now Bar, which is a key interface element but does not render the device unusable or cause crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Clock and date on AOD doesn't change its position
rows.Problem: AOD clock and date does not change its position, remaining constant over time, raising concern about AMOLED screen pixel burn due to prolonged static display.
rows.Summarized Problem: The clock and date on the Always On Display remain in a fixed position and do not update, potentially causing AMOLED pixel burn.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects a core display function but does not cause device crash or complete unavailability; it is a partial malfunction with potential long-term screen degradation risk.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: App icon missing or replaces with other app icons
rows.Problem: After updating to One UI 7, app icons are disappearing and sometimes showing icons from other apps. Only the app name is visible in some cases. This occurs specifically for apps inside folders. The issue returns when navigating back to the home screen after opening an app.
rows.Summarized Problem: App icons are disappearing or being replaced with other apps' icons after updating to One UI 7, especially for apps in folders.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects app visibility and usability but does not prevent device operation or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Notification tone cannot be heard, no notification pop up & silent notification issue
rows.Problem: Silent notification issue and notification tone is not heard, notification popup not coming in all applications
rows.Summarized Problem: Silent notifications and notification tone are not heard, with no popup in applications.
rows.Severity Reason: Users cannot receive alerts or hear notifications, making the device functionally unusable for important alerts.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Samsung messages app shows Registration Failed
rows.Problem: After switching to Galaxy A36, Samsung Messages shows "Registration failed" repeatedly while Google Messages works fine. User wants to use Samsung Messages RCS.
rows.Summarized Problem: Samsung Messages fails to register for RCS functionality on Galaxy A36, showing 'Registration Failed' repeatedly.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents full use of Samsung Messages RCS but does not cause device crash or data loss; it is intermittent and resolves after reboot.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Network configuration not ready; Countermeasure: Reboot device to trigger autoconfiguration.

rows.Title: Over heating observed in the device
rows.Problem: Abnormal heating on Galaxy S24 during normal use such as gaming or charging, with CPU/GPU thermal sensor reaching 53.1°C and battery at 41.2°C
rows.Summarized Problem: The device overheats during normal use, especially when connected to fast charging and running applications, with thermal sensors reaching 53.1°C.
rows.Severity Reason: Overheating occurs during typical usage scenarios but is within expected temperature ranges and not causing device failure or crash.
rows.R&D Comment: Overheating during charging and app usage is normal due to high CPU usage; no abnormal behavior detected in dumpstate data.

rows.Title: Display brightness goes low during recording/taking photos/videos in sunlight
rows.Problem: Display brightness goes low during recording/taking photos/videos through camera in sunlight condition
rows.Summarized Problem: The display brightness drops unexpectedly during camera recording or photo/video capture in sunlight.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes the display to become unusable during critical camera operations, leading to poor user experience and potential failure in essential functions.
rows.R&D Comment: The root cause is insufficient log coverage due to delayed log extraction after camera use; a countermeasure is to extract logs immediately when the issue occurs for accurate analysis.

rows.Title: Device lags on using 5g, and frame drop observed while playing games
rows.Problem: The device got very slow and laggy while using 5g and now this time too I'm writing this and this happened now too.... While playing normal games like free fire the FPS constantly dropping
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences significant lag and frame drops when using 5G, especially during gaming.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes unresponsive during gameplay due to performance degradation under 5G conditions, leading to a poor user experience and potential game instability.
rows.R&D Comment: High thermal activity limits performance; memory leaks from system and video player apps contribute to instability. Recommend investigating thermal management and app memory usage.

rows.Title: Device taking a long time to process the image
rows.Problem: Processing time taken for more than 15 minutes but still not completed
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera takes over 15 minutes to process an image without completion.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is stuck in image processing, leading to prolonged operation and potential user frustration or device unresponsiveness.
rows.R&D Comment: Only PostProcessThread stuck found in MFP soln for S24, No MFP logs present/insufficient logs to debug.

rows.Title: Battery drain
rows.Problem: Serious battery drain issue on Samsung galaxy s24 ultra after update to 7.0 UI. Delay in lock screen by microseconds when locking the phone.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences significant battery drain and a microsecond delay when locking the screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The battery drain is severe and affects device usability, while the lock screen delay impacts user experience immediately upon interaction.
rows.R&D Comment: Battery drain is caused by insufficient log coverage and short screen-off duration; countermeasure is to capture extended screen-off logs to analyze discharge behavior.

rows.Title: Battery drain
rows.Problem: Battery is not good and old, please recommend customer replace a new one at CS Center
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences excessive battery drain due to an old and degraded battery.
rows.Severity Reason: The battery is severely degraded, leading to rapid drain, which renders the device unusable without a replacement.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Pictures in gallery is shown with .dwg thumbnail
rows.Problem: In new OneUI 7.0 in gallery app it shows .dwg file as thumbnail. It is not supposed to show .dwg file at all in gallery
rows.Summarized Problem: The gallery app displays .dwg files as thumbnails, which is not intended behavior.
rows.Severity Reason: The gallery app shows .dwg files as thumbnails, which are not images and should not be displayed, leading to incorrect content presentation and user confusion.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Overlapping of modes button in quick panel
rows.Problem: Overlapping issue of modes button in quick panel
rows.Summarized Problem: The modes button in the quick panel is overlapping with another element.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects usability but does not cause device failure or data loss, and is limited to UI layout.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue not reproducible in latest binary; further investigation needed

rows.Title: Battery drain and overheating
rows.Problem: I am not getting good battery backup; battery level is very low and none of the steps worked
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences significant battery drain and overheating, leading to poor battery backup and performance issues.
rows.Severity Reason: The device overheats and drains battery rapidly, making it unusable and posing a risk of hardware damage.
rows.R&D Comment: Overheating is caused by increased battery thermistor readings and high ambient environment; countermeasure involves monitoring thermistor values and ambient conditions.

rows.Title: Remove help text from lock screen
rows.Problem: Cannot remove help text from lock screen after One UI 7 update
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot remove the help text from the lock screen after the One UI 7 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from customizing the lock screen, but does not cause device crash or data loss or render the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Multiple issues observed
rows.Problem: Charging indicator misaligned on AOD screen but aligned on lock screen; Game Booster's 'Block During Game' feature missing from settings
rows.Summarized Problem: The charging indicator is misaligned on the AOD screen during charging, and the Game Booster app lacks a 'Block During Game' setting.
rows.Severity Reason: The charging indicator misalignment affects user experience on the AOD screen, and the missing Game Booster feature limits performance control, but neither causes device failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Display mode change resets total modes widget
rows.Problem: Changing display resolution mode from the widget on home screen resets the total modes widget
rows.Summarized Problem: Changing display resolution mode resets the total modes widget.
rows.Severity Reason: The widget resets upon mode change, affecting functionality but not rendering the device unusable or causing data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue resolved by updating sesl glance; not reproducible with latest version of Modes & Routine

rows.Title: Wifi & Bluetooth does not work
rows.Problem: After updating to One UI 7, Wi-Fi and Bluetooth stopped working. The switches do not turn on in quick settings or main settings. Bluetooth sometimes turns on by itself but cannot be controlled manually. A factory reset did not resolve the issue.
rows.Summarized Problem: Wi-Fi and Bluetooth are not responding to user controls and sometimes activate automatically, indicating a failure in initialization after an OS update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents basic connectivity functions, rendering the device unusable for internet or device pairing.
rows.R&D Comment: WIFI initialization is failing when booting. Please visit CS Center for WIFI IC related HW issue and request WIFI / BT related HW inspection.

rows.Title: Bluetooth logo shown instead of app logo in separate app sound feature
rows.Problem: When using the separate app sound feature, the app's logo appears instead of the Bluetooth logo, indicating a display glitch in audio settings.
rows.Summarized Problem: The app's logo is displayed instead of the Bluetooth logo when using the separate app sound feature.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects the visual feedback during audio feature usage but does not prevent functionality or cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Insufficient log time coverage; issue not reproducible in current environment

rows.Title: Sound lag while playing YouTube video
rows.Problem: Sound lag while playing audio content
rows.Summarized Problem: There is a sound lag when playing audio content such as videos on YouTube.
rows.Severity Reason: Sound lag during playback renders the audio experience unusable and disrupts user interaction with media content.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue occurs in ExoPlayer's MediaCodec reset process; external app (YouTube) responsibility; further investigation needed

rows.Title: Multiple issues observed in the device
rows.Problem: Camera struggles at 3x zoom on S23, battery drains almost 50% in half a day without gaming or camera use, issues occur after updating to One UI 7
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences significant battery drain and camera performance issues after updating to One UI 7.
rows.Severity Reason: The battery drain is severe and occurs under no usage conditions, indicating a major system-level issue that affects core device functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue cannot be reproduced at our end due to insufficient details and no media logs; requires proper reproduction steps and preconditions to investigate further.

rows.Title: Device not working properly
rows.Problem: Device screen gets stuck for a few seconds intermittently. Issue started after software reset at service center, data lost. Phone worked fine for two days before One UI 7 update, then problem returned. User tried factory reset but issue persists.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device screen intermittently gets stuck for several seconds, causing device instability and data loss after a software reset.
rows.Severity Reason: The screen freezing disrupts device usability and leads to data loss, making the device functionally unusable during affected periods.
rows.R&D Comment: Exact root cause is not clear from logs; issue does not reproduce in latest binary. Further investigation needed.

rows.Title: Instagram HDR Reels have more saturation on S25
rows.Problem: Saturation is more on S25 while watching HDR reels on Instagram compared to S23, which delivers proper saturation. Both devices run on One UI 7 and software is up to date.
rows.Summarized Problem: Instagram HDR reels on S25 exhibit higher saturation compared to S23, leading to inconsistent visual quality.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visual quality but does not cause device malfunction or data loss, and is observed only in specific content playback scenarios.
rows.R&D Comment: GMS log analysis indicates temporary slowness; retesting in latest version recommended.

rows.Title: Multiple issues observed in the device
rows.Problem: Phone lags and freezes during calls, switching from 120 to 60 Hz, requiring lock and unlock to recover. Device performance is inconsistent compared to S25.
rows.Summarized Problem: Phone lags and freezes during calls when switching from 120 to 6 when using 60 Hz, requiring user to lock and unlock the device to recover.
rows.Severity Reason: The phone freezes during calls, which is a major functional failure that disrupts usability and can lead to dropped calls or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue cannot be diagnosed from logs alone; user must share a video recording of the issue with logs for root cause analysis.

rows.Title: Reducing animation in vision enhancement causes Samsung Shop app to behave abnormally
rows.Problem: When reducing animation in Vision Enhancement settings, the Samsung Shop app starts behaving abnormally. A video demonstrating this is attached, showing the app behavior and version.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Samsung Shop app behaves abnormally when the animation reduction feature in Vision Enhancement is enabled.
rows.Severity Reason: The app malfunctions under specific settings, but does not crash or render the device unusable, indicating a partial malfunction.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: phone completely frozen
rows.Problem: phone completely frozen and didnt respond until restart; keyboard lagging; freezing occurs while surfing Instagram reels
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone freezes completely while browsing Instagram reels, leading to unresponsiveness and lagging input, especially during video playback.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes completely unresponsive, preventing normal use and requiring a restart, which indicates a critical system-level failure.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue was caused by incorrect HDR10+ metadata in HLG-based videos from Instagram's server, leading to a kernel panic; fixed on the server side by Meta.

rows.Title: Instagram Screen freezes and restarts
rows.Problem: Screen froze up while watching Instagram reels and automatically restarted
rows.Summarized Problem: The screen freezes and automatically restarts while watching Instagram reels.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes the screen to freeze and restart during video playback, making content viewing unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue was caused by a server-side problem with HDR10+ metadata in HLG images and has been resolved by META; no further action needed.

rows.Title: Youtube video flickers in green color
rows.Problem: Video flickers in green color when using Samsung Browser for long periods, persists even after clearing data and caches
rows.Summarized Problem: YouTube video playback flickers in green color when using Samsung Browser for extended periods.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects video display consistency but does not cause device crash or data loss, and persists only under specific usage conditions.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue cannot be reproduced; likely temporary. Precondition details needed for further analysis.

rows.Title: App icons missing from homescreen and app tray
rows.Problem: Three installed apps—Samsung Internet, Camera, and Dialer—are missing from quick launch and nowhere visible in the apps list. Rebooting and force-stopping the One UI home app did not resolve the issue.
rows.Summarized Problem: App icons are missing from the homescreen and app tray despite being installed.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves missing functionality in app visibility but does not cause device crash or complete failure of core operations.
rows.R&D Comment: The 'Show favorites' option is off in HomeUp, causing app icons to be hidden; users should enable this setting to restore visibility.

rows.Title: Multiple issues observed
rows.Problem: Auto blocker not available on this device due to lack of SAK (Samsung Attestation Key). Request to enable Q0000 or RF test menu.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device lacks SAK (Samsung Attestation Key), making auto blocker unavailable and preventing access to Q0000 or RF test menu.
rows.Severity Reason: The absence of auto blocker due to missing SAK prevents users from securing their device, impacting core functionality and usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Auto blocker is not supported on devices without SAK; this is a platform-level limitation and cannot be worked around.

rows.Title: Battery drain very quickly
rows.Problem: Battery is draining too quickly even in ideal mode after latest security patch
rows.Summarized Problem: The device's battery is draining rapidly even in ideal usage conditions after a recent security patch.
rows.Severity Reason: The battery is draining too quickly, which makes the device unusable for normal daily use.
rows.R&D Comment: Log data is insufficient to identify root cause; further logs needed if issue recurs.

rows.Title: Call background wallpaper not showing
rows.Problem: Selected wallpaper doesn't show up during calls
rows.Summarized Problem: The selected wallpaper fails to display during calls.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of the call background feature, but the call function remains usable.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Show contact photo background when contact photo is not saved; Countermeasure: Fix to show default background and allow user to set custom call background via profile or saved images.

rows.Title: Battery drain after update
rows.Problem: Post-One UI 7 update, S23 Ultra exhibits substantial battery drain despite cache clearing and background process optimization. Screen-on time has diminished by one to one and a half hours. Widespread reports indicate similar issues across forums and Reddit.
rows.Summarized Problem: The S23 Ultra experiences significant battery drain after the One UI 7 update, reducing screen-on time by one to one and a half hours.
rows.Severity Reason: The device shows substantial battery drain, which directly impacts usability and core functionality, making it difficult to use for extended periods.
rows.R&D Comment: This issue should be checked by Meta side; it is currently classified as a third-party app issue under investigation.

rows.Title: Unable to transfer call from handset mode to BT buds
rows.Problem: Unable to take calls from any bluetooth headsets, including galaxy buds
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot transfer calls from handset mode to Bluetooth headsets, including Galaxy Buds.
rows.Severity Reason: Users are unable to make or receive calls via Bluetooth headsets, which is a core communication function, making the device unusable for basic calling.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Phone call app not showing contacts and Truecaller closing often
rows.Problem: The phone call app is not showing contacts and Truecaller app closes frequently after the One UI 7 update.
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone call app fails to display contacts and Truecaller frequently closes after the One UI 7 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The phone call app is failing to show contacts, which directly impacts basic communication functionality, making the device unusable for calls.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by a contaminated contact database; a workaround exists but results in loss of local contacts, and the same root cause is confirmed in the countermeasure.

rows.Title: Battery draining fast
rows.Problem: Battery draining issue and device overheating and lagging after UI 7 update
rows.Summarized Problem: The device is experiencing rapid battery drain and overheating with lagging after the UI 7 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is overheating and lagging, which indicates a major functional failure affecting usability and stability.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: DeX crashes when changing audio output to display device
rows.Problem: Dex crashes when media output is changed from device to display device
rows.Summarized Problem: Samsung DeX crashes when switching audio output to the display device.
rows.Severity Reason: The device crashes during a core functionality operation, making DeX unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: It seems HDMI adapter or monitor problem. Please ask user to test with other HDMI adapter or other monitor.

rows.Title: Lockscreen swipe and setting swipe stopped working
rows.Problem: After the UI 7 update, lockscreen swipe and setting swipe stopped working. Even with face unlock, the device did not allow unlocking. Touch response showed touch working, but the swipes failed. The issue persists after unlocking via face and navigating to camera app.
rows.Summarized Problem: Lockscreen and settings swipes are no longer functional despite touch responsiveness, preventing normal device navigation.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from unlocking or navigating the device, making it unusable after face unlock.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: 5G network becomes inactive after 30 minutes
rows.Problem: 5G network becomes inactive after approximately 30 minutes and does not resume until airplane mode is toggled on and off or the device is restarted. The 5G symbol remains but only the upward arrow lights up; no downlink activity occurs in any application.
rows.Summarized Problem: 5G network disconnects after 30 minutes and fails to reconnect without airplane mode toggle or device restart.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes complete loss of internet bandwidth and renders the device unusable for internet-based activities until manually reset.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Pictures clicked in complete darkness using 12 MP and 50 MP, the picture quality is not good
rows.Problem: captured two photos in complete darkness using my s25 ultra's flashlight. One was taken with a 12 MP camera and the other with a -than camera. The image from the 12 MP camera turned out poorly, with colors appearing almost black and white. Please refer to the attached photos to compare the difference in quality. Kindly improve this ASAP, as we don't expect this kind of quality from a phone that costs ₹1.4 lakh
rows.Summarized Problem: Photos taken in complete darkness using the flashlight have poor image quality, especially with the 12 MP camera, showing colors as almost black and white.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera fails to produce acceptable image quality under low-light conditions, which is a major functional failure expected in a high-end device.
rows.R&D Comment: The difference in flash light between camera modes causes darker images; auto-exposure adjusts light levels, but the 12 MP result is still suboptimal.

rows.Title: Battery drain
rows.Problem: Battery level dropped from 60% to 50% after 50 minutes of use with a single application running at minimum brightness, location services off, Wi-Fi on, and room temperature. This behavior is new and not observed before the latest update.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences significant battery drain after 50 minutes of light usage, a new behavior following the latest software update.
rows.Severity Reason: The battery drains rapidly under normal usage conditions, indicating a major performance issue that affects device usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Battery drainage seems normal; request QA to provide correct logs for further analysis

rows.Title: Samsung Health steps not displayed when phone is locked
rows.Problem: Samsung Health steps not work on lock phone
rows.Summarized Problem: Samsung Health does not display step count when the phone is locked.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents the display of a core health metric when the device is locked, rendering the feature unusable in a primary use case.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue was caused by incorrect handling of BR event for OOBE and has been fixed in version 6.30; users will see the fix upon app update.

rows.Title: Battery backup not good
rows.Problem: How can I send you video and screenshot of bad battery backup?
rows.Summarized Problem: The device's battery backup is poor, with significant power drain when the screen is off.
rows.Severity Reason: The device consumes excessive power when the screen is off, leading to rapid battery drain and poor usability.
rows.R&D Comment: GMS apps run in the background and consume significant power, especially when screen is off, indicating a major power drain issue that requires intervention.

rows.Title: Rotate to landscape feature showing disabled
rows.Problem: Rotate to landscape feature is not available. I am not able to turn it on and off.
rows.Summarized Problem: The rotate to landscape feature is disabled and cannot be turned on or off.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is unavailable and cannot be toggled, but the device remains otherwise functional.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause and countermeasure both indicate that enabling Free Grid disables the rotate feature; users must disable Free Grid in HomeUp settings to restore functionality.

rows.Title: Multiple issues observed
rows.Problem: Performance issue and overheating when using camera in 4K and HDR mode, and when phone is off showing heating at 40 degrees or above.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device overheats significantly during 4K HDR camera use and when powered off, causing performance lag and high temperature readings.
rows.Severity Reason: Overheating during active use and when off leads to device instability and potential damage, making it unusable under normal conditions.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Battery drain and heating during social media and web browsing
rows.Problem: Significant battery drain and device heating during normal use such as web browsing and social media activity, especially after updating to One UI 7. This issue was not present before the update and appears to be related to third-party app power consumption.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences excessive battery drain and overheating during normal use like web browsing and social media, likely due to third-party app power consumption after a system update.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes unusable due to rapid battery depletion and overheating during basic tasks, which can lead to performance degradation or safety risks.
rows.R&D Comment: According to analysis by GMS team, apps like com.facebook.katana and com.instagram.android are consuming power; Samsung has no role in their development, and memory usage varies with usage scenarios.

rows.Title: Device become very slow after latest update
rows.Problem: Device become very slow after latest update, screen functioning packing, battery drains quicker, mobile has become useless to use
rows.Summarized Problem: Device performance significantly degrades after the latest update, causing slow responsiveness, screen lag, and rapid battery drain.
rows.Severity Reason: Device becomes unusable due to severe performance degradation and rapid battery drain, indicating a major functional failure.
rows.R&D Comment: High device temperature leads to performance throttling; further investigation needed to confirm root cause and update impact.

rows.Title: Call not connecting
rows.Problem: Call is not connecting most of the time, requires switching to airplane mode to resolve
rows.Summarized Problem: Calls are not connecting and require airplane mode to resolve.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents successful call establishment, rendering the device unusable for basic communication.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Game freezes when WhatsApp call is picked and remains frozen after call ends
rows.Problem: Game freezes when WhatsApp call is picked and remains frozen after the call ends. The game suddenly freezes during gameplay and does not resume even after the call ends. This may indicate that WhatsApp calls are causing app crashes or freezes.
rows.Summarized Problem: The game freezes when a WhatsApp call is answered and remains frozen even after the call ends.
rows.Severity Reason: The game becomes unresponsive and remains frozen after a call, making it unusable during gameplay.
