rows.R&D Comment: The issue arises from a timeout during database upgrade operations in the contacts provider; countermeasure includes running the upgrade in the background and clearing local storage to recover data from synchronized sources.

rows.Title: Google Play Protect is off and there is no option to turn it on
rows.Problem: There is no option to turn on Google Play Protect in system settings or the Play Store after updating to One UI 7 (Android 15).
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot re-enable Google Play Protect after an update, leaving their device without a key security feature.
rows.Severity Reason: The absence of a security feature prevents users from protecting their device from malicious apps, posing a significant risk to device and user data.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: App icon shows older after update
rows.Problem: App icon shows older version from ONU UI 6.1 even after updating to ONE UI 7
rows.Summarized Problem: App icons display outdated versions despite system update to ONE UI 7.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visual consistency but does not prevent device operation or cause crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue is not reproducing in the latest ONEUI Home; will be fixed in Homescreen Version 16.0.09.13 or above.

rows.Title: Processing notification message after closing incognito tab
rows.Problem: Screen freezes for a few seconds when processing a notification after closing the incognito tab, despite ample RAM and storage.
rows.Summarized Problem: The screen freezes for a few seconds when processing a notification after closing the incognito tab.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a temporary screen freeze but does not prevent device usage or result in data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue is not reproducing in the latest ONEUI Home; will be fixed in Homescreen Version 16.0.09.13 or above.

rows.Title: App display overlaps while minimizing
rows.Problem: Scheduled light and dark mode not working; requires manual enable after restart; tile malfunction on minimize
rows.Summarized Problem: The app display overlaps and malfunctions when minimized, with scheduled light and dark mode failing to retain settings after restart.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects functionality during app use but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Spotify plays on its own when phone is opened
rows.Problem: Spotify music is automatically playing after Samsung latest update, occurs while calling or using camera
rows.Summarized Problem: Spotify automatically plays music when the phone is opened, such as during calls or camera use, despite being paused previously.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of Spotify playback control, affecting user experience during specific app usage but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The behavior is due to a predefined 'workout mode' triggering media playback on app open; users can disable it by removing the mode.

rows.Title: Now bar not showing live sports score
rows.Problem: Now bar is not showing live sports scores. Not seeing live notifications for scores from Sports from Google in Lock screen (Now bar). Have configured all the settings as required.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Now Bar on the Lock Screen is not displaying live sports scores or notifications from Google Sports.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of the Now Bar feature, where live sports updates are missing despite correct configuration, but the overall device remains usable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: weather app showing wrong location
rows.Problem: when I find Lengpui in samsung weather the location appears incorrectly
rows.Summarized Problem: The weather app displays the wrong location when the user is in Lengpui.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes incorrect location data display, but the app remains functional and does not crash or lead to data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Bluetooth icon missing in status bar
rows.Problem: Bluetooth icon is gone from the status bar after UI 7 update, preventing users from seeing device connectivity at a glance
rows.Summarized Problem: The Bluetooth icon is missing from the status bar after the UI 7 update, making it difficult for users to see device connectivity at a glance.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visibility of a key device status but does not cause device malfunction or crash.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Now bar not showing live sports score
rows.Problem: The now bar for live sports stopped showing after clearing the live sport notification. Turning the now bar on/off does not resolve the issue
rows.Summarized Problem: The Now Bar for live sports is not displaying live scores after a notification was cleared.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects functionality of a key feature but does not cause device failure or data loss; users can still access other content.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Alarm not working
rows.Problem: Alarm not working
rows.Summarized Problem: The alarm is not sounding due to the master alarm sound being turned off.
rows.Severity Reason: The alarm function is partially disabled because the sound is off, but the alarm still triggers and can be enabled manually.
rows.R&D Comment: Alarm sound is off in the alarm settings; user should enable alarm sound to hear the alarm.

rows.Title: Black screen during screen transition in apps
rows.Problem: In some apps, during screen transitions, black screens with lines appear. For example, in WhatsApp, when opening a video call, the video screen shows black screens with lines before transitioning to the new screen. A similar issue is observed in the flo app during navigation.
rows.Summarized Problem: Apps show black screens with lines during screen transitions, affecting user experience during navigation.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue occurs intermittently during app navigation and affects visual content, but does not cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: This issue is caused by a third-party app and requires coordination with the app owner for resolution; further investigation needed.

rows.Title: Touch is not responding on those particular areas
rows.Problem: Touch is not responding on those particular areas after updating to UI 7.0. Touch sensitivity decreased. Device was used normally until issue appeared. Testing with *#0*# shows no response on specific keyboard areas. Samsung members device diagnosis shows full touch dots, but issue persists.
rows.Summarized Problem: The touch sensor on the display has a hardware defect, causing specific areas to not respond to touch input after a UI update.
rows.Severity Reason: The touch function is completely failing on specific areas, preventing basic device interaction such as typing, which renders the device unusable for core operations.
rows.R&D Comment: Touch sensor in display module has HW defect (Tx channel 13 is cracked). Display module should be checked and replaced if necessary at Service center.

rows.Title: Static noise in video specially on black area
rows.Problem: Static noise in video specially on black area even on bright part of also around flower still not sharp and clear
rows.Summarized Problem: Video recordings exhibit static noise, especially in black areas and around flowers, with poor clarity and sharpness.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects video quality in dark areas, leading to visible noise and lack of clarity, which compromises user experience and usability of the video function.
rows.R&D Comment: The noise is caused by high ISO and fast shutter speed in slow-motion recording, resulting in poor video quality in low light; countermeasure is to optimize video settings in slow-motion mode to reduce noise.

rows.Title: Flight mode do not turn on/off properly
rows.Problem: Airplane mode is not turning on properly, which prevents turning it off. Restarting the device is required to turn it off.
rows.Summarized Problem: Flight mode fails to turn on and off properly, requiring a device restart to turn it off.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents proper control of flight mode, making it impossible to disable without restarting the device, rendering a core function inoperable.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Significant lag while launching gaming hub
rows.Problem: Device slows down significantly during gaming hub launch; RAM usage reaches 5.2 GB in normal use, and performance degrades even after RAM cleanup. Issue persists post-update.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences significant lag when launching the gaming hub, even after RAM cleanup and despite normal usage conditions.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes noticeably slow during a core functionality (gaming hub launch), which impacts usability and may lead to user frustration or abandonment.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: New charging animation not shown on the lockscreen
rows.Problem: Not shows new charging animation in my phone
rows.Summarized Problem: The new charging animation is not displayed on the Now Bar of the lock screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The charging animation is missing from the intended location on the lock screen, but it is still visible on the status bar, indicating a partial malfunction rather than complete device failure.
rows.R&D Comment: The charging animation is shown on the top-right status bar instead of the Now Bar; a UI adjustment is needed to redirect the animation to the correct location.

rows.Title: Internet browsing and apps takes long to load and open
rows.Problem: Since the last update, the internet browsing has become very slow, even when internet speed is high and stable. All the apps takes a lot of time to load, load images and open web pages. Only facing this issue since the last update.
rows.Summarized Problem: After the last update, internet browsing and app loading have become significantly slow, despite stable network conditions.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects core functionality of internet access and app performance, making device usage inefficient and potentially unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is likely caused by a software defect in the browser or app launcher, and the recommended countermeasure is to update the Instagram app, suggesting a third-party app interaction issue.

rows.Title: Sports from google not shown on now bar
rows.Problem: Sports scores are not showing on now bar for the last two days. Even today games are going on but no scores showing on now bar. All required things are switched on and following all the teams.
rows.Summarized Problem: Sports scores are not displaying on the Now Bar despite games being in progress.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from viewing live sports scores, which is a core functionality during active games, leading to a significant user experience gap.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Modes and smart view button overlap
rows.Problem: Sometimes the mode button is above smart view button
rows.Summarized Problem: The mode button overlaps with the smart view button on the quick panel, causing visual confusion.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes visual overlap but does not prevent device operation or lead to functional failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause and countermeasure both point to the need for CP silent logs for further investigation.

rows.Title: Phone heats up and battery drains quickly while using Instagram
rows.Problem: After the latest update, using Instagram causes the phone to heat up and battery to drain quickly. The issue persists even after uninstalling and reinstalling the app. No such issues existed before the update.
rows.Summarized Problem: Using Instagram causes the phone to overheat and battery drain rapidly.
rows.Severity Reason: The phone overheats and drains battery quickly during app usage, which can lead to device performance degradation or damage.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Instagram app caused high CPU usage, now resolved by the app developer. Countermeasure: Users should clear cache and data of Instagram.

rows.Title: battery life is coming in only 5 to 5:30 hours
rows.Problem: My battery life is coming in only 5 to 5:30 hours. It's very short. Its battery in ONE UI 6. It lasted 7 to 8 hours. Now it has become very low. And the phone is getting very hot. Uploading videos through feedback. You can watch this of battery life. It's very low. It needs to be improved and send it to the Firmware team.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device's battery life has significantly decreased, lasting only 5 to 5.5 hours instead of the previous 7 to 8 hours, and the phone is getting very hot during use.
rows.Severity Reason: The battery life has dropped significantly, and the device is overheating, which may lead to device instability or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Overheating caused by Instagram app CPU overutilization has been observed; improvement of the Instagram app is required.

rows.Title: App icon size gets back to default
rows.Problem: App icon size changes back to default after updating to One UI 7, and customizations no longer apply consistently.
rows.Summarized Problem: App icon size resets to default after updating to One UI 7, despite previous successful customizations.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes inconsistent behavior in customizations but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue with homeup has been fixed, and an alternative option is now available in home screen settings to adjust icon size and labels.

rows.Title: Navigation Bar Open Google Assistant by swiping corner is not working
rows.Problem: The feature of opening Google Assistant by swiping the corner of the navigation bar is not working after the UI 7 update. No settings are found for this feature, and switching to Google Assistant or Hoogle Assistant does not resolve it. It may have been removed.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot open Google Assistant by swiping the corner of the navigation bar after the UI 7 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing post-update, but users can still access Google Assistant through other means, indicating partial functionality failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: UI often becomes unresponsive
rows.Problem: The UI often becomes unresponsive, causing the mobile to freeze for a few seconds before restarting. This issue started after the updates on 19th May.
rows.Summarized Problem: The user interface frequently freezes and becomes unresponsive, leading to brief device stalls before restarting.
rows.Severity Reason: The UI freezing causes device unresponsiveness, disrupting user interaction and potentially leading to a poor user experience during critical operations.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: At 0.5x, the video gets blurry and grainy
rows.Problem: The video becomes blurry and grainy at 0.5x zoom level, persisting before and after the One UI 7 update. All troubleshooting steps have been tried without resolution. User is wondering if it's a software issue.
rows.Summarized Problem: Video quality degrades to blurry and grainy at 0.5x zoom level in the camera app.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects video clarity at a specific zoom level but does not render the device unusable or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is likely related to software handling of low-zoom video rendering; countermeasure and cause match, indicating a known I2C communication timing issue in the camera subsystem.

rows.Title: serious software issue detect popup
rows.Problem: receiving pop up message regarding serious software issue but no update available
rows.Summarized Problem: Users receive a popup message indicating a serious software issue, but no update is available.
rows.Severity Reason: The popup indicates a serious software issue, which may impair device usability and user trust, leading to potential device malfunction or user frustration.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Swiped from top with 2 fingers in Samsung DeX creates ghost window
rows.Problem: In an app opened in full screen in Dex mode, swiping from top with two fingers creates a translucent ghost window similar to resize window. This window appears in addition to the existing app in full screen. Repeated swiping causes additional windows to appear, leading to system freeze and unresponsive touch.
rows.Summarized Problem: Swiping from top with two fingers in Samsung DeX creates a ghost window that causes system freeze and unresponsive touch.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes system freeze and unresponsive touch, making the device unusable during operation.
rows.R&D Comment: This is a Dex window leak; the issue will be resolved in OneUI 8.0 MR.

rows.Title: Degradation in camera quality
rows.Problem: The camera delivers consistently poor results across all functions, significantly declining in quality since the UI7 update, making photography and videography disappointing.
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera quality has degraded significantly since the UI7 update, resulting in consistently poor performance across all functions.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera, a flagship feature, now delivers poor results consistently, severely impacting user experience and usability.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is irreproducible and both UOS and VOS use identical solution libraries; potential resolution exists in existing build configurations.

rows.Title: Unable to run: GOS Lite error
rows.Problem: Game plugins removed and app shows "Unable to run: GOS Lite" when reinstalled, affecting gaming functionality
rows.Summarized Problem: Game plugins are no longer supported and cause the app to show 'Unable to run: GOS Lite' when reinstalled.
rows.Severity Reason: The error prevents the app from running, directly impacting core gaming functionality and user experience.
rows.R&D Comment: GamePlugin is no longer supported from Android V-os. The individual app setting function has been changed to the main function of GameBooster, and the rest of the functions will be supported through the Goodlock app. Please delete GamePlugin app.

rows.Title: Weather lockscreen not working properly
rows.Problem: Weather lockscreen shows inappropriate weather data; shows fog when it's sunny or raining, sometimes shows nothing. Tried resetting apps and clearing data, but issue persists.
rows.Summarized Problem: The weather display on the lock screen shows incorrect or inappropriate weather data, such as fog in sunny or rainy conditions, and occasionally fails to display any data at all.
rows.Severity Reason: The weather display shows incorrect data under normal conditions, leading to user confusion and a misleading perception of the environment, which is a major functional failure on the lock screen.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: picture quality is not good
rows.Problem: Poor quality photo, photo not have sharp edge and not focus the object. Blur on photo quality. Zoom shot photo are low quality and captured pictures are always poor quality. Photos are not contain more details. Once again I tell camera is poor quality compare to the new phone starting time clarity not in after all update. This is happens all time not a some times
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera produces blurry and poorly focused photos, especially in zoom shots, with insufficient detail and lack of sharp edges.
rows.Severity Reason: Photos are consistently poor in quality, with blurring and lack of focus, making them unusable for clear image capture.
rows.R&D Comment: User did not allow autofocus to stabilize before capturing, leading to poor image quality; improve user guidance on proper zoom capture technique.

rows.Title: Device getting overheat in idle state
rows.Problem: Device overheats significantly when idle, even with background apps off and settings at default. Screen usage time reduced to 5-6 hours max after UI 7 update. Heating occurs independently of usage or background activity.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device overheats significantly when idle, even with no background apps running and settings at default, reducing screen usage time to 5-6 hours.
rows.Severity Reason: The device overheats during idle states, which can lead to performance degradation, battery drain, or potential hardware damage, making it unusable under normal conditions.
rows.R&D Comment: Overheating is triggered by third-party app Instagram, likely due to high CPU load; requires further review with third-party app developers.

rows.Title: Good Lock app content not compatible with phone
rows.Problem: Good Lock app shows error 'This content isn't compatible with your phone' when opened on Galaxy F55, preventing access to features like LockStar and Task Change.
rows.Summarized Problem: Good Lock app fails to load on Galaxy F55, displaying a compatibility error and blocking access to LockStar and Task Change features.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes or fails to load, preventing users from accessing key Lock Screen features, rendering the functionality unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: App Icon Not Changed after One UI Update
rows.Problem: Icons design did not change after One UI 7 update, despite all apps being updated
rows.Summarized Problem: App icons fail to update after One UI 7 upgrade, retaining One UI 6 design.
rows.Severity Reason: Icons do not update after OS upgrade, affecting user experience but do not prevent device usage or cause crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: It is confirmed that ThemePark AppIconPack is applied and was created for One UI 6; a new AppIconPack for One UI 7 must be recreated.

rows.Title: Lock Screen Clock Animation Not Working
rows.Problem: The new lock screen clock animation does not work on the Tab S9 FE; the clock appears statically when the screen is woken, with no animation.
rows.Summarized Problem: The lock screen clock animation fails to display any motion and appears only as a static image.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is partially malfunctioning as the animation is missing but the clock remains visible and functional.
rows.R&D Comment: The animation is not supported due to GPU performance limitations in the device.

rows.Title: Torch and side switch off button not working
rows.Problem: Torch function and side switch off button are not working after update. Camera light is working, but other options are not. User raised concerns about losing important torch function.
rows.Summarized Problem: Torch and side switch off button are not working after software update, despite camera light functioning.
rows.Severity Reason: The torch function is a critical feature for usability, and its failure after update renders a key functionality unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: System error message on launching Bixby
rows.Problem: Bixby is not working properly after One UI 7 update
rows.Summarized Problem: Bixby is not working properly after the One UI 7 update.
rows.Severity Reason: Bixby is a core feature that is completely non-functional after the update, making the device unusable for voice-assisted operations.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: keyboard disconnects intermittently
rows.Problem: samsung tab s9 ultra original keyboard disconnects intermittently, leading to repeated keystrokes and other disruptions. the problem stops if touchpad is turned off. ps. i have updated to one ui 7 and tried all the solutions posted online and on members community and didnt solve the issue. some people are posting that only replacing the keyboard with new unaffected one can solve the issue.
rows.Summarized Problem: The BT keyboard disconnects intermittently, causing repeated keystrokes and disruptions, and stops functioning when the touchpad is turned off.
rows.Severity Reason: The keyboard disconnects intermittently, leading to repeated keystrokes and disruptions, which severely impacts usability and prevents reliable input.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is likely due to hardware or driver incompatibility; recommend testing with a replacement keyboard to confirm and validate root cause.

rows.Title: Weather App is Not showing correct information
rows.Problem: The weather app shows incorrect location data, displaying 'Lakanpur' instead of 'Banharpalli', which is the actual location. The temperature shown is also inaccurate, differing by 1 degree and being 16 km away from the real location.
rows.Summarized Problem: The weather app displays incorrect location and temperature data, showing 'Lakanpur' instead of the actual location 'Banharpalli' and an inaccurate temperature.
rows.Severity Reason: The app shows incorrect location and temperature data, which is a partial malfunction affecting accuracy but does not cause device freeze or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Directed this issue to TWC. To be registered as an improvement item in TWC and to be monitored for improvement. Location data is commonly shown by all partners and takes time to improve.

rows.Title: Mobile network not working despite VoLTE showing
rows.Problem: Mobile network not working during calls; mobile data works but calls fail. VoLTE option is present after software update, no auto mode connect options visible.
rows.Summarized Problem: Mobile network fails during calls despite VoLTE being enabled, while mobile data works normally.
rows.Severity Reason: Call functionality is completely broken, making the device unusable for voice communication.
rows.R&D Comment: Require CP silent logs to investigate root cause and validate VoLTE implementation.

rows.Title: Galaxy buds manager widget background not transparent
rows.Problem: Galaxy buds manager widget lacks blur effect and has a black background, which looks out of place on the home screen
rows.Summarized Problem: The Galaxy Buds manager widget has a black background without blur, making it visually out of place on the home screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visual consistency but does not prevent device functionality or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: A blue circle appears on the screen while scrolling
rows.Problem: A blue circle appears while scrolling through apps and disappears when removing recent apps. It reappears after some time.
rows.Summarized Problem: A blue circle appears intermittently during scrolling through apps and disappears when recent apps are dismissed.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue occurs intermittently and affects app navigation but does not cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue will be resolved in OneUI 8.0 through defense code modifications, and users can mitigate it by touching the scroller.

rows.Title: Overheating
rows.Problem: After a recent factory reset, the Galaxy S24 gets hot while using the camera in a cool room with a fan. The thermal sensor reaches around 61°C within minutes, even without background apps or with no other abnormal operations.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device overheats during camera use, reaching 61°C within minutes, despite being in a cool environment and with no background apps.
rows.Severity Reason: The device reaches high temperatures during normal use, which could lead to performance degradation or safety risks, and the thermal control system is not preventing further heating.
rows.R&D Comment: The camera usage causes temporary heating, with thermal control operating well and preventing further escalation; no abnormal operations were observed.

rows.Title: Error message pops up on launching secure folder
rows.Problem: After updating to One UI 7 on my Galaxy S24, Secure Folder is missing. It shows "App not compatible with your phone's operating system" error when trying to install. Please provide the updated Secure Folder version for One UI 7
rows.Summarized Problem: Secure Folder fails to install on Galaxy S24 after One UI 7 update, showing an error about app incompatibility.
rows.Severity Reason: The app cannot be installed, preventing users from accessing a core security feature, rendering the device functionally incomplete.
rows.R&D Comment: User deleted Secure Folder app via adb; recommend reinstalling through Galaxy Store; factory reset required if installation fails.

rows.Title: Fingerprint recognition requires pressure
rows.Problem: Fingerprint recognition now requires pressing hard to be recognized after an update
rows.Summarized Problem: Fingerprint recognition requires significant pressure to be detected after a software update.
rows.Severity Reason: Users must apply excessive pressure to authenticate, which is a major usability issue and indicates a fundamental software malfunction in biometric recognition.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Contact expand often shows another contact
rows.Problem: Attaching a video which shows the issue
rows.Summarized Problem: When a contact is tapped to expand, it often shows another contact instead of the intended one.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes incorrect contact display, leading to user confusion and loss of usability during contact search.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue was caused by real-time list refresh during contact expand due to Samsung Search frequently searched contacts order changes. The solution is to only refresh the list when data actually changes or during re-render, not on every order update.

rows.Title: Not able to update darwainbox App
rows.Problem: Issue with application update after UI update 7.0. Battery draining very fast and heating issue occurs when using phone for more than half an hour.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users are unable to update the darwainbox app after UI update 7.0, and the device experiences excessive battery drain and heating during prolonged use.
rows.Severity Reason: The device overheats and drains battery rapidly during normal use, which could impair performance and potentially lead to device malfunction or safety risks.
rows.R&D Comment: No abnormal heat generation was observed during app usage; temperatures remained at around 37°C, and current consumption averaged 689mA. The issue may be related to background processes or app-specific behavior, requiring further investigation.

rows.Title: App history removal during call removes phone call app
rows.Problem: Removing a background app from app history during an active call removes the call app, leaving no way to end the call on my side. The person on the other end must end the call.
rows.Summarized Problem: Removing a background app from the recent apps list during an active call removes the call app, making it impossible to end the call without the other party doing so.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes complete loss of call control, rendering the device unusable for communication during active calls.
rows.R&D Comment: In the attached logs, the complete logs capturing call scenario are not present. Request you to please provide dumpstate logs capturing the complete issue scenario

rows.Title: Front Camera not working
rows.Problem: Front camera not working and face lock not working
rows.Summarized Problem: The front camera is not functioning, and face lock is also not working.
rows.Severity Reason: The front camera fails to function, and face lock is unresponsive, which prevents core device usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: I2C error during initialization of front image sensor; Countermeasure: Swap front camera module

rows.Title: Spotify alarm background changes automatically
rows.Problem: When setting a Spotify song as alarm, the alarm background automatically changes to Spotify's interface and customization is no longer possible.
rows.Summarized Problem: Setting a Spotify song as an alarm automatically changes the alarm background to Spotify's interface, preventing user customization.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature no longer allows user customization, which is a partial malfunction of the alarm background setting functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: The behavior is now aligned with the latest clock guide, displaying the current song's image as a normal operation.

rows.Title: battery drain
rows.Problem: Update causes battery drain on Z Fold 4, device not allowing entry into recovery mode
rows.Summarized Problem: Z Fold 4 experiences significant battery drain and fails to enter recovery mode after an update.
rows.Severity Reason: Device fails to enter recovery mode and shows severe battery drain, indicating a critical system malfunction that renders the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Battery drain is caused by device operating in poor network areas with insufficient log coverage; mitigation involves improving network context logging and battery monitoring during poor connectivity.

rows.Title: Lockstar app not functioning
rows.Problem: The Lockstar app has not been functioning since the OneUI 7 update
rows.Summarized Problem: The Lockstar app is not functioning after the OneUI 7 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The app is completely non-functional, preventing users from using the Lockstar feature.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: One Ui home is not responding
rows.Problem: One Ui home is not responding
rows.Summarized Problem: The One UI home screen is not responding.
rows.Severity Reason: The home screen is not responding, making the device interface unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: The analysis from provided logs is not sufficient. Also, as no release is planned for OS 14 and the issue is not occurring in the latest OS 15 launcher apk, please help to update to latest OS.

rows.Title: loud read notifications in Modes and Routines aren't working
rows.Problem: loud read notifications in Modes and Routines aren't working
rows.Summarized Problem: Loud read notifications in Modes and Routines are not working after the One UI 7.0 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely non-functional, preventing users from receiving audio alerts for notifications in Modes and Routines.
rows.R&D Comment: As per logs, there are no modes & routine set. Please provide logs if issue still reproducible.

rows.Title: Screen casting with Smart View on S25 Ultra unable to set screen size to monitor
rows.Problem: When screen casting using Smart View on S25 Ultra, unable to set screen size to that of my monitor (Samsung M7). In the attached screenshot even though I've set aspect ratio to Full screen on connected device, the aspect ratio is that of the mobile device.
rows.Summarized Problem: During screen casting via Smart View on S25 Ultra, the screen size cannot be set to match the monitor, and the aspect ratio defaults to the mobile device's resolution.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents proper screen alignment and display scaling, making the casting experience unusable and leading to a mismatched visual output.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause and countermeasure both point to the need for CP silent logs to diagnose the issue.

rows.Title: Sports from Google option not appearing in Now Bar Setting
rows.Problem: The live cricket score option is still not showing. All settings are perfect, now bar doesn't show on lock screen
rows.Summarized Problem: The live cricket score option from Google is not appearing in the Now Bar on lock screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing in a key context (lock screen Now Bar), but the overall device remains usable and settings are intact.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Processing notification message at the bottom of the screen after closing incognito tab
rows.Problem: When swiping to remove a notification from the status bar, such as closing a private window in Google Chrome, the screen displays 'processing notification' and then freezes for a few seconds, preventing use of other apps or folders. This occurs with multiple apps, not just Chrome.
rows.Summarized Problem: The screen displays a 'processing notification' message and freezes when removing a notification, especially from private browser windows, preventing user interaction with other apps.
rows.Severity Reason: The screen freeze prevents user interaction with other apps, rendering the device temporarily unusable during the event.
rows.R&D Comment: This is a Chrome-specific issue; we have logged it on Crbug with IDs 416181574 and 424066119. Google will evaluate and resolve it in future Chrome updates.

rows.Title: Internal error of the device pops up on launching the app
rows.Problem: Facing this issue with GoodLock application
rows.Summarized Problem: The device shows an internal error when launching the Good Lock app.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes on launch, preventing user access to the feature.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Spam call blocking not working
rows.Problem: The spam call blocking feature on the phone has been unable to block unwanted calls for several days. The user has tried restarting the phone and checking app settings, but the issue persists. This is causing significant disruption.
rows.Summarized Problem: The spam call blocking feature is failing to block unwanted calls, causing disruption to the user's experience.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely failing to function, preventing the device from blocking spam calls, which is a core communication function.
rows.R&D Comment: It is difficult to determine the exact timing of the issue, making analysis challenging. If you could capture the phenomenon and dump the logs at the moment the problem occurs and upload them, we can further investigate. When capturing, please ensure that the time of the incoming call causing the issue is displayed.

rows.Title: Battery widget not displayed on homescreen
rows.Problem: Battery widget on homescreen does not display battery percentage of Samsung Watch 3
rows.Summarized Problem: The battery widget on the homescreen fails to display the battery percentage for Samsung Watch 3.
rows.Severity Reason: The widget does not show battery percentage, which is a partial malfunction of a core display function.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Auto app installation
rows.Problem: Google Play installed an app without user permission, despite App Protection being enabled. User received a notification but did not install the app. User wants to know how to safeguard their phone.
rows.Summarized Problem: Google Play Store installs apps automatically without user consent, even when App Protection is enabled.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of app installation permissions, where the system acts without explicit user consent, but does not cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Disable Auto-Install in Google Play Store Settings to prevent unauthorized app installations.

rows.Title: System UI Not Responding
rows.Problem: System UI not responding error message showing often during multitasking and when closing apps, started after 1 May 2025 update
rows.Summarized Problem: The system UI is not responding during multitasking and app closure, especially after the May 1, 2025 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The system UI unresponsiveness causes device instability and disrupts core user interactions during normal usage.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Temporarily not available message pops up
rows.Problem: Samsung Pass is not working
rows.Summarized Problem: Samsung Wallet is not functioning due to a failure in PIN/Pattern/Password handling during registration with KnoxMatrix EscrowVault.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents the Samsung Pass feature from working, which is essential for device authentication and access.
rows.R&D Comment: The root cause is a failure in PPP information handling during KnoxMatrix registration; a countermeasure requires silent logs for further analysis.

rows.Title: Homescreen lag
rows.Problem: Software not working properly, always keeps lagging, themes colours not comfortable for eyes
rows.Summarized Problem: The homescreen experiences persistent lag and has uncomfortable theme colors.
rows.Severity Reason: The homescreen lagging significantly impacts device usability and performance, making it difficult to navigate the interface effectively.
rows.R&D Comment: Performance issue due to ART interpreting bytecode instead of running native code; multiple apps being optimized simultaneously leading to high CPU usage and slow app launch.

rows.Title: Multi control is not working
rows.Problem: Multi control is not working. It is showing that accessibility feature is turned on
rows.Summarized Problem: The multi-window feature is not functioning and incorrectly shows the accessibility feature as enabled.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is not working, indicating a major malfunction that prevents intended user functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Upon unsubscribing, a pop comes up
rows.Problem: When selecting unsubscribe in a text message, a popup frequently flashes or refreshes
rows.Summarized Problem: A popup frequently flashes or refreshes when users select unsubscribe in a text message.
rows.Severity Reason: The popup refreshes intermittently, causing user frustration but does not prevent device operation or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue reported to Google for concept verification; please check in latest AM app version.

rows.Title: Device gets locked on its own
rows.Problem: phone is getting locked frequently while using it, sometimes it gets locked just after opened it
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone frequently locks itself shortly after being opened, even while in use.
rows.Severity Reason: The device locks unexpectedly during use, which can interrupt user operations and make the device unusable in real-time scenarios.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Front camera starts clicking picture
rows.Problem: Front Camera continuously takes pictures even when no gesture is used
rows.Summarized Problem: The front camera continuously takes pictures without any user gesture.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera operates without user input, leading to unintended photo capture, which can disrupt user experience and cause device misuse.
rows.R&D Comment: Pushing arcsoft library v290 (with v289 as base) with reduced misrecognition (false positives) rate

rows.Title: Calendar widget font too small
rows.Problem: Calendar widget font is extremely small and buttons are almost touching the edges, inconsistent with other widgets
rows.Summarized Problem: The calendar widget has excessively small font size and buttons are nearly touching the edges, causing inconsistency with other widgets.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visual consistency and usability but does not prevent device operation or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue is not reproducing in the latest ONEUI Home; will be fixed in Homescreen Version 16.0.09.13 or above.

rows.Title: Glitch while unlocking the phone
rows.Problem: While unlocking my phone it first shows AOD then goes back to lockscreen. This glitch started today after the update
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone shows AOD and then returns to lockscreen when unlocking, causing a glitch after the latest update.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to properly unlock, creating an unstable user experience and potential usability issue during authentication.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: System not responding
rows.Problem: System not responding again and again, causing frequent restarts and excessive hang
rows.Summarized Problem: The system repeatedly becomes unresponsive, leading to frequent restarts and significant hang issues.
rows.Severity Reason: The system is unresponsive and repeatedly hangs, causing the device to restart, making it unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: App icon disappears or duplicates
rows.Problem: Home screen icons sometimes disappear and show wrong icons for apps. No Bluetooth icon appears in notification bar when device is connected.
rows.Summarized Problem: Home screen app icons intermittently disappear or show incorrect icons, and Bluetooth notification icon is missing when connected.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of the home screen interface and missing notifications, but does not render the device unusable or crash.
rows.R&D Comment: Fixed isTransparentDrawable initialization to false when iconView is cleared; scheduled for OneUIHome update on 5/9.

rows.Title: Lag in using TalkBack
rows.Problem: Slow phone with TalkBack. Recently, I have purchased Samsung Galaxy S24 FE of 8GB RAM and 256GB Storage. I am person with blindness, so I use TalkBack to operate phones. My experience with this phone is bad so far, with TalkBack, this phone lags. Before this phone, I was using Samsung Galaxy A52s 5G, so I am saying this in the comparison of that phone. However, this phone has more powerful processor than A52s phone. But also, this phone feels laggy with TalkBack. And without TalkBack also, this
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone lags when using TalkBack, despite having a more powerful processor than previous models.
rows.Severity Reason: TalkBack is a critical assistive feature for users with blindness, and lagging severely impacts usability and device functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Key notifications not working properly
rows.Problem: I have set a routine to notify me on special words like report and parichay but I don't get the special notification. Please look into it
rows.Summarized Problem: Users do not receive notifications when specific keywords are detected in incoming messages, despite having set up routines for such triggers.
rows.Severity Reason: The routine fails to trigger on specific keywords, resulting in partial functionality failure but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: This is not an issue; routine triggers only when a notification is received with the specified keyword and sound mode is on. Users should verify notification receipt and sound settings.

rows.Title: Search option not working properly
rows.Problem: Search option in notes is not working properly as I am unable to search a word even in small document
rows.Summarized Problem: The search function in the notes app is not working properly, preventing users from searching for words even in small documents.
rows.Severity Reason: Users are unable to search for words in documents, making the notes feature essentially unusable for basic functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Logic search text is incorrect; the ending line of copy text and text page are different.

rows.Title: Clicked pictures are blurry
rows.Problem: camera is taking blurry photos
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera is capturing blurry photos when taking pictures.
rows.Severity Reason: Blurred photos prevent users from obtaining clear images, which is a major function failure in photography.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Battery drain
rows.Problem: 80% maximum protection feature consumes more battery than 100 basic protection feature. Is this intended behavior?
rows.Summarized Problem: The 80% maximum protection feature is consuming more battery than the 100% basic protection feature, raising concern about its efficiency.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature exhibits inconsistent power consumption, affecting user experience but does not cause device failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is related to the Instagram app excessively consuming CPU in the background. Once the app is fixed, it will be updated through the Play Store.

rows.Title: Private share crashes when launched
rows.Problem: Private Share app crashes every time it is launched
rows.Summarized Problem: The Private Share app crashes every time it is launched.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes every time it is launched, making it completely unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Jio sim not working properly
rows.Problem: Jio SIM shows full signal but internet is extremely slow or doesn't work at all. Device shows RACH failures and poor network connection despite correct network mode and APN settings. Issue persists across multiple Jio SIMs and other devices confirm SIM works fine.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device shows strong signal but fails to connect to the internet, with RACH failures indicating poor network connection due to weak signal in the area.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is unable to establish a functional internet connection despite showing strong signal, leading to complete loss of network functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Device is in a weak signal area causing RACH failures; user should move to a better signal location; if issue persists, hardware or software network module needs service center inspection.

rows.Title: Tap and pay does not work
rows.Problem: NFC is present and Wallet is installed, but the Tap & Pay feature remains unavailable despite being advertised at launch. Support has provided generic responses and closed the thread. No clear resolution from Samsung Pay support.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Tap and Pay feature is unavailable on the Galaxy M55s 5G despite NFC and Wallet being installed and advertised at launch.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely missing and users cannot perform a core payment function, making the device unusable for transactions.
rows.R&D Comment: The feature is only supported for Mini version and is not enabled for M55s; update APP confirmation to include M55s support.

rows.Title: Home screen display color looks very dull
rows.Problem: After upgrading to oneui 7, the screen colours faded. It looks dull and it can not be resolved
rows.Summarized Problem: The home screen display color has faded significantly after upgrading to OneUI 7, and the issue cannot be resolved.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visual clarity of the home screen but does not cause device malfunction or crash, and is partially resolvable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Sports from google not displayed on the Now Bar
rows.Problem: The google sports on nowbar don't works
rows.Summarized Problem: Google sports are not displayed on the Now Bar.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature does not function fully, but the device remains usable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Animation not working on lock screen clock style
rows.Problem: Animated clock style does not show any animation effect when changing clock style on lock screen, while it works properly on other Samsung devices.
rows.Summarized Problem: The animated clock style on the lock screen fails to display any animation effect when changed.
rows.Severity Reason: The animation fails to display during clock style change, but functionality is partially intact as it works on other devices, indicating a partial malfunction.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Now bar only showing Spotify and no other app
rows.Problem: Now Bar only works with Spotify app and not with other apps, despite user having configured settings through multiple videos
rows.Summarized Problem: The Now Bar on the lock screen only displays Spotify app and does not show media from other applications.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature partially malfunctions as it only supports one app, limiting functionality but does not cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is likely due to a media notification filtering bug; countermeasure is to require user to provide logs and video for reproduction to validate the problem.

rows.Title: Clock style setup on lock screen lacks animation
rows.Problem: Lock screen clock animation is not working after upgrading to OneUI 7 stable
rows.Summarized Problem: The clock animation is missing when setting up clock styles on the lock screen after upgrading to OneUI 7.
rows.Severity Reason: The animation is missing during a functional setup step but does not prevent device usage or cause crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Blinking in apps observed while launching
rows.Problem: Blinking of apps while launching and nav bar not transparent
rows.Summarized Problem: Apps blink when launching due to animation issues.
rows.Severity Reason: The blinking occurs during app launch but does not prevent device usage or cause crashes, indicating a partial malfunction.
rows.R&D Comment: This issue is fixed with commit: 5ca96bb7147bdf89004625027604911e6c47a2b7, app launch animation params has been updated.

rows.Title: Vibrate when answered or call ends doesn't work
rows.Problem: Vibrate when call answered or ended not working despite all settings in place
rows.Summarized Problem: The device does not vibrate when a call is answered or ended, even when vibration settings are configured.
rows.Severity Reason: The lack of vibration during call events prevents users from receiving critical feedback about call status, making the device unusable in key scenarios.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by a missing implementation in vibration settings; users must manually set media vibration intensity to a non-zero value to restore functionality.

rows.Title: Transition when quick panel is pulled down in landscape mode takes time
rows.Problem: Quick panel lags slightly when opened in landscape mode or fullscreen during light tasks, even with power saving mode off
rows.Summarized Problem: The quick panel lags when pulled down in landscape mode during light usage.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction during normal use but does not cause device unavailability or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Notification panel shown instead of quick panel on swipe
rows.Problem: Notification panel opens when swiping from both sides instead of quick settings panel when dragging from the right side
rows.Summarized Problem: Users are unable to access the quick settings panel by swiping from the right side; instead, the notification panel opens.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a partial malfunction of the quick settings access, preventing users from reaching quick settings directly but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: User action is not to pull down from statusbar; launcher swipe opens notification panel. To access quick settings, users must pull down from the statusbar indicator area.

rows.Title: Network automatically shifts from 5G to LTE
rows.Problem: The network automatically shifts from 5G to LTE and this is just too frequent and the frequency even doubled after the OneUI7 update
rows.Summarized Problem: The device frequently switches from 5G to LTE, especially after the OneUI7 update, causing inconsistent network performance.
rows.Severity Reason: The frequent network switching disrupts connectivity and may lead to poor user experience or device usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Modes and smart view button overlap
rows.Problem: The smart view and modes panels randomly overlap in the notification panel
rows.Summarized Problem: The smart view and modes panels randomly overlap in the notification panel.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of the quick panel interface, leading to visual confusion but does not prevent device usage.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Camera lags freezes at wide angle camera
rows.Problem: The wide-angle camera on Galaxy S21 FE freezes or lags when switching to the lens for photos or videos, while the main 1x camera works fine. The issue started with One UI 6.1 and persists after updating to One UI 7. Tried wiping cache, factory reset, and testing in cool environment with no improvement.
rows.Summarized Problem: The wide-angle camera lens on the Galaxy S21 FE freezes or lags when used, affecting photo and video capture.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera freezes during use, making it unusable for photo and video functions, which are core features of the camera module.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: YT video resolution changes to 480p on its own when trying to switch to 2160p
rows.Problem: When watching 4K videos on YouTube, the app automatically switches to 4
rows.Summarized Problem: YouTube automatically switches 4K videos to 480p during playback, disrupting the intended viewing experience.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to display intended video quality, resulting in a significant degradation of user experience and functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue originates in YouTube app's video resolution handling; recommend updating to latest app version and clearing cache to resolve.

rows.Title: optical image system twitching noise
rows.Problem: The main camera has a twitching noise from the optical image system that occurs only once when accessing the primary camera.
rows.Summarized Problem: The optical image system produces a twitching noise when the primary camera is accessed, occurring only once per access.
rows.Severity Reason: The noise occurs during camera access, which is a core functionality, and may indicate a hardware or system-level issue affecting user experience during operation.
rows.R&D Comment: The twitching noise during camera access is caused by the optical image system; updating the MCU firmware to LS23_R33M is recommended as a countermeasure.

rows.Title: Remaster feature produces dull images
rows.Problem: The Remaster feature in the Gallery app now produces dark images after the One UI 7 update, while it was working perfectly just minutes before the update.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Remaster feature in the Gallery app produces dark images after the One UI 7 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature no longer functions correctly after an update, resulting in visibly degraded image quality, but the core functionality is not entirely absent.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Device lags in app launch and normal operations
rows.Problem: Performance and RAM management has been reduced after UI 7 update
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences significant lag during app launch and normal operations after the UI 7 update, with reduced RAM management.
rows.Severity Reason: The device lags severely during core operations, making it difficult to use, which impacts usability and overall device performance.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Vibrate when answered or call ends doesn't work
rows.Problem: None of the services attached in the screenshot is working. It could be a bug.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device does not vibrate when a call is answered or ends.
rows.Severity Reason: The vibration feedback is missing during call events, making it impossible for users to know when a call is answered or ended, which is a critical interaction in phone usage.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Not able to select Call Type
rows.Problem: After updating to OneUI 7.0, unable to select 'Call Type' option for reporting spam calls to Hiya service. This is important as user receives many spam calls. Previously reported during beta with no resolution. Attached screen recording and exception log.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot select call type when reporting spam calls to the Hiya service after updating to OneUI 7.0.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is partially unavailable, preventing users from reporting spam calls, but the device remains otherwise functional.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Lockscreen display zoomed in
rows.Problem: The lockscreen gets zoomed in automatically, showing only the top left quadrant of the screen, especially at night. This happens only when the phone is locked using fingerprint or number lock, and does not occur during the day.
rows.Summarized Problem: The lockscreen display is zoomed in, showing only the top left quadrant of the screen, particularly at night.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visibility of the lockscreen but does not cause device failure or crash, and only occurs intermittently during nighttime use.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue was not reproducible in the latest binary; further investigation needed to confirm root cause and reproduce under controlled conditions.

rows.Title: dxf and dwg format files showing in gallery
rows.Problem: Dxf format and dwg format files showing in the gallery after the one UI update
rows.Summarized Problem: DXF and DWG format files are incorrectly displayed in the gallery after a UI update.
rows.Severity Reason: Files are showing in the gallery despite being non-image formats, causing confusion and incorrect categorization, but the core functionality remains usable.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Android 15 changed the MIME type of DWG files to images, causing them to appear in the gallery. Countermeasure: Report to Google and wait for fix via Play Store.

rows.Title: Security policy prevents installation of secure folder
rows.Problem: Unable to access secure folder after updating UI 7; shows security error
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot access the secure folder after updating UI 7 due to a security policy error.
rows.Severity Reason: The secure folder is a core feature for device security, and users are unable to access it after an update, rendering a key functionality unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: DO was created and later removed; factory reset is recommended to resolve the issue.

rows.Title: Camera not starting up
rows.Problem: Camera not working after software update from version 14 to 15
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera fails to start after a software update from version 14 to 15.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera is a core functionality that fails to start, making the device unusable for basic operations.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by missing camera logs during reproduction; a countermeasure is to ensure logs are captured immediately after reproducing the issue and to include a video.

rows.Title: Unable to restore backup after installing Smart Switch PC app
rows.Problem: Smart Switch PC app shows backup but unable to restore. After updating, no backup is shown even after manually specifying path. Reinstalling again results in showing backup but still unable to restore.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Smart Switch PC app shows backup folders but fails to restore them, even after updates and reinstallation.
rows.Severity Reason: Users cannot restore data, which is essential for device recovery, leading to potential data loss and device unusability.
rows.R&D Comment: BackupHistory.xml is removed during uninstallation, causing loss of backup list; users must manually register backup folders via the app menu to restore data.

rows.Title: Camera not available after update
rows.Problem: Camera app is not available to update
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera app is no longer available after an update.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera app is completely unavailable, preventing core device functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Sound quality is not good
rows.Problem: Audio quality is very poor during video or audio recording in Laud Music DJ events; music sound is not clear, unlike other phones that record clearly under same conditions.
rows.Summarized Problem: Audio recording quality is poor during music events, with unclear sound compared to other devices.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents proper audio capture during events, making the device unusable for music-related activities.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue occurs during recording but no recording logs are available; user must provide logs from actual recording scenarios to diagnose the root cause.

rows.Title: Capture images have poor quality
rows.Problem: Front and back camera images have poor quality, appearing unclear and dull, despite cleaning the lens and phone multiple times. The camera performance is significantly below expectations.
rows.Summarized Problem: Camera images are unclear and dull, with poor image quality on both front and back cameras.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera function is fundamentally failing to deliver usable images, making it difficult to capture clear photos, which is a core usability requirement.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Lag observed in the device
rows.Problem: phone is lagging too much and it gets stuck in one place and automatically restarts, sometimes looping to power off
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences severe lag, freezing, and automatic restarts, leading to instability.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes unusable due to frequent freezing and restarts, indicating a major system instability.
rows.R&D Comment: UFS link layer errors suggest hardware issues; recommend hardware inspection at the customer service center.

rows.Title: Long screenshot lines get cut off
rows.Problem: While capturing long screenshots—especially of documents or webpages—the stitching sometimes fails, resulting in smudged areas or misaligned text, particularly where sentences or lines continue across screens.
rows.Summarized Problem: Long screenshots exhibit smudging and misalignment due to stitching failures when content spans multiple screens.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial visual degradation in long screenshots but does not prevent full functionality or lead to device instability.
rows.R&D Comment: Stitching failure in scroll capture due to lack of overlapping match between consecutive frames; alternative solution under development.

rows.Title: Widgets seem to be compact and not using full space of the screen
rows.Problem: After upgrading to One UI 7, home screen, lock screen, and app drawer widgets appear smaller and do not use the full width of the display. On the lock screen, app icons are centered instead of aligned to the corners.
rows.Summarized Problem: Widgets on the lock screen and home screen are too small and not using the full screen width, with icons centered instead of aligned to screen corners.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visual layout and user experience but does not cause device malfunction or data loss; functionality remains operational.
rows.R&D Comment: The compact widget layout is intentional due to a 6x8 grid setting, and users can adjust grid size via home screen settings.

rows.Title: Call App getting crash
rows.Problem: Call app not working properly; missing record call and voice focus features. User installed app from unknown source, uninstalled updates, and no option to update via Galaxy Store or directly on device. Device may have underlying issues.
rows.Summarized Problem: The call app crashes and fails to provide voice focus and record call functionality due to installation from unknown sources and lack of updates.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes and fails to perform core call functions like recording and voice focus, rendering the call feature unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Voice focus is not supported for this device; app functionality is compromised due to installation from unknown sources and uninstalled updates. Advised to reset device to factory settings.

rows.Title: Gallery App Remaster Feature Shows Black Transparent Layer
rows.Problem: When applying remaster on an image, the feature shows a black transparent layer instead of improving the image.
rows.Summarized Problem: The remaster feature in the Gallery app displays a black transparent layer instead of enhancing the image.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature fails to perform its intended function and shows a visible, disruptive layer on all images, rendering the image editing process unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Clock animation not working in Lock screen
rows.Problem: The clock animation on the lock screen is not working after updating to One UI 7. It was expected to be functional based on the changelog, but it is missing on the Galaxy A35 5G.
rows.Summarized Problem: The clock animation on the lock screen is not working after the One UI 7 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature promised in the update is missing, making the lock screen visually incomplete and inconsistent with user expectations.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Battery draining and heating up
rows.Problem: Battery draining more and heating up the device even after clearing cache
rows.Summarized Problem: The device is draining battery and heating up rapidly even after clearing cache, despite no unnecessary apps being installed.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is overheating and draining battery rapidly, which can lead to performance degradation or safety risks, making it unusable under normal use conditions.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Network is completely dripping
rows.Problem: Network is completely dripping
rows.Summarized Problem: Network registration is failing completely after the UI7 update due to poor PRX chain and significant RX imbalance.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to register with the network, rendering basic connectivity functions unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Poor PRX chain and huge RX imbalance are causing network registration failure.

rows.Title: Battery drain
rows.Problem: New battery installed on S20 FE 5G shows only 6 hours of backup, less than a one-year-old phone. Calibration has been done. Service center claims this is normal for new battery.
rows.Summarized Problem: A newly installed battery on S20 FE 5G provides only 6 hours of backup, significantly less than a one-year-old battery, despite calibration.
rows.Severity Reason: The device shows significantly reduced battery life after a new battery installation, which is critical for daily usability and indicates a major malfunction in battery performance.
rows.R&D Comment: Service center must initialize battery cycle to 0 after installing new battery; this step is currently being skipped by some centers and requires guidance from service center in-charge.

rows.Title: Good Lock app does not open
rows.Problem: After upgrading to One UI 7.0, the Good Lock app does not open and keeps showing the update congratulation screen
rows.Summarized Problem: The Good Lock app fails to open after a software update and displays a congratulatory message instead of launching.
rows.Severity Reason: The app does not fully function but allows partial access; users can see the update message but cannot use the app to manage lock screen features.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by a missing or outdated Home Up version in the Good Lock app; users must update Home Up via the app to resolve it.

rows.Title: Battery drain observed in the device
rows.Problem: Serious battery drain issue after security patch update; screen on time drops from 4-5 hours to 3 hours or less after UI 7 update. Lagging and slow lock screen when double tabbing.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences significant battery drain after a security patch and UI update, reducing screen on time from 4-5 hours to 3 hours or less, with lag during lock screen interaction.
rows.Severity Reason: Battery drain is severe and directly impacts device usability, with screen on time dropping significantly and affecting daily operation.
rows.R&D Comment: Battery drain occurs only during specific apps; normal when screen is off or during standard usage. Further investigation needed for root cause of reduced screen on time post-update.

rows.Title: Media player not opening from notification panel
rows.Problem: The media player at the top is not opening correctly in some cases
rows.Summarized Problem: The media player in the notification panel fails to open correctly in some cases.
rows.Severity Reason: The media player fails to open in some cases, indicating partial malfunction.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Notification sounds goes mute and only vibrates
rows.Problem: Whatsapp and slack may be more but these are installed go to mute and no notification sounds played except vibrations
rows.Summarized Problem: Notification sounds are muted and only vibrations are delivered for WhatsApp and Slack.
rows.Severity Reason: Users cannot hear notifications, making it impossible to respond to important alerts, leading to device usability issues.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Audio issue with wired earphones
rows.Problem: After updating to Android 15, audio glitches occur with wired earphones, including sudden sound stoppage or buzzing noise. The issue appears software-related and started post-update.
rows.Summarized Problem: Wired earphones experience random sound stoppage or buzzing noise after Android 15 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The audio function is intermittently failing, causing complete loss of sound during usage, which renders the device unusable for media consumption.
rows.R&D Comment: There is no media playback seen in the current logs. Please check and provide logs taken immediately after the issue occurs, along with the time of occurrence.

rows.Title: Refining process takes too long on picture capture
rows.Problem: Taking pictures shows a never-ending refining process, preventing picture transfer. This occurs after the recent update.
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera's photo refinement process hangs indefinitely, preventing picture transfer and usability.
rows.Severity Reason: The refining process does not complete, blocking picture transfer and rendering the camera function unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Device memory is insufficient for camera operation; refinement process consumes excessive memory, causing hang and failure.

rows.Title: Contact expand often expands another contact
rows.Problem: Attached recordings show the issue
rows.Summarized Problem: When a contact is expanded, the list incorrectly expands another contact instead of showing the intended contact.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a partial malfunction in contact navigation, but the device remains usable and does not crash or lose data.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue was caused by list redraw on order change due to Samsung Search's frequently searched contacts; the fix now redraws only when actual data changes or during explicit refresh, improving usability.

rows.Title: Charger and wired earphones stopped working
rows.Problem: After updating to One UI 7, wired earphones and charger stopped working. Tried all troubleshooting steps but nothing worked.
rows.Summarized Problem: Wired earphones and charger stopped working after updating to One UI 7.
rows.Severity Reason: Device functionality for audio and charging is completely lost, making the device unusable for basic operations.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue likely stems from a problem with the USB Type-C port; recommend testing with another earphone and visiting a service center if the issue persists.

rows.Title: Top speaker does not work for system volume
rows.Problem: The top speaker does not work for system volume, but works for other audio types. It functions correctly for app and notification sounds.
rows.Summarized Problem: The top speaker fails to play system volume audio, though it works for app and notification sounds.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects system volume playback but does not render the device unusable or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: As per the dual speaker concept, music or long duration playback is routed to both top and bottom speakers, while system tones play only on the bottom speaker. Users should be informed about this feature.

rows.Title: Sports notifications not showing on now bar
rows.Problem: Sports from google ipl notification not showing on now bar
rows.Summarized Problem: Sports notifications from Google IPL are not displaying on the Now Bar.
rows.Severity Reason: The notification fails to appear on a key UI element, affecting user experience but does not cause device failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: WhatsApp video and photo folders removed from gallery
rows.Problem: WhatsApp video and photo folders are removed from gallery, forcing users to open the app to view content, which is irritating, especially after software updates
rows.Summarized Problem: WhatsApp video and photo folders are no longer visible in the gallery, requiring users to open the WhatsApp app to view content.
rows.Severity Reason: Users cannot access media directly in the gallery, making it difficult to browse content without opening the app, which is a major usability failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Sports from Google got cleared accidentally
rows.Problem: I accidentally cleared notification and cleared sports from Google live match reports, now my Now bar sports from Google is not working
rows.Summarized Problem: Users accidentally cleared sports content from Google live match reports, causing the Now bar sports section to stop working.
rows.Severity Reason: The Now bar is a core feature for real-time sports updates, and its failure prevents users from accessing live match reports, rendering the feature unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Post update Pubg getting 30fps
rows.Problem: After update, PUBG runs at 30 fps instead of 59-60 fps, causing significant lag. Game plugins were removed, which previously helped monitor CPU, FPS, memory, and GPU status. Users believe this removal hides performance issues and may be detrimental to gameplay.
rows.Summarized Problem: PUBG performance drops significantly after update, dropping from 59-60 fps to 30 fps due to removal of game plugins that previously provided performance monitoring.
rows.Severity Reason: The game runs at half its original frame rate, resulting in a severely degraded user experience and potential device instability during gameplay.
rows.R&D Comment: GamePlugin is no longer supported from Android V-os. The individual app setting function has been changed to the main function of GameBooster, and the rest of the functions will be supported through the Goodlock app. Please delete GamePlugin app.

rows.Title: Instagram not optimized for latest Android version
rows.Problem: Home button becomes unresponsive and fails to return or open apps; error message states feature is not optimized for latest Android version after upgrading to ONE UI 7.0
rows.Summarized Problem: The home button on the Samsung S21 FE 5G is unresponsive and fails to return or open apps, with an error indicating Instagram is not optimized for the latest Android version.
rows.Severity Reason: The home button is a core navigation feature; its failure to respond renders the device unusable for basic navigation and app access.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Screen gets stucked while taking screenshot
rows.Problem: After One UI 7 update, screen gets stuck when taking screenshot using power button and volume down button, unable to open or do anything for 3-5 minutes.
rows.Summarized Problem: The screen gets stuck and becomes unresponsive after taking a screenshot using the power and volume down buttons.
