rows.Summarized Problem: A new phone is experiencing random restarts.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is randomly restarting, which may lead to data loss or device unavailability.
rows.R&D Comment: Six resets have occurred recently. It is a random reset of unknown reason, and if the number of resets increases, hw defect should be checked.

rows.Title: Smart Things widget doesn't show select devices
rows.Problem: After One UI 7.0 update, the SmartThings widget doesn't show devices in the widget, but when long pressed to edit, it shows devices in the preview.
rows.Summarized Problem: The SmartThings widget fails to display devices in the widget interface, although device list is visible when editing via long press.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects device visibility in the widget but does not prevent full app functionality or cause device loss or crash.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue caused by Google Work Manager task enqueueing; temporary fix involves clearing app data and reinstalling; fix planned for next app update 1.8.33.

rows.Title: Videos not playing in any media application
rows.Problem: Videos not playing in any media application
rows.Summarized Problem: Videos fail to play in all media applications.
rows.Severity Reason: Video playback failure across all media apps renders core functionality unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Attached logs and video are not in sync. Please retest in latest version under strong, stable network and attach new logs and video in sync if issue persists.

rows.Title: Showing add to contacts and update existing contact option again and again after saving a number through call log
rows.Problem: Showing aad to contacts and update existing contact option again and again after saving a number through call log
rows.Summarized Problem: The 'add to contacts' and 'update existing contact' options continue to appear repeatedly after saving a number from the call log.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes repeated prompts but does not prevent device usage or cause a crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Edit to dismiss add contact dialog; confirmed in version 15.7.39.

rows.Title: Quick Panel
rows.Problem: Glitch found in quick panel
rows.Summarized Problem: A glitch is present in the Quick Panel.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a malfunction in a functional panel, but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: No NowBar charging animation on lockscreen
rows.Problem: NowBar lock screen charging animation does not appear when charging while screen is locked. Device care widget is not completely transparent. Tremendous battery drain.
rows.Summarized Problem: The NowBar charging animation fails to appear on the locked screen during charging.
rows.Severity Reason: The charging animation is missing, leading to a noticeable and functional gap in user feedback during charging.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Phone has become very laggy while unlock device
rows.Problem: Since I have updated my phone to one ui 7, I have noticed that there are some jerks in animation, especially when I unlock my phone. Phone has become very laggy, and I also feel like it's heating more than usual.
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone experiences significant lag and jerky animations when unlocking, especially after the One UI 7 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The lag during unlock severely impacts usability, making the device feel unresponsive and potentially leading to user frustration or inability to use the device effectively.
rows.R&D Comment: The lag occurs due to the system's UI redrawing during transition from lock screen to home screen, and the issue is mitigated by optimizing UI reload and component redrawing during screen transitions.

rows.Title: Unable to open camera app setting
rows.Problem: After updating to One UI 7, tapping the setting icon in the camera app causes it to close without allowing changes to settings.
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera app closes immediately when the user taps on the settings icon, preventing access to app settings.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes upon accessing settings, preventing users from modifying camera configurations, rendering a core feature unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause and countermeasure both point to the need for CP silent logs to diagnose the issue.

rows.Title: nowbar is not showing live sports score
rows.Problem: the now bar option is pretty great but the sports by google on lockscreen is not showing live sports scores. i have tried everything but it is not happening
rows.Summarized Problem: The Now Bar on the Lock Screen is not displaying live sports scores.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely missing, preventing users from viewing live sports scores, which is a core functionality of the Now Bar.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Calculator app opens with 0 on right side of cursor
rows.Problem: When opening the Calculator app, it displays a 0 on the right side of the cursor instead of the left. Pressing any number (e.g., 6) results in '60' being typed instead of '6'. This issue occurs consistently and has been present since the update to One UI 7. The app version is 12.4.00.11.
rows.Summarized Problem: The calculator app displays a zero on the right side of the cursor, causing incorrect number input.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes incorrect number entry, leading to malfunction of core calculator functionality and user error in calculations.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Timing issue causes firmware to return wrong cursor position on first load. Countermeasure: Fixed in version 12.4.00.13 and will be released soon.

rows.Title: Snapchat notification content always hidden
rows.Problem: Snapchat notification content is always hidden regardless of the overall notification setting, even after resetting the secure folder settings.
rows.Summarized Problem: Snapchat notification content is always hidden despite user settings, regardless of overall notification visibility.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from seeing Snapchat notifications, which is a core functionality of the secure folder feature.
rows.R&D Comment: There is no log for the security folder settings; users are advised to toggle the option and provide a reproduction video and dump log for further investigation.

rows.Title: Background blur and gesture animation control not working
rows.Problem: Background blur and gesture animation control not working
rows.Summarized Problem: Gesture animation control and background blur are not working on the navigation bar.
rows.Severity Reason: The gesture animation control is a core interaction feature that is not functioning, preventing users from navigating the device effectively.
rows.R&D Comment: All gesture animation tuning will be applied on swipe from sides and bottom gesture settings.

rows.Title: your buds aren't near you popup occurs when put buds on case
rows.Problem: error screen shows "your buds aren't near you" when placed in case and case is closed
rows.Summarized Problem: The watch shows a 'your buds aren't near you' popup when buds are placed in the case and the case is closed.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a notification to appear intermittently when the case is closed, but does not prevent device operation or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: This is a known issue; a firmware update and Buds Manager app release planned for mid-June.

rows.Title: Vibrate when answered feature not working
rows.Problem: The vibrate when a call is answered feature is not working on my S24 ultra since the One UI 7 beta update. It is still not working on the latest official One UI 7.0 update.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device does not vibrate when a call is answered.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely missing, preventing users from receiving tactile feedback during call interaction, which is essential for usability.
rows.R&D Comment: The answer/end call vibration is currently controlled via media intensity in Sounds and Vibration settings; a force vibrate solution will be implemented in One UI 8.0.

rows.Title: Battery drain issue
rows.Problem: Battery drain issue observed after UI 7 update on Galaxy A16 5G
rows.Summarized Problem: Device experiences significant battery drain after UI 7 update due to system failing to enter suspend mode during screen off periods.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to enter suspend mode when screen is off, causing continuous power consumption and leading to rapid battery drain, making the device unusable without frequent charging.
rows.R&D Comment: The system does not enter suspend mode during off-screen periods due to persistent wake locks from WLAN timers; countermeasure involves capturing standby power consumption and verifying suspend functionality via log commands.

rows.Title: Now bar not showing live sports scores
rows.Problem: Now bar not showing live sports scores
rows.Summarized Problem: The Now bar on the lock screen is not displaying live sports scores.
rows.Severity Reason: The Now bar is a core feature on the lock screen that fails to show live sports scores, which are a primary user expectation for real-time content.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Now bar is not showing live score
rows.Problem: Now bar is not showing live score
rows.Summarized Problem: The Now bar is not displaying live scores.
rows.Severity Reason: The Now bar failing to show live scores prevents users from accessing real-time sports data, which is a core functionality of the Smart Suggestions feature.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Device switches from 5G to 4G
rows.Problem: The phone is getting heated and is going from 5G to 4
rows.Summarized Problem: The device switches from 5G to 4G and gets heated during operation.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is switching from 5G to 4G, which indicates a major network malfunction that may lead to poor connectivity and overheating, impacting usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Not able to turn on location tags
rows.Problem: There are many glitches and bugs
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot turn on location tags due to glitches and bugs in the settings flow.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a malfunction in the location tag activation flow, which is partially broken but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Battery widget not displaying anything
rows.Problem: Home screen has glitches, now bar location is unstable, sometimes below, above, or on left/right of fingerprint sensor, keyboard has ghost touches during typing
rows.Summarized Problem: The now bar on the home screen is intermittently misaligned and displays incorrectly, with ghost touches on the keyboard.
rows.Severity Reason: The now bar instability and ghost touches affect core usability and device reliability, leading to inconsistent user experience and potential input errors.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue is not reproducing in the latest ONEUI Home version 16.0.09.19 or above; further investigation needed

rows.Title: YouTube shifts to 1080p60 from 4K
rows.Problem: YouTube tries to play 4K videos in 1080p or 1080p60 quality instead of 2160p (4K) after updating to One UI 7 / Android 15.
rows.Summarized Problem: YouTube fails to play 4K videos and defaults to 1080p or 1080p60 resolution.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects video quality but does not cause device crash or data loss; it is a partial malfunction of playback functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue has been reported to Google and will be resolved in a future YouTube app update.

rows.Title: Frame drop observed while playing games
rows.Problem: Video glitches occur on multiple apps like Instagram and YouTube after updating to One UI 7 and Android 15. Game FPS drops from 60 to 30 and experiences frequent frame drops. Also faces battery drain and 5G connectivity issues. Same SIM, same device, but user does not receive 5G network.
rows.Summarized Problem: Game performance drops significantly with FPS reduced from 60 to 30 after OS update, causing frame drops and video glitches across apps.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes unresponsive during gameplay with severe performance degradation, leading to inconsistent frame rates and visual glitches, making gaming unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Quick panel transparency lost
rows.Problem: Quick panel has become dark and lost its transparent look after updating to One UI 7
rows.Summarized Problem: The Quick Panel has lost its transparency and now appears dark after the One UI 7 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visual appearance but does not prevent device usage or cause functional failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Navigation bar overlaps
rows.Problem: The navigation bar is blocking the app, making it difficult to use. Previously the app border extended to the navigation bar, but now it overlaps. This issue occurs on One UI 7 and was not present in earlier versions. Changing the navigation bar to a plain line resolves it temporarily.
rows.Summarized Problem: The navigation bar overlaps the app interface, blocking visibility and usability.
rows.Severity Reason: The navigation bar is blocking the app interface, making it unusable and preventing user interaction.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue needs to be checked from the app side, as they need to add an offset for the navigation bar.

rows.Title: WhatsApp calls automatically muted during incoming call
rows.Problem: WhatsApp calls automatically mute during incoming calls, working fine with normal calls but sometimes muting during regular usage as well
rows.Summarized Problem: WhatsApp calls automatically mute during incoming calls, affecting call audio functionality.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes complete loss of audio during WhatsApp calls, making communication impossible and rendering the feature unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: No record found of call mute during WhatsApp app usage; requires video evidence and further investigation.

rows.Title: Spotify doesn't update the song
rows.Problem: The audio of other apps stops when the notification card of last played song is cleared. The notification media card does not switch to the currently playing audio when a song is stopped.
rows.Summarized Problem: Spotify fails to update the currently playing song and does not switch notification media when playback changes.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes interruption in audio playback from other apps when notifications are cleared, but does not completely disable functionality or cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Contact screen doesn't scroll when opened via messages
rows.Problem: Contact screen fully hangs when opening a contact from SMS app, but device does not hang
rows.Summarized Problem: The contact screen fails to scroll when opened from the SMS app, causing a full hang.
rows.Severity Reason: The contact screen completely hangs, preventing user interaction, which renders the feature unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: No specific logs available and cannot reproduce on real device.

rows.Title: Keyboard panel overlaps search dialog box
rows.Problem: The new placement of search box is getting hidden by the keyboard pane, making it unable to be seen completely and creating a bad user experience
rows.Summarized Problem: The keyboard panel overlaps the search dialog box, making the search box partially hidden and difficult to see.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects usability but does not cause device crash or data loss; it is a partial malfunction of the interface layout.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue not reproduced in latest binary; recommend software update, cache clear, and GBoard update as countermeasure.

rows.Title: Now brief is not showing on the now bar in lock screen
rows.Problem: Now brief is not showing on the now bar in lock screen
rows.Summarized Problem: The Now Brief is not displaying on the Now Bar in the Lock Screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing from a critical UI element on the lock screen, preventing users from seeing essential information.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Battery drain
rows.Problem: Phone takes slow charging and has unstable USB connection; battery drains faster after UI 7.0 update; device heats up during use
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone experiences slow charging, unstable USB connections, and increased battery drain after UI 7.0 update, with the device overheating during use.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is experiencing slow charging, unstable connections, and rapid battery drain, which significantly impacts usability and may lead to overheating and data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Game mode not working properly
rows.Problem: The game mode in the modes and routines app is not working properly; it is buggy and keeps pushing notifications while gaming, despite all necessary settings being turned on.
rows.Summarized Problem: The game mode in the modes and routines app is buggy and continues to push notifications during gaming, despite proper settings.
rows.Severity Reason: The game mode is malfunctioning and actively pushing notifications during gameplay, which disrupts the user experience and renders the intended 'quiet gaming' feature ineffective.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Widget pops up when notification panel is dragged down
rows.Problem: Unwanted widget appears when pulling down to open notifications panel and remains even after restart
rows.Summarized Problem: An unwanted widget appears and persists in the notification panel when it is pulled down.
rows.Severity Reason: The widget appears in a critical interface during normal device interaction, disrupting user experience and potentially affecting usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Screen green and red dots appear when camera launched
rows.Problem: Screen remains green and red dots appear when face is detected; tried reset and safe mode but issue persists
rows.Summarized Problem: Red dots and green screen appear when camera is launched, indicating display malfunction during camera use.
rows.Severity Reason: The screen display shows abnormal colors and visual artifacts during camera operation, which directly affects user experience and device usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Defect likely in image sensor; recommend sending NG camera module to R&D for analysis and validation.

rows.Title: Game Booster not compatible with device
rows.Problem: Game Booster not found in Galaxy Store; app shows compatibility issue when accessed via Google link
rows.Summarized Problem: Game Booster app is not available in Galaxy Store and shows compatibility error when accessed via external link.
rows.Severity Reason: The app is not available in the official store and shows a compatibility error, but users can still access it through external links and use it via settings or navigation bar.
rows.R&D Comment: Game Booster is not available in Galaxy Store and is likely a third-party app; the issue is due to absence of official store listing, not a functional defect.

rows.Title: Phone randomly restarting
rows.Problem: My phone randomly restarts every 5 minutes and gets stuck before switching off.
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone randomly restarts and gets stuck every 5 minutes, causing instability.
rows.Severity Reason: The device repeatedly crashes and restarts, making it unusable and indicating a critical system instability.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by UFS link layer errors and requires hardware inspection of the AP or UFS component; the same countermeasure is recommended.

rows.Title: Issue in camera quality while switching from 0.6x to 5x
rows.Problem: Video exposure shifts drastically when moving camera up, lower part becomes extremely dark. Focus gets haywire when switching from 0.6x to 5x.
rows.Summarized Problem: Camera exposure shifts and focus becomes unstable when switching from 0.6x to 5x zoom.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes significant visual distortion and loss of focus, making video recording unusable during zoom transitions.
rows.R&D Comment: Camera behavior is tied to zoom ratio and lens activation; initial lens position is based on previous focus, causing exposure and focus instability.

rows.Title: Side button functionality not working properly
rows.Problem: Side button frequently opens torch instead of gemini on long press or double press. Changing gemini setting temporarily resolves it, but the issue returns after a few days. Requires repeated manual reconfiguration to restore functionality.
rows.Summarized Problem: The side button incorrectly triggers torch instead of gemini on both long and double press, leading to inconsistent behavior and requiring repeated manual fixes.
rows.Severity Reason: The side button is a core interaction point for user functions, and its inconsistent behavior causes unreliable operation and repeated user intervention, rendering the device unusable for intended tasks.
rows.R&D Comment: Side button input handling is misconfigured; users should check Routine and Good Lock apps for related side button settings.

rows.Title: Phone gets hot while charging
rows.Problem: Phone gets hot while charging
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone overheats when charging after updating to oneUI 7.
rows.Severity Reason: Overheating during charging can lead to device instability or safety risks, making the device potentially unusable or hazardous.
rows.R&D Comment: Lots of background services are running, causing high system consumption; users should reduce usage of camera and speaker while using Facebook.

rows.Title: Turn on Wi-Fi scanning dialog box on using location feature
rows.Problem: Users receive a pop-up message asking to 'Turn On Wi-Fi Always' when creating location-based routines or using UPI payment apps like Gpay. This issue did not exist in One UI 6.1.1.
rows.Summarized Problem: A pop-up dialog prompts users to turn on Wi-Fi scanning when using location-based features or making UPI payments, which was not present in previous versions.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a user experience disruption during routine tasks but does not prevent device functionality or lead to data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The cause is that Wi-Fi scanning is required for network location; the countermeasure is to guide users to enable Wi-Fi scanning in Settings > Location > Location services > Wi-Fi scanning.

rows.Title: Back gesture doesn't work
rows.Problem: The back gesture doesn't work sometimes in some apps. Closing and reopening the app resolves it. This is not a WhatsApp-specific issue.
rows.Summarized Problem: The back gesture fails intermittently across apps and requires app restart to resolve.
rows.Severity Reason: The gesture fails intermittently across apps, affecting user navigation but does not cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Unable to change AOD clock style
rows.Problem: Users cannot change AOD clock style after updating to One UI 7. The settings option shows 'LOCK SCREEN AND AOD', but changes only apply to the lock screen, not the AOD.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot change the AOD clock style after updating to One UI 7, as changes only apply to the lock screen and not the AOD.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects functionality but does not prevent device use or cause crashes; users can still access the lock screen and other features.
rows.R&D Comment: The AOD clock and lock screen clock were integrated in One UI 6, and this design is consistent across Samsung devices; no change in functionality is planned.

rows.Title: unrestricted battery not able change settings optimised
rows.Problem: My phone samsung s21 fe after android 15 update battery drain rapidly. I gone service centre also but does not any change. I take screenrecord sent it to you. App settings software update apps battery unrestricted only not to change optimized more than 7 apps this type of settings. System app software update unrestricted battery not able change settings optimised
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot modify battery optimization settings after the Android 15 update, leading to rapid battery drain.
rows.Severity Reason: The inability to adjust battery settings prevents users from managing battery life, resulting in rapid drain and device unusability.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is related to the Instagram app excessively consuming CPU in the background. This issue has been reported to Meta as follows, and the Meta engineering team is currently investigating it: Once the app is fixed, it will be updated through the Play Store.

rows.Title: Quality of photos worst and heavy grains after update
rows.Problem: Photo quality has worsened with heavy grains after update, and there is no proper stabilization
rows.Summarized Problem: Photos have deteriorated with heavy graininess after the update, lacking proper stabilization.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes significant degradation in image quality, which directly impacts user experience and device usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Video playback appears pixelated and glitched in YouTube App
rows.Problem: Video playback appears pixelated and glitched in YouTube app, only on Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra with One UI 6.1. Issue persists despite reinstalling app, clearing cache, reverting to factory version, and safe mode. Works fine in Chrome, indicating app-specific rendering bug or Android compatibility issue.
rows.Summarized Problem: Video playback in YouTube app appears pixelated and glitched on Samsung Galaxy S24 Ultra, despite troubleshooting efforts, suggesting a rendering or compatibility bug.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents smooth video viewing in a core media app, impacting user experience significantly and only occurs in the YouTube app, indicating a critical functionality failure.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue appears to be caused by a rendering or compatibility bug in the YouTube app on Android; countermeasure is to guide customers to service centers for PBA exchange due to suspected AP HW defect.

rows.Title: swiping down quick panel glitch
rows.Problem: sudden glitch in tablet while swiping down quick panel causes functional widgets box from home screen and lock screen to appear unexpectedly, persists after restart, intermittent, resolves after some time
rows.Summarized Problem: A glitch occurs when swiping down the quick panel, causing an unexpected appearance of widgets from the home and lock screens, which appears intermittently after restart and resolves over time.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes intermittent malfunction of the lock screen interface but does not prevent device usage or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: WiFi fails to connect or it gets much time to catch the WiFi device
rows.Problem: WiFi fails to connect or it gets much time to catch the WiFi device when the router is far from the phone, especially on Samsung phones like Galaxy M52 5G and Galaxy A35 5G. This issue is worse than on other Android phones.
rows.Summarized Problem: WiFi connection is slow or fails when the router is far from the phone, particularly on Samsung devices.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction in WiFi connection performance under weak signal conditions, but does not cause device freeze or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by a higher RSSI threshold in Samsung's WiFi signal filtering, which makes networks less visible under weak signals. The countermeasure is to maintain the current RSSI thresholds to ensure seamless connectivity.

rows.Title: Lag observed while switching between notification and quick panel
rows.Problem: Stuttering and lagging animation while switching between notification panel and quick panel, mainly when music live notification is there
rows.Summarized Problem: Users experience stuttering and lagging animations when switching between notification and quick panels, especially with music live notifications.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes intermittent performance degradation during common user interactions but does not prevent device operation or lead to data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Unable to resume call
rows.Problem: After hanging up a second call, unable to return to the first call
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot return to a previous call after ending a second call during an active call.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from resuming a call, which is a core functionality in communication and can lead to user frustration and loss of connectivity.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause and countermeasure both point to the need for CP silent logs to diagnose the issue.

rows.Title: Battery drain
rows.Problem: Battery drains from 30% to 20% overnight after a UI 7 update, with no background activity or storage issues. Device performance is affected, and the phone is new with good storage.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences significant battery drain overnight after a UI 7 update, dropping from 30% to 2
rows.Severity Reason: The battery drains significantly over a short period, leading to device unavailability and requiring frequent charging, which impacts usability.
rows.R&D Comment: System reset due to MFC buffer size inconsistency may be related to battery drain; further investigation needed

rows.Title: Battery Draining After Update
rows.Problem: More battery draining is seen after updating to one ui 7
rows.Summarized Problem: Increased battery drain is observed after updating to one UI 7.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of battery performance, specifically increased drain during app usage, but does not cause device freeze or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The battery discharged rate is quite good; user spent much time on YouTube app, and mobile data in poor signal quality increases energy consumption. Recommend using Wi-Fi instead of mobile data in weak signal areas.

rows.Title: camera cut out option not working properly
rows.Problem: camera cut out option not working properly when show camera cut out is selected, same issue with Auto and Hide camera cutout
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera cut out feature does not work properly when the show camera cut out option is selected, and the issue persists with Auto and Hide settings.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera cut out feature is completely non-functional across multiple settings, preventing users from controlling camera visibility during idle states, which is a core functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by a crash in the camera session handler; countermeasure suggests testing in other apps and providing new logs for deeper analysis.

rows.Title: People face category not created in Gallery
rows.Problem: In the Gallery application, when searching, no people faces are shown, and all photos of that face are not displayed
rows.Summarized Problem: The Gallery application does not display people faces in the search section, even though photos of those faces should be shown separately.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of the face recognition feature in the Gallery app, where content is missing but the core functionality is not fully broken.
rows.R&D Comment: FaceService operates as a background service and requires device to be idle with screen off and nearly fully charged; taking regular photos after OS update and temporarily disabling Battery Protect may help initiate face analysis.

rows.Title: screen will not come on after closing and unfolding
rows.Problem: After the One UI 7.0 update, the phone's screen will not come on after closing and unfolding. The outer screen also doesn't work. The phone is on and receives notifications, but after 2-3 minutes it turns on on its own. Every time the screen is unfolded, it remains blank. Now the phone must be used unfolded.
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone's screen fails to turn on when the device is folded, remaining blank upon unfolding, despite the phone being powered and receiving notifications.
rows.Severity Reason: The screen failure prevents normal use of the device during folding and unfolding, making it unusable in typical usage scenarios.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Video quality drops to 480p
rows.Problem: The request clip is attached below
rows.Summarized Problem: YouTube video playback drops to 480p resolution due to hardware codec limitations on the Exynos 1380 chipset.
rows.Severity Reason: The device cannot decode 4K 60fps videos due to chipset limitations, resulting in a complete failure to play higher resolutions, forcing a fallback to 480p which significantly degrades user experience.
rows.R&D Comment: The Exynos 1380 chipset only supports up to 4K at 30fps; when attempting to decode 4K 60fps content, the codec fails, and YouTube application falls back to 480p. The error handling is application-level, and the issue is rooted in hardware capability mismatch.

rows.Title: Now bar not showing on lock screen
rows.Problem: Now bar is not showing on lock screen despite all settings being turned on
rows.Summarized Problem: The Now bar is not displaying on the lock screen despite all settings being enabled.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is not working under normal conditions but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Call Background not working
rows.Problem: CX faces call background issue; kindly check video and listen to call recording properly for issue i am facing
rows.Summarized Problem: The call background feature is not functioning properly on the device.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of the call background feature, which affects user experience but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Fast charging doesn't working
rows.Problem: Fast charging doesn't working, only normal charging working. Using different Samsung charger with fast charging support also doesn't work
rows.Summarized Problem: Fast charging is not functioning and does not work with different Samsung chargers that support fast charging.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to perform fast charging, which is a core functionality, and this issue persists across different chargers, rendering the device unusable for fast charging use cases.
rows.R&D Comment: Charging scenario logs were not captured; faulty charging port or charger may be causing slow charging. Please visit service center for hardware inspection.

rows.Title: 2nd sim card not working
rows.Problem: After software update, second sim card is not working. Both sim cards were previously working fine. Please check if sim is in slot; using a different mobile works.
rows.Summarized Problem: Second SIM card is not working after a software update, while the first SIM and other devices work normally.
rows.Severity Reason: The second SIM card fails to function after a software update, which renders a key network feature inoperable, making the device unusable for dual SIM users.
rows.R&D Comment: Physical device not detected during MIPi scan; identified as a hardware issue specific to this device.

rows.Title: unable to take screenshots using the control panel
rows.Problem: After installing the recent software update, I am no longer able to take screenshots using the control panel. When I attempt to do so, a pop-up message appears stating: "Please allow Accessibility Service permission to use Screenshot." I have already contacted the customer support team and followed multiple troubleshooting steps they suggested in the settings. Unfortunately, the issue remains unresolved.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot take screenshots via the Quick Panel after a software update due to an Accessibility Service permission request.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents screenshot functionality but does not cause device crash or data loss; users can still use other methods to take screenshots.
rows.R&D Comment: The Quick Panel screenshot feature requires Accessibility permission, which is a known requirement for third-party screen capture services; no change needed, but user guidance should be improved.

rows.Title: Netflix not working on Lock Screen
rows.Problem: Netflix app showing L3 video quality instead of L1 on device, despite device having security level 1. App prevents requesting L1 security level until reinstalled after reboot.
rows.Summarized Problem: Netflix app incorrectly displays L3 video quality and prevents requesting L1 security level until reinstalled after a reboot.
rows.Severity Reason: The app prevents proper security level usage, leading to inconsistent video quality and device-level security misconfiguration, which affects core functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Root cause: Fallback security level not captured in logs; app sets property preventing L1 requests after detecting L3. Countermeasure: Terminal reboot and reinstalling Netflix app or clearing app data/caches.

rows.Title: Device overheating
rows.Problem: Device is overheating extremely, unable to turn on and use phone
rows.Summarized Problem: The device is overheating severely, preventing it from turning on and being used.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is unable to turn on and use, indicating a critical failure that renders the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Battery's temperature is not stable, suspicious thermistor damage; recommended CS testing.

rows.Title: Frequent FPS Drop in Real Racing 3 game
rows.Problem: Frequent FPS Drop in Real Racing 3 game when playing with Game Optimization at Balanced and Battery Saver settings, despite previous performance with 60FPS in similar conditions.
rows.Summarized Problem: Real Racing 3 experiences frequent frame drops during gameplay, especially during scene transitions, leading to inconsistent frame rates.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes intermittent performance degradation but does not result in game crash or complete failure, only affecting visual smoothness during transitions.
rows.R&D Comment: Frame drops occur during scene transitions due to tight CPU/GPU resource management for battery conservation; fix will be applied in next update version.

rows.Title: Blur portrait feature missing in gallery tool
rows.Problem: Photo editing tools missing blur portrait feature after 7.0 update; image editing and saving results in noise
rows.Summarized Problem: Blur portrait feature is missing in the photo editing tools after the 7.0 update, leading to image noise when saving edited photos.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing post-update, causing degraded image quality during editing, but the device remains usable and core functions are intact.
rows.R&D Comment: From One UI 7.0, only 6 PBE effects are provided. Please keep the current status. Thanks.

rows.Title: Fast charging no longer works
rows.Problem: Fast charging and USB connectivity issues have developed after updating to One UI 7. Charging is inconsistent, and USB file transfer and PC detection are completely broken. The phone worked perfectly before the update, and the issue persists across different chargers and cables.
rows.Summarized Problem: Fast charging and USB connectivity are no longer working after the One UI 7 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to perform basic charging and data transfer functions, rendering it unusable for core operations.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue is likely due to a software misconfiguration in the charging protocol; recommend testing with alternate cables and fast chargers to confirm and validate behavior.

rows.Title: Wrong time display on quick panel
rows.Problem: Time in notification panel is behind and the actual time is ahead; correct time not shown
rows.Summarized Problem: The time displayed in the notification panel is incorrect and lagging behind the actual time.
rows.Severity Reason: The time display is inaccurate, leading to user confusion and potential misjudgment of real-time events.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Camera quality has become so poor
rows.Problem: The camera quality has become so poor
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera image quality has significantly degraded after an OS update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a noticeable drop in image quality, which affects user experience but does not cause device failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue appears to be caused by manual settings like EV and Spot Weight, and users may need to adjust these settings to restore default performance.

rows.Title: Automatic brightness not working properly
rows.Problem: Automatic brightness not working properly. It is good at outdoor but dims in bright indoor light and I can't see things on phone
rows.Summarized Problem: The automatic brightness feature fails in bright indoor environments, causing the screen to dim and making it difficult to see content on the phone.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature fails in normal use conditions (bright indoor light), leading to impaired visibility and usability of the device.
rows.R&D Comment: The terminal temperature rose above 40°C, and the maximum brightness was limited for thermal control. This is normal operation based on the thermal control concept and does not indicate any unusual issues.

rows.Title: Now bar sports isn’t working
rows.Problem: Now bar for sports isn’t working. I have turned on the notifications of Google but there is no option like live notifications.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Now Bar for sports is not functioning and lacks live notifications option.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely non-functional and lacks a key notification option, making it unusable for users.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Unable to play 2160p videos
rows.Problem: When playing 2160p videos, the device automatically switches back to 480p within 2-3 seconds and does not allow any higher resolution options. The system shows 'Not enough resource to record' when attempting screen recording, indicating a resource limitation.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device fails to play 2160p videos and automatically drops to 480p resolution after a brief delay, preventing users from viewing higher-quality content.
rows.Severity Reason: The device crashes or fails to support a core function (high-resolution video playback), rendering content unusable and causing a significant user experience failure.
rows.R&D Comment: The Exynos 1380 chipset only supports 4K at 30 fps; playing 4K 60 fps videos causes codec errors. YouTube application incorrectly limits resolution options after the error, and the error handling is application-level. 4K at 30 fps plays fine, indicating a specific resolution and frame rate incompatibility.

rows.Title: Frame drop observed while taking video
rows.Problem: Camera video quality is lower than expected, showing 480p instead of 60fps FHD, though picture quality is acceptable
rows.Summarized Problem: Video recording experiences frame drops and low resolution, showing only 48
rows.Severity Reason: Video frame drops and degraded resolution significantly impact user experience during recording, making content unusable for high-quality use cases.
rows.R&D Comment: Root cause: Camera damaged; Countermeasure: Restart device and check auxiliary camera; if issue persists, provide initialization log and consider camera replacement

rows.Title: Wi-Fi sharing and power saving mode not available under Mobile hotspot
rows.Problem: Wi-Fi sharing and power saving options are unavailable on the device, while they are available on another phone
rows.Summarized Problem: Wi-Fi sharing and power saving mode options are missing in the Mobile Hotspot settings on the device.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing on the device but available on another model, indicating a partial malfunction in the settings interface.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Navigation Bar overlaps with screen content
rows.Problem: I can't close advertising window while watching movies due to navigation bar Close sign 'X' hide behind navigation bar. Please check and suggest
rows.Summarized Problem: The navigation bar overlaps with screen content, causing the close button of an advertising window to be hidden and preventing users from closing it.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from closing an advertising window during movie playback, which directly interferes with core device functionality and user experience.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by navigation bar settings (goodlock navstar) and can be mitigated by disabling those settings.

rows.Title: Mobile data and wifi symbols not displayed on Quick panel
rows.Problem: Mobile data and wifi is on but not displaying in notification panel and the back button and keyboard lags a lot of times after the software update
rows.Summarized Problem: Mobile data and Wi-Fi symbols are not displayed in the notification panel, and the back button and keyboard experience frequent lag after a software update.
rows.Severity Reason: The lack of symbols in the notification panel and persistent lag affect core device usability and responsiveness, making the interface unreliable.
rows.R&D Comment: The Wi-Fi and data icons are visible in the latest binary, indicating a rendering issue; countermeasure confirms visibility in binary but does not address the UI display problem.

rows.Title: Dark mode not applied to Now Bar
rows.Problem: Now bar stopped showing in dark mode after UI 7 update; previously worked for 1-2 days
rows.Summarized Problem: The Now Bar is no longer displaying in dark mode after a UI 7 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects functionality after an update but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Automatically turn off and restarts when play some video or music at 40% battery or below
rows.Problem: My a34 automatically turn off and restarts when play some video or music at 40% battery or below of it
rows.Summarized Problem: The device automatically turns off and restarts when playing video or music at 40% battery or below.
rows.Severity Reason: The device shuts down and restarts during media playback at low battery levels, which renders the device unusable during playback and poses a risk of data loss or user disruption.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Hearing enhancements sound setting not work properly
rows.Problem: Left/right sound balance is incorrect when phone is in middle position, resulting in high tune and low voice; clear sound at edges but not stereo. Issue occurs with wired earphones, not Bluetooth. Sound balance works correctly when mono audio is enabled, even at low volume.
rows.Summarized Problem: The sound balance setting on the phone is not working correctly with wired earphones, resulting in inconsistent audio output and lack of stereo sound.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes inconsistent audio output but does not render the device unusable or result in data loss or crash.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is likely due to the earphone's internal DAC; further investigation needed

rows.Title: After trimming a video and saving as a copy, exits from the media folder
rows.Problem: While editing a camera video, many times after trimming and saving a video as a copy, the app exits from the media folder. This also happens with image editing.
rows.Summarized Problem: The gallery app exits unexpectedly after trimming and saving a video or during image editing.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes during video editing, causing users to lose their work and exit the media folder, making the feature unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Network registration error
rows.Problem: Device not registered on network frequently
rows.Summarized Problem: The device frequently fails to register on the network.
rows.Severity Reason: Network registration failure prevents the device from connecting to the network, making it unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Poor PRX chain and high RX imbalance. Countermeasure: Same as cause.

rows.Title: WhatsApp old photos reappear in recent capture app
rows.Problem: Photos and videos that were deleted repeatedly reappear in the gallery section of the device, suggesting a bug in the gallery app or photo sync functionality.
rows.Summarized Problem: Deleted WhatsApp photos and videos reappear in the gallery due to backup or sync issues.
rows.Severity Reason: Photos reappear after deletion, indicating a partial malfunction in photo management, but the device remains usable.
rows.R&D Comment: Photos reappear due to backup or sync services; users should check Google Photos or Samsung Cloud settings to prevent restoration.

rows.Title: Image become darker after remastering
rows.Problem: Images are getting black after remastering, not just one image but every image
rows.Summarized Problem: Images turn black after remastering process across all photos.
rows.Severity Reason: All images become black, rendering the photo editing function completely unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Theme Park app not working
rows.Problem: App is continuously showing and not working after UI7 update
rows.Summarized Problem: The Theme Park app is not working after the UI7 update due to incompatibility with the new V OS.
rows.Severity Reason: The app is completely non-functional after the update, preventing users from using it at all.
rows.R&D Comment: The app is incompatible with V OS due to SO file incompatibility; users must download the latest version from the store.

rows.Title: Network issue
rows.Problem: Phone does not show network in notification bar even after mobile data is enabled in tool bar, though the tool bar indicates data is on, and internet access is not possible.
rows.Summarized Problem: Mobile data is not properly displayed in the notification bar, and internet access is not possible despite the tool bar indicating data is on.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to show network status and cannot access the internet, rendering basic functionality unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Unable to fetch SMS service centre number
rows.Problem: I am unable to configure SMS service centre number. It is disabled by default. Check in "Messaging - Settings - Advanced - SMSC" - it's showing not available.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot configure the SMS service centre number as it is disabled by default in the messaging settings.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue is a configuration limitation, not a functional failure or device malfunction, and does not impact core device usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Wifi not working
rows.Problem: Wifi is not working at all. Tried resetting network settings and clearing cache files, but it didn't work. The wifi is not turning on.
rows.Summarized Problem: The WiFi function is not turning on and is completely non-functional despite attempts to reset network settings and clear cache.
rows.Severity Reason: The WiFi function is completely non-functional, preventing basic connectivity, which renders the device unusable for internet access.
rows.R&D Comment: There is a FW crash in the WiFi service; full ramdump is needed to debug further.

rows.Title: Fingerprint data removed from device
rows.Problem: Fingerprint sensor not working since this morning. After selecting to erase fingerprint data, saved fingerprints were deleted and no option to add them back. Device states fingerprint data is corrupted and no way to restore it.
rows.Summarized Problem: Fingerprint sensor fails to recognize fingerprints after a data erase operation, with no option to restore saved fingerprints.
rows.Severity Reason: Device cannot restore saved fingerprints after an erase operation, rendering biometric authentication completely unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Failed communication between AP and fingerprint sensor; hardware issue suspected. Recommend reboot and service center inspection if issue persists.

rows.Title: Device switching off automatically after one ui security patch update
rows.Problem: Phone becoming an oven. Lagging, switching off automatically after the one ui security patch update. Fix it asap.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device switches off automatically and becomes laggy after a UI security patch update, indicating a potential battery or system instability issue.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is switching off unexpectedly and becoming unresponsive, which renders it unusable and poses a risk of data loss or hardware damage.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by UFS link layer errors, likely due to hardware defects such as ball cracks in the board interface; the countermeasure recommends hardware inspection at a service center.

rows.Title: Contacts application shows updating contacts and apps close
rows.Problem: After system UI upgrade, opening Contacts shows 'updating contacts' and apps close. Call logs and dialer are not visible. Opening other apps like WhatsApp or Settings causes auto-closure and return to home screen.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Contacts app shows 'updating contacts' and crashes, causing other apps to close unexpectedly after a system UI upgrade.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes and closes unexpectedly, preventing users from accessing core functionalities like calls and dialer, making the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Large database during upgrade triggers long onUpgrade operation exceeding 10-second timeout, causing provider failure. Countermeasure: Move upgrade operation to background runtime; clear local contacts data to recover, with re-sync to Samsung/Google contacts.

rows.Title: YouTube app limits playback to 1080p
rows.Problem: YouTube app only allows up to 1080p playback even for videos that support higher resolutions like 1440p or 2160p
rows.Summarized Problem: The YouTube app restricts video playback to 1080p despite device support for higher resolutions such as 1440p and 2160p.
rows.Severity Reason: Users cannot access higher resolution content, which is a core functionality of video playback, leading to degraded user experience and potential loss of content quality.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Taskbar option not working
rows.Problem: My tablet taskbar option is on but it is not working. Past 2 days I have do everything that I can. Now what to do sir.
rows.Summarized Problem: The taskbar option is visible but not functional on the tablet.
rows.Severity Reason: The taskbar, a core interface element, is not working, preventing user interaction with basic settings.
rows.R&D Comment: We have improved the taskbar code to fix this type of problem. Kindly help to update to latest ONEUI7.0 Market released binary.

rows.Title: Corrupt image showing in gallery
rows.Problem: Some images in gallery appear grey and are corrupt. The issue occurs randomly.
rows.Summarized Problem: Images in the gallery appear grey and corrupted, occurring randomly.
rows.Severity Reason: Corrupt images prevent users from viewing content properly, leading to a degraded user experience and potential data integrity issues.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Camera flickers while taking photos and videos
rows.Problem: Camera flickers while taking photos and videos
rows.Sub-Module: Flicker during photo and video capture
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera flickers when taking photos and videos.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera flickering during photo and video capture prevents reliable image capture, making the function unusable in practical use cases.
rows.R&D Comment: If the problem occurs all the time, please check camera module in service center.

rows.Title: Unable to connect wifi and hotspot
rows.Problem: After updating to One UI 7, unable to connect to wifi and hotspot. Issue persists after multiple restarts and factory reset. No such issue on previous software version.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot connect to Wi-Fi or hotspot after updating to One UI 7, with the issue recurring despite restarts and factory reset.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to turn on Wi-Fi at boot, resulting in complete inability to connect to networks, making the device unusable for basic internet access.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Device fails to start Wi-Fi vendor HAL at boot. Countermeasure: Recommend user to check hardware Wi-Fi chipset and visit service center if issue persists after reboot.

rows.Title: Not able to type I and 8
rows.Problem: User can barely type 'I' and cannot type 'Eight' (numerical)
rows.Summarized Problem: Users are unable to type the letters 'I' and the number '8' on the Samsung keyboard.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects typing functionality but does not completely prevent device use or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: This issue is not reproducing at our end; users are advised to check in the next OS version and provide logs if the issue recurs.

rows.Title: Battery protection icon visible when not plugged in
rows.Problem: The battery protection icon is showing even though the phone is not plugged in
rows.Summarized Problem: The battery protection icon displays incorrectly when the phone is not plugged in.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects UI visibility but does not cause device malfunction or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Sluggish during multitasking
rows.Problem: Phone lags severely during multitasking, basic apps are unresponsive, and memory issues prevent background app usage despite 4GB RAM. Device shows low memory warnings even with extended memory, and uploading files to websites fails.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences severe lag during multitasking and background app usage, despite having 4GB of RAM, leading to unresponsiveness and failed file uploads.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is unresponsive during basic operations and multitasking, making it unusable for everyday tasks, which constitutes a major functional failure.
rows.R&D Comment: System is experiencing high CPU and memory pressure; memory reclamation is causing instability during multitasking.

rows.Title: text size auto changed in App
rows.Problem: The app automatically changes its text size after being closed and restarted, returning to original or set size
rows.Summarized Problem: The app automatically resets its text size after being closed and restarted.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes inconsistent text display but does not prevent app functionality or cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Widgets not updating
rows.Problem: Widgets are not updating after UI 7 update. Previously supported features like background blur and preview are now shown during widget editing, but the widgets fail to update. Examples include Samsung Health and Samsung Weather Forecast.
rows.Summarized Problem: Widgets are not updating after a UI 7 update, and previously supported features like background blur and preview are incorrectly shown during editing.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents core functionality (widget updates) from working, making key apps like Samsung Health and Weather unresponsive.
rows.R&D Comment: The analysis from provided logs is insufficient; issue does not occur in OS 15, suggesting it is a compatibility or update regression issue. Recommend updating to latest OS version.

rows.Title: Phone still restarting and freezing up
rows.Problem: Phone still restarting and freezing up even after updating the software. Lots of important documents were lost during backup. The latest UI has lots of glitches.
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone repeatedly restarts and freezes after software update, leading to data loss and UI glitches.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is constantly restarting and freezing, making it unusable, and causing data loss, which are critical issues affecting core functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: UFS link layer errors indicate a hardware-level issue at the AP-UFS interface; recommend hardware inspection and customer service center evaluation.

rows.Title: Widget showing blank on lock screen
rows.Problem: The time widget on lock screen is sometimes not visible, showing blank. It becomes visible after going into the application or after unlocking and locking the screen again
rows.Summarized Problem: The time widget on the lock screen occasionally displays blank and only becomes visible after interacting with the app or after unlocking and locking the screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes intermittent failure of a core display element on the lock screen, but does not prevent device usage or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Bluetooth and Wifi turns off automatically
rows.Problem: Bluetooth and WiFi automatically turn off and then turn on immediately when the phone is placed on charge, occurring two to three times.
rows.Summarized Problem: Bluetooth and WiFi periodically turn off and on automatically when the phone is charging.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes intermittent connectivity problems but does not prevent device usage or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Airplane mode may be turning on during charging; customer needs to provide silent logs to confirm the root cause.

rows.Title: Battery drain
rows.Problem: Phone is draining quickly after update to one ui 7.0 and charging slow. Using a 25w PPS charger, it takes nearly 2.5 hours to charge from 0% to 100%.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device is draining battery quickly and charging slowly after updating to one UI 7.0, with charging taking nearly 2.5 hours from 0% to 100%.
rows.Severity Reason: The slow charging and rapid battery drain indicate a major performance issue that affects core device functionality and usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Slow charging is caused by overheating due to background app activity, which triggers safety protection reducing current to prevent battery temperature rise; customers should be guided that the delay is due to overheating protection.

rows.Title: Cursor appears before 0 in input field
rows.Problem: The cursor (blinking input indicator) is placed before the zero in the Samsung Calculator app input field instead of after it, leading to incorrect typing experience where entering '482' results in '4820'.
rows.Summarized Problem: The cursor appears before the zero in the calculator input field, causing incorrect typing behavior.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a partial malfunction in user input flow, leading to incorrect number entry but does not result in device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Timing issue causes firmware to return wrong cursor position on first open. Countermeasure: Fixed in version 12.4.00.13; release planned and verified via QA store.

rows.Title: Gyroscope and Touch Control Delay in BGMI
rows.Problem: Noticeable delays in gyroscope response and touch controls while playing Battlegrounds Mobile India (BGMI), causing laggy gameplay, especially during aiming and fast movements. Issue persists even with background apps closed, performance mode enabled, and graphics set to smooth extreme.
rows.Summarized Problem: Players experience laggy gyroscope and touch controls during gameplay in BGMI, affecting aiming and responsiveness.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue directly impacts core gameplay functionality, leading to poor user experience and potential loss of control during critical moments.
rows.R&D Comment: Gyroscope fluctuation over 15dps may indicate a real or fake issue; users need to perform a self-test and share results to verify the problem.

rows.Title: Music player not working properly while playing games
rows.Problem: Music player not opening correctly while playing game
rows.Summarized Problem: The music player fails to open correctly when a game is being played.
rows.Severity Reason: The music player does not function during gameplay, but it does not completely fail or cause device crash or data loss, indicating a partial malfunction.
rows.R&D Comment: As discussed with QA member, please share which music player customer is using. This is not Samsung music.

rows.Title: Unable to open One Drive via manage storage
rows.Problem: Unable to open One Drive or Google Drive from manage storage option; shows blank screen. In my files, both lagging first then loading.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot open One Drive or Google Drive from the manage storage option, showing a blank screen, and experience lag in the 'My Files' section.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from accessing essential cloud storage features, resulting in a complete failure of the manage storage function.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: 5G not working
rows.Problem: 5G is not working
rows.Summarized Problem: 5G connectivity is not functioning.
rows.Severity Reason: The device cannot connect to 5G networks, which is a major functionality failure preventing core mobile network usage.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Mic mode option not showing in quick panel
rows.Problem: Mic mode option is not showing in quick panel when switching into voice focus mood
rows.Summarized Problem: The mic mode option does not appear in the quick panel when switching to voice focus mood.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing during a specific user action, preventing intended functionality but does not cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Heating observed in the device
rows.Problem: Heating occurs when using camera, especially in high environmental temperatures or direct sunlight
rows.Summarized Problem: The device overheats when using the camera, particularly in high environmental temperatures or direct sunlight.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction under specific conditions, not complete device failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Overheating during camera use is due to environmental thermal exposure, not device operation; countermeasure is environmental awareness and thermal design improvement.

rows.Title: Glitch in app tray
rows.Problem: Bug in recent app button after update
rows.Summarized Problem: The recent apps button is malfunctioning after the latest software update.
rows.Severity Reason: The recent apps feature is partially non-functional, affecting user experience but not rendering the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Stuttering observed while typing
rows.Problem: Since the UI7 update, the device has started stuttering. Typing in contact search shows delayed characters, scrolling in WhatsApp chat has massive stutters, and searches in WhatsApp have up to 15-second delays before results appear.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences significant stutters during typing and app interactions, especially in contact search and WhatsApp, with delays up to 15 seconds in result loading.
rows.Severity Reason: The stuttering affects core user interactions like typing and searching, leading to a degraded and unstable user experience, making the device feel unresponsive and unusable in critical tasks.
rows.R&D Comment: Device instability due to insufficient uptime in logs; requires at least 5 minutes of stable log coverage to properly diagnose the root cause.

rows.Title: Android Auto not working
rows.Problem: Android Auto does not work, Bluetooth music works fine
rows.Summarized Problem: Android Auto is not functioning properly while Bluetooth music works normally.
rows.Severity Reason: Android Auto fails to work, but other features like Bluetooth music operate normally, indicating a partial malfunction.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Whatsapp screen is not working properly
rows.Problem: Whatsapp video call starting time screen showing a side part line type view in a straight way. Then when the full screen video seeing the other side person he is also seeing the same types video bit rest screen are okay. Screenshot of the problem attached here. Kindly tell me is it software related issue or hardware? Im using latest version of system.
rows.Summarized Problem: During WhatsApp video calls, the screen shows a distorted line-type view on the start screen, and the other party sees the same issue, while the rest of the screen functions normally.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects the core video call functionality and causes visible distortion during active calls, impairing user experience and communication.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by a display rendering bug in WhatsApp; countermeasure involves reviewing known PLMs for similar speaker path and display issues to validate and fix the root cause.

rows.Title: Content doesn't hide when in recent tab
rows.Problem: Named security folder as "key" shows original name in recent apps and content is visible through the screen without hiding
rows.Summarized Problem: Content in a secure folder is visible in the recent apps tab instead of being hidden.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of the secure folder feature, allowing content visibility in recent apps, but does not render the device unusable or result in data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Search option doesn't show the options
rows.Problem: I can't search for anything that I need or don't know how to navigate to, just because this searching is not working.
rows.Summarized Problem: The search function in settings does not display available options.
rows.Severity Reason: Users cannot search for anything, making navigation impossible and rendering the device unusable for basic tasks.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is likely caused by a missing index during language change; a reset of the search index via language toggle is a temporary fix.

rows.Title: Screen goes automatically blank while watching videos
rows.Problem: Screen automatically goes blank while watching videos due to proximity sensor issue, even when the 'do not turn screen off while watching' function is enabled.
rows.Summarized Problem: The screen automatically goes blank during video playback due to a faulty proximity sensor.
rows.Severity Reason: The screen going blank during video playback renders the device unusable for content viewing, which is a critical user experience failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Mis-detection of face presence by the proximity sensor due to environmental factors; accurate analysis requires stored visual data, which is not available during operation.

rows.Title: Unable to login to Samsung cloud
rows.Problem: Samsung cloud notification for login keeps appearing and the screen gets stuck, preventing progress and causing annoyance
rows.Summarized Problem: Users are unable to proceed past a login screen in Samsung Cloud due to a persistent notification that keeps popping up.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a partial malfunction of the login flow, preventing user progression but does not result in device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by a permission problem between Samsung and Microsoft accounts; users can resolve it by reconnecting their accounts.

rows.Title: Device keeps switching from 5G to 4G
rows.Problem: My Samsung Galaxy M35 keeps switching from 5G to 4
rows.Summarized Problem: The Samsung Galaxy M35 repeatedly switches from 5G to 4G despite being set to '5G only', unlike other models.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to maintain 5G connectivity consistently, affecting network performance, but does not result in complete device failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Contact sharing suggestions disable option not available in setting
rows.Problem: Contact sharing suggestions disable option not available in setting
rows.Summarized Problem: The option to disable contact sharing suggestions is missing in the settings.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing from the settings, preventing users from disabling contact sharing suggestions, which is a partial malfunction of the functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: The contact sharing suggestions disable option has been moved to GoodLock App -> HomeUp -> Share Manager since OS 15 version; users are directed to that location for use.

rows.Title: Device over heat while play game
rows.Problem: Phone starts to over heat and becomes hot and hard to hold after playing the game smash karts for 10 minutes, even though the game is very light at around 100 mb. The phone feels slightly warm during daily usage as well.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device overheats during gameplay and feels warm during daily use, especially when running light games like smash karts.
rows.Severity Reason: The device overheats significantly during normal use, leading to discomfort and potential safety concerns due to high temperature rise.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by high CPU usage and data transfer from the game, and the countermeasure is to escalate to the app owner for investigation as it is a 3rd party app issue.

rows.Title: Bluetooth pairing request by unknown source repeat again

rows.Summarized Problem: Bluetooth pairing requests from unknown sources appear repeatedly and immediately after cancellation, causing user irritation.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a recurring pop-up that persists even after cancellation, interfering with user experience but does not cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by nearby devices in pairing mode triggering pop-ups; users should switch off the interfering device as a countermeasure.

rows.Title: Captured image is showing blur distorted while uploading on instagra and social media
rows.Problem: Facing issue while uploading photos in instagram and social media when capture through camera showing blur pixel distort but when upload photos from screenshot folder it doesn't showing any issue please check as mention attachments
rows.Summarized Problem: Photos captured through the camera show blur and pixel distortion when uploaded to Instagram and social media, but do not show the issue when uploaded from the screenshot folder.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects image quality during upload but only when captured via camera, not when using screenshots, indicating a partial malfunction of the camera upload process.
rows.R&D Comment: This line artifact is usually happening when resizing large image to small one. This resizing logic is Instagram's policy. But to reproduce this issue, we need to get original image that showing image quality degradation. Please contact user and get the original image.

rows.Title: Notification Panel not working properly

rows.Title: System sound not working after security patch update
rows.Problem: System sound is not working after the security patch update. Previously, at full volume, keyboard tapping and screen locking were loud and clear, but now it seems only at 30% volume. Using an earpiece makes sound loud again, indicating the issue is with the speaker.

rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects sound functionality but does not cause device freeze, crash, or data loss; sound is partially functional when using external devices.

rows.Title: Device is lagging and sound is breaking

rows.Title: Camera not capturing detailed images

rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects photo quality during motion but does not prevent functionality or cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The patchy details in photos during motion are caused by side effects of multiframe merging technology under indoor lighting; the issue has been mitigated by optimizing merging strength during object movement.

It is totally counter productive to the whole concept of now bar itself, major bug I'll say.

rows.Title: Issue observed in device uptime
rows.Problem: The phone's uptime is reported as 250 hours, which corresponds to about 10.4 days. User reports using the device for only 3 to 4 hours per day, suggesting the device may not have been rebooted in over a week.

rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a misinterpretation of uptime as a system performance metric, but does not cause device malfunction or crash—only a potential misunderstanding of the feature behavior.
rows.R&D Comment: Uptime is the time since last reboot; the reported value is consistent with a long period without reboot. Customer should verify if device has been rebooted in over 10 days.
