rows.Title: Battery drain
rows.Problem: Battery is draining quickly despite following all recommended troubleshooting steps including battery optimization, turning off Bluetooth and Wi-Fi, reducing brightness, closing background apps, disabling auto-sync, and updating apps. High data usage from apps like Brave Browser, Hotstar, Instagram, and Google Photos is observed.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device battery drains quickly due to high app usage and data consumption, even after user has followed all recommended troubleshooting steps.
rows.Severity Reason: The battery drain is caused by high data usage from specific apps, indicating a partial malfunction rather than a device-level crash or failure.
rows.R&D Comment: User's real app usage and data consumption are the primary cause of battery drain; no device-side abnormality detected.

rows.Title: Audio bar not working properly
rows.Problem: The audio display incorrectly indicates the end of the audio when playback starts, while the media appears to be playing. The issue occurs intermittently and is not consistent across all instances.
rows.Summarized Problem: The audio bar incorrectly shows the end of playback when media is actually playing, causing confusion and inconsistency in the user interface.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes inconsistent display behavior during playback but does not prevent device operation or cause a crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Check logs for anomalies in audiocore; verify if the issue occurs with other media playback apps; recommend updating software and app versions.

rows.Title: Lift to wake up not working during the call
rows.Problem: Lift to wake up not working during the call
rows.Summarized Problem: The lift to wake feature does not work during phone calls.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature fails during a critical usage scenario (call), but does not cause device crash or data loss, and is not fully broken—only partially malfunctioning.
rows.R&D Comment: PickUpController ignores Lift to Wake event during call. It is by concept. Please maintain current status

rows.Title: Status bar icon shifts
rows.Problem: Taskbar icons on the right keep shifting when unlocking the phone
rows.Summarized Problem: The status bar icons on the right shift when the phone is unlocked.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes inconsistent behavior during phone unlock but does not render the device unusable or result in data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Require CP silent logs for further investigation.

rows.Title: Battery drain
rows.Problem: Battery drain issue not resolved even after following provided steps
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences significant battery drain even after following the provided troubleshooting steps.
rows.Severity Reason: Battery drain causes device to shut down unexpectedly, leading to loss of usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Require CP silent logs to investigate root cause and validate the issue.

rows.Title: Sound issue while setting ringtone
rows.Problem: Sound goes off while playing media, though ringtones play normally. YouTube video sounds are off.
rows.Summarized Problem: Media playback sounds are off while ringtones play normally, indicating a sound output issue during media playback.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to play audio during media playback, which is a major functional failure affecting core usability.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue occurs when the device incorrectly detects a 3.5mm earphone insertion; hardware defect (earjack, PBA) analysis is required.

rows.Title: Display yellowish tint
rows.Problem: Screen shows yellowish color, affecting image display and causing eye strain. Issue previously resolved with update, but has returned.
rows.Summarized Problem: The display shows an inconsistent yellowish tint, especially in images, causing visual discomfort.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects image color accuracy and causes eye strain, but does not render the device unusable or cause system crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: EOL Model: Please check and share HW side analysis if issue persists continuously

rows.Title: Apps not aligned in recent bar
rows.Problem: Apps are misaligned and shifted towards bottom left in recent bar; issue occurs intermittently and resolves after restart.
rows.Summarized Problem: Apps in the recent bar are misaligned and shifted to the bottom left, causing a visual glitch that intermittently occurs and resolves after a restart.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of the recent bar interface but does not prevent device usage or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Battery drain
rows.Problem: Battery drains constantly without usage, even with minimal device activity. Already tried reducing brightness, closing background apps, and software updates, but issue persists.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device battery drains rapidly even when not in use, despite minimal activity and basic troubleshooting.
rows.Severity Reason: The battery drains continuously without usage, which renders the device unusable without frequent charging and poses a risk of sudden shutdown.
rows.R&D Comment: Battery situation is not good and very old; recommend customer replace a new one at CS center

rows.Title: Camera quality degraded
rows.Problem: Every time I open Instagram, the camera turns blurry. This happens permanently and every time I use the app.
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera appears blurry when opened in Instagram, indicating a consistent quality degradation.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue occurs permanently and affects core functionality during app usage, making the camera unusable in a key application.
rows.R&D Comment: Resolution-related quality degradation observed; however, no blur detected in HD testing, suggesting inconsistency in real-world conditions or app-specific rendering.

rows.Title: Unable to unlock or reset Secure folder
rows.Problem: Secure Folder remains locked despite correct Samsung account login. It displays 'Settings locked' and does not allow reset or access. User has tried clearing data, updating apps, and re-adding the Samsung account.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot unlock or reset the Secure Folder despite being signed in with the correct Samsung account.
rows.Severity Reason: The Secure Folder is completely inaccessible, preventing users from accessing protected settings, which renders a core device feature unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Failed unlock attempts (15) indicate a security lockout mechanism; user must capture logs to diagnose root cause and prevent future lockouts.

rows.Title: Unable to use bluetooth while calling
rows.Problem: i am not able to use Bluetooth while taking calls
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot use Bluetooth during phone calls.
rows.Severity Reason: Bluetooth functionality is completely disabled during calls, preventing a core feature of device usage.
rows.R&D Comment: There is no call-related logs in dumpstate; user did not capture logs properly. Recommend providing CP silent logs for future issues.

rows.Title: Fingerprint sensor issue
rows.Problem: Biometrics service not showing in Developer Options, fingerprint option shows white screen or 'Sensor isn't responding' error after Android 15 update
rows.Summarized Problem: Fingerprint sensor fails to respond after Android 15 update, showing white screen or 'Sensor isn't responding' error despite passing diagnostic tests.
rows.Severity Reason: The fingerprint function is completely non-responsive, preventing user from unlocking the device, which is a core usability feature.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Failed communication between AP and fingerprint sensor, indicating a hardware issue. Countermeasure: Recommend service center inspection of fingerprint sensor hardware.

rows.Title: Issue observed in Plato app while creating a new game
rows.Problem: The Plato app’s "Create New Game" button does not work after the system update on Galaxy A33. The screen flickers without opening the popup when tapped, specifically outside the Secure Folder. The feature works fine inside the Secure Folder. It appears the system is blocking a popup or overlay.
rows.Summarized Problem: The "Create New Game" button in the Plato app fails to function outside the Secure Folder after a system update, with the screen flickering instead of opening the popup.
rows.Severity Reason: The button is completely non-functional outside the Secure Folder, preventing users from creating games, which is a core feature of the app and renders the functionality unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: The app receives touch events but shows no action, indicating a system-level blocking of overlays; no logs from the time of occurrence are available for analysis.

rows.Title: 5G not working properly
rows.Problem: 5G is gone again after latest update
rows.Summarized Problem: 5G connectivity is no longer functioning after the latest software update.
rows.Severity Reason: The device loses a major network function, rendering 5G connectivity unavailable, which is essential for core mobile operations.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Unable to make SIM call while on WhatsApp call
rows.Problem: After updating to One UI 7, unable to make a regular SIM call while on a WhatsApp call. When trying to make a SIM call and place WhatsApp call on hold, the SIM call fails with message: "Can't call from a personal app Your organisation only allows you to make calls from work apps". This issue did not occur before the update.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot make a SIM call while on a WhatsApp call, resulting in a failure message about personal app calling restrictions.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from making basic calls during active conversations and blocks functionality of a core communication feature.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Dolby Atmos not functional with bluetooth
rows.Problem: Dolby Atmos is not functional on bluetooth audio devices which support surround sound
rows.Summarized Problem: Dolby Atmos does not function properly on Bluetooth audio devices that support surround sound.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction where Dolby Atmos is not working on Bluetooth devices, but the system logs indicate proper setup and no underlying binary issues, suggesting a perceptual or conditional failure rather than a complete system crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Dolby Atmos is set properly and functioning in logs; the perceived lack of effect may be content-specific, and users are advised to report logs after reproducing the issue.

rows.Title: Youtube lags on playing video at 4k60p
rows.Problem: When I play 4k60 video on youtube its lagging
rows.Summarized Problem: YouTube lags when playing 4K60p videos, which was not present before the UI 7 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The lagging during 4K60p video playback significantly impacts user experience and makes video viewing unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is not related to DRM or Widevine; it originates in the app-side video decoding, and further investigation is needed to identify the root cause.

rows.Title: Registration for RCS/Chat Settings in Samsung Messages fails
rows.Problem: Registration for RCS/Chat Settings in Samsung Messages fails after updating to One UI 7 and resetting the phone. Device receives 401 error from server, preventing autoconfig retry for 12 hours.
rows.Summarized Problem: RCS/Chat Settings registration fails in Samsung Messages after an OS update due to a 401 error from the server.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from using RCS functionality, which is a core communication feature, and results in a complete failure of chat service registration.
rows.R&D Comment: Server-side 401 error prevents autoconfig retry; issue should be addressed on server side.

rows.Title: Camera cutout issue
rows.Problem: Efootball full screen issue started after OneUi 7 update
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera cutout appears during gameplay in Efootball, causing a full-screen issue.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects gameplay display but does not cause device crash or data loss, and is triggered by a software update.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: camera recording in green when using 2x zoom
rows.Problem: using camera in 2x zoom results in greenish recording, need solution or replacement
rows.Summarized Problem: Camera records with a greenish tint when using 2x zoom.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a visible color distortion during zoom but does not render the device unusable or cause a crash.
rows.R&D Comment: When adjusting the zoom, a greenish tint is suspected to be caused by a change in sensor mode. For an accurate analysis, a wide camera module is required, but analysis is difficult as the customer has one. Please visit the nearest service center to replace the wide camera module.

rows.Title: Phone launcher keeps crashing and phone gets locked frequently
rows.Problem: Phone launcher keeps crashing and phone gets locked frequently. I have tried clearing individual app cache/data, tried clearing cache partition of the phone via recovery mode and also tried factory reset of the phone and reconfigured the phone again. I see that issue is still persistent and its impacting my usage of the phone. Please do the needful.
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone launcher crashes frequently and causes the device to lock unexpectedly, even after clearing cache and performing a factory reset.
rows.Severity Reason: The launcher crashes and causes the device to lock, making the phone unusable during normal operation.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Circle to Search shows half black screen while scroll
rows.Problem: The Circle to Search feature on my S24 Ultra shows results initially but turns black or glitches when scrolling, hiding results completely. This has persisted despite clearing cache, updating apps, rebooting, and factory resetting.
rows.Summarized Problem: Scrolling in the Circle to Search feature causes a half-black screen glitch that hides search results.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes complete loss of search results during scrolling, making the feature unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue has been reported to Google and is being monitored via issue #428861366.

rows.Title: Searching contacts and clicking on the required contact highlights another
rows.Problem: Searching contacts and clicking on the required contact highlights another contact
rows.Summarized Problem: When searching contacts and clicking on a contact, another contact is highlighted instead of the selected one.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes incorrect selection behavior during contact search, leading to a partial malfunction in the user interface.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Blurry white noise in 10x zoom camera
rows.Problem: Picture is blurry in 10x zoom camera despite clear lens
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera produces blurry images at 10x zoom, even with a clean lens.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects image clarity during zoom but does not cause device crash or complete failure.
rows.R&D Comment: The haze appears to be caused by flare in the outdoor environment. If the issue persists after cleaning the lens, a hardware inspection is required.

rows.Title: Hotspot disconnects frequently
rows.Problem: Phone frequently disconnects laptop from hotspot despite hotspot being on, with no set timer or restrictions, issue persists even after software update and has become more frequent.
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone frequently disconnects a laptop from the hotspot despite the hotspot being enabled, with no user-set timer or restrictions, and the issue has worsened after software updates.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to maintain a stable connection, rendering the hotspot function unusable for consistent internet sharing.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Device is over heating and battery is draining too fast
rows.Problem: Device is over heating and battery is draining too fast. When I use for 2-5 minutes display starts to heat and battery drops 1% in 2-5 minutes of usage. No background activity running. Diagnosed in Samsung member app. Everything clear. In safe mode, 5 minutes of usage causes 3% battery drop. Heating and battery draining occur even without social apps usage.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device overheats and experiences rapid battery drain during normal usage, even with no background apps running.
rows.Severity Reason: The device overheats and drains battery rapidly during usage, which can lead to performance degradation, potential hardware damage, or device failure.
rows.R&D Comment: HEating and battery analysis have been previously documented in comments #C00003 and #C00004.

rows.Title: Camera not working
rows.Problem: Camera not working after factory reset
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera function is not working after a factory reset.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera is a core functionality that is completely non-operational after a factory reset, making the device unusable for basic tasks.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Not able to use circle to search
rows.Problem: Not able to use circle to search on my device. Though notification from google pop''s up that my phone now support circle to search.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot use the circle search feature despite Google notifications indicating support.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is partially functional as users see notifications but cannot perform the search action.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue raised to Google via https://partnerissuetracker.corp.google.com/issues/428861366; status to be maintained.

rows.Title: Auto pilot engaged screen appear while charging
rows.Problem: When charging the mobile, text appears on the screen. This only happens during charging and may be related to screen settings.
rows.Summarized Problem: A text message appears on the screen during charging, likely due to an incorrect screen saver setting.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a visual anomaly during charging but does not affect device usability or core functions.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by a screen saver set to 'Android game'; users should change it to 'None' to resolve.

rows.Title: Distorted display during multi-tasking window resize
rows.Problem: The screen shows a static display whenever resizing multi-tasking windows, and occasionally when launching apps. This issue started after the One UI 7.0 update. Screen recording fails to capture the glitch, so a separate phone was used to record the issue.
rows.Summarized Problem: The display distorts and shows a static image when resizing multi-tasking windows, affecting usability during app switching.
rows.Severity Reason: The distortion prevents proper visual feedback during multi-tasking, making it difficult to interact with apps and leading to a device that appears non-functional in core UI operations.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Battleground app pop-up view screen broken; DpAsyncBlitStream does not support compress format. Countermeasure: MTK request to merge patch (742b209.diff.zip) and add safeguard for incompatible compression and pixel format combinations to ensure system stability and correct rendering.

rows.Title: Sharpness and colors not good from rear camera
rows.Problem: After One UI 7 update, rear camera shows poor sharpness and color accuracy, especially in dark environments with gray-free surfaces, due to noise and AWB algorithm distortion.
rows.Summarized Problem: The rear camera exhibits poor sharpness and color distortion in dark environments, particularly on gray-free surfaces, due to noise and AWB algorithm inaccuracies.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects image quality in specific conditions but does not cause device crash or complete failure, and is not a major functional failure.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is due to noise and AWB algorithm distortion in dark environments; no change in image quality from OS upgrade, and the phenomenon is known in cameras.

rows.Title: Widget visibility is not good in light mode
rows.Problem: The weather widget is not visible in standard mode and appears unclear when a light wallpaper is applied, though it is visible in dark mode.
rows.Summarized Problem: The weather widget is not visible in light mode due to poor contrast between text and background.
rows.Severity Reason: The widget fails to display clearly in standard mode with light wallpapers, affecting usability but does not cause device failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue stems from font color mapping based on wallpaper background, and a font color setting has been added in BOS to address visibility.

rows.Title: Sound in recorded videos is very bad
rows.Problem: Voice in recorded videos is strange and sometimes there is no voice at all. Background noise is coming strangely. After resetting and clearing app data, camera quality deteriorated and camera started lagging.
rows.Summarized Problem: Audio in recorded videos is distorted and sometimes completely absent, with strange background noise.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue results in complete loss of voice in videos, making content unusable and affecting core functionality of video recording.
rows.R&D Comment: Please reproduce again, collect a new dumpstate logs, and attach the recorded clip and accompanying video so we can see how you reproduce this issue first hand.

rows.Title: Modes & Routines keep stopping error
rows.Problem: Error in routines
rows.Summarized Problem: Modes and routines keep stopping unexpectedly.
rows.Severity Reason: The routine functionality is failing, causing the device to lose critical operational features.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue not reproducible with latest routine 4.9.0.77 version; please update to oneUI 8.0

rows.Title: Different Font Color Display
rows.Problem: Font color inconsistent across app and home screens, making it difficult to read and navigate
rows.Summarized Problem: Inconsistent font color across app and home screens makes content difficult to read and navigate.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects readability in multiple screens but does not cause device crash or complete failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Prime Video not playing screen is black audio is playing
rows.Problem: In amazon prime video is not playing screen is black audio is playing
rows.Summarized Problem: Prime Video fails to display video content while audio continues to play.
rows.Severity Reason: The screen remains black while audio plays, indicating a failure in video rendering that prevents content from being viewed, making the app unusable for its primary function.
rows.R&D Comment: This issue belongs to 3rd party application. It should be checked and fixed by 3rd as we don't have source code and no commercial contract with the app owner.

rows.Title: Android Auto not working
rows.Problem: Android Auto not working
rows.Summarized Problem: Android Auto is not functioning properly.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely non-functional, preventing users from using Android Auto, which is a core functionality for device connectivity and usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Android Auto app is disabled in settings. Countermeasure: Users should disable the Android Auto app in settings to resolve the issue.

rows.Title: Highlighting Not Visible in Exported PDF
rows.Problem: When a note is highlighted in Samsung Notes and exported as a PDF, the highlighted sections are either not visible at all or appear so faint that they are unreadable in most PDF viewers.
rows.Summarized Problem: Highlights are not visible or appear too faint when exporting notes from Samsung Notes to PDF.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from seeing highlighted content in exported PDFs, making the output unreadable and unusable for note review.
rows.R&D Comment: The PDF export functionality converts all note content into a single image, failing to preserve highlight opacity, resulting in invisible highlights.

rows.Title: Unable to download the app in device
rows.Problem: I am unable to download the app, I have tried all the tips showing in the feedback but it is not working
rows.Summarized Problem: Users are unable to download apps from the Google Play Store, despite trying various troubleshooting steps.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from installing apps, which is a core functionality for device usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Play consents failed to retrieve for a specific account due to sync errors; users need to re-enter credentials or clear cache and reset app settings.

rows.Title: Flickering lines appear while playing video in landscape mode
rows.Problem: Flickering lines appear when playing videos in landscape mode on apps like Netflix, JioHotstar, Crunchyroll, and Amazon Prime, but not on YouTube or VLC. The issue occurs consistently across these apps and started after updating to One UI 7. No lines appear in normal mode.
rows.Summarized Problem: Flickering lines appear during video playback in landscape mode on multiple apps, but not in normal mode or on other media players.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue occurs during video playback in a critical mode (landscape) and affects multiple apps, making media viewing unreliable and potentially leading to user frustration or device unusability.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Navigation bar is not visible
rows.Problem: Navigation bar is not visible after system update
rows.Summarized Problem: The navigation bar is not visible after a system update, causing user inconvenience.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue results in partial functionality failure as the navigation bar is missing but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue was caused by incorrect userId value being sent as '0' in device policy manager, and has been fixed with a rel request raised - 49637.

rows.Title: One UI Home isn’t responding
rows.Problem: The system crashes when trying to add apps to the Edge Panel with the message 'One UI Home isn’t responding'.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Edge Panel crashes when attempting to add apps, causing system unresponsiveness.
rows.Severity Reason: The system crashes during a core interaction (adding apps), making the feature unusable and disrupting user workflow.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue occurs because edge panel settings are accessible from Dex space.

rows.Title: Images are getting more saturated in the rear camera and are grainy in the front camera
rows.Problem: Images are getting more saturated in the rear camera and are grainy in the front camera
rows.Sub-Module: Rear Camera Saturation, Front Camera Graininess
rows.Summarized Problem: Rear camera images become overly saturated, especially in the background, while front camera images appear grainy, particularly during heat generation.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects image quality in specific conditions but does not cause device malfunction or data loss, and is intermittent due to heat-related processing limitations.
rows.R&D Comment: Saturation and graininess occur during heat generation due to disabled HDR post-processing for performance reasons; users should be guided to allow cooling before re-taking photos.

rows.Title: Battery drain issue
rows.Problem: Abnormal battery drain occurs on Galaxy Watch 7 when idle, from 21% to 0% in under an hour, despite AOD off, no third-party apps running, Bluetooth connected, and sleep tracking enabled. The issue is concerning given the device was not in use.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Galaxy Watch 7 experiences rapid battery drain when idle, dropping from 21% to 0% in under an hour despite no active usage or third-party apps.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes unusable within a short period after going idle, leading to complete power loss without user action.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by a third-party app (WhatsApp) running in the background and consuming power; Samsung has no control over its development or behavior.

rows.Title: S pen unexpectedly disconnects
rows.Problem: The S Pen unexpectedly disconnects when removed from the device and the device no longer recognizes it, even after reinserting. The issue persists and may be due to software or hardware fault.
rows.Summarized Problem: The S Pen unexpectedly disconnects when removed and fails to reconnect, even after reinsertion.
rows.Severity Reason: The device loses stylus input immediately upon removal, rendering the stylus function unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Camera flickers and image/video gets blurred when switching to 3x zoom
rows.Problem: When zooming from 1x to 2.9x, the image suddenly becomes clear after hitting 3x zoom. The camera vibrates and image or video becomes blurred. Zooming is not possible and occurs consistently.
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera image and video become blurred and the device vibrates when zooming past 2.9x, specifically at 3x, making it impossible to use the zoom function.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents effective use of the zoom function, leading to a complete inability to capture clear images or videos during zoom, which is a core camera functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue occurs under indoor flicker light conditions due to insufficient exposure time, causing flicker outside correction range; this is a known normal occurrence under such conditions.

rows.Title: UI issue in quick panel
rows.Problem: Notification cards are squeezed to a very compact size, causing the volume and display brightness bars to be too small
rows.Summarized Problem: Notification cards in the quick panel are too compact, making volume and brightness controls difficult to see and use.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visibility and usability of key controls but does not cause device malfunction or crash.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Network issue
rows.Problem: No 5G network despite being in a 5G area. 4G signal is weak with only 1 to 2 signal bars. Service provider confirms their side is fine. Troubleshooting steps including network reset have been tried with no improvement.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device fails to connect to 5G and has weak 4G signal, even when in a 5G coverage area, with no improvement after troubleshooting.
rows.Severity Reason: The device cannot establish 5G connectivity in a supported area, which is a major functional failure affecting core network operations.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Image quality is not good
rows.Problem: The ultra-wide lens image is blurry, and the main lens image is still quite bad in quality.
rows.Summarized Problem: The ultra-wide lens produces blurry images, and the main lens image quality is still poor.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects image clarity but does not cause device crash or complete failure, and is partially mitigated by considering subject distance.
rows.R&D Comment: The ultra-wide camera uses fixed focus (FF) design, which does not support autofocus, and image quality varies based on subject distance.

rows.Title: Unable to set ANC and 360 Audio via Routine
rows.Problem: Unable to set the Galaxy Buds2 Pro ANC and 360 Audio via Routine. Please see the screen recording video for details.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot set ANC and 360 Audio features through routines on Galaxy Buds2 Pro.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely unavailable via routine, preventing users from configuring key audio settings.
rows.R&D Comment: Fix NoiseControl state, 360 audio, BoostLoudness icon in RoutineActionProvider; fix setup Noise control in Routine

rows.Title: Lag observed while opening quick panel
rows.Problem: User can use some parts of the screen but cannot open control panel sometimes
rows.Summarized Problem: Users experience lag and intermittent failure when trying to open the quick panel.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction of a core interface function, preventing reliable access to controls under certain usage patterns.
rows.R&D Comment: The lag occurs due to multi-touch handling in OneUI, which was implemented to meet customer requests for touch intercept; the same mechanism causes instability when multiple touches are applied simultaneously.

rows.Title: Unable to play YouTube 4K videos in 60fps
rows.Problem: Unable to play YouTube 4K videos in 60fps. Videos automatically change to maximum 480p when trying to play 4K 60fps content.
rows.Summarized Problem: YouTube fails to play 4K 60fps videos and automatically downgrades to 480p resolution.
rows.Severity Reason: The device cannot handle 4K 60fps content due to hardware limitations, resulting in a complete failure of video playback functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: The Exynos 1380 chipset only supports 4K at 30fps; 4K 60fps videos cause codec errors, and YouTube application incorrectly limits resolution to 480p. Error handling is application-level, not hardware-based.

rows.Title: Connected Hotspot shows no internet
rows.Problem: When other users use my hotspot, it shows no internet on their mobile devices, though I have sufficient speed and mobile data. All settings are visible but not applied. Internet returns after restarting the mobile device.
rows.Summarized Problem: Hotspot fails to provide internet to connected devices, despite having sufficient data and speed, and settings appear but are not applied.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes intermittent connectivity failure for users, but the device remains functional and internet returns after a restart.
rows.R&D Comment: Request customer to attach logs from the client device showing no internet connectivity.

rows.Title: Closing notification shows processing popup
rows.Problem: Closing notification shows processing popup and cannot open any app while swiping notification panel
rows.Summarized Problem: Closing a notification triggers a processing popup that prevents opening apps and interacting with the notification panel.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents user from opening apps and interacting with the notification panel, making the device unusable during this state.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Lag in Smart Things App
rows.Problem: Device Management option in SmartThings app no longer opens when tapped, though it still appears in the menu.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Device Management feature in the SmartThings app no longer opens when tapped, despite still appearing in the menu.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature does not function properly but still appears, resulting in partial malfunction of device management functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Weak 5G network issue
rows.Problem: Facing weak 5G network issue since purchase. Already tried all troubleshooting and Samsung Remote Management Service, still issue persists. Screenshot shows 4G logo while switching to 5G.
rows.Summarized Problem: Device shows 4G instead of 5G despite attempting to switch, indicating a persistent weak 5G network connection.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to properly establish or maintain a 5G connection, which is a core network functionality, leading to degraded performance and potential service disruption.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Call gets disconnected automatically while being on another call
rows.Problem: Call disconnection issue while busy on another call
rows.Summarized Problem: A call gets disconnected automatically when the user is already on another call.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a major function (call continuity) to fail during active usage, leading to device usability disruption.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Wireless Android Auto keeps disconnecting
rows.Problem: Wireless Android Auto repeatedly disconnects on Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 5 with Tata Safari 2022, while wired connection and Google Pixel work fine. User has tried all standard troubleshooting steps.
rows.Summarized Problem: Wireless Android Auto disconnects repeatedly on Samsung Galaxy Z Fold 5, despite working with wired connection and other devices.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents consistent use of Android Auto, making it unreliable for real-time navigation and communication.
rows.R&D Comment: The android_auto_mode routine modifies WiFi settings; users can adjust this routine to prevent unwanted behavior.

rows.Title: My Files keeps auto closing
rows.Problem: The My Files Application keeps closing again and again making it impossible to access any documents. I have cleared the cache and have updated the app to the latest version but the issue persists.
rows.Summarized Problem: The My Files app repeatedly closes, preventing users from accessing their documents despite cache clearing and app update.
rows.Severity Reason: The app repeatedly crashes, making it unusable and preventing access to essential documents.
rows.R&D Comment: Added exception handling for non-hierarchical URI; users should clear download_uri data by renaming the Downloads folder and restoring it.

rows.Title: Unable to log in to Samsung Max VPN
rows.Problem: Unable to log in to Samsung Max VPN it shows the error: "Check your internet connection" even though internet is working for other apps
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot log in to Samsung Max VPN despite having a working internet connection.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a specific connectivity failure in the VPN service, preventing access but not causing device-wide crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Instagram content doesn't display
rows.Problem: Instagram content is not showing even though the Hide Content toggle is off, despite reinstalling the app
rows.Summarized Problem: Instagram content is not displaying in the secure folder despite the Hide Content toggle being off.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of content visibility in a secure folder, not complete device failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Voice input not working
rows.Problem: Mic not showing even though it is turned on, voice to text conversion fails
rows.Summarized Problem: Voice input fails to activate despite the microphone being turned on, preventing voice-to-text conversion.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is partially malfunctioning as voice input does not activate, but users can still access it via navigation bar button after manual configuration.
rows.R&D Comment: User must manually enable keyboard button on navigation bar and press and hold to select voice input; no underlying software defect detected.

rows.Title: Lag observed in the device
rows.Problem: Device hangs during high performance tasks
rows.Summarized Problem: The device hangs during high performance tasks, causing significant lag.
rows.Severity Reason: The device hangs during high performance tasks, making it unusable for performance-intensive operations.
rows.R&D Comment: Device hangs due to preload class creation; request for silent logs to investigate root cause.

rows.Title: rapid battery drain
rows.Problem: The Samsung S24 Plus exhibits a rapid battery drain, decreasing from 10% to 1% in a short timeframe, resulting in significantly reduced battery lifespan. This behavior appears to be a technical anomaly, potentially addressable through a software update. A video shows the device dropping from 6% to 1% in one minute and thirty seconds, indicating concerning battery performance.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences rapid battery drain, dropping from 10% to 1% in a short period, leading to significantly reduced battery life.
rows.Severity Reason: The battery drains extremely quickly under normal use, causing device unavailability and a major functional failure.
rows.R&D Comment: When heavy load occurs in low voltage state, voltage drops to Vempty level, causing rapid SOC decline; if SOC drops rapidly without usage, users should visit service center for battery inspection.

rows.Title: Noise control didn't get changed
rows.Problem: Galaxy Buds FE noise cancellation doesn't change during calls, even when touch control is disabled. Touch control toggles automatically on and off during calls, but noise control remains unchanged. Cache clearing did not resolve the issue.
rows.Summarized Problem: Noise cancellation mode fails to activate during calls on Galaxy Buds FE despite correct configuration and touch control settings.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature partially malfunctions during calls, affecting user experience but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: VoLTE not working
rows.Problem: VoLTE and WiFi calling options are not available despite enabling IMS TS32 Profile in Developer Options. Phone Info shows VoLTE, Video Calling, and WiFi Calling provisioned as HIDE. Airtel confirms IMS provisioning has been pushed.
rows.Summarized Problem: VoLTE is not functioning on the device despite proper IMS provisioning and enabling of IMS TS32 Profile in Developer Options.
rows.Severity Reason: VoLTE is a core network function; its failure prevents voice calls over 4G, rendering the device unusable for basic communication.
rows.R&D Comment: Provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Device loses network when NR is selected
rows.Problem: Device loses all network when NR Only (5G Only Mode) is selected, showing "No Service" immediately. Even though 5G appears briefly in 5G Preferred mode, the device cannot stay connected to 5G in NR Only mode.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device loses all network connection when NR Only (5G Only Mode) is selected, failing to maintain 5G connectivity.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes completely unable to connect to any network in NR Only mode, rendering it unusable for calls or data.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Voice recorder not working properly
rows.Problem: The voice recorder is not working; it only works when connected to earphones and does not record what is spoken.
rows.Summarized Problem: The voice recorder fails to record audio when not connected to earphones, and does not function properly under normal usage.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature partially malfunctions under certain conditions, but does not completely fail or cause device instability.
rows.R&D Comment: Customer should be guided to perform self-test; silent logs should be provided for further analysis.

rows.Title: Camera failed pop up occurred
rows.Problem: Video for camera error
rows.Summarized Problem: Camera sensor fails to read identity and does not function properly during video capture.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera sensor fails to detect its identity (expected ID 0x754 vs read 0x0), causing a failure in initialization and preventing video capture, rendering the camera function unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Camera sensor imx754 (ID 0x754) fails to initialize due to incorrect ID reading; hardware replacement recommended.

rows.Title: Lag in camera
rows.Problem: Video attached showing lag in camera
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera exhibits lag during operation.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction of the camera function, causing lag but not complete failure or device freeze.
rows.R&D Comment: From attached logs, only an actuator error is observed; no other issues found. Recommendation: Reboot device and capture logs upon reproduction.

rows.Title: Files folder is crashing
rows.Problem: The Download section of my files folder is crashing for a long time with no changes made
rows.Summarized Problem: The download section of the files folder is crashing repeatedly without any user-initiated changes.
rows.Severity Reason: The download section crashes repeatedly, making the files folder unusable and preventing access to downloaded content.
rows.R&D Comment: Added exception handling for non-hierarchical URI; users should rename and restore the Downloads folder to clear corrupted download_uri data.

rows.Title: Telegram not updating
rows.Problem: Telegram profile pictures do not load, even after factory hard reset. Issue persists across networks (Jio to Airtel).
rows.Summarized Problem: Telegram profile pictures fail to load despite factory reset and network changes.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects a core feature (profile picture loading) but does not cause device crash or complete failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Unable to uninstall some apps
rows.Problem: Cannot uninstall apps
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot uninstall certain apps, impacting system performance and control.
rows.Severity Reason: Users are unable to remove apps, which is a core system function and affects usability of the device.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: WhatsApp images, documents, and videos folder not showing in gallery
rows.Problem: WhatsApp images, documents, and videos folder is not showing in gallery. User cannot find WhatsApp media despite facing this issue for many days.
rows.Summarized Problem: WhatsApp images, documents, and videos folder is not visible in the gallery, making it difficult for users to locate and access their media.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from accessing their media, but the functionality of the device remains usable and the problem is not complete failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Check Media Visibility Settings: Ensure Include Videos and Auto Backup are enabled in WhatsApp; verify gallery settings include WhatsApp media.

rows.Title: Samsung Wallet not working
rows.Problem: Samsung Wallet not working on device and unwanted background activities running continuously, no option to disable or restrict battery usage, performance degraded due to background services.
rows.Summarized Problem: Samsung Wallet is not functioning on the device and several background services run continuously without user control, degrading performance.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves multiple background services running without user control, leading to performance degradation and device usability concerns.
rows.R&D Comment: Samsung Wallet logs are not present in the dumpstate; recommend customer download wallet from Galaxy Store and share logs if issue persists.

rows.Title: Screen recorder missing from quick panel
rows.Problem: The built-in screen recorder feature is missing from the Galaxy A23 with One UI 6.1 and Android 14. It is not visible in the Quick Panel or in Settings > Advanced features.
rows.Summarized Problem: The screen recorder feature is missing from the Quick Panel and Settings > Advanced features on the Galaxy A23.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is not accessible in key UI locations, affecting user ability to record screen, but does not cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Error changing clock style on lock screen
rows.Problem: Lock screen error when changing clock style
rows.Summarized Problem: Users encounter an error when trying to change the clock style on the lock screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The error prevents full customization of the lock screen but does not cause device malfunction or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Bixby is not working
rows.Problem: Bixby is not working
rows.Summarized Problem: Bixby voice functionality is not working on the device.
rows.Severity Reason: The Bixby feature is completely non-functional, preventing users from using a core voice assistant, which is essential for device usability.
rows.R&D Comment: A Wakeup Register Error occurred, but no related logs were found in the attached file. Please try registering again from scratch and report the issue immediately after it occurs, with the proper logs included.

rows.Title: Device asking for password after restart when pin set
rows.Problem: Device asks for password after restart despite having a pin set; user cannot unlock without losing data or personal information
rows.Summarized Problem: The device asks for a password after restart when a PIN is already set, preventing user from unlocking the device without losing personal data.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is unable to unlock, which makes it unusable, and users risk losing personal data or being unable to access their device.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Mobile data not working
rows.Problem: All settings have been tried but problem not solved
rows.Summarized Problem: Mobile data is not working despite all settings being tried.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a persistent failure of a core network function, but the device remains usable and settings are fully configured.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Whatsapp image video section not showing in gallery
rows.Problem: After the new update in gallery no whatsapp sections is showing a bug need to be fix
rows.Summarized Problem: WhatsApp image and video sections are not visible in the gallery after the update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visibility of specific content in the gallery but does not cause device crash or complete failure of functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: One drive files not showing in my files
rows.Problem: The OneDrive files are not showing in My Files. I have checked there is no connectivity or login issue. The OneDrive application on the phone is working fine and shows all the files. Never faced this issue earlier.
rows.Summarized Problem: OneDrive files are not visible in the My Files section despite proper connectivity and app functionality.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction where files are missing from a specific view, but the underlying app and connectivity are confirmed to be working.
rows.R&D Comment: Fix to sync logic to update folders and files list. - August App update.

rows.Title: Unable to turn on mobile hotspot
rows.Problem: mobile hotspot not working when turned on; it instantly turns off in 5GHz band only
rows.Summarized Problem: The mobile hotspot turns off instantly when turned on in the 5GHz band.
rows.Severity Reason: The hotspot fails to remain active after activation, causing complete loss of connectivity functionality in a key feature.
rows.R&D Comment: Hostapd service starts but WiFi bus is in suspend state, indicating a driver-level issue during hotspot activation.

rows.Title: Mobile data not working
rows.Problem: Mobile data is not working despite correct settings; device has relied on Wi-Fi for three months.
rows.Summarized Problem: Mobile data is not functioning despite correct settings, forcing reliance on Wi-Fi.
rows.Severity Reason: The device cannot connect to mobile data, making internet access impossible without Wi-Fi, rendering the device unusable for core functions.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause and countermeasure both point to the need for CP silent logs for diagnosis.

rows.Title: Different date is showing in the picture
rows.Problem: The Gallery app fails to sort images and videos by their metadata dates. Photos taken on 09th July 2025 are displayed under today's date (16th July 2025). This issue persists after clearing cache, wiping cache partition, and restarting the device. It affects multiple images and videos.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Gallery app incorrectly displays images with metadata dates as today's date instead of their actual capture date.
rows.Severity Reason: The app fails to properly read or sort image metadata, leading to incorrect date display which compromises user trust and usability of the gallery function.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Camera failed
rows.Problem: The camera failed after official software update. Previously both sides of the camera did not work, but now only one side works in third party apps, not in Samsung camera app.
rows.Summarized Problem: After a software update, only one side of the rear camera works in third-party apps, but not in the Samsung Camera app.
rows.Severity Reason: The rear camera function is partially non-functional in the primary app, making it unusable for core photography tasks, and indicates a critical hardware-software interaction failure.
rows.R&D Comment: I2C error detected in logs suggests rear camera hardware fault; recommend reboot and hardware inspection if issue persists.

rows.Title: Need to on/off aeroplane mode to use mobile data
rows.Problem: UI bug preventing proper network setting; device requires airplane mode on/off to access internet after switching from Wi-Fi, despite resets and SIM changes
rows.Summarized Problem: Users must toggle airplane mode multiple times to access mobile data after switching from Wi-Fi, indicating a UI or network configuration bug.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents reliable access to mobile data, making internet usage inconsistent and unreliable, rendering the device unusable in data-dependent scenarios.
rows.R&D Comment: Provide CP silent logs to investigate the root cause of the UI failure in network setting transitions.

rows.Title: Whatsapp icon aligned incorrectly on home screen
rows.Problem: WhatsApp icon is misaligned on the home screen, occurring intermittently every 3 to 4 days, affecting user experience
rows.Summarized Problem: The WhatsApp app icon is misaligned on the home screen, causing visual inconsistency and intermittent occurrence.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes intermittent visual misalignment but does not prevent device usage or cause system crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Phone randomly freeze
rows.Problem: The phone randomly freezes and no buttons or gestures are functional on any screen, even on the notification panel or recent apps screen. The only way to resolve it is by force restarting.
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone randomly freezes completely, making all interactions unresponsive until a force restart is performed.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes completely unresponsive, preventing any user interaction, which renders the phone unusable until restarted.
rows.R&D Comment: FATAL exception in Google Play Store app due to unsupported offset; Google needs to investigate as sources are encrypted.

rows.Title: Bixby Basic Commands Installation Issue
rows.Problem: Bixby prompts users to install Basic Commands for simple tasks like playing music, but the installation option redirects to Samsung website with no download or install option available
rows.Summarized Problem: Bixby fails to install basic commands due to missing download option on Samsung website.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is partially functional as it prompts installation, but users cannot complete the setup, resulting in a partial failure of Bixby functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Not able to login to Samsung Wallet
rows.Problem: Unable to login to Samsung Wallet for the last week. No solution from Samsung support. Unable to determine if issue is server-side or app blocked.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot log in to Samsung Wallet after one week, with no resolution from support and uncertainty about whether the issue is server or app-related.
rows.Severity Reason: Login failure prevents access to a core feature, rendering the application unusable for users.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Navigation bar overlaps or gets cropped in apps
rows.Problem: Navigation bar overlaps or gets cropped in apps like Google Pay and SBI
rows.Summarized Problem: The navigation bar overlaps or gets cropped in certain apps, affecting user interface visibility.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial UI malfunction in specific apps, impacting usability but not rendering the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Unable to View OneDrive Files in My Files App
rows.Problem: Unable to view OneDrive files or folders in the My Files app after signing in.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot view their OneDrive files or folders in the My Files app after signing in.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents access to files but does not cause device crash or data loss, and files remain accessible via other methods.
rows.R&D Comment: Fix to sync logic to update folders and files list. - August App update.

rows.Title: Edited videos not supporting in Samsung gallery
rows.Problem: Edited videos are not supported in Samsung Gallery after update; videos edited in Kinemaster or other apps show 'video not supported, video codec not supported' when downloaded, even though previously they played normally.
rows.Summarized Problem: Edited videos are not supported in Samsung Gallery after the update, showing 'video not supported, video codec not supported' error.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from viewing their edited videos, rendering a core functionality of the My Files module unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: The platform (Exynos 1330) has a hardware limitation of 1920x1080@150; videos with higher resolution (3840x2160@60) exceed this limit and are not supported, leading to playback errors.

rows.Title: Can't View One Drive Folders Or Can't Sync, Add New Folders In One Drive In Samsung My Files App
rows.Problem: Can't view One Drive folders or can't sync, add new folders in One Drive in Samsung My Files app
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot view, sync, or add new folders in One Drive within the Samsung My Files app.
rows.Severity Reason: Users are unable to access or manage One Drive content, which is a core functionality for file management and productivity.
rows.R&D Comment: Fix to sync logic to update folders and files list. - August App update.

rows.Title: Palm gesture screenshot not working
rows.Problem: Unable to take screenshot using palm gesture as it is not working properly after latest UI update
rows.Summarized Problem: Palm gesture for taking screenshots is not working after the latest UI update.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is not functioning properly but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: No swipe detected in logs; user must swipe from left to right for correct behavior. Missing timestamp logs prevent root cause analysis.

rows.Title: Delay observe while switching Front& Back Camera
rows.Problem: Switching between front and back camera takes a lot of time on Galaxy S23. User has cleared camera app data, updated to latest software, not using third-party apps, and performed factory reset with no improvement.
rows.Summarized Problem: Switching between front and back cameras on Galaxy S23 is significantly delayed despite clearing app data, updating software, and performing a factory reset.
rows.Severity Reason: The delay prevents smooth camera switching, which is a core functionality, and persists after multiple troubleshooting steps, making it unusable in practice.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Camera Freeze while open pro video mode and click on mic options
rows.Problem: After one UI 7.0 update, the camera application freezes when opening pro video mode and clicking on mic options, showing a warning 'camera application has been stopped'. The issue occurs intermittently and persists after resets; it returns after about 5 minutes.
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera application freezes when entering pro video mode and clicking on mic options, showing a 'stopped' warning, and the issue recurs after a short period despite resets.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera application crashes during core functionality, rendering the feature unusable and causing device instability.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Clock Alignment on Lock Screen
rows.Problem: Lock screen clock is misaligned
rows.Summarized Problem: The clock on the lock screen is misaligned.
rows.Severity Reason: The clock is misaligned, which affects usability but does not prevent device operation or cause crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Camera app crashes when 5G is enabled
rows.Problem: Camera app crashes when 5G is enabled on Galaxy S23 Ultra, showing error message 'Camera server error occurred'. Works fine on 4G.
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera app crashes when 5G is enabled, showing a 'Camera server error occurred' message, and functions correctly on 4G.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera app crashes completely when 5G is enabled, rendering the feature unusable in a key use case.
rows.R&D Comment: Defect caused by hardware factor; requires AS center inspection to verify hardware issues.

rows.Title: Phone getting lag and doesn't work anything
rows.Problem: Phone suddenly gets lag and doesn't work properly, even after restart. The issue persists and phone gets stuck with some options working and others not.
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone experiences severe lag and unresponsiveness, with some functions working intermittently and others failing.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes unresponsive and unusable, preventing normal operation and requiring restarts, which indicates a critical system-level failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Hostapd has a null pointer exception; this issue is identical to P250714-07628 and requires follow-up with Samsung for resolution.

rows.Title: Camera is taking blurry pictures
rows.Problem: My camera is not taking normal pictures ... makes pictures blurry. Looking i am using the basic budget phone under 8k. See the shady pictures , blurred , not clear. I did already all these steps. Lens is clear , phone is updated . Still not clicking good pictures
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera is producing blurry and unclear pictures despite the lens being clean and the phone being updated.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera fails to produce clear images, but the issue does not render the device unusable or cause a complete failure of core functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: The blurriness is likely due to camera window dirt or oil; users should clean the window and check if the issue persists. If it does, condensation inside the camera window may be the cause, requiring a hardware replacement.

rows.Title: Unable to update google play services
rows.Problem: I am not able to update the google play services even though it is showing "failed to update ". Please fix this issue
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot update Google Play Services due to a failure during installation, indicated by verification errors.
rows.Severity Reason: The update failure prevents the device from accessing essential services, leading to potential loss of functionality and app access.
rows.R&D Comment: The error INSTALL_FAILED_VERIFICATION_FAILURE indicates a failure in creating the Apex Verity device during installation; countermeasure includes checking internet connection and storage space.

rows.Title: Rotate to landscape mode option is not working in portrait mode
rows.Problem: Landscape rotation has not working in my S24 ultra since last 2 month. Same reporter to the customer technician over Smart Tutor he was not aware how to fix this bug. Pfa video for ref. Secondly, the iOS screenshot and screen recording are far better quality they offer. Samsung need to learn from them Awaiting your response
rows.Summarized Problem: The option to rotate the screen to landscape mode is not working when in portrait mode.
rows.Severity Reason: The screen rotation feature is completely non-functional, preventing users from changing orientation, which is a core usability function.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Fingerprint unlock not recognizing
rows.Problem: Fingerprint unlocking not working despite successful registration; attempts to deregister and re-register fail
rows.Summarized Problem: The fingerprint unlock feature on the lock screen is not working after successful registration.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to unlock via fingerprint, making it unusable without alternative authentication methods.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Blur effect missing in YouTube navigation bar
rows.Problem: Blur effect on the bottom navigation bar in YouTube app is missing; previously had frosted-glass blur behind Home, Shorts, and Library buttons, now shows solid color with no transparency
rows.Summarized Problem: The blur effect on the YouTube app's navigation bar is missing, showing only a solid color instead of a frosted-glass transparent background.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visual appearance but does not prevent app functionality or cause device instability.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Voice assistant sound coming as robotic
rows.Problem: Voice assistant sound is very bad during voice search on YouTube, caller name announcements, and maps
rows.Summarized Problem: The voice assistant produces robotic and distorted sounds during various functions like YouTube voice search, caller name announcements, and maps.
rows.Severity Reason: The voice assistant is malfunctioning across multiple critical use cases, leading to a poor user experience and potential frustration during core device operations.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by improper functionality in the Google TTS app; no Samsung involvement in development, and root cause analysis is beyond current capabilities.

rows.Title: System UI crashing
rows.Problem: The system UI is still crashing despite previous reports.
rows.Summarized Problem: The system UI crashes intermittently, affecting device usability.
rows.Severity Reason: The UI crashes cause the device to become unusable, leading to a major functional failure.
rows.R&D Comment: UFS link layer errors indicate a hardware-level issue; recommend checking signal and power integrity on the AP and UFS interface.

rows.Title: Network issue
rows.Problem: Mobile data randomly drops on Galaxy M35 5G, network icon disappears, internet stops for a few seconds, then reconnects to 2G before switching back to 5G/4G
rows.Summarized Problem: Mobile data randomly drops and reconnects on Galaxy M35 5G, causing intermittent internet loss.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes intermittent loss of connectivity, affecting usability but not rendering the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Rotate to Landscape mode showing disable in device
rows.Problem: Unable to use landscape mode on home screen and app drawer; toggle for enabling landscape mode appears greyed out and unresponsive
rows.Summarized Problem: The screen rotation functionality is not working as the landscape mode toggle is greyed out and unresponsive.
rows.Severity Reason: The user cannot switch to landscape mode, which affects usability in certain app interactions, but the device remains otherwise functional.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Call connection delay after accepting incoming call
rows.Problem: Call does not connect or has no response after accepting an incoming call, occurring after recent system update
rows.Summarized Problem: After accepting an incoming call, the device fails to connect or shows no response, with a delay of 3 to 4 seconds.
rows.Severity Reason: The call fails to connect or shows no response after acceptance, making it unusable for users during communication.
rows.R&D Comment: Require CP silent logs to investigate root cause and validate issue.

rows.Title: Screen is Not showing properly in Portrait Mode
rows.Problem: Screen orientation issue: screen displays half when in portrait mode. Critical issue affecting usability; device unusable for daily use due to this defect.
rows.Summarized Problem: The screen displays only half of the content when in portrait mode, making the device unusable for daily use.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes unusable in portrait mode due to partial screen display, preventing normal operation.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: camera doesn't get open, it gets black and sometimes stuck on one object
rows.Problem: My camera doesn't get open, it gets black and sometimes stuck on one object even though the camera points on other object. The issue still persist even after performing above task
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera fails to open and displays a black screen, sometimes getting stuck on a single object despite pointing at others.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera fails to open and gets stuck, preventing basic functionality and rendering the device unusable for photography or video.
rows.R&D Comment: CSIS errors occurred during stream on of rear wide sensor. Please reach out to Samsung service center and ask for HW analysis. Analysis needs to be done on IMX906 sensor module also AP S5e8855.

rows.Title: Lag observed while playing YT video
rows.Problem: Phone pauses during video playback, gets heated, freezes, and stops responding to touches, eventually switching off after a period of inactivity
rows.Summarized Problem: Device freezes and stops responding during video playback, causing pauses and eventual shutdown.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes completely unresponsive during video playback, leading to loss of functionality and potential data loss or device shutdown.
rows.R&D Comment: Device reboots during playback; logs show no codec issues but input-output dumps are needed for further analysis. Issue not reproducible on Sherlock.

rows.Title: Brief option in lock screen is not showing
rows.Problem: The now brief option in lock screen is not showing up and it only shows when music is playing; otherwise, no content appears and all tips and notifications are blocked.
rows.Summarized Problem: The now brief option on the lock screen fails to display and only appears when music is playing, blocking all notifications and tips.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature fails to show under normal conditions and blocks all notifications and tips, rendering the lock screen functionally incomplete.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Video playback green screen and screen hang
rows.Problem: After updating to Android 15, UI 7, sometimes during video playback after 15 minutes, green screen appears, then screen pauses and mobile hangs, requiring restart.
rows.Summarized Problem: During video playback, a green screen appears, followed by screen pause and hang, requiring restart after update.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes unresponsive after video playback, causing a complete hang and requiring restart, making the device unusable during playback.
rows.R&D Comment: Root cause: potential memory leak due to reference counting or resource leaks during buffer handling. Solution: explicitly release buffer before freeing to prevent memory leaks or refcount mismatches. Verify CL#31882965 (main) and CL#31883115 (release).

rows.Title: Stop Watch still running even stopped clock app in active app section
rows.Problem: The stopwatch shows up in the now bar and continues running in the background even after the clock app is closed or stopped in the active app section. Closing the app in recents does not stop it.
rows.Summarized Problem: The stopwatch continues running in the background after the app is closed or stopped, even when the user attempts to stop it.
rows.Severity Reason: The stopwatch remains active in the background, preventing proper user control and indicating a malfunction of the app's stop functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Lag on swiping down notification Panel upon unlocking
rows.Problem: After updating to One UI 7 (Android 15), the phone experiences lag when waking up and unlocking, with the notification panel stuttering heavily right after unlock. Fingerprint and face unlock also freeze for 2–3 seconds. The Lift to Wake gesture works only about 50% of the time. These issues affect daily usability.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device exhibits significant lag and stuttering when unlocking and accessing the notification panel after wake-up.
rows.Severity Reason: The lag and freeze during unlock severely impact device usability, making it difficult to use the device for basic tasks.
rows.R&D Comment: The system is busy and operating under Android performance constraints; closing background apps can temporarily resolve the issue.

rows.Title: Pen not working properly
rows.Problem: Writing tools are useless; toggles don't turn on and one that is on doesn't work properly. Pointer assistant and pen nib also don't work well, making note-taking difficult for studying with exams in two months.
rows.Summarized Problem: The S Pen writing tools and associated features are not functioning properly, making note-taking difficult.
rows.Severity Reason: The pen is essential for primary use (note-taking) and fails to function, rendering the device unusable for core tasks.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: USB-C Earphones Not Working for Calls
rows.Problem: USB-C earphones do not work for calls; audio defaults to tablet speaker during calls, no USB audio or headset option is available, microphone also does not work for calls.
rows.Summarized Problem: USB-C earphones fail to function during calls, with no audio output option and microphone failure.
rows.Severity Reason: Call functionality is completely broken with no audio output or microphone input via USB-C, making voice communication impossible.
rows.R&D Comment: Call over USB headset is not supported; device only supports 3.5mm headset for calls.

rows.Title: Taskbar overlaps
rows.Problem: Taskbar stays stuck after exiting an app, overlays other elements, and does not respond to taps; touch input is registered by icons behind it. It should auto-hide or be interactive.

rows.Title: Optical Image Stabilization is no longer working

rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely non-functional after an update, preventing proper video stabilization during movement, which is a core camera functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue appears to be related to vertical movement exceeding correction margins; testing stabilization in general walking scenarios is needed to confirm the root cause.

rows.Title: apps not visible on app drawer

rows.R&D Comment: The missing app icons are likely due to app uninstalls and cleanup; users can manually clean up pages in the app drawer to resolve the issue.

rows.Title: faces not shown in search

rows.Summarized Problem: New photos are not being separated or processed during search due to potential database corruption from prolonged charging with screen off.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to process new photos, which are essential for normal gallery functionality, leading to a major usability failure.

rows.Title: Wi-Fi toggle not working

rows.Title: Gemini not working

rows.Title: Picture are a little bit sifted towards redish tint while captured in 2x

rows.Title: Object eraser is not working

rows.Title: Sim1 slot as Vodafone however it shows under sim2 when clicked Sim Manager issue
rows.Problem: The sim1 is actually inserted as vodafone and sim2 is jio under sim tray. Attached screenshots show different display. It needs to show sim1 as vodafone only and sim2 as jio. The problem occurs under about phone section and sim manager but not under phone diagnostic option. In my iphone i switched sim and it shows vodafone there in sim1, thinking sim1 is not recognized as vodafone and puts it to sim2.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device incorrectly displays SIM1 as Vodafone under SIM2 in the Sim Manager section, despite correct physical insertion, indicating a UI labeling or recognition issue.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes incorrect SIM labeling in the UI, affecting user understanding of which SIM is in which slot, but does not cause device crash or data loss or prevent core functionality.
rows.Resolve Type: Product Requirement, UX Guide, Standard Technical Specification
rows.R&D Comment: The UI guide specifies that 'SIM 1' is assigned to the first inserted SIM regardless of slot; the current behavior appears to align with this rule, suggesting the issue may be a display or labeling inconsistency rather than a functional failure.

Headset works fine on other devices. Issue started after latest update on Galaxy A15. Media audio is delayed every second during Google Meet.
