rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Closing all apps from recent bar launches weather widget
rows.Problem: When closing all apps from the recent apps screen in landscape mode, the phone misinterprets input and launches the weather widget, which is located below the close all button. This occurs when the action is performed quickly and is noticeable and annoying. The bug does not occur when the screen is rotated to landscape due to the repositioning of the weather widget.
rows.Summarized Problem: Closing all apps in landscape mode inadvertently triggers the weather widget instead of closing apps.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a misinterpretation of user input but does not result in device crash or data loss, and only affects a specific action in a specific mode.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue not reproducible in latest OS version; no ANR or crash found. Recommend checking in latest OS with fresh logs and video if issue persists.

rows.Title: Camera cutout issue
rows.Problem: The camera cutout setting is broken — even after enabling "Show camera cutout", the app doesn’t extend to full screen.
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera cutout setting is broken and prevents apps from extending to full screen during gameplay.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of full-screen app functionality, affecting user experience but not rendering the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Bluetooth button not showing
rows.Problem: When on a call, Bluetooth Samsung Buds 3 is connected, but after reopening the notification panel, the Bluetooth button is no longer visible. There is a UI issue.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Bluetooth button fails to appear in the notification panel after a call ends, indicating a UI issue.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects the visibility of a key feature in the notification panel during and after calls, but does not cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: vertical line coming while zoom camera
rows.Problem: vertical line coming while zoom camera
rows.Summarized Problem: A vertical line appears when zooming in the camera.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue occurs during camera operation and affects the usability of the zoom function, making it unusable in practical scenarios.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Issue with mobile data sharing
rows.Problem: Mobile data sharing fails when used via USB tethering or mobile hotspot, causing apps like Roblox to fail to connect on other devices. This affects both USB tethering and Wi-Fi hotspot.
rows.Summarized Problem: Mobile data sharing fails when shared via USB tethering or mobile hotspot, preventing apps from connecting on other devices.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents apps from connecting on other devices during data sharing, rendering the feature unusable for users relying on tethering or hotspot.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Unable to edit lockscreen
rows.Problem: AOD and lock screen problem
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot edit the lock screen, specifically affecting the AOD feature.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue impacts a key feature of the lock screen but does not render the device unusable or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Sim 1 slot not showing
rows.Problem: After updating the system device shows only sim slot 2 and not showing the sim slot 1 or sim 1
rows.Summarized Problem: The device no longer displays SIM slot 1 after a system update, showing only SIM slot 2.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of the SIM card display functionality, where one slot is missing but not entirely failing.
rows.R&D Comment: User has renamed the value from SIM 1 to SIM 2; please provide CP silent logs for further investigation.

rows.Title: Unable to register for RCS service after upgrading to One UI 7
rows.Problem: User unable to register for RCS service after upgrading to One UI 7 and switching default messaging app to Samsung Messages. Registration process shows "Registration Failed" after about 5 minutes. Network provider confirms no side issues.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot register for RCS service after upgrading to One UI 7 and switching to Samsung Messages, with registration process failing after 5 minutes.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents full RCS functionality but does not cause device crash or data loss; registration failure is intermittent and may be resolved with proper logs or configuration.
rows.R&D Comment: Insufficient log coverage; request for proper issue timing logs to identify root cause.

rows.Title: Application icon disappears from home screen intermittently
rows.Problem: Application icon intermittently disappears from home screen
rows.Summarized Problem: The app icon intermittently disappears from the home screen after a software update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes inconvenience but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss or crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is resolved by changing the app sorting method to direct setting and then back to alphabetical sorting.

rows.Title: Recent view not display properly
rows.Problem: On the recent application screen, it happens every time
rows.Summarized Problem: The recent application view does not display properly every time.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue occurs consistently on the recent application screen, indicating a partial malfunction.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Unable to add credit or debit cards to Samsung Wallet
rows.Problem: Unable to add any credit or debit cards to Samsung Wallet. It shows 'Couldn't complete'
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot add credit or debit cards to Samsung Wallet, with the app showing 'Couldn't complete' error.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from completing a core payment function, making the wallet unusable for transactions.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: accelerometer gyroscope and flex mode sensor not functioning
rows.Problem: device frequently hangs and essential sensors like the accelerometer gyroscope and flex mode sensor are not functioning correctly
rows.Summarized Problem: The device frequently hangs and essential sensors including accelerometer, gyroscope, and flex mode sensor are not functioning correctly.
rows.Severity Reason: The device hangs frequently and essential sensors are not working, which prevents normal device operation and usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: S Pen warning popup not occurring
rows.Problem: When the S Pen is out and the home screen is locked using the side button, the reminder notification that my S PEN IS OUT does not show.
rows.Summarized Problem: The S Pen warning notification does not appear when the home screen is locked with the side button.
rows.Severity Reason: The warning fails to show during a normal locking action, preventing users from knowing the S Pen is out, but the device remains usable and does not crash or lose data.
rows.R&D Comment: The warning does not show when the device is on a table and the user walks away; users must be guided to walk away with the phone to trigger the notification.

rows.Title: Image badly post processed with blurry painting effect when set as key image in motion photo
rows.Problem: When setting an image as a key image in a motion photo, the image is badly post processed with a blurry painting effect and gets saved, even when no AI modifications or editing have been done.
rows.Summarized Problem: The key image used in motion photos is incorrectly post-processed with a blurry painting effect, resulting in a visibly degraded image quality.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects image quality during motion photo creation but does not cause device crash or complete failure of core functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Require original shooting images to accurately analyze the post-processing issue and reproduce the problem.

rows.Title: Persistent Wi-Fi Connection Issue
rows.Problem: Wi-Fi quick toggle often fails and gets stuck on "Obtaining IP address" loop before eventually connecting.
rows.Summarized Problem: Wi-Fi quick toggle fails and gets stuck in an 'Obtaining IP address' loop before connecting.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes persistent failure in establishing Wi-Fi connections, leading to device usability problems.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Camera not work
rows.Problem: camera problem after one ui 7.0 update
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera is not functioning after the One UI 7.0 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera fails to work entirely, rendering a primary device function unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: The camera probe failure is suspected to be a hardware issue. A detailed log is needed for confirmation. Please use the following command to capture the log: adb root, adb remount, adb shell mkdir vendor/etc/camera, adb shell "echo logWarningMask=0xFFFFFFFFFFFFFFFF >> /vendor/etc/camera/camxoverridesettings.txt", adb shell "echo logInfoMask=0xA01C092 >> /vendor/etc/camera/cam-override settings.txt", adb shell "echo logEntryExitMask=0x0 >> /vendor/etc/camera/camxoverridesettings.txt"

rows.Title: 5g not working
rows.Problem: 5g is gone again after latest update
rows.Summarized Problem: 5G connectivity is no longer functioning after the latest software update.
rows.Severity Reason: The device loses a core network functionality, preventing reliable mobile connectivity, which renders the device unusable in areas with 5G coverage.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Samsung TTS not working properly
rows.Problem: Unable to use Samsung TTS on Google Play Books; app uses Google speech service instead of Samsung TTS, and when Samsung TTS is set as default, the app asks to install a TTS app.
rows.Summarized Problem: Samsung TTS fails to function properly in Google Play Books, defaulting to Google speech service or prompting for app installation.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature partially malfunctions in a specific app context, preventing intended use but not rendering the device unusable or causing data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: From V OS, third-party apps are not allowed to use Samsung TTS; however, third-party apps can use Samsung TTS via AI SDK.

rows.Title: HDR not working
rows.Problem: HDR not working on Samsung A35
rows.Summarized Problem: HDR functionality is not working on the Samsung A35 device due to codec errors when playing 4K 60fps content.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to decode 4K 60fps videos due to chipset limitations, causing a complete failure of HDR playback, making content viewing unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: The Exynos 1380 chipset only supports 4K at 30fps; playing 4K 60fps videos results in codec errors and HDR failure.

rows.Title: Issues playing BGMI
rows.Problem: Joystick gets stuck, touch becomes unresponsive, and controls lag during gameplay
rows.Summarized Problem: Game controls lag and become unresponsive during gameplay in BGMI.
rows.Severity Reason: Lag and unresponsive controls severely impact gameplay usability, making the app difficult to operate effectively.
rows.R&D Comment: This issue belongs to a 3rd party application and is outside Samsung's control; the root cause cannot be identified or fixed by Samsung.

rows.Title: Eye comfort shield issue
rows.Problem: Eye comfort shield turns on with full intensity and appears deep yellow in screenshots, unlike other Samsung devices with same settings, but matches F06 5g behavior, causing irritation and visual concern
rows.Summarized Problem: The eye comfort shield activates at full intensity and displays a deep yellow color in screenshots, inconsistent across devices and causing user irritation.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visual appearance during screenshots and is inconsistent across devices, but does not cause device malfunction or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Unable to reset samsung account password
rows.Problem: Not working, showing error again with provided link
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot reset their Samsung account password due to an error that reappears after a session timeout or improper browser storage.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from resetting their account password, which is a critical function for accessing device and account services, leading to potential device unavailability or account lockout.
rows.R&D Comment: It is INVALID_SESSION error; session value not stored properly in browser or page displayed for over 30 minutes. Users should delete browser cookies and temporary data and retry.

rows.Title: NotiStar is not working
rows.Problem: Samsung Good Lock NotiStar is not working
rows.Summarized Problem: The NotiStar feature on the lock screen is not working.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely non-functional on the lock screen, preventing users from receiving notifications.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Wallpaper and Styles feature not working
rows.Problem: The Wallpaper and Styles feature on my phone is not working. When I try to set a wallpaper for either the main screen or the cover screen, the app closes automatically and becomes unresponsive. I am currently unable to set wallpapers on both the cover screen and the main screen.
rows.Summarized Problem: The wallpaper and styles feature fails to function, causing the app to close automatically when attempting to set a wallpaper on either the main or cover screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes immediately upon attempting to set a wallpaper, preventing users from customizing their device's appearance, which is a core functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: The problem is solved when updating the latest software.

rows.Title: Camera Image quality not good
rows.Problem: The camera image quality shows excessive noise and lack of detail, especially in well-lit conditions. Comparison between Z Fold 7 and Vivo X200 Pro shows significant difference in image clarity, with Z Fold 7 producing noisy and low-detail photos despite being in a non-low-light scenario.
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera produces noisy and low-detail images under well-lit conditions, leading to poor image quality compared to other devices.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects image clarity in normal lighting but does not cause device crash or complete failure of core functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue is due to insufficient post-processing in wide-angle sensor; countermeasure is to disable macro mode and use wide sensor for comparisons.

rows.Title: Software issue detected pop up occurs
rows.Problem: Fold 4 inner screen not working when phone opens, no display or sound, no response to troubleshooting or reset, error report shows software issue
rows.Summarized Problem: The inner screen of the Fold 4 shows no display or sound when the phone is opened, despite troubleshooting and resets.
rows.Severity Reason: The device shows no screen or sound upon opening, making it completely unusable for basic operations.
rows.R&D Comment: If no display or sound occurs 100% depending on fold state, hardware inspection is required. Guide customer to service center for inspection.

rows.Title: Keyboard not showing up
rows.Problem: Keyboard not showing up when typing, especially in messaging apps. Issue occurs intermittently.
rows.Summarized Problem: The keyboard fails to appear when typing, particularly in messaging apps, and occurs intermittently.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of input functionality but does not render the device unusable or lead to data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Incorrect focus update from application side leads to keyboard show call being ignored. Countermeasure: Users should clear app data and update to the latest software version; if issue persists, detailed reproduction path and logs are needed for further analysis.

rows.Title: MX player cant process media files pop up occurs
rows.Problem: Everytime I Open Media players like MX player or even gallery. The error pops up sayi g Can't process media files. The media does play well without any hickups. But the pop up is annoying. Hoping to get a fix for this.
rows.Summarized Problem: MX Player displays a pop-up error stating 'Can't process media files' when opening media players or gallery, despite media playing smoothly without hiccups.
rows.Severity Reason: The error occurs intermittently and affects user experience during media access, but media playback functions correctly, indicating partial malfunction.
rows.R&D Comment: MediaProvider supports HEVC transcoding but apps do not request it; transcoding is disabled for long-duration videos due to cost, leading to error pop-up when app fails to handle HEVC files properly.

rows.Title: 2 icons for same app is shown
rows.Problem: applications showing double in apps
rows.Summarized Problem: Applications are displaying two icons instead of one.
rows.Severity Reason: The duplicate icons are part of a normal feature (Dual Messenger) and do not affect device functionality or performance.
rows.R&D Comment: Duplicate icons are due to Dual Messenger profile activation; user should be informed that this is intended behavior.

rows.Title: Bluetooth not working
rows.Problem: Bluetooth is not showing clear cache option and has low sound quality after UI 7 update
rows.Summarized Problem: Bluetooth functionality is degraded with poor sound quality and missing cache option after UI 7 update
rows.Severity Reason: Bluetooth is not working properly, leading to impaired device usability and degraded audio experience
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Battery drain
rows.Problem: Battery drops from 60-80% to 20-15% within 3-4 hours during normal use with minimal app activity, browser usage, and stable network. Device shows rapid battery consumption during simple typing, with 3% drain observed in under a minute. No heavy work or multitasking. Samsung reports fail to deliver normal battery performance.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences rapid battery drain under normal usage conditions, with significant consumption observed during simple tasks like typing.
rows.Severity Reason: The battery drains rapidly during basic operations, indicating a major performance issue that undermines device usability.
rows.R&D Comment: There is no significant drainage observed in real-world metrics; further investigation needed to identify root cause and validate battery consumption logs.

rows.Title: Camera quality is not good
rows.Problem: Pictures taken with 200MP and 12MP do not have sharpness when zoomed in. The 200MP mode switches to 50MP under low light or bright conditions due to sensor limitations, resulting in poor image quality when zoomed.
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera fails to deliver sharp images when zoomed in, especially in 200MP mode due to sensor limitations under varying light conditions.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents clear image capture, which is a core function of the camera, leading to a poor user experience and potential device usability failure.
rows.R&D Comment: The 200MP mode switches to 50MP under low or bright light due to sensor limitations, resulting in poor image quality when zoomed; the high-resolution sensor performs best only under bright light conditions.

rows.Title: Optical Image Stabilization not working
rows.Problem: Camera stabilization is not working
rows.Summarized Problem: Optical Image Stabilization is not functioning properly in the camera.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of a camera feature, where stabilization fails under certain conditions but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue appears to be related to user operation or video shaking; further analysis is needed to confirm whether the stabilization is truly malfunctioning or if it is a result of excessive movement.

rows.Title: Gallery app crashes while using
rows.Problem: application it will close automatically while using the gallery it's showing the ui update after
rows.Summarized Problem: The gallery app crashes and closes automatically while in use, with UI updates appearing afterward.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes during use, making it unusable and potentially leading to data loss or user frustration.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Network issues in mobile data
rows.Problem: Mobile data automatically freezes, shifts to 3g, and cannot be changed back to 4g despite good network strength. Issue persists for days until device restart. After restart, 4g connection returns temporarily.
rows.Summarized Problem: Mobile data intermittently drops to 3G and cannot be switched back to 4G, requiring device restart to recover.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes device to lose reliable network connectivity, rendering mobile data unusable for extended periods, which severely impacts user functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Bixby can not send messages through several apps when it is set to US English
rows.Problem: Bixby can not send messages through several apps when it is set to US English. Every time I ask it to send WhatsApp message, it asks me permission to change language to Indian English.
rows.Summarized Problem: Bixby asks users to switch to Indian English when trying to send messages through WhatsApp, even when set to US English.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a prompt interruption during message sending but does not prevent functionality entirely, indicating partial malfunction.
rows.R&D Comment: The language switch prompt was introduced during en-IN launch to migrate Indian users; with 70% of Indian users now using en-IN, the prompt will be removed in the next planned release.

rows.Title: Display gets pink on lock screen
rows.Problem: A glitch appears on the top part of the screen while unlocking, lasting 2-3 seconds and then vanishing, experienced 2-3 times this week
rows.Summarized Problem: A pink glitch appears on the top of the screen during unlock and disappears after 2-3 seconds.
rows.Severity Reason: The glitch occurs intermittently and affects the user experience during unlock, but does not prevent device usage or cause device failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Low clock (mdp core_clk 100000000) set in 60PHS mode causes waveform stretching and tearing due to mismatched scan rates between hwc and kernel. Countermeasure: Not provided.

rows.Title: Notifications not shown on Galaxy 3 watch
rows.Problem: Not getting notifications in Samsung galaxy 3 watch for two apps: MultiTimer and Microsoft To Do. Have tried everything. Have listed this issue before but got no resolution.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Galaxy 3 watch is not displaying notifications for MultiTimer and Microsoft To Do apps.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to show notifications for critical apps, making it unusable for essential alerts.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is resolved in the following CL: https://gerrit.sw.sec.samsung.net/package/c/Package/BandModule/+/1447203

rows.Title: Insta pop up has its icons overlapping
rows.Problem: While using landscapes in apps or games the insta popup view is buggy and inappropriate according to instagram appearance
rows.Summarized Problem: The Instagram popup view has overlapping icons and appears buggy during landscape usage in apps or games.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes an inappropriate appearance during gameplay but does not prevent device operation or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Unable to sign in google account
rows.Problem: not able to sign in google account in watch 8. reset multiple times didn't work. msg pops up saying couldn't copy your google account
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot sign in to their Google account on the watch 8, even after multiple resets, with a message indicating 'couldn't copy your Google account'.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from accessing core functionality (like Google Assistant) and requires repeated device resets, making it critical for usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause and countermeasure both indicate that video and logs are not in sync, and users need to clear Google Play Services and retest.

rows.Title: Font style didn't changed for Instagram
rows.Problem: The font I applied on my device is not reflected in Instagram; it still shows the default font.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot apply custom font styles to Instagram, which continues to display the default font despite user settings.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction where user-customized font settings are not applied, but the app remains functional and does not crash or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is rooted in Instagram's third-party app code, not Samsung's software; Facebook should investigate, and the problem is temporary and not reproducible across devices.

rows.Title: Lag observed in the device
rows.Problem: The device froze and incorrectly restarted automatically
rows.Summarized Problem: The device freezes and restarts unexpectedly, causing significant lag and instability.
rows.Severity Reason: The device freezes and restarts unexpectedly, making it unusable and indicating a critical system malfunction.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is likely due to hardware malfunction in the PCIe block or WiFi module; a RAM dump is needed for full diagnosis, and hardware investigation is recommended.

rows.Title: Unable to log to my samsung account
rows.Problem: Unable to log to my samsung account even after changing password multiple times. Not able to use samsung wallet and password.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot log into their Samsung account after changing the password multiple times, affecting access to Samsung Wallet and password features.
rows.Severity Reason: Users are unable to log into their Samsung account, which prevents access to essential features like Samsung Wallet and password management, rendering core functionality unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Camera lags
rows.Problem: Phone camera lags and zitters when opened since purchase. Tried reset settings, clear app data and cache, safe mode, and latest update. Issue persists consistently.
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone's camera lags and zitters when opened, even after multiple troubleshooting steps and software updates.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera lag and zittering prevent consistent use of a core functionality, making it difficult to take photos or videos.
rows.R&D Comment: Device temperature is very high in logs; issue requires reproduction in latest binary to confirm and reopen PLM if reproduced.

rows.Title: Google app issue
rows.Problem: Swiping diagonally from the bottom corners of the screen does not open Google Assistant or Gemini, although it works with 'Hey Google'. All settings are enabled and the Google app is updated.
rows.Summarized Problem: Swiping diagonally from the bottom corners fails to open Google Assistant or Gemini, despite working with voice command 'Hey Google'.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature fails under specific gestures but works with voice command, indicating a partial malfunction of gesture-based functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause and countermeasure both state that pressing and holding the side button opens the digital assistant; gesture-based access is not supported in current One UI version.

rows.Title: hotspot disconnects from devices after a few minutes
rows.Problem: The system hotspot stays ON but disconnects from all other devices after a few minutes, indicating a firmware bug unrelated to user settings.
rows.Summarized Problem: The mobile hotspot disconnects from devices after a few minutes, causing connectivity issues.
rows.Severity Reason: The hotspot fails to maintain connections, rendering it unusable for sharing internet, which is a core network function.
rows.R&D Comment: Firmware bug causing hotspot disconnection; user reports intermittent failure across devices, suggesting a systemic issue.

rows.Title: phone is crashing very frequently
rows.Problem: Post recent software update the phone is crashing very frequently. The UI crashing is very bothering. Please provide a solution ASAP or help to downgrade.
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone is crashing frequently after a recent software update, causing UI instability.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is crashing frequently, leading to instability and potential unavailability of core functions.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Battery protection not working
rows.Problem: Battery charging setting set to maximum 80% but this function is not working
rows.Summarized Problem: The battery protection feature, which limits charging to 80%, is not functioning properly.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is not working, preventing users from controlling battery charging, which directly impacts device usage and battery life.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Display statters when played YT video on 2x speed in 4k, 2k, 1080p
rows.Problem: After the security patch update, YouTube videos played at 2x speed in 4k, 2k, and 1080p cause frequent display statters. This issue did not occur before the update.
rows.Summarized Problem: YouTube video playback at 2x speed in high resolutions causes frequent display statters after a recent security patch update.
rows.Severity Reason: The display statters during video playback, which is a major functional failure that affects core usability of the device.
rows.R&D Comment: Null interaction logging and layout state errors in YouTube indicate a UI rendering failure; countermeasure includes app cache clearing and update, but root cause requires deeper investigation.

rows.Title: Ghost touch issue
rows.Problem: Ghost touch issues still persist on Galaxy A14 5G, especially during gaming. The issue remains despite factory reset, removal of screen protector, and using recommended settings like 'Disable HW Overlays'.
rows.Summarized Problem: Ghost touch issues persist on Galaxy A14 5G during gaming despite multiple troubleshooting steps.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents normal device operation during gaming, a critical use case, and persists after factory reset and recommended settings.
rows.R&D Comment: The root cause is spec-out touch characteristic data; users should visit a service center for inspection.

rows.Title: Device restarts unexpectedly
rows.Problem: The device restarts frequently, especially when battery drops below 50%, and becomes more severe as battery percentage decreases. This mainly occurs while playing videos through apps or from the gallery, disrupting daily usage.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device unexpectedly restarts when battery drops below 50%, particularly during video playback, indicating a power management issue.
rows.Severity Reason: The device restarts repeatedly under normal usage conditions, leading to loss of device functionality and disruption of user experience, which is a critical issue.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Touch issues
rows.Problem: The touch is sometimes missing at the fingerprint sensor area or gets stuck, and the issue resolves automatically or after manually restarting or locking and unlocking the device.
rows.Summarized Problem: The fingerprint sensor area occasionally fails to register touch input, which intermittently resolves on its own or after a device restart.
rows.Severity Reason: The touch failure occurs intermittently and affects usability during specific interactions, but does not cause complete device failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Camera quality degraded
rows.Problem: After the last update, camera photos are coming out dark, dull, and slightly blurred even with HDR and Scene Optimizer turned on.
rows.Summarized Problem: Camera photos are dark, dull, and slightly blurred even with HDR and Scene Optimizer enabled.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of camera image quality under specific settings, but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Image is captured at ISO 2000 which looks balanced between clarity and noise. So recommending to maintain the current behavior.

rows.Title: Battery draining unusually fast during light usage
rows.Problem: Battery is draining unusually fast even during light usage. The phone also heats up during idle time. Background apps are using more battery than expected.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device is draining battery rapidly during light usage and overheats when idle, with background apps consuming excessive power.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is experiencing significant battery drain and overheating during idle use, which indicates a major system-level performance issue that impacts usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Background apps like com.facebook.services and com.google.android.gms are using excessive battery; reducing background activity and limiting updates in app settings can help mitigate the issue.

rows.Title: Battery Drain
rows.Problem: The battery drains quickly and requires charging twice a day.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device battery drains rapidly, requiring charging twice daily.
rows.Severity Reason: The battery drains so quickly that the device requires frequent charging, making it unusable for daily use.
rows.R&D Comment: Battery drain is a normal operation under the current continuity service concept; location requests are part of user activity monitoring.

rows.Title: Display turns yellow on notification
rows.Problem: Display color tone turns yellowish when receiving messages or calls
rows.Summarized Problem: The device display turns yellow when receiving notifications or calls.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects notification display but does not cause device malfunction or data loss, and is triggered by a specific setting.
rows.R&D Comment: The yellow color is caused by the 'flashing notification' feature; users should disable it to resolve the issue.

rows.Title: Camera pop up occurs
rows.Problem: When trying to open the Camera app, a message says 'Another app is using the camera' even when no other app is running. The issue persists after restarting the phone, clearing camera cache, and checking app permissions.
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera app displays a message indicating another app is using the camera, despite no other app being active.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents the user from accessing the camera function, which is a core feature of the device, leading to a complete failure of intended functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: FATAL error in camera recovery module detected; further investigation needed for root cause and silent logs analysis.

rows.Title: mobile starts lagging after recent update
rows.Problem: mobile starts lagging when uploading images in ChatGPT, issue persists until device restart, resumes after restart but returns upon reusing ChatGPT with image
rows.Summarized Problem: Mobile lags when uploading images in ChatGPT, issue resolves after device restart but returns upon reuse.
rows.Severity Reason: The lag occurs during a specific function use and is intermittent, but impacts usability during image uploads.
rows.R&D Comment: Customer's power saving mode was disabled, which restricted system resources; recommend guiding user to disable power saving mode.

rows.Title: Network issues
rows.Problem: Phone switches between 4G and 5G even when 5G is available, causing network errors. User has tried all self-guided solutions without success.
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone intermittently switches from 5G to 4G despite being in a 5G network, causing connectivity errors.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to maintain a stable 5G connection, leading to intermittent network failure and potential data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Devices only latching to 4G despite strong 5G coverage
rows.Problem: Devices only latching to 4G despite being in a strong 5G coverage area where other phones work fine with Jio 5G
rows.Summarized Problem: Devices fail to connect to 5G and consistently fall back to 4G in areas with strong 5-5G coverage.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is unable to utilize available 5G connectivity, which is a major functional failure in network performance, rendering the 5G capability ineffective in real-world conditions.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Battery drain
rows.Problem: Battery draining is very fast after updating to One UI 7.0, despite user efforts to save battery. The device is known for good battery life, but current update causes rapid battery drain.
rows.Summarized Problem: Battery drains rapidly after updating to One UI 7.0, despite user efforts to conserve battery.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is known for good battery life, but post-update battery drain is severe and inconsistent with expected performance, making it unusable for daily use.
rows.R&D Comment: Battery discharge rate is within normal range per logs; further investigation needed to identify root cause of perceived rapid drain.

rows.Title: Delayed touch response
rows.Problem: Touch response often delays when pulling down the screen to see notifications or when turning on Wi-Fi or vibration mode from the notification panel, or when going back between pages or scrolling up/down. This has been happening for 3 to 4 days.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device exhibits delayed touch response when interacting with the display, such as pulling down for notifications or scrolling.
rows.Severity Reason: Delayed touch response prevents normal device interaction and can lead to user frustration and potential usability failure.
rows.R&D Comment: User needs to update to latest version and provide video with logs if issue recurs for better analysis.

rows.Title: Internet not working
rows.Problem: Internet suddenly stops working showing 5G but no internet connection. Turning on flight mode takes several minutes to respond, and after turning it off, the phone has no network for a long time. A device restart is required to fix it. This issue occurs only on my device, while family members with the same Samsung phone and network provider (Airtel) experience no such issues.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device fails to maintain an active internet connection, showing 5G but no actual connectivity, with intermittent network failures and requires device restart to resolve.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes complete loss of internet access, preventing device usability, and requires repeated restarts to recover, indicating a critical network function failure.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is likely due to temporary network rejection (NW_FAILURE=17); if persistent, recommend contacting the network operator for resolution.

rows.Title: Accessibility keeps stopping
rows.Problem: See this installed apps not open
rows.Summarized Problem: Accessibility features are stopping unexpectedly, preventing users from seeing installed apps.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from accessing core app visibility, making the device unusable for accessibility-dependent functions.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue was caused by DevicePolicyManager and AppOpsManager failing to retrieve package info without packageName in RestrictedPreference. A fix was implemented by adding logic to set packageName, and the issue is resolved in version 14.1.00.17.

rows.Title: Search in gallery doesn't work properly
rows.Problem: Search in gallery doesn't work properly. If I search for driving license it doesn't show the image even though I have it.
rows.Summarized Problem: The gallery search function fails to display images, even when they are present in the device.
rows.Severity Reason: Users cannot find images they have stored, making the gallery function practically unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Lag observed while switching between lenses
rows.Problem: Camera lag observed when switching between lenses
rows.Summarized Problem: Camera lags when switching between lenses.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction during lens switching but does not prevent device usage or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Wi-fi calling option not showing
rows.Problem: Wi-fi calling option disappeared after Android update from 14 to 15. Unable to turn on wifi calling as option is missing.
rows.Summarized Problem: WiFi calling option is missing after Android 14 to 15 update, preventing users from enabling it.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely missing after update, making it impossible to enable WiFi calling, which is a core communication function.
rows.R&D Comment: Provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: battery drain so fast
rows.Problem: battery drops 27% in 1 hour 32 minutes with no gaming and no excessive brightness, despite user trying to limit background usage. Full charge provides only 5 hours 32 minutes of screen time without gaming and 4 hours 48 minutes with gaming. Problem persists after factory reset.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences rapid battery drain, dropping 27% in just one hour and thirty-two minutes under normal usage conditions, with no gaming or excessive brightness, and the issue persists after a factory reset.
rows.Severity Reason: The battery drains extremely quickly under normal usage, significantly reducing usable screen time and making the device unusable for everyday tasks.
rows.R&D Comment: Battery was drained from 100% to 73% over 12 hours and 57 minutes, not 1 hour and 32 minutes; screen on time is not a capability issue but reflects user usage patterns; logs do not match user description and show no abnormal behavior.

rows.Title: Unable to Make Voice Call while on Dual WhatsApp Call
rows.Problem: I can't make voice calls while on using dual WhatsApp call. I got "Call cannot be placed because there are no calling accounts that support calls of this type" error message as reply. While speaking on normal WhatsApp I can make normal voice calls only, problem with dual WhatsApp call only
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot make voice calls when in a dual WhatsApp call, receiving an error indicating no calling accounts support the call type.
rows.Severity Reason: The device prevents users from placing voice calls during a dual WhatsApp call, which is a major functional failure that blocks core communication capability.
rows.R&D Comment: User must disconnect the ongoing call in another userhandle to make a new call; the issue stems from WhatsApp's call management conflict during dual calls.

rows.Title: Network drop from 5G to 4G
rows.Problem: Device: Galaxy S23 FE One UI Version: 7 (Android 15) Carrier: Jio 5G (Standalone - SA) Issue: My S23 FE aggressively drops from 5G n78 to 4G or 5-5G n28 when indoors, even when n78 signal is present (~ -105 dBm). This causes slow speed and unstable internet indoors. I have tested the same Jio SIM in a OnePlus 13R under identical conditions, and it stays locked on 5G n78 without fallback — same signal strength. Troubleshooting done: Battery optimizations disabled, SIM Toolkit, Phone Service disabled.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Galaxy S23 FE drops from 5G to 4G or 5G n28 indoors despite present 5G n78 signal, causing unstable internet and slow speeds.
rows.Severity Reason: The device loses 5G connectivity indoors, leading to unstable internet and significant performance degradation, making the device unusable for reliable communication.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Unable to configure supplementary services
rows.Problem: Unable to configure supplementary services
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot configure supplementary services due to a temporary network issue causing QMI failure and base station release without reason.
rows.Severity Reason: The failure prevents users from setting up essential services, rendering a core functionality unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by a temporary network problem leading to QMI failure and base station release; no clear reason provided, requiring further investigation.

rows.Title: Game icon didn't update
rows.Problem: Samsung launcher doesn't display the new icon for Free Fire game
rows.Summarized Problem: The Samsung launcher fails to display the updated icon for the Free Fire game.
rows.Severity Reason: The launcher shows an outdated icon, causing a partial malfunction in app visibility but does not prevent device usage or cause crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is due to a mismatch between the app manifest and displayed icon; the app developer must investigate and correct the icon configuration.

rows.Title: camera is not functioning properly
rows.Problem: The camera is not functioning properly (e.g., showing a black screen, not focusing, or crashing), which is affecting my daily usage.
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera fails to function properly, showing black screen, failing to focus, or crashing.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera is failing to function, causing complete loss of usability during daily operations, including basic photo and video capture.
rows.R&D Comment: The camera sensor is not functioning properly; requires hardware team intervention.

rows.Title: Black line appears when capture photo from rear camera
rows.Problem: Black line appears when capturing photos from rear camera, especially on plain walls, when 'Intelligent Optimization' is set to maximum or medium.
rows.Summarized Problem: A black line appears in photos taken from the rear camera when 'Intelligent Optimization' is set to maximum or medium, particularly on plain backgrounds.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects photo quality in specific conditions but does not prevent full functionality or cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Black stripes appear due to fast shutter speeds in Fast Shutter Mode; deflicker feature can minimize this effect.

rows.Title: GPS not working
rows.Problem: Location services have not been working at all since the first day of use, despite trying every possible solution. The blue location tick icon is missing in Google Maps.

rows.Title: Video codec not supported

rows.Severity Reason: The video fails to play on the device, indicating a core functionality failure that prevents normal use of the video player.
rows.R&D Comment: The driver received an unsupported stream error; video file required for further investigation.

rows.Title: Contact details mismatching

rows.Title: Left edge pixels missing on Edge light

rows.Title: read caller name aloud functions have stopped working

rows.Title: 4k and 8k videos not playing properly after ONE UI 7 update

rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects video playback functionality but does not cause device crash or complete failure; users can still use the device normally.
rows.R&D Comment: The media codec shows no error; playback issue may be due to software compatibility. Recommend testing with Samsung Video Player to confirm.

rows.Title: efootball game keeps crashing
rows.Problem: My efootball game keeps crashing in between and I cannot understand why. It just automatically closes. I have not seen this in any other app just this game for now. I wanted to have an amazing gaming experience in this new phone but apparently it is not like that. Can u please explain me the reason why this is happening. I have already asked the support before and performed the steps for resetting my new phone purchased just 1 week back.
rows.Summarized Problem: The eFootball game crashes unexpectedly and closes automatically during use.
rows.Severity Reason: The game crashes mid-use, preventing gameplay and rendering the app unusable for users.

rows.Title: My file keep crashing

rows.Title: Internet network keeps on going to zero

But the problem still persists. Did reboot, reset device, reset network, sim slot change but still internet suddenly goes down, especially downloading.

rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes complete loss of internet access, especially during downloads, rendering the device unusable for online activities.

rows.Title: Wifi is not getting turned on

rows.Severity Reason: The WiFi function fails to initialize completely and remains inaccessible even after multiple troubleshooting steps, rendering the device unable to connect to networks.
rows.R&D Comment: Failed to load WiFi driver and initialize firmware mode controller; vendor HAL startup failed due to system-level driver issues.

rows.Title: Fingerprint sensor not working properly

rows.Title: popup Occurs in device

rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes unusable due to frequent restarts and severe lagging, which are major functional failures.

rows.Title: Unable to connect to Samsung health app

rows.Title: Call and Text on other devices not working on Tab S10

rows.Title: Unable to register for RCS service after upgraded to One UI 7

rows.Title: Can't install WhatsApp Application

rows.Title: noise distortion muffling in sound

rows.Title: Media Picker consuming excessive battery

rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes device to become unusable due to rapid battery drain, severely limiting screen on time and impacting daily usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Caused by com.microsoft.appmanager app continuously scanning /storage/emulated/0; countermeasure involves third-party app analysis, no Samsung involvement.

rows.Title: YouTube Video quality automatically drops back from 2160p to 480p
rows.Problem: On YouTube, video quality automatically drops from 2160p to 480p after a short playback. When manually set to 2160p, it buffers for 2–3 seconds before dropping back to 480p. The quality change option sometimes does not appear. This issue occurs on multiple tablets.

rows.R&D Comment: YouTube app incorrectly limits video resolution to 480p when user selects 2160p, despite device support; this issue should be addressed in the YouTube app.

rows.Title: dolby atmos seems to be broken
rows.Problem: The dolby atmos seems to be broken and there is no difference in audio when playing over bluetooth to Sony XM4. Neither turning on/off nor changing modes makes any difference. Even restarting the mobile did not help. This used to work earlier, suspecting recent oneui updates.

rows.Severity Reason: The feature does not work as intended but is not completely non-functional; user experience is degraded but device remains usable.

rows.Title: Not able to hear voice from other side

rows.Title: battery getting draining very fast
rows.Problem: Battery is draining very fast. Like I charged 80% and as far rightnow, I have used 32% and only get 2:21 of SOT. Attaching the screenshot of my battery usage data please refer to it. Still battery getting draining very fast and facing pathetic battery backup and need to charge up twice a day.

rows.Title: Unable to use 5g

rows.Title: Applications icons not showing in app drawer

rows.Title: unable to use 5g data from jio sim

rows.Title: Battery draining very fast in normal Usage
rows.Problem: Battery drains rapidly during normal usage, dropping from 100% to 19% in just 3 hours 30 minutes without heavy usage or high-power activities.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device drains battery rapidly during normal usage, dropping from 100% to 19% in under four hours without heavy applications or usage.
rows.Severity Reason: Battery drains significantly in normal use, indicating a major performance issue that compromises device usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Battery drain caused by high CPU usage from AI apps like ChatGPT and Perplexity; countermeasure is to limit background AI app usage.

rows.Title: BGMI joystick stuck while jiggle movement
rows.Problem: Samsung A26 5G – please improve touch sampling rate optimization for smooth gaming
rows.Summarized Problem: The joystick on the BGMI game is stuck during jiggle movements, causing poor gaming performance.
rows.Severity Reason: The joystick is stuck during gameplay, which directly prevents smooth interaction and makes the game unplayable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Low Edge Light
rows.Problem: Low edge light
rows.Summarized Problem: The edge light on the device is too dim.
rows.Severity Reason: The edge light is not bright enough, affecting visibility but does not prevent device usage or cause crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Battery icon disappears from status bar
rows.Problem: The battery icon does not show up in the status bar.
rows.Summarized Problem: The battery icon fails to appear in the status bar.
rows.Severity Reason: The battery icon is a critical status indicator that is missing, making it impossible for users to monitor battery level.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Cannot turn on dual always on option for dual sim
rows.Problem: Using both Jio eSIM and Airtel physical SIM, cannot turn on dual always on option for dual sim. Getting error "couldnt turn on dual sim always on"
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot enable the dual always on display option when using both an eSIM and a physical SIM, resulting in an error message.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature failure prevents users from using a key functionality (always-on display) with dual SIMs, rendering the device unusable for that use case.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Advanced mic settings cause force close in pro camera video mode
rows.Problem: Advanced mic settings cause force close in pro camera video mode. Not able to select external mic settings like usb mic, bt mic, gain settings.
rows.Summarized Problem: The app crashes when using advanced microphone settings in pro camera video mode.
rows.Severity Reason: The app force closes, preventing users from using external mic settings, which is a critical function in video recording.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Battery Protection set to Maximum: 80% but phone still charging beyond 80%
rows.Problem: Phone still charging beyond 80% when Battery Protection is set to Maximum: 80%, even after reset and update to One UI 7. The device automatically charges beyond 80% after unplugging and replugging after reaching 80%.
rows.Summarized Problem: Phone continues to charge beyond 80% despite Battery Protection being set to maximum 80%.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is not functioning as intended, causing deviation from user-set limits, but the device remains usable and does not crash or lose data.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Touch screen just stops working
rows.Problem: The touch screen just stops working at any time and on any screen. The issue can occur intermittently and sometimes resolves itself after idle time. The phone acts as if swiping to navi when touch is malfunctioning.
rows.Summarized Problem: The touch screen intermittently stops working across all screens and may resolve itself after idle time.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of touch functionality but does not render the device unusable or result in data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: 4K video not playing
rows.Problem: 4K video playback fails in Samsung Video Player and third-party apps like VLC. On Samsung F14 5G, videos play at only 15-18 fps instead of the claimed 30 fps, causing a shutter effect. Device runs UI 7.0.
rows.Summarized Problem: 4K video playback is unstable and runs at low frame rates due to insufficient VP9 decoding support.
rows.Severity Reason: The device cannot play 4K videos smoothly, resulting in a severe stuttering experience that makes video viewing unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Playback failure occurs because the device's VP9 decoder only supports 2K; without hardware decoding, software playback is highly dependent on AP performance and cannot be resolved by Samsung.

rows.Title: Error occurs while using SBI YONO Merchant App
rows.Problem: App shows error "Unbale To Use App You Are Using Key Logger Software" when using SBI YONO MERCHANT App.
rows.Summarized Problem: The SBI YONO Merchant App displays an error indicating the use of key logger software when accessed.
rows.Severity Reason: The error suggests a security violation that could compromise app integrity or user data, potentially leading to misuse or unauthorized access.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Settings open slowly
rows.Problem: Device becomes slower when opening any settings, options open very slowly
rows.Summarized Problem: Settings menu opens slowly, causing device to feel sluggish during navigation.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction in settings performance, affecting user experience but not rendering the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Log dumping process can slow system performance; user should be guided to take logs properly and provide more details if issue recurs.

rows.Title: Wuthering Weaves crashes every 5-10 minutes during gameplay
rows.Problem: Wuthering Weaves crashes every 5-10 minutes during gameplay. Device gets heated while playing. Crashes occur regardless of installation source (Google Play Store or Galaxy Store). Tried clearing cache, restarting, uninstalling and reinstalling — no resolution.
rows.Summarized Problem: Wuthering Weaves crashes every 5-10 minutes during gameplay, causing device to overheat.
rows.Severity Reason: The game crashes repeatedly during gameplay, leading to instability and device overheating, making it unusable during play.
rows.R&D Comment: This issue belongs to a 3rd party application and requires investigation and fix by the app developer. No root cause can be identified due to lack of source code and no commercial agreement between Samsung and the app owner.

rows.Title: Unable to register fingerprint
rows.Problem: Unable to register fingerprint. There are more glitches and lags after the current update. The camera has especially slow performance and when switching from picture to video, it takes a very big lag.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot register their fingerprint and experience significant lag when switching between picture and video modes in the camera app.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents basic device functionality (fingerprint registration) and causes severe performance lag affecting core camera operations.
rows.R&D Comment: No camera app logs available; request for updated logs and video after the issue occurred.

rows.Title: Camera not working
rows.Problem: Camera not working after update
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera is not working after a software update.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera is a core functionality that is completely non-operational after an update, making the device unusable for basic tasks.
rows.R&D Comment: Root cause not identifiable due to insufficient log coverage; require CP silent logs for further investigation.

rows.Title: Unable to place the call in the first attempt
rows.Problem: Unable to place the call in the first attempt and today iam Unable to lift the call also attached screenshot for reference
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot place a call on the first attempt and are unable to lift the call.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from initiating a call, which is a fundamental function of the device's communication capability.
rows.R&D Comment: Temporary network signaling issue; if recurring, users should visit service center for device logs.

rows.Title: notifications taking time to come to my watch ultra
rows.Problem: notifications are taking time to come to my watch ultra 2024, some are not coming, and some come only after invoking the watch screen. this happens for many apps, not specific to any.
rows.Summarized Problem: Notifications are delayed or missing on the Galaxy Watch Ultra, affecting multiple apps.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction of notification delivery across multiple apps, but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Earpiece speaker distortion in One UI 7
rows.Problem: Earpiece speaker distortion returns after several hours or days of use, resolves after reboot, but recurs over time. No hardware issues identified; suggests a background process or audio routing bug.
rows.Summarized Problem: Earpiece speaker produces distorted sound after several hours of use, resolving after reboot but recurring over time.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue is not a complete failure but a recurring malfunction that affects audio quality intermittently after a period of use.
rows.R&D Comment: The software team found no abnormal behavior; possible hardware defect in speaker material requires service center inspection.

rows.Title: Game performance sluggish and lag in tab while playing BGMI
rows.Problem: BGMI game experiences FPS skip and sudden lag when encountering enemies, with no optimization or action taken by Samsung for Tab S9
rows.Summarized Problem: The BGMI game on the Tab S9 experiences sudden lag and FPS skips during gameplay, particularly when encountering enemies.
rows.Severity Reason: The game freezes or lags during critical gameplay moments, disrupting user experience and potentially leading to loss of in-game progress or performance.
rows.R&D Comment: Device not fully charged prevents background dexopt compilation; recommend charging to full capacity and reporting with logs and timestamps if issue persists

rows.Title: Creating new album shows No.people.found
rows.Problem: Auto updating album in gallery stopped working after switching from Galaxy A34 5G to Samsung S24 5-5G. When trying to create a new album, it shows 'No.people.found'. This issue affects the functionality of the gallery feature.
rows.Summarized Problem: The auto-updating album feature in the gallery no longer works and shows 'No.people.found' when creating a new album.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely non-functional, preventing users from creating albums and accessing updated photos, making it unusable for core photo management.
rows.R&D Comment: Database may be corrupted due to prolonged idle time with screen off and charging; clearing related app data can initiate fresh reanalysis.

rows.Title: No Service logo showing for both SIM cards
rows.Problem: Ever since the July 2025 Software update, my device has "No Service" logo showing for both SIM cards. None of the SIMs are working. I tried activating eSIM to no avail. I can receive SMS & Calls over Wifi calling but standalone does not work.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device shows 'No Service' logo for both SIM cards after the July 2025 software update, with no standalone SIM functionality despite working on Wi-Fi calling.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to register with SIMs, rendering basic cellular functionality unusable, which is a core network operation.
rows.R&D Comment: MIPI test failed due to six hardware components (DevInst, BUS, MID, USID, STATUS, RF_Component) being reported as 'Not Good'; recommend hardware inspection and replacement at service center.

rows.Title: While charging the phone it's stopping at 79% itself and showing as fully charged
rows.Problem: While charging the phone it's stopping at 79% itself and showing as fully charged. But I have set the limits upto 80%. It sometime reaches 80% but often get struck to 79% only. Attached screenshot.
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone stops at 79% during charging and displays as fully charged, despite having a set limit of 80%.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to reach the intended charge level and incorrectly shows full charge, which may lead to user confusion and potential overuse or battery damage.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Sound quality via Bluetooth on Bowers & Wilkins Pi8 earphones has dropped significantly
rows.Problem: Bluetooth audio output quality on Fold 7 is extremely bad with no bass and voice prioritized, causing music volume to drop drastically when voice is active, despite similar EQ settings on earphones, Samsung EQ, and music player.
rows.Summarized Problem: Bluetooth audio output on Fold 7 has severely degraded with no bass and voice prioritization, causing volume drops during voice content.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes significant degradation in audio experience, with noticeable loss of bass and abrupt volume drops during voice content, making the audio unusable for music playback.
rows.R&D Comment: EQ settings are not properly applied in Bluetooth audio output; further investigation needed to identify root cause and implement proper EQ session handling.

rows.Title: Lag & frame drop when playing game
rows.Problem: Cannot play game since software update ui 7.0
rows.Summarized Problem: Device lags and drops frames when playing games after software update UI 7.0
rows.Severity Reason: Game performance is severely degraded, making gameplay unusable
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Internet speed in tab is far lower compared to my mobile
rows.Problem: Internet speed on tab is far lower than on mobile when both devices are at same distance from modem. Speed test shows tab at 1-20mbps while mobile shows 100-30 Tbps. Issue persists after forgetting password and reconnecting WiFi on both 2.4 and 5GHz bands. Speed fluctuates but tab consistently performs much worse.
rows.Summarized Problem: The tablet's WiFi connection shows significantly lower internet speed compared to the mobile device under identical conditions, with consistent performance gaps and poor signal stability.
rows.Severity Reason: The device's WiFi performance is drastically lower than expected, with data transfer speeds at only 1-20 Mbps compared to mobile's 100-300 Mbps, indicating a potential hardware-level issue affecting core connectivity.
rows.R&D Comment: There is a suspected hardware issue causing poor WiFi link speeds and high frame error rates; recommend checking RSSI for each antenna to confirm antenna performance.

rows.Title: Google chrome and samsung calculator not visible in home page

rows.Summarized Problem: Applications such as Google Chrome and Samsung Calculator are missing from the home screen app section.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves apps being hidden by user settings, not a device malfunction or core function failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Apps are hidden by user settings; users can unhide them via Settings > Homescreen settings > Hide apps on Home and App screen.

rows.Title: Cannot calibrate the watch for blood pressure

rows.R&D Comment: ANR is caused by delayed touch event handling in the navigation bar, but system busy state is the root cause; further investigation needed

rows.Title: Google feed gets disappeared automatically

rows.Title: Super fast charging instead of Super fast charging 2.0

rows.R&D Comment: The device incorrectly displays charging level text; using the correct E MAKER cable (5A support) is required for 45W charging, but the display error persists regardless of cable type.

rows.Title: Battery draining
rows.Problem: Battery drains from 70% to 35% in one hour with no usage of mobile features like video, calls, or maps. Device not used for over an hour.

rows.Severity Reason: Battery drains rapidly under minimal usage, indicating a major performance issue that renders the device unusable without a software fix.
rows.R&D Comment: You're using auto brightness setting; high screen brightness increases battery discharge. Turn off auto brightness to reduce drain.

rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot enable VOLTE in settings for BSNL on Samsung A16 5G, leading to major call drop issues.

rows.Title: Editing live photo automatically darkens
rows.Problem: When editing a live photo by selecting a frame and saving, the photo automatically darkens as if exposure has decreased. This issue appears to be related to a recent software update, as the same feature works correctly on an unupdated Samsung tablet.
rows.Summarized Problem: Editing a live photo automatically darkens during the save process, causing incorrect exposure.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects the core functionality of photo editing but does not cause device crash or data loss, and is intermittent or dependent on software state.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Overheating issues
rows.Problem: Device overheats significantly, reaching up to 90°C even with only Wi-Fi enabled and other features like location and Bluetooth turned off. Average temperature is 38.4°C, which is abnormally high. User reports this overheating occurs despite minimal usage.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device overheats to 90°C under minimal usage conditions, indicating a failure in thermal management.
rows.Severity Reason: The device reaches extreme temperatures (90°C) under normal usage, which can lead to device damage or safety risks and renders the device unusable in practical scenarios.

rows.Title: Bixby not working

rows.Summarized Problem: Bixby is not functioning on the Galaxy A56 5G device.

rows.R&D Comment: Users must wait a week for personal data to be cleared before re-enabling Bixby; if issues persist, further investigation is needed.

rows.Title: Charging stop working
rows.Problem: Charging issue after updating to One UI 7.0 on Galaxy M14 5G. Original Samsung 25W adapter and cables no longer charge the device. Troubleshooting steps: cleaned charging port, tried different cables and adapters, rebooted and force restarted.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device no longer charges after updating to One UI 7.0, indicating a hardware fault in the USB connector.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to charge, rendering it unusable for basic functionality, and the issue is linked to hardware damage.
rows.R&D Comment: Shorts detected in USB connector pins indicate hardware damage; recommend service center inspection and repair.

rows.Title: Pause PD charging is greyed out
rows.Problem: The phone is connected to a 32W (PD3.0 PPS supported) adapter but the pause PD charging is greyed out
rows.Summarized Problem: The pause PD charging function is greyed out when connected to a 32W PD3.0 adapter.
rows.Severity Reason: The function is completely unavailable, preventing user from pausing PD charging, which is a core feature of power management.
rows.R&D Comment: The terminal recognizes the TA as the charger of the FPDO Type, causing the "pause PD" function to be disabled due to PD communication protocol behavior.

rows.Title: Galaxy Wear doesn't show the super wide band speech feature
rows.Problem: Galaxy Wear doesn't show the super wide band speech feature with Galaxy Buds 3 Pro in advanced settings, while other devices like Fold and Flip series do have it. Using an S23
rows.Summarized Problem: Galaxy Wear does not display the super wide band speech feature when paired with Galaxy Buds 3 Pro on Galaxy S23.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing in settings but works on other devices, indicating a device-specific limitation rather than a complete malfunction.
rows.R&D Comment: The Galaxy S23 does not support the super wide band speech feature, so it is not shown in Galaxy Wear. Users should use S25 or Z Fold 6 instead.

rows.Title: Wrong Storage and Memory Capacity
rows.Problem: Phone shows 32GB storage and 2GB RAM instead of actual 512GB storage and 12GB RAM
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone incorrectly displays storage and memory capacity, showing 32GB instead of 512GB and 2GB instead of 12GB RAM.
rows.Severity Reason: The discrepancy is a display issue, not affecting device functionality or usability.
rows.R&D Comment: This is a Wearable Device Care screen showing wearable specs; phone Device Care storage and memory is correctly displayed. The issue is likely due to screen context misinterpretation, not a system bug.

rows.Title: Audio delay when using any application

rows.Title: Home screen went black when going to the home screen from an app

rows.Title: Phone is not recognizing the sim1 properly and it keeps getting on and off
rows.Problem: Mobile network settings and sim card is automatically changing again and again and popup shown no sim card. This is happening after the latest system software update on 4th august. This is happening frequently that sim settings are changed. Phone is not recognizing the sim1 properly and it keeps getting on and off.

rows.Title: Takes a lot of time to refine the picture

rows.Title: WhatsApp video call unable to switch to back camera

rows.Title: Camera Mode not showing in more option
