rows.Title: Galaxy Watch 8 classic showing wrong sleep time
rows.Problem: Galaxy Watch 8 classic showing wrong sleep time. Device shows sleeping period from 12:30 to 5:29 am when user was not sleeping, and walking data confirms activity during that time. This error occurs frequently.
rows.Summarized Problem: Galaxy Watch 8 classic incorrectly identifies sleep periods, showing sleeping data during active times when the user was walking.
rows.Severity Reason: The device falsely records sleep during active periods, leading to inaccurate health data and potentially misleading user behavior insights.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Light sensor not working
rows.Problem: Light sensor doesn't work. It may work for one hour after restart as reported by other users. The auto brightness also doesn't work, making it frustrating to use in daylight. Users have to find dimmer places to adjust brightness and see in daylight. Please fix this with an update.
rows.Summarized Problem: The light sensor is not functioning properly, causing auto brightness to fail and making it difficult to adjust screen brightness in daylight.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents normal device usage in daylight conditions, requiring users to manually adjust brightness in inconvenient locations.
rows.R&D Comment: The light sensor's Data Ready is suspected to be malfunctioning; a sample is required for accurate analysis, and hardware inspection may be needed if the issue persists after reboot.

rows.Title: myExcitel is always crashing
rows.Problem: The attached application myExcitel is always crashing and giving the attached error
rows.Summarized Problem: The myExcitel market app is consistently crashing.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes repeatedly, making it unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Low Camera Image quality
rows.Problem: Images captured on multiple devices including S22, S24, and Moto G85 are soft compared to other models, even in manual mode with infinite focus. Professional photographer confirms issue persists. Chinese phone with similar specs captures sharper images. Service center reports waiting for updates, but problem continues after multiple updates.
rows.Summarized Problem: Camera captures soft images even in manual mode with infinite focus, significantly worse than other models and other devices, despite updates and professional testing.
rows.Severity Reason: Images are soft and inconsistent across devices, even under optimal settings, affecting professional use and user experience, indicating a fundamental malfunction in image capture.
rows.R&D Comment: If the issue occurs in all scenes and persists without Magsafe case, hardware OIS malfunction may be present; recommend module swap at service center if shaking is reproduced after VDIS OFF.

rows.Title: No apps showing in wear app
rows.Problem: App not installing on Galaxy Watch
rows.Summarized Problem: Galaxy Watch app installation is failing, preventing apps from being installed or displayed.
rows.Severity Reason: The device cannot install or show apps, making the wearable functionality unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Error in joining ui 8 beta programme
rows.Problem: When i click on join button it shows that 'if you have any promblem then contact us on support section' and failed to join the beta programme
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot join the beta programme due to an error message appearing when clicking the join button.
rows.Severity Reason: The function partially fails, preventing successful participation but does not cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Error occurs while try to join BETA
rows.Problem: When I click join this message appears and nothing happens. I cannot join because I don't have an Indian SIM, which I heard is required.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot join the BETA program due to a requirement of an Indian SIM, which is not available to them.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents access to a feature (BETA) but does not cause device crash or data loss; it is a conditional requirement issue.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Recording at 60 fps, but videos are saved at lesser fps
rows.Problem: Recording at 60 fps, but videos are saved at lesser fps (30, 56). Please check attached logs and video. This is after the latest OS Upgrade.
rows.Summarized Problem: Videos recorded at 60 fps are being saved at lower frame rates such as 30 or 56 fps.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to maintain intended frame rate during recording, resulting in degraded video quality and potential user dissatisfaction.
rows.R&D Comment: Attatched log file do not have camx info/config logs to check this issue. Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: WiFi, Bluetooth and hotspot nothing is working
rows.Problem: WiFi, Bluetooth and hotspot are not working despite user having tried all settings options.
rows.Summarized Problem: WiFi, Bluetooth, and hotspot functions are not working on the device.
rows.Severity Reason: The device's network functions are completely non-functional, preventing basic connectivity and usability.
rows.R&D Comment: The cnss is not powering up properly; recommend checking with a swapped Wi-Fi card and guiding the customer to an SC center for diagnosis.

rows.Title: Video stabilisation not properly working
rows.Problem: Phone's video stabilisation is not properly working after UI 7 update
rows.Summarized Problem: Video stabilisation is not working properly after the UI 7 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is not functioning correctly but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: can't connect to some websites/apps including popular ones such as Reddit, X, Clash Royale etc.
rows.Problem: Mobile data works initially but after 2-3 days, some websites and apps like Reddit, X, Clash Royale fail to connect. Resetting mobile network settings restores connectivity. This issue occurs on both OneUI 6 and OneUI 7.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users experience intermittent connectivity failures with popular websites and apps after a few days, requiring manual reset of mobile network settings to restore access.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents normal device usage of essential apps and websites, leading to functional disruption and user frustration, despite working connectivity initially.
rows.R&D Comment: Weak signal quality and high BLER values indicate a potential hardware or signal processing defect; further investigation needed to confirm root cause and validate hardware defects via CP logs.

rows.Title: Camera not working
rows.Problem: Camera not working, screen black
rows.Summarized Problem: The front camera is not functioning and the screen appears black.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to display the screen and camera functionality is completely missing, making the device unusable for basic operations.
rows.R&D Comment: Hardware failure in the front camera sensor (S5K3L6) detected; recommend hardware analysis at service center.

rows.Title: Picture colors have significantly faded
rows.Problem: Picture colors have significantly faded. Although the last security update improved the front camera quality, the colors are still not as good as they used to be in the beginning.
rows.Summarized Problem: The picture colors have significantly faded after recent updates, affecting visual quality.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visual quality but does not cause device crash or complete failure, and is not fully resolved despite a recent update.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Not able to read the text of Notification Panel in Dark Mode
rows.Problem: The notification text is not readable in dark mode, but is visible in light mode.
rows.Summarized Problem: Notification text is not readable in dark mode, though it is visible in light mode.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects readability in dark mode but does not prevent device usage or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is likely related to dark mode UI rendering; software update may resolve it.

rows.Title: Device getting Heatup while charge
rows.Problem: Device overheats while charging, even with no apps running or high usage, such as no gaming or meta apps. Heating occurs only during charging, not otherwise.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device overheats when charging, even with no heavy usage or apps running.
rows.Severity Reason: Overheating during charging occurs under normal usage conditions, which is a partial malfunction affecting user experience but does not cause device failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Overheating during charging is attributed to booting-related performance load; thermal management system is functioning as designed.

rows.Title: Emergency call only appears
rows.Problem: Device keeps prompting to repeat steps despite user already trying them and sending logs
rows.Summarized Problem: The device repeatedly prompts users to repeat steps when attempting to make emergency calls, despite already being tried.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to allow emergency calls to function properly, which is critical for user safety and device usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Poor RF signal causes device to fail in receiving network service; user needs to visit service center for RF check.

rows.Title: Not able to open Excel in Dex mode
rows.Problem: Not able to open Excel in Dex mode unless app data is cleared
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot open Excel in Dex mode without clearing app data.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes unusable for Excel functionality without manual data clearing, indicating a major functional failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: searching for contact and tapping it calls wrong contact
rows.Problem: contact application fails to search correctly and when a contact is tapped, it calls a different, wrong contact instead of the intended one, especially after the recent update to UI 7 and Android 15.
rows.Summarized Problem: The contact search function is incorrect, causing the app to call a different, wrong contact when a user taps on a search result.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue leads to incorrect calls, which can result in user confusion and potential privacy or communication errors, making the feature unusable for intended functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Island application not functioning on Samsung Galaxy A14
rows.Problem: The Island application is not functioning on my Samsung Galaxy A14 device. I have attempted all basic troubleshooting steps including reinstalling the application, clearing cache and data, and checking permissions, but the problem persists. The work profile fails to set up and cloned applications do not launch as expected.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Island application fails to function on Samsung Galaxy A14, with work profile setup and cloned app launching also failing.
rows.Severity Reason: The application fails to launch and work profile setup is broken, rendering core functionality unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: This issue belongs to a third-party application. The app owner should investigate and fix the defect; no root cause is identifiable in the device-side code.

rows.Title: Contact not functioning
rows.Problem: Contact application is not functioning after the last system update. No use despite following the process.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Contacts application is not functioning after a recent system update.
rows.Severity Reason: The application fails to start due to a database initialization failure, rendering the Contacts feature unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Contact database size has grown significantly, preventing initial initialization. Countermeasure: Users can clear contact and call log storage, but this will erase all related data; backup recommended.

rows.Title: Fingerprint not working
rows.Problem: fingerprint not working after updating. Screen got blur after updating to latest security patch.
rows.Summarized Problem: Fingerprint authentication is not working after a system update, and the screen appears blurred.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of a core security feature after an update, but the screen blur is secondary and not critical to device usability.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is unclear from logs; reproduction and detailed logs with screenshots are needed for analysis.

rows.Title: App size inside the suggested app widget become smaller
rows.Problem: App size in the suggested app widget is smaller, caused by forcibly sideloading an updated version; user requests default version for SM-A346E
rows.Summarized Problem: The app size in the suggested app widget is incorrectly reduced after a forced sideload of an updated version.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects widget appearance but does not cause device malfunction or data loss; functionality remains partially operational.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Icons do not fully change according to the set display theme
rows.Problem: Cx facing icons do not fully change according to the display theme
rows.Summarized Problem: Icons do not fully change when the display theme is set.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction of icon appearance under theme changes, affecting user experience but not rendering the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: The dark mode on/off functionality works normally in the latest version; updating software may resolve the issue.

rows.Title: Camera takes very dark images
rows.Problem: Camera takes very dark images even after motherboard change
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera produces very dark images even after motherboard replacement.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of image output, which affects user experience but does not cause device failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is likely due to sensor calibration or exposure settings; recommended solution is to guide users to use EV control menu.

rows.Title: Unable to create double whatsapp business app
rows.Problem: Unable to create double whatsapp business app and other apps. Current OS does not support dual app creation for WhatsApp Business. Users can only use Secure Folder as workaround.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot create a second instance of WhatsApp Business, as the system does not support dual app creation for this app.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial limitation in app functionality, as users are restricted from creating dual instances of WhatsApp Business, but a workaround exists via Secure Folder.
rows.R&D Comment: Dual app creation is currently limited to whitelisted apps; WhatsApp Business is not included. Future OS versions may consider support for this feature, with users advised to use Secure Folder as a workaround.

rows.Title: Suggested apps widget is not working
rows.Problem: Suggested apps widget is not working. I have tried resetting system settings. But still does not work. Please check and let me know what settings is blocking this feature. Attaching screenshot and a small recording to show same apps are suggested even after cleaning up cache and data of the app.
rows.Summarized Problem: The suggested apps widget is not functioning properly despite attempts to reset system settings and clear app cache.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of a feature that is not fully working after user actions, but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Cant install WhatsApp messenger
rows.Problem: Cant install whatsapp messenger
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot install the WhatsApp messenger app due to an outdated version conflict.
rows.Severity Reason: The installation fails due to version mismatch, preventing users from installing a required app, which is essential for communication.
rows.R&D Comment: Installation error caused by outdated app version; countermeasure is to clear data of previous version and retry installation.

rows.Title: Camera failed suddenly after update
rows.Problem: Front camera failed
rows.Summarized Problem: The front camera has suddenly stopped working after a software update.
rows.Severity Reason: The front camera is completely non-functional, preventing basic device usage.
rows.R&D Comment: This is a hardware defect in the camera sensor module; customers should be guided to an official Samsung CS center for hardware inspection and repair.

rows.Title: Outlook app crashes
rows.Problem: Outlook app crashes once in while
rows.Summarized Problem: The Microsoft Outlook app crashes intermittently.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes intermittently, which prevents users from using the application effectively, leading to device usability issues.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Photo Assist AI is creating images which are not similar to the image
rows.Problem: Photo Assist AI in Portrait Studio is creating images that are not similar to the input image, especially when face is covered. The AI fails to maintain image similarity as expected.
rows.Summarized Problem: Photo Assist AI in Portrait Studio generates images that do not match the input image, particularly when a face is covered.
rows.Severity Reason: The AI fails to maintain image similarity, leading to inconsistent outputs, but the device remains usable and core functions are not disrupted.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue arises due to generative AI model limitations when detecting covered faces; countermeasure involves improving AI style generation while preserving input image shape and composition.

rows.Title: unable to transfer data via Smart Switch
rows.Problem: Smart Switch app not showing QR code to transfer data when attempting data transfer
rows.Summarized Problem: The Smart Switch app fails to display a QR code during data transfer, preventing users from transferring data between devices.
rows.Severity Reason: The absence of a QR code prevents data transfer, which is a core functionality, making the device unusable for this use case.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Old version of Smart Switch app installed on receiving device. Countermeasure: Update to latest app version (v3.7.64.10) on receiving device; if issue persists, collect logs from both devices.

rows.Title: Drawing circle in Notes app
rows.Problem: When trying to draw a circle, a straight line forms in between. Words also break in between.
rows.Summarized Problem: When drawing a circle in the Notes app, a straight line appears instead, and text breaks mid-word.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes incorrect drawing and text fragmentation, making content creation unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Camera is continuously shaking rapidly only in 1x while taking photo and video
rows.Problem: In 1x while moving the phone camera is continuously shaking rapidly only in 1x while taking photo and video
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera continuously shakes rapidly when using 1x zoom during photo and video recording.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes instability during use but does not prevent full functionality or cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Customer feedback indicates normal video appearance; suggested verification via side-by-side recording and dumpstate to confirm issue origin.

rows.Title: Samsung Wallet not working
rows.Problem: Samsung Wallet is not working. Tried all listed solutions, uninstalling Play Services and Play Store updates did not work.
rows.Summarized Problem: Samsung Wallet is not functioning despite attempts to resolve via system updates and service resets.
rows.Severity Reason: The app fails to work despite multiple troubleshooting steps, indicating a core service failure that prevents user functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: This is a problem with the Google push service used by Samsung Wallet; connection between smartphone's Google push service and Google server is abnormal. Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Video not able to play
rows.Problem: Video not able to play which is taken from meta Ai glases, it's showing error codec not supported. Please go through attached screen record and resolve this issue ASAP.
rows.Summarized Problem: The video captured from Meta AI glasses fails to play due to a codec not supported error.
rows.Severity Reason: The video playback fails entirely with a clear error, preventing user from viewing content captured via device.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause and countermeasure both indicate that log extraction is delayed, and playback traces are missing; ensure logs are captured immediately after reproduction.

rows.Title: Wi-Fi turn on causes green screen and restart
rows.Problem: Each time Wi-Fi is turned on, the phone shows a green screen and restarts. This issue started after the recent update.
rows.Summarized Problem: Turning on Wi-Fi causes the phone to display a green screen and restart.
rows.Severity Reason: The device crashes and restarts upon Wi-Fi activation, rendering it unusable during the process.
rows.R&D Comment: There is no response from the firmware for mm start; WLBT fails to initialize. Customer should be guided to a CS center for hardware/firmware diagnosis.

rows.Title: Gmail application and widgets get stuck in loading
rows.Problem: Gmail application and widgets get stuck in loading every 2 to 3 days. Earlier, just removing application from recents or force stopping used to work which still works for the application, but the widget requires deleting all the widgets to make it work.
rows.Summarized Problem: Gmail application and widgets get stuck in loading every 2 to 3 days, requiring force stop or widget deletion to resolve.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a persistent failure in Gmail functionality, impacting user experience and requiring manual intervention to restore basic operation.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Security exception when attempting to access Google API service; Countermeasure: Request CP silent logs for deeper analysis.

rows.Title: Wallpaper automatically changed to the previous one
rows.Problem: The wallpaper automatically reverts to a previous wallpaper chosen months ago, even after deletion. This occurs on both lockscreen and homescreen, and the dynamic wallpaper feature is not enabled.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device automatically reverts to a previously selected wallpaper on both lockscreen and homescreen, even after deletion.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes inconsistent wallpaper display but does not render the device unusable or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Custom cursor not working in tab
rows.Problem: Custom cursor appears correctly on home screen but reverts to default dot in certain apps like Samsung Notes.
rows.Summarized Problem: The custom cursor feature fails to remain active in specific apps, reverting to default after opening apps like Samsung Notes.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects functionality in specific apps but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: MyFiles app keeps crashing every time
rows.Problem: MyFiles app keeps crashing every time, upon trying to move files to Secure folder.
rows.Summarized Problem: The MyFiles app crashes repeatedly when attempting to move files to the Secure folder.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes every time during a critical file operation, making it unusable for users.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: One UI Home keeps crashing
rows.Problem: One UI Home keeps crashing or becomes unresponsive, especially after closing apps. The device often lags or freezes, making it impossible to restart or power off until it responds again.
rows.Summarized Problem: One UI Home crashes and becomes unresponsive after closing apps, causing device freezes and making restart or power off difficult.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes and causes device to freeze, making it impossible to restart or power off, severely impacting usability.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by a third-party app (RailOne) crashing, and the countermeasure is to have the third-party app side investigate and resolve the defect.

rows.Title: Display working automatically and sometimes get blank
rows.Problem: Screen blank automatically after update
rows.Summarized Problem: The display occasionally turns blank after an update, causing screen visibility issues.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes intermittent screen blanking, which affects usability but does not render the device completely unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: keyboard disconnects intermittently
rows.Problem: samsung tab s9 ultra original keyboard disconnects intermittently, leading to repeated keystrokes and other disruptions. the problem stops only if touchpad is turned off. i have tried all the solutions posted online and on members community. softwear is up to date, cache cleared, restart the tablet, safe mode, reset keyboard settings. nothing is resolving the issue. this ultra tablet with expensive keyboard is turning my life hell. i have reported the issue before, but no one seems to care
rows.Summarized Problem: The physical keyboard on the Samsung Tab S9 Ultra disconnects intermittently, causing repeated keystrokes and disrupting usability, and only stops when the touchpad is disabled.
rows.Severity Reason: The keyboard disconnects intermittently, leading to repeated keystrokes and disruption of core functionality, making the device unusable for basic tasks.
rows.R&D Comment: S/W side suspects keyboard/Tablet contact problem. If possible, please swap test with other good working keyboard. The problem symptoms follow the issued keyboard, indicating it may be a single item defect. A detailed analysis is required, and the issued keyboard needs to be sent for testing.

rows.Title: Samsung keyboard crash
rows.Problem: Samsung keyboard crashing after latest security update, unable to use completely
rows.Summarized Problem: The Samsung keyboard crashes after a security update, making it completely unusable.
rows.Severity Reason: The keyboard is completely crashed and unusable, preventing basic device functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: System not responding
rows.Problem: System not responding
rows.Summarized Problem: The system is not responding, causing user interface issues.
rows.Severity Reason: The system failing to respond renders the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: video calls not working as my camera freezes
rows.Problem: my camera freezes whenever I make a video call, other person cannot see me
rows.Summarized Problem: The front camera freezes during video calls, preventing the other party from seeing the user.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera freezes during video calls, resulting in the other party being unable to see the user, making communication ineffective.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: 5g is not working
rows.Problem: network issue in phone 5g not working network automatically off
rows.Summarized Problem: 5G connectivity is not working and the network automatically turns off.
rows.Severity Reason: The network automatically turns off, preventing 5G usage, which renders a key communication feature unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Camera image blur on primary lens after update
rows.Problem: The upper part of images in camera from primary lens gets blurred automatically after last updated. Most of the times the image gets blurred of its own and its too frustrating
rows.Summarized Problem: Images taken with the primary camera lens are blurring on the upper portion after the latest software update.
rows.Severity Reason: The blurring affects image quality significantly and occurs consistently, making photos unusable and impacting core camera functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue may be caused by AF motor malfunction due to prolonged vibration and physical stress; further investigation needed.

rows.Title: Games icons are not move automatically in the game launcher
rows.Problem: Games icons are not move automatically in the game launcher
rows.Summarized Problem: Game icons do not move automatically in the game launcher.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of a functional element in the game launcher, preventing automatic icon movement but not rendering the interface unusable or causing data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: clock size gets reduced automatically
rows.Problem: when reading a PDF file in landscape mode and locking the phone, the clock size on the lock screen and AOD display reduces automatically
rows.Summarized Problem: The clock size automatically reduces when the phone is locked after reading a PDF in landscape mode.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of the clock display under specific usage conditions, but does not prevent device operation or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: night mode of camera app not working properly
rows.Problem: The night mode of the camera app makes images black and dull when taking photos of humans, especially in low light conditions.
rows.Summarized Problem: The night mode in the camera app produces black and dull images when capturing human faces in low light.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of the night mode function, resulting in degraded image quality but does not render the app unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Logs appear fine; no comparison data between old and new UI available. Request for comparison data between old and new UI to identify root cause.

rows.Title: battery protection at maximum (85%) but charging stops at 84%
rows.Problem: Battery protection set to maximum (85%) but charging stops at 84% and only resumes when SOC drops to 83%.
rows.Summarized Problem: Battery protection is set to 85% but charging stops at 84%, only resuming when SOC drops to 83%.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction in charging behavior, not full device failure or data loss, but affects user experience during charging.
rows.R&D Comment: Charging stops at 85% and resumes when SOC drops to 83%, which is normal behavior as per logs and user confirmation.

rows.Title: Digital Wellbeing PIN bypass and missing lock on app launch
rows.Problem: The Digital Wellbeing parental PIN can be bypassed, and the app does not require authentication to open. Even if a PIN is set to restrict app timer changes, anyone can modify the "Excluded Apps" list without entering a PIN and add all apps to the excluded list.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users can bypass the parental PIN and access Digital Wellbeing without authentication, allowing unauthorized modification of app exclusion settings.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue allows unauthorized users to fully manipulate parental controls, compromising device security and privacy.
rows.R&D Comment: Support for PIN input in Excluded Apps entry is being implemented and will be available in a market update at the end of October.

rows.Title: Slow networks
rows.Problem: Network issue on Samsung S23 FE; device has very slow network speeds compared to other devices on the same network, with significantly fewer network bands (15-20K) and poor 5G performance, even among Samsung S series devices.
rows.Summarized Problem: Samsung S23 FE experiences significantly slower network speeds and fewer network bands compared to other devices on the same network, including other Samsung devices.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to achieve normal 5G speeds and network band support, resulting in poor connectivity and performance that affects daily usage.
rows.R&D Comment: Provide CP silent logs for the issue to investigate root cause and network band support limitations.

rows.Title: Camera performance has degraded
rows.Problem: Severe camera performance degradation after One UI 7.0 update, including oversaturation, color imbalance, autofocus issues, inconsistent portrait mode, and video jitters.
rows.Summarized Problem: Camera performance has significantly degraded after the One UI 7.0 update, with issues in color accuracy, autofocus, portrait mode, and video stability.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera functions are severely impaired, with visible degradation in image quality and stability, affecting core usability of the camera feature.
rows.R&D Comment: Changes in sensor handling and upscaling may cause color saturation and focus inconsistencies; further investigation needed.

rows.Title: Can't receiving or sending RCS messages in Samsung Message Application
rows.Problem: RCS is not working in Samsung Message App, using only Carrier SMS instead. It works in Google Message but not in Samsung Message App. App data cleared and device restarted, but issue persists.
rows.Summarized Problem: RCS messaging fails in Samsung Message App while working in Google Message.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely non-functional in the primary messaging app, preventing users from using modern RCS capabilities on the device.
rows.R&D Comment: B OS Ver 16 is already planned for this model. Kindly help share behavior on B OS. If reproduced, pls report PLM accordingly.

rows.Title: ringtone and notification sound not changed after ONE UI7 update
rows.Problem: ringtone and notification sound not changed after ONE UI7 update
rows.Summarized Problem: The ringtone and notification sound settings are not updating after the ONE UI7 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The sound settings fail to update post-update, affecting user experience but does not cause device malfunction or crash.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Watch is still in emergency calls only
rows.Problem: After cancelling and re-registering an airtel postpaid eSIM plan, the watch is still in emergency calls only despite confirmation that regular calling and texting should be available from 02/09/2025 at 4.30pm.
rows.Summarized Problem: The watch remains in emergency calls only mode after successful eSIM re-registration, preventing normal calling and texting functionality.
rows.Severity Reason: The device cannot perform regular calls or texts, rendering a core communication function unavailable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Routine is not working
rows.Problem: Routine is not working properly. Mobile data remains on during charging even when set to off. Same issue occurs when charge is full. Sound mode also shows inconsistent behavior.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device's routine feature fails to properly disable mobile data and sound mode during charging, resulting in inconsistent behavior.
rows.Severity Reason: The routine function does not consistently apply settings during charging, leading to partial malfunction in expected behavior.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Unable to Login Unidays ID in phone
rows.Problem: User has a previous UNIDAYS ID linked to an email that expired, and a new ID is created. During purchase, the Samsung account shows error 'DuplicateUserPhone' indicating the phone number is already associated with a store. Unidays says the old email's account must be deregistered from Samsung. The phone number remains linked to the previous UNIDAYS/store account, causing conflict.
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone number is still linked to a previous UNIDAYS account, causing a duplicate phone error when trying to register a new UNIDAYS ID on Samsung Store.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a purchase failure during a specific flow but does not crash or make the device unusable; it is a partial malfunction due to residual account linkage.
rows.R&D Comment: The phone number remains linked to a previous UNIDAYS/store account, causing a conflict during registration. Provide user details and ask UNidays to confirm removal of old account linkage.

rows.Title: Steps counted during running is very less
rows.Problem: Steps counted during running is very less. It is nearly half of what it should be. Error report already attached. Two screenshots of today's run vs run in June is attached. Cx facing Samsung health app issue
rows.Summarized Problem: The step counting feature during running is significantly inaccurate, showing only about half the expected steps.
rows.Severity Reason: The step count is substantially off but not completely broken, affecting accuracy rather than device usability or core functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Step counting accuracy is affected when the phone is not held close to the body during running; further investigation needed to validate cadence data and sensor calibration.

rows.Title: 5g switching to 4g
rows.Problem: 5g switching to 4s when app openings, youtube playing, downloading. Occurring due to thermal throttling set for network switching at very low temperature. If cannot use 5g data in youtube or downloading, then why buy 5g phone. This problem facing all people using f14 5g model, a23 other many models. Want to stop thermal throttling for network switching.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device switches from 5G to 4G during normal usage, such as app opening, YouTube playback, and downloads, due to thermal throttling at low temperatures.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents full use of 5G data, rendering the 5G feature ineffective during core usage scenarios, which undermines the primary benefit of a 5G phone.
rows.R&D Comment: Provide CP silent logs for the issue to investigate thermal throttling behavior during network switching.

rows.Title: In 50 mp camera mode it makes skin tone red
rows.Problem: In 50 mp camera mode it makes skin tone red and in portrait mode in any lens edge detection is very poor after changing settings like intelligent optimisation reset camera and restart phone etc and details ain't coming awfully experience bought samsung again after 3.5 years again and paid the flagship price but what the hell is this too much disappointed shifting to iPhone again it might not have telephoto lens or 120 hz but camera quality feels like flagship from both lens
rows.Summarized Problem: The 50MP camera mode causes incorrect skin tone coloring and poor edge detection in portrait mode, leading to a degraded user experience.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects core camera functionality—skin tone accuracy and edge detection—which directly impacts user experience and image quality, especially in critical scenarios like portrait photography.
rows.R&D Comment: The 50MP mode uses AI-based image processing, which may result in temporary color shifts and edge detection inaccuracies; further investigation is needed to validate the AI processing behavior and its impact on skin tone and edge detection.

rows.Title: E-SIM receiving calls and messages after being turned off
rows.Problem: Despite deactivating my second SIM, I am still receiving calls and messages. The eSIM is inactive, yet I am still receiving calls and messages on that number.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users are receiving calls and messages on an inactive eSIM despite it being turned off.
rows.Severity Reason: The device is receiving calls and messages on a deactivated eSIM, which indicates a critical malfunction in SIM handling that affects core network functionality and user experience.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue occurs because calls are routed to the pSIM instead of being blocked when eSIM is disabled; the system fails to correctly handle inactive eSIM states.

rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Data roaming was established. Samsung Switch to Mobile data feature would not work in case of data roaming to avoid unexpected charge.

rows.Title: Unable to change modes
rows.Problem: Modes and routines issue
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot change device modes due to a null pointer exception in metadata loading.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a crash in mode switching, preventing users from changing device modes, which is a core functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Camera flickers

rows.Summarized Problem: The camera exhibits flickering at 0.6x zoom level.
rows.Severity Reason: The flickering prevents proper camera functionality and may lead to inconsistent image capture, rendering the feature unusable at specific zoom levels.
rows.R&D Comment: UV Damper peeling and misalignment cause AF position error; improved jig and OVS inspection will mitigate the issue.

rows.Title: Issues observed in phone app
rows.Problem: No such option as 'Dual Clock' on lockscreen. Unknown calls still occur despite blocking unknown numbers, which was previously working.
rows.Summarized Problem: The 'Dual Clock' feature is missing on the lockscreen, and users are still receiving unknown calls despite having blocked them.
rows.Severity Reason: Users are experiencing a major malfunction in call blocking and a missing feature on the lockscreen, which directly impacts core functionality and user trust.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: App not processing google command

rows.Summarized Problem: The app is not processing Google commands.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of app command processing, affecting functionality but not rendering the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Camera issue
rows.Problem: Camera not working as it should be. Pictures are blurry and pixel broken. Issue persists despite multiple complaints
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera produces blurry and pixelated images, especially in low-light conditions, due to hand tremors and small sensor pixel size in 2x mode.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of camera functionality, with degraded image quality but does not prevent full operation or cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The blurriness and pixelation are caused by hand tremors and small sensor pixel size in 2x mode; using 1x camera in low light improves image quality.

rows.Title: Battery drain
rows.Problem: Battery life shows hours on my phone while friend's shows days. Is this normal or a concern?
rows.Summarized Problem: User reports inconsistent battery life display, showing hours instead of days, raising concern about normality or underlying battery performance issues.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a display inconsistency rather than a device crash or major malfunction, but it raises user concern about battery performance.
rows.R&D Comment: Insufficient information about actual battery consumption; only 7% used in one hour reported, with no abnormal behavior observed during use.

rows.Title: Issues with enable disable button of eye comfort shield
rows.Problem: The enable disable button of the eye comfort shield settings doesn't have any animation. When pressed, the slider just instantly changes position unlike any other slider which has a slight animation of changing position. I have checked and my animations were all on. To check, I compared it side by side with other window and it turns out that there's a defect in the software. I've attached a screen recording for reference. Hope it gets fixed in the next update.
rows.Summarized Problem: The enable and disable button for the eye comfort shield lacks animation and responds instantly instead of smoothly, indicating a software defect.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects user experience by lacking visual feedback, but does not prevent device operation or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Battery drain
rows.Problem: The battery drains very fast without heavy usage. After the oneUI 7 update, screen on time dropped from over one hour at 10% battery to only 40 minutes.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences rapid battery drain after the oneUI 7 update, reducing screen-on time from over one hour to only 40 minutes.
rows.Severity Reason: The battery drains rapidly under normal usage, which significantly reduces device usability and operational time.
rows.R&D Comment: Background app activity increased after the oneUI 7 update; reducing app background tasks in battery settings can help mitigate the issue.

rows.R&D Comment: Out-of-focus and grainy footage are caused by high ISO and 60fps recording; suggest adjusting recording settings to 30fps or lower ISO to improve image quality.

rows.Title: Gallery people and pets issue

rows.Title: System heats up and goes in restart loop

rows.Severity Reason: The hotspot function becomes completely inoperative after repeated use, rendering a key connectivity feature unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: PCIE interface between AP and WLAN Chipset is unstable; requires hardware inspection and customer center visit.

rows.R&D Comment: The conflict between high efficiency video and high bitrate settings is due to bitrate reduction; both options cannot be enabled at once, though Galaxy S24+ supports HEVC with high bitrate recording.

rows.Title: Wireless Android Auto not working properly
rows.Problem: Wireless Android Auto is not working properly. Music plays like scratched CD. Map freezes and unable to take calls. No issue with wired Android Auto.
rows.Summarized Problem: Wireless Android Auto fails to function properly, causing music playback issues, map freezing, and inability to take calls, while wired Android Auto works normally.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature fails to function properly, leading to critical usability issues such as map freezing and inability to take calls, rendering the device unusable for key driving functions.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Facebook closes as soon as it is launched
rows.Problem: Facebook not working after One UI 8 update
rows.Summarized Problem: Facebook app crashes immediately upon launch after the One UI 8 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes on launch, making it unusable for users.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue occurs in the PasskeyService component of the Facebook app; root cause is outside Samsung's control as it is a third-party app developed by META.

rows.Title: Now Brief not shown on lock screen
rows.Problem: I am unable to see now brief on my lock screen
rows.Summarized Problem: The Now Brief is not displayed on the lock screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing from the lock screen, preventing users from seeing the Now Brief, which is a core part of the lock screen experience but not fully absent or causing device failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Camera stutters in auto focus and macro mode
rows.Problem: Auto focus and macro mode are not working properly
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera's auto focus and macro mode are not working properly, causing stutters during operation.
rows.Severity Reason: Auto focus and macro mode are essential functions; their failure results in device usability issues and impaired user experience.
rows.R&D Comment: UV damper separation due to improper assembly causes AF oscillation errors; improved jig and OVS inspection will mitigate the issue.

rows.Title: Slide to typing is not working in Samsung keyboard
rows.Problem: Slide to typing is not working in Samsung keyboard
rows.Summarized Problem: The slide to typing feature is not working in the Samsung keyboard.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely non-functional, preventing user interaction with the keyboard.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Filters missing from portrait video in camera
rows.Problem: Portrait video filters such as Color Point and High-Key Mono are missing, even after the stable One UI 8 update, despite being available on previous Galaxy S Series phones with UI7.
rows.Summarized Problem: Portrait video filters are missing in the camera app on the Galaxy S25 Ultra, despite being available on earlier Galaxy S Series models.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely absent in a core camera function, preventing users from accessing a key visual enhancement, making the experience significantly degraded.
rows.R&D Comment: The absence of portrait video filters is due to a design decision to simplify the feature set; no change is planned, and the issue is effectively a feature removal rather than a bug.

rows.Title: Animated clock does not appear on AOD
rows.Problem: After the latest One UI 8 update, the animated clock does not appear on the Always On Display, showing only a basic, non-animated clock instead.
rows.Summarized Problem: The animated clock fails to display on the Always On Display after the One UI 8 update, showing only a basic, non-animated clock.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects a core visual feature of the display but does not render the device unusable or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Camera lens not focusing properly
rows.Problem: The camera lens is not focusing properly. The lens mechanism keeps adjusting and the back area of the phone heats up significantly. This issue has been occurring since July. Attached screen recording and logs of the last 10 minutes.
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera lens fails to focus correctly and continuously adjusts, causing instability and overheating in the phone's back area.
rows.Severity Reason: The lens focus malfunction leads to inconsistent image capture and potential device overheating, rendering the camera function unreliable and unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: UV Damper peeling and improper assembly cause focus instability; improved jig and OVS inspection will mitigate the issue.

rows.Title: Chat setting option is greyed out
rows.Problem: I can't open message Chat setting
rows.Summarized Problem: The chat setting option is greyed out and cannot be accessed to open message settings.
rows.Severity Reason: The user cannot access a specific setting, which partially limits functionality but does not render the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Quick Panel background becomes transparent when switching between dark and light modes
rows.Problem: The notification panel becomes completely transparent when switching from light mode to dark mode, causing it to overlap the home screen during use.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Quick Panel becomes completely transparent when switching from light to dark mode, causing it to overlap the home screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes visual overlap and usability disruption during mode switching, but does not result in device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Back navigation is not working
rows.Problem: Back navigation is not working while on call screen
rows.Summarized Problem: Back navigation does not work when on a call screen.
rows.Severity Reason: Users cannot navigate back during calls, which may lead to loss of context or inability to exit calls, making the device operation unusable in that scenario.
rows.R&D Comment: Back navigation is not supported during calls; users should use home or recent app buttons to minimize calls instead.

rows.Title: Camera stutters at 0.6x
rows.Problem: Ultra wide lens 0.6x creates glitter and noise when viewing video
rows.Summarized Problem: The ultra wide lens at 0.6x on the camera produces visual noise and glitter during video viewing.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes visible noise and glitches in video, impairing image quality and usability of the camera function.
rows.R&D Comment: UV Damper peeling and misalignment cause driving force errors, leading to AF position instability; improved jig and OVS inspection will mitigate the issue.

rows.Title: Clock style not adjusting with wallpaper
rows.Problem: Clock style issue on lock screen
rows.Summarized Problem: The clock style on the lock screen does not adjust properly when the wallpaper changes.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects the visual consistency of the lock screen but does not prevent device operation or cause crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Lock Screen wallpaper shows black
rows.Problem: Lock screen wallpaper does not display correctly and shows black
rows.Summarized Problem: The lock screen wallpaper fails to display and shows only black.
rows.Severity Reason: The lock screen is a primary user interface element, and a black wallpaper renders the screen unusable and misleading.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Lockscreen shortcut outline visible when now bar is expanded
rows.Problem: Lock screen shortcuts outline present when expanding now bar
rows.Summarized Problem: The outline of lock screen shortcuts appears when the now bar is expanded.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a visual element during a functional interaction but does not prevent device usage or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Beta banner issue
rows.Problem: Samsung member showing beta banner after updating to latest UI 8.0. Leave beta tab is visible. Updated to latest software version. Need to know if leaving beta program and restoring device is required.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users see a beta banner and a leave beta tab after updating to UI 8.0, even after software update, and are unsure if leaving the beta program and restoring the device is necessary.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects user experience but does not cause device malfunction or data loss; users can still use the device normally, though they face confusion about required actions.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Blue hue seen while using camera
rows.Problem: Video with log file shows blue hue during camera use
rows.Summarized Problem: A blue hue appears in the camera preview under specific conditions.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue manifests during active camera use and involves visual distortion that could affect user experience and image quality, indicating a critical malfunction in real-time display.
rows.R&D Comment: AWB jump in preview mode under specific conditions; enable debug logs to capture sensor and exposure data for root cause analysis.

rows.Title: Volume drops to zero when connecting Type C wired earphone
rows.Problem: After updating to One UI 7.0, when connecting Samsung Type-C wired earphones, the phone volume automatically drops to zero every time earphones are plugged in.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device volume drops to zero every time a Type-C wired earphone is connected.
rows.Severity Reason: The volume drops to zero every time earphones are connected, making audio unusable during operation.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue occurs during USB headset connection; silent logs needed to confirm volume stream behavior.

rows.Title: Unable to find edge panel
rows.Problem: Edge panel setting is missing in display settings and cannot be accessed
rows.Summarized Problem: The edge panel setting is missing in the display settings and cannot be accessed.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing from the display settings, preventing users from accessing a standard UI element, but the device remains usable overall.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Scrolling has become slow
rows.Problem: hanging issue
rows.Summarized Problem: Scrolling has become slow and causes hanging issues.
rows.Severity Reason: The hanging issue during scrolling makes the device unusable and disrupts user interaction with the interface.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Device turns off frequently
rows.Problem: Device frequently restarts
rows.Summarized Problem: The device frequently restarts on its own.
rows.Severity Reason: The device restarting frequently makes it unusable and may lead to data loss or system instability.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: BT not connecting
rows.Problem: bluetooth connectivity issue
rows.Summarized Problem: Bluetooth is unable to connect to the device.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to establish Bluetooth connectivity, which is a core network function required for device operation.
rows.R&D Comment: Main PBA defect (BT/WIFI IC mounted) is suspected; physical unit analysis is required for confirmation.

rows.Title: Wifi calling not working
rows.Problem: Wi-fi calling option stopped working after security updates, though it previously worked for one year. Troubleshooting steps have been tried, and the feature works on another Samsung handset with the same SIM card but not on this device.
rows.Summarized Problem: WiFi calling is no longer functioning on the device after a security update, despite working previously and working on another Samsung device with the same SIM.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely non-functional after a security update, and the device cannot make calls via WiFi, rendering a key communication function unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: As per logs, no call activity was observed; further investigation required to identify root cause and provide silent logs for analysis.

rows.Title: Battery drain
rows.Problem: Battery health issue
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences excessive battery drain despite normal usage conditions.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial battery performance degradation, not complete failure or device unusability.
rows.R&D Comment: Battery drain likely caused by high-CPU apps; recommend monitoring logs under specific usage conditions.

rows.Title: Facebook screen goes black while scrolling
rows.Problem: Cx app screen issue
rows.Summarized Problem: The Facebook app screen turns black while scrolling.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial screen malfunction during scrolling but does not result in device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue is from app side; recommend updating app to latest version and clearing cache before testing.

rows.Title: Mobile data not working
rows.Problem: Check attached video
rows.Summarized Problem: Mobile data connectivity is not functioning.
rows.Severity Reason: The device cannot connect to mobile data, which is essential for basic communication and internet access.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Camera failed pop up occur
rows.Problem: Cx facing camera issue
rows.Summarized Problem: The front-facing camera is failing to function properly, resulting in a pop-up error.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera fails to function, which prevents normal device usage and may cause user frustration or inability to perform basic tasks.
rows.R&D Comment: This is a hardware defect in the camera sensor module; customers should be guided to an official Samsung CS center for inspection and repair.

rows.Title: Camera stutters at 0.6x
rows.Problem: Camera suffers from stutters when using 0.6x zoom, persistent issue for months. Tried all recommended guidelines previously. No resolution yet.
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera stutters when using 0.6x zoom, a persistent issue affecting video and photo capture.
rows.Severity Reason: Stuttering during video and photo capture at 0.6x zoom significantly impacts user experience and device usability, especially during prolonged use.
rows.R&D Comment: Camera sensor module HW defect or damaged PBA connector; customer should visit official Samsung CS center for hardware inspection and repair.

rows.Title: Goodlock app unable to load app list
rows.Problem: cannot download plugins from Good Lock on Samsung S25 Ultra due to error
rows.Summarized Problem: The Goodlock app fails to load its app list and cannot download plugins on Samsung S25 Ultra.
rows.Severity Reason: The app functionality is partially broken, preventing plugin downloads but not causing device crash or complete failure.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is due to Good Lock not being supported in Bhutan; no immediate countermeasure available, further investigation needed

rows.Title: Lock screen adaptive clock not working
rows.Problem: Adaptive clock face is not working every time
rows.Summarized Problem: The adaptive clock face on the lock screen is not functioning properly.
rows.Severity Reason: The adaptive clock face fails to work every time, making the lock screen functionally unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Home screen customizations gets reversed
rows.Problem: Home screen customizations are reverting after each power cycle following the update to One UI 8 and the Home Up application
rows.Summarized Problem: Home screen customizations are reverting after each power cycle after updating to One UI 8 and the Home Up app.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of home screen settings, but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue may be due to a specific path or setting in the Home Up app; detailed user operations needed for further analysis.

rows.Title: Camera quality is not good
rows.Problem: I'm facing very low image quality, like a lack of detail in images I take from the camera. Also, whenever there is a light source on an object, the camera takes a photo that is very white and of bad quality. I uploaded a picture you can zoom in and check; there is a lack of detail. Also, there is one image of a kid where the light source made the image very white and of bad quality. Whenever I take a photo in lighting, the image has too much white and over exposure.
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera produces images with low detail and overexposure in light conditions due to insufficient light sensitivity and inadequate sensor resolution.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera fails to capture clear images under normal lighting, resulting in overexposure and loss of detail, which significantly impacts usability.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue stems from low light sensitivity and inadequate sensor resolution; countermeasure involves addressing upscaling artifacts and depth of field limitations in high-resolution mode.

rows.Title: Battery drain
rows.Problem: Battery drains faster on UI 8.0 compared to UI 7.0, with 12-20% loss after one hour of YouTube use, 2-4% in two minutes on Chrome, and 3-4% in two minutes of screen-on news app usage. Need fix for S25.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences significantly increased battery drain on UI 8.0 compared to UI 7.0, especially during video playback and browser use.
rows.Severity Reason: The battery drain is substantial and occurs during normal usage, leading to rapid depletion and potential device unavailability for daily tasks.
rows.R&D Comment: Battery drain is caused by hotspot usage when screen is off; users should be guided to turn off hotspot when not in use.

rows.Title: Performance issue in AI image functionality
rows.Problem: AI image functionality is experiencing performance issues after the One UI 8 update
rows.Summarized Problem: The AI image generation feature is experiencing performance issues after the One UI 8 update, particularly when multiple people or multi-racial inputs are provided.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature crashes or fails under common use cases involving multiple people or diverse races, making it unusable for core functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: AI image generation fails with multi-racial or multi-person inputs due to hallucination and error rates; the system will block generation of people and improve output quality over time.

rows.Title: System text UI size increases or decreases automatically
rows.Problem: Text DPI on screen automatically increases or decreases, causing text to appear very small or enlarged, requiring phone restart to resolve
rows.Summarized Problem: Text size on the screen automatically changes, causing inconsistent display sizes that require a restart to fix.
rows.Severity Reason: The automatic change in text size affects usability and consistency across the interface, making content difficult to read and rendering the display unstable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Media player option not shown on Now Bar
rows.Problem: Missing option of media player in live notifications now bar
rows.Summarized Problem: The media player option is missing from the Now Bar live notifications.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing from a key notification area but does not prevent device operation or cause crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Overlapping in quick panel buttons
rows.Problem: Software glitches when scrolling down to control panel
rows.Summarized Problem: Buttons in the quick panel overlap due to layout timing issues when scrolling.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes visual glitches during scrolling but does not prevent device operation or cause crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: Layout timing issue resolved by adjusting layout rendering; fix included in OS update.

rows.Title: Call option not there in vibration intensity
rows.Problem: Call option not there in vibration and intensity
rows.Summarized Problem: The call option is missing in vibration intensity settings.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing in a specific vibration setting, but the device's hardware may not support it, indicating a partial malfunction rather than a full device failure.
rows.R&D Comment: This device does not support call vibration intensity. This option depends upon the motor HW in device.

rows.Title: Image downloaded from Google Photos have different date in gallery
rows.Problem: When downloading photos from Google Photos to my Samsung Galaxy device, the date of the photos in the phone's gallery app is changed to the current date and time of the download. This makes it impossible to organize downloaded photos chronologically alongside photos taken with the device's camera.
rows.Summarized Problem: Photos downloaded from Google Photos show the current download date instead of the original capture date, disrupting chronological organization.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects photo organization but does not prevent device usage or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The gallery app uses the device's current time instead of EXIF metadata; users should re-upload the image to Google Photos to ensure proper date retention.

rows.Title: Can't apply content pop up in galaxy themes
rows.Problem: Cx unable to apply icon on device from galaxy theme
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot apply icons from Galaxy themes due to unsupported QMG-based content.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to apply icons from Galaxy themes because it lacks QMG library support, rendering theme customization unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: QMG content is not supported on devices without QMG library; system shows incompatibility and current status remains unchanged.

rows.Title: Unable to login to work profile
rows.Problem: Unable to login to work profile on Samsung A22. Default work profile shows 'try again' error when entering PIN or pattern. Second profile does not open despite having same lock settings.
rows.Summarized Problem: User cannot log in to the work profile on Samsung A22, receiving 'try again' error despite correct PIN or pattern, and the second profile fails to open.
rows.Severity Reason: User is unable to access the work profile, which is a core functionality for device usage and management, leading to complete inability to switch between profiles.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: 5G signal not working
rows.Problem: 5G signal not showing even in 5G network area
rows.Summarized Problem: The device fails to show 5G signal despite being in a 5G network area.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to detect 5G signal in a 5G network area, making the network functionality unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: mipi failure in physical device layer; Countermeasure: Provide CP silent logs for further analysis.

rows.Title: S Health app is not auto syncing
rows.Problem: Samsung Health is not auto syncing Galaxy Watch 8 LTE data regularly. It only syncs when the app is opened. Troubleshooting steps including app update, power saving mode disable, background usage enable, auto sync settings, app cache clear, and device updates have been completed but no improvement. Logs show data sync was ongoing at the time of screenshot; last sync occurred at 10:28 PM previous day.
rows.Summarized Problem: Samsung Health fails to auto-sync data from Galaxy Watch 8 LTE regularly, only syncing when the app is manually opened.
rows.Severity Reason: The app fails to sync data automatically, which is essential for real-time health monitoring, leading to loss of critical data and user frustration.
rows.R&D Comment: Data sync is triggered only when user manually initiates it; auto-sync functionality is not reliably working due to time sync or background execution issues.

rows.Title: Auto rotate icon appears on the top of the screen
rows.Problem: Autorotate icon appears on right hand top corner, which if clicked, turns to landscape. How to prevent this
rows.Summarized Problem: The auto rotate icon appears on the top right corner of the screen and can be clicked to switch to landscape mode.
rows.Severity Reason: The icon is functional and causes a mode change upon interaction, but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Cursor placement is wrong
rows.Problem: The cursor is placed before the 0 when opening the Samsung Calculator app, making it difficult to use immediately. Users must clear the 0 before starting calculations.
rows.Summarized Problem: The cursor is incorrectly placed before the zero when opening the Samsung Calculator app, hindering immediate use.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects usability but does not prevent the app from functioning or cause device-wide crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Cursor will be behind zero.

rows.Title: Android update warning
rows.Problem: Apps like Teams and Outlook fail to open due to Android security patch requirement of 2025-05-01
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot open apps due to an Android security patch requirement error.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to launch essential work apps, making it unusable for core functions.
rows.R&D Comment: Customer should update software via Settings > Software Update to resolve the issue.

rows.Title: Lock screen shows black screen
rows.Problem: lockscreen shows black screen instead of dynamic wallpaper
rows.Summarized Problem: The lock screen displays a black screen instead of the dynamic wallpaper.
rows.Severity Reason: The lock screen fails to show the intended dynamic wallpaper, resulting in a partial malfunction of the display function.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Camera stutters at 0.5x
rows.Problem: The 0.5x lens (wide lens) is unstable after the ONE UI 7 update, causing shaking and poor image clarity with oily texture.
rows.Summarized Problem: The wide lens (0.5x) on the camera is unstable and produces shaky, blurry images with poor clarity after the ONE UI 7 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The instability causes visible shaking and degraded image quality, making the camera function unreliable and unusable for clear photography.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Degraded camera quality
rows.Problem: Camera quality degraded after OneUI 7 update. Images have over-sharpness, pale colors, increased noise, and poor shadows. Selfie camera shows pale skin tones. 0.5x camera produces blurry images and no video stabilization. Poor performance in low light and bright conditions.
rows.Summarized Problem: Camera image quality has degraded with over-sharpness, color paleness, increased noise, and poor shadows, especially in selfies and low light.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera malfunction affects core image capture functionality, resulting in visibly poor visual output across multiple conditions, making photos and videos unusable for normal use.
rows.R&D Comment: SeamlessZoom was not supported in U OS, causing mismatched camera IDs; now camera ID is aligned with U OS for 50MP camera.

rows.Title: Brightness issue in low light condition
rows.Problem: The phone brightness is low in low light conditions, and when scrolling on dark backgrounds, white colors appear with a pinkish tone. This issue does not resolve with changes to refresh rate or screen color mode.
rows.Summarized Problem: The display shows a pinkish tint when scrolling on dark backgrounds in low light, and brightness remains low despite adjustments.
rows.Severity Reason: The visual distortion and low brightness impair user experience and eye comfort, especially in low light, making the device unusable for normal viewing.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Low brightness area (IT1小) color draw due to Green emission delay from CEL cap difference. Countermeasure: Reduced emission delay time to match previous models (A54, A34) with improved R/G/B ratios.

rows.Title: Mobile data not working with Swiggy and BlaBla
rows.Problem: No internet connectivity
rows.Summarized Problem: Mobile data connectivity is failing for Swiggy and BlaBla apps.
rows.Severity Reason: The device cannot access internet for key apps, making functionality unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Camera quality is not good

rows.Summarized Problem: Photos taken with flash are dimmed or completely black, indicating a failure in flash-based image capture.
rows.Severity Reason: Photos are completely black when using flash, making image capture unusable under typical conditions.
rows.R&D Comment: If issue still persists, please provide CP silent logs for analysis; recommended steps include cleaning the lens, resetting camera settings, checking resolution, testing in good lighting, and updating software.

rows.Problem: The Instagram app keeps closing automatically and shows the message Instagram closed because this app has a bug. Try updating this app after its developer provides a fix for this error. Please resolve the issue as soon as possible
