rows.Summarized Problem: The camera quality is blurry after the update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of camera performance after an update, affecting image clarity but not causing device crash or complete failure.
rows.R&D Comment: The blur is likely due to a foreign object (e.g., fingerprint) on the lens; cleaning the lens with microfiber cloth resolves the issue.

rows.Title: Notification expands automatically
rows.Problem: When a new notification arrives, touching the screen simultaneously even outside the notification area causes the notification panel to automatically expand downward without intentional swipe or tap on the status bar. This behavior is unintended and disrupts normal interaction. WhatsApp notifications display identical sender profile pictures.
rows.Summarized Problem: The notification panel automatically expands when the screen is touched, even outside the notification area, disrupting normal user interaction.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes unintended behavior during normal interaction but does not result in device crash or data loss, and functionality remains partially usable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: System UI pop up occurs
rows.Problem: Pop up occurs after UI update while connecting wireless Android Auto
rows.Summarized Problem: A pop-up appears in the System UI after a UI update, occurring during wireless Android Auto connection.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects functionality during a key use case but does not cause device crash or data loss, and is intermittent or context-dependent.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Lines appear at border when launching apps
rows.Problem: Lines reflecting at border while opening apps, including camera app
rows.Summarized Problem: Lines appear at the screen border when launching apps or opening the camera.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects app launch and camera experience but does not cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by scaling calculation errors in UI layer rendering, leading to a 1-pixel border line; a fix requires adjusting scaling precision in the OS layer rendering pipeline.

rows.Title: Searching contacts
rows.Problem: When searching for a contact with a partial name like 'Div', the search shows other contacts starting with 'a' or names containing 'div' in the middle or at the end.
rows.Summarized Problem: Contact search returns incorrect results when using partial names, showing contacts that do not match the query.
rows.Severity Reason: The search function partially fails, leading to inaccurate results, but the device remains usable and core functions continue to operate.
rows.R&D Comment: Root cause not identifiable due to insufficient logs and missing index files; recommend clearing SCS data to trigger reindexing.

rows.Title: Unable to reset the EPC
rows.Problem: I cannot reset the EPC. I need a reset option so I can use the EPC properly.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot reset the EPC, which prevents proper use of the EPC feature.
rows.Severity Reason: The reset function is missing, preventing users from properly using the EPC feature, but the issue does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: What is EPC? Please provide more information in detail for the EPC.

rows.Title: Video call UI glitch on WhatsApp
rows.Problem: WhatsApp video call side screen problem
rows.Summarized Problem: WhatsApp video call displays a glitch in the side screen UI during calls.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects the UI during video calls but does not cause device crash or data loss, and is limited to a visual display anomaly.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue likely stems from WhatsApp app version mismatch; recommend updating app and clearing cache to resolve.

rows.Title: Screen off memo option not showing in S Pen settings
rows.Problem: Screen off memo enabled disable option not showing in S Pen setting option
rows.Summarized Problem: The screen off memo option is not visible in the S Pen settings.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing from the settings interface, preventing users from configuring screen off memo functionality, but the device remains otherwise usable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Modes and routines not working properly
rows.Problem: There is no update available and I have completed all troubleshooting steps. A screen recording is attached showing the issue.
rows.Summarized Problem: Modes and routines are not working properly on some devices due to app compatibility issues during automation execution.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents the proper execution of modes and routines, which are essential functions for user workflow and device usability.
rows.R&D Comment: A compatibility issue in the Modes and Routines app during automation execution has been identified; a fix will be included in the next update.

rows.Title: Screen display not working properly
rows.Problem: The display has broken pixels and background waves, indicating faulty screen quality
rows.Summarized Problem: The screen display has broken pixels and visual waves, indicating a defective display panel.
rows.Severity Reason: The display has visible defects and broken pixels, making it unusable for normal viewing and potentially leading to data loss or device malfunction.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Modes and routines not working properly
rows.Problem: Please check the videos. I have already shared log I guess with my previous messages.
rows.Summarized Problem: Modes and routines are not working properly on some devices due to app compatibility issues.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature fails to function entirely on some devices, rendering it unusable and impacting core user functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: A compatibility issue between the Modes and Routines app and other apps causes failure in execution; a fix is scheduled for September update.

rows.Title: Pictures are not clear
rows.Problem: High noise in pictures taken with camera
rows.Summarized Problem: Pictures taken with the camera have high noise, especially in dark environments and when using digital zoom.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction under specific conditions (dark environments and digital zoom), not a complete failure or device crash.
rows.R&D Comment: The noise is caused by high ISO and digital zoom in dark environments; no countermeasure is provided beyond the observation.

rows.Title: Modes and routines keeps stopping pop up
rows.Problem: Cx facing Modes and Routines is not working
rows.Summarized Problem: Modes and Routines feature is not working and keeps stopping.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature keeps stopping, which prevents users from using essential routines, making the device unusable in certain contexts.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: fingerprint unlock is getting disabled automatically
rows.Problem: After the Aug security update on Galaxy S24 Ultra, fingerprint and face unlock are getting disabled automatically and need to be re-enabled repeatedly. Also, after first PIN unlock, a screen recording popup appears on the display.
rows.Summarized Problem: Fingerprint unlock is being disabled automatically after the August security update, requiring frequent re-enabling and causing a screen recording popup upon first PIN unlock.
rows.Severity Reason: The automatic disabling of fingerprint unlock renders the device unusable for secure access and causes a disruptive user experience with a secondary popup.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Battery drain issue
rows.Problem: Significant battery drain even when the device is not in use, worse than on old phone. Battery dropped from 89% to 36% in 9 hours and 19 minutes with only 3 hours and 5 minutes of screen-on time. Mainly used Instagram app. Poor signal strength and high cellular TX power (54.1%) contribute to increased network consumption and frequent reconnections.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences significant battery drain when not in use, even with minimal screen-on time, due to poor signal conditions and high cellular transmission power.
rows.Severity Reason: The battery drains rapidly under normal usage, leading to device unusability within hours and indicating a major system-level performance issue.
rows.R&D Comment: Battery drain caused by poor signal conditions and high cellular TX power; countermeasure aligns with root cause and confirms network-related power consumption as primary driver.

rows.Title: Issue observed while zooming in the camera
rows.Problem: Cx facing camera issue
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera zoom function exhibits a slight visual distortion when switching between lenses due to differences in lens characteristics such as distortion and focal length.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a minor visual artifact during zoom transitions but does not prevent core functionality or lead to device failure.
rows.R&D Comment: The lens switching during zoom results in slight visual distortion due to differing lens characteristics, which is a known behavior in multi-camera systems.

rows.Title: Unable to receive incoming calls
rows.Problem: Fails to receive all incoming calls after the update
rows.Summarized Problem: The device fails to receive all incoming calls after the update.
rows.Severity Reason: The device cannot receive incoming calls, which is a core communication function and renders the device unusable for basic communication.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Spam not working
rows.Problem: Spam call not showing during call reception even though spam protection is enabled
rows.Summarized Problem: Spam call detection is not functioning during incoming calls, despite spam protection being enabled.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is partially malfunctioning as spam calls are not detected during calls, but the overall device remains usable.
rows.R&D Comment: Spam call filtering may be failing due to Hiya service not flagging spam numbers; users should report suspicious numbers via official path.

rows.Title: Unable to play videos on 4K in YouTube
rows.Problem: The Samsung Galaxy M33 model is promised to support 4K Ultra HDR but does not actually support 4K quality options on YouTube or any OTT platform. Some Samsung Galaxy devices support 4K, but the M33 does not.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Samsung Galaxy M33 cannot play 4K content on YouTube or other OTT platforms due to insufficient hardware decoder support.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to support 4K playback on major video platforms, which directly impacts core functionality and user experience, making content viewing unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Device supports only software decoding for VP9 up to FHD; 4K playback is possible only for AVC/HEVC at 30fps, depending on content, and not guaranteed across all videos.

rows.Title: Device restarts and freezes
rows.Problem: Device restarts and freezes
rows.Summarized Problem: The device restarts and freezes unexpectedly.
rows.Severity Reason: The device restarts and freezes, making it unusable and causing major functional failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: During call, the sound is very noisy
rows.Problem: issue in call during the call the call is not clear and some noise too just like broken speaker
rows.Summarized Problem: During calls, the audio is noisy and unclear, resembling a broken speaker.
rows.Severity Reason: The call audio is severely degraded, making communication difficult or impossible, which renders the device unusable for basic voice functions.
rows.R&D Comment: Check the voice call route settings and audio path (*#0*#>LOOPBACK>Rcv_1stMic, SPK_2ndMic) to verify the audio routing and identify the source of noise.

rows.Title: Device freezes and jitters
rows.Problem: face gitter and freezes issue
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences freezing and jittering during operation.
rows.Severity Reason: The device freezes and jitters, which causes it to become unusable and unstable during operation.
rows.R&D Comment: GMU error is suspected as an AP defect; recommend customer to check hardware.

rows.Title: Unable to set up mobile plan in galaxy watch 8
rows.Problem: Unable to add mobile plan in Galaxy Watch 8
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot add a mobile plan to their Galaxy Watch 8.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is essential for device functionality and users cannot complete a basic setup step.
rows.R&D Comment: Airtel's webpage shows an error screen during Watch eSIM ODSA subscription, causing subscription failure.

rows.Title: Whatsapp notification not shown
rows.Problem: Facing whatsapp notification issues
rows.Summarized Problem: WhatsApp notifications are not appearing on the device.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of notification display for a specific app, affecting user experience but not rendering the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Now bar not shown on lock screen
rows.Problem: Now brief is not showing or visible after updating One UI 8.0, appears after 12 hours but then disappears again and is not showing now
rows.Summarized Problem: The Now Bar is not visible on the lock screen after updating to One UI 8.0 and fails to remain visible even after briefly appearing.
rows.Severity Reason: The Now Bar is a core feature on the lock screen that fails to appear consistently, rendering the lock screen functionally incomplete and impacting user experience significantly.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Camera quality is not good
rows.Problem: Front camera videography is the worst. Video recorded in Pro Video mode at 60fps with maximum ISO results in noise, especially in low-light environments.
rows.Summarized Problem: The front camera produces noisy video in low light due to high ISO settings in Pro Video mode.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes visible noise in low-light video but does not prevent recording or cause device failure or crash.
rows.R&D Comment: The noise is caused by maximum ISO in Pro Video mode; recommended to suggest longer shutter speed in low light as a countermeasure.

rows.Title: Time zone settings
rows.Problem: Time zone settings not working
rows.Summarized Problem: Time zone settings are not working properly.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of a core settings function, preventing correct time display but not rendering the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: USB headphones does not work
rows.Problem: usb headphones does not work
rows.Summarized Problem: USB headphones are not working after the update.
rows.Severity Reason: The device's audio functionality is impaired, preventing users from using USB headphones, which is a core input/output feature.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Device keeps on lagging
rows.Problem: Device lags and scrolling in social media apps is stuttering and jittery
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences significant lag and stuttering during scrolling in social media apps.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes unresponsive during normal use, especially in key apps, affecting usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Instagram app crash
rows.Problem: Instagram app crashes frequently and requires clearing cache or reinstalling to function. Issue occurs only with the official Instagram app and is intermittent.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Instagram app crashes frequently and requires frequent clearing of cache or reinstallation to function.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes repeatedly, making it unusable and requiring constant intervention to restore functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: App is not developed by Samsung; issue requires reporting to app developer, but developer considers it low priority.

rows.Title: Distorted pixels on Instagram and YouTube
rows.Problem: Damaged pixels causing display issues in Instagram and YouTube apps, persists after factory data reset.
rows.Summarized Problem: Damaged pixels are causing distorted display in Instagram and YouTube apps.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects visual content display in key apps and persists after factory reset, indicating a hardware defect that impacts core functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Unable to see live cricket scores on the Now bar
rows.Problem: Unable to see live cricket scores on the Now bar
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot see live cricket scores on the Now bar of the lock screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is partially non-functional, limiting specific content visibility on the lock screen without completely breaking functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Camera quality is not good
rows.Problem: Camera image quality noticeably degraded compared to Galaxy S23. Photos and videos appear dull, moody, and noisier. Portraits lack sharpness and detail. Colors are less vibrant and punchy, low-light noise is more prominent. This is evident even in normal daylight shots.
rows.Summarized Problem: Camera image quality is noticeably degraded compared to Galaxy S23, with dull colors, lack of sharpness, and increased noise even in daylight.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects core image quality performance, resulting in visibly poor visual output across normal conditions, impacting user experience significantly.
rows.R&D Comment: Noise removal performance is inferior in Pro mode and high magnification due to single-frame processing and small sensor pixel size.

rows.Title: Bixby unable to send WhatsApp message
rows.Problem: Cannot send a WhatsApp message to a contact, while Gemini can
rows.Summarized Problem: Bixby fails to send WhatsApp messages to contacts, while Gemini successfully sends them.
rows.Severity Reason: Bixby cannot send messages to contacts, but functionality is partially available through Gemini, indicating a partial malfunction rather than complete failure or device unusability.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause and countermeasure both point to contact synchronization issues in WhatsApp; the issue is resolved by verifying WhatsApp login status, contact sync settings, and icon visibility in Contact App.

rows.Title: Network issue
rows.Problem: Network issue
rows.Summarized Problem: Users are experiencing a network issue in the Mobile Networks setting.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects network functionality but does not completely disable device operation or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Call background shows solid color instead of default background
rows.Problem: Call background shows solid color instead of default background after updating to One UI 7
rows.Summarized Problem: The call background displays a solid color instead of the user's default background after updating to One UI 7.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects the visual appearance of the call interface but does not prevent functionality or cause device failure.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by an older version of Samsung InCallUI (16.1.00.79) displaying contact card as background; it is resolved in version 16.1.00.112 and above.

rows.Title: Face recognition option missing in Gallery
rows.Problem: Face recognition option missing in Gallery
rows.Summarized Problem: The face recognition option is missing in the Gallery app.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is not available, but the Gallery app remains functional and users can still access other features.
rows.R&D Comment: Database corruption may occur after prolonged idle time; clearing related app data initiates reanalysis.

rows.Title: Unable to launch Instagram
rows.Problem: Instagram is not opening on Galaxy S24 after recent update. App crashes with 'IllegalStateException: Unknown executor name' during launch. Clearing cache, data, force-stopping, and reinstalling have not resolved the issue. Supermoney app also crashes, but issue persists despite prior attempts.
rows.Summarized Problem: Instagram fails to launch on Galaxy S24 after an update, crashing with a runtime error during startup.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes during launch, preventing user access to a core social media application, which renders the device unusable for key functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue is caused by app-side code defect in executor handling; countermeasure is to advise users to switch to official app version on Google Play, as the current version is unstable and not developed by Samsung.

rows.Title: Call UI issue
rows.Problem: Name scrolling issue when calling or receiving a call with long names; name not fully displayed with scrolling
rows.Summarized Problem: Long caller names do not fully display and scroll properly in the call interface.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial visibility of caller names, affecting usability during calls but does not cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is due to small profile picture size limiting space; countermeasure is to allow users to select large profile picture size in settings to improve name display.

rows.Title: Poor camera quality
rows.Problem: camera facing issue
rows.Summarized Problem: The facing camera produces poor image quality under low light conditions with visible edging effects, and lacks proper capture dumps for analysis.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction under specific conditions, affecting image quality but not rendering the device unusable or causing crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: The photo with grass is taken in extreme low light condition with BV = -11; the image looks expected in such conditions, but the second image shows edging effect instead of noise. Proper capture dumps are required for analysis.

rows.Title: Video quality compromises when posted on Instagram
rows.Problem: Cx facing Instagram video quality issue
rows.Summarized Problem: Video quality is compromised when posted on Instagram, likely due to compression or codec handling during upload.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction of video quality during posting, not full device failure or data loss, but affects user experience during content sharing.
rows.R&D Comment: Video quality degradation during Instagram upload is caused by codec pipeline handling; mitigation includes using high-quality source videos and optimized editing before upload.

rows.Title: Issue occurred while launching Airtel Thanks App
rows.Problem: When I try to open the Airtel Thanks app, I am getting the following error: "Screen overlay detected. Please disable." Please look into this and suggest a solution.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Airtel Thanks app displays a "Screen overlay detected" error when launched, indicating interference from other apps.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction where the app detects overlays but does not crash or become unusable, and users can resolve it via device settings.
rows.R&D Comment: The app may be detecting overlay apps such as screen recorders or live wallpapers as interference; users should check and disable non-essential overlay apps and clear the app cache.

rows.Title: Call background issue
rows.Problem: When calling a saved contact, the call background is replaced with a random color preset for that contact. When calling a random number, the chosen call background is displayed. This behavior started after the One UI 7 update and was not present in One UI 6.
rows.Summarized Problem: The call background incorrectly changes when calling saved contacts, replacing the user-selected background with a contact-specific preset.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes inconsistent behavior during calls to saved contacts but does not prevent functionality or cause device crash or data loss.
rows.Resolve Type: Product Requirement, UX Guide, Standard Technical Specification
rows.R&D Comment: The behavior is as per UX; further investigation needed

rows.Title: Charging

rows.Summarized Problem: The device intermittently stops showing the remaining charge time on the lock screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves intermittent failure of a key charge indicator on the lock screen, affecting usability but not causing complete device failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Setting up key for Samsung Wallet

rows.Severity Reason: The applet consistently fails to install, preventing user from setting up a key for Samsung Wallet, which is essential for device access.

rows.Title: Device freezes and restarts

rows.Summarized Problem: The device frequently freezes and restarts, causing instability in system operation.
rows.Severity Reason: The device freezes and restarts, making it unusable and indicating a major system malfunction.
rows.R&D Comment: UFS link layer errors suggest hardware-level issues in the AP or UFS component; recommend hardware inspection and signal/power integrity checks.

rows.Title: Lock Screen clock issue

rows.Title: Green tint observed while recording in pro video at 2x zoom

rows.Summarized Problem: A green tint appears during night and fast movement in pro video recording on Samsung Camera app, and persists across all camera modes including selfie.
rows.Severity Reason: The green tint affects video quality in critical conditions (night, fast movement) and persists across all camera modes, including selfie, making it a major usability and visual defect.

rows.Title: Call background displays a solid color instead of the selected wallpaper

rows.Title: Spam call detection not working

rows.R&D Comment: Spam call detection is not functioning as intended; users need to manually report numbers to flag them as spam.

rows.Summarized Problem: The Eye Comfort Shield causes the display to appear yellow or brown, altering screen color consistency.

rows.Title: Permission pop up comes even when permissions are enabled

rows.Title: AOD option cannot be found in settings

rows.Title: Bluetooth issue while connecting tripod camera
rows.Problem: Cannot pair the tripod camera's Bluetooth module with Galaxy M35 5G. The module pairs successfully with Galaxy M12 and a computer, but not with Galaxy M35 5G. Another Bluetooth module works with Galaxy M35 5G. Unable to determine if the issue is with the phone or the module.
rows.Summarized Problem: Galaxy M35 5G cannot pair with a specific tripod camera's Bluetooth module, despite successful pairing with other devices and another Bluetooth module.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction in Bluetooth pairing functionality, not complete device failure or data loss.

rows.Title: Device faces performance glitch while launching any app

rows.Title: Sound limit issue observed post update
rows.Problem: After UI 7.0 update, the volume limit at 80dB is shown at 60% and at 85dB at 70%. When earphones are connected and the phone restarted, the volume limit returns to expected levels. However, upon removing earphones and reconnecting, the volume limits drop back to 60% at 80dB and 70% at 85dB.

rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes inconsistent volume limits under normal usage but does not prevent device operation or cause crashes or data loss.

rows.Title: Swipe gestures are not working

rows.Title: A blank space in app drawer

rows.Title: Call and internet issue

rows.Severity Reason: Call quality failure and connectivity issues prevent effective device usage, making the device unusable for core communication functions.

rows.Title: Work profile provisioning blocked
rows.Problem: Work profile provisioning issue
rows.Summarized Problem: Work profile provisioning is blocked due to Samsung Finance+ India's security policy.
rows.Severity Reason: The device cannot install work profiles, which are essential for enterprise device setup and usage, rendering the device unusable for business purposes.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Work profile provisioning blocked by Samsung Finance+ India's security policy. Countermeasure: Device removed from financing system, allowing proper work profile installation.

rows.Title: Charging issues
rows.Problem: Battery and slow charging worsen phone usage; charging twice is necessary even with minimal use, especially when using moderate or higher charge levels
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone experiences slow charging and requires two charging sessions even with minimal usage.
rows.Severity Reason: Slow charging and the need for double charging sessions significantly impact device usability and user experience, making it difficult to maintain consistent device operation.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Unable to maximise the screen
rows.Problem: After minimizing the screen for any app, I am not getting option to maximize the screen again. Basically once I am minimizing the screen then I am not able to open the app again or not able to maximize the screen again
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot maximize the screen after minimizing any app, preventing them from reopening apps or restoring full screen view.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from restoring app views and full screen access, making the device unusable for normal interaction.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Call waiting feature not working
rows.Problem: Call waiting feature is not working in the phone app even after activation on Jio SIM by dialing a specific number.
rows.Summarized Problem: The call waiting feature is not functioning properly in the phone app after activation on the Jio SIM.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature does not work after activation, but the app remains otherwise functional, indicating a partial malfunction.
rows.R&D Comment: Provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: A cursor is displayed on screen randomly
rows.Problem: Display issue with cursor showing unexpectedly
rows.Summarized Problem: A cursor appears unexpectedly on the screen when a device with mouse properties is connected.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes intermittent display of a cursor, disrupting user experience but does not prevent device usage or cause crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: Cursor appears when mouse-device connects; future OS update will hide cursor to improve user experience.

rows.Title: 5G network issues
rows.Problem: The Airtel 5G network lags and does not run smoothly on Samsung Galaxy F15 5G, while it works perfectly on Redmi 13 5G. The issue started recently, though it previously worked well.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Airtel 5G network lags and fails to run smoothly on Samsung Galaxy F15 5G, despite working on other devices.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction of 5G network performance, affecting user experience but not rendering the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Glitch in game booster settings
rows.Problem: Unable to see in-game panel or game booster notification while playing games. Previously showed as a small vertical bar or notification, now not working.
rows.Summarized Problem: Game booster notifications and in-game panel are no longer visible during gameplay.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is partially malfunctioning, as notifications and in-game panel are missing but not completely absent.
rows.R&D Comment: Game booster does not recognize apps installed via Samsung Cloud as games; functionality is restored when apps are installed from official stores.

rows.Title: Vibration not working
rows.Problem: Vibration or haptic feedback is not working during typing, incoming calls, messages, and when using back and home buttons. This issue started a few days ago (around 10-11 days). No vibration or haptic feedback is present despite checking all settings and diagnostics. The user suspects it started after the September update on their Samsung Galaxy F15 5G. Device has not been water-damaged or dropped.
rows.Summarized Problem: Haptic feedback and vibration are not functioning on the device after a recent software update.
rows.Severity Reason: The device lacks basic tactile feedback during key interactions, making it unusable for common user actions like calls and typing.
rows.R&D Comment: Vibrator driver logs are normal; if the issue persists, further hardware investigation is needed.

rows.Title: Device power off automatically
rows.Problem: Galaxy F14 5G automatically powers off after 5 to 10 minutes of being in a pocket, and does not turn back on
rows.Summarized Problem: The Galaxy F14 5G automatically powers off after 5 to 10 minutes of being in a pocket and does not restart.
rows.Severity Reason: The device powers off unexpectedly and fails to restart, rendering it unusable during normal use.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Keyboard does not appear when accessing from notification panel
rows.Problem: Keyboard doesn't appear when trying to reply through quick panel
rows.Summarized Problem: The keyboard fails to appear when accessed from the notification panel.
rows.Severity Reason: The keyboard is essential for user interaction during replies, and its absence prevents basic functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Google sports live notification not displayed on Now bar
rows.Problem: Google Sports live score not working on Now bar even with all settings enabled
rows.Summarized Problem: Google Sports live score notifications are not displaying on the Now Bar.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature does not work when settings are enabled, indicating a partial malfunction of the Now Bar functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Optimisation error for WhatsApp
rows.Problem: Error occurring for each application
rows.Summarized Problem: WhatsApp and other applications are experiencing optimisation errors, causing errors across all apps.
rows.Severity Reason: The error occurs across all applications, indicating a system-wide issue that may affect device usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Android update causes app touch delays; Countermeasure: Restart device and update WhatsApp

rows.Title: Animated clock not working
rows.Problem: The clock style on the lock screen does not animate when the device is powered on, despite being set to One UI 7
rows.Summarized Problem: The animated clock on the lock screen fails to display animation when the device is powered on.
rows.Severity Reason: The clock fails to animate on startup, which is a functional issue but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Unable to sync Samsung Notes
rows.Problem: No option to sync data with Samsung Cloud or OneDrive in Samsung Notes app or Samsung Gallery. Urgently need access to important data affecting earnings.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot sync their notes with Samsung Cloud or OneDrive due to missing sync options in the app.
rows.Severity Reason: Users are unable to access critical data that directly affects their earnings, resulting in a loss of productivity and data access.
rows.R&D Comment: Synchronization is not supported in Knox or B2B mode; recommend rechecking device logs to confirm mode and validate sync capability.

rows.Title: 5G network issue
rows.Problem: 5G network mode has been disabled after the latest software update. It was working earlier.
rows.Summarized Problem: 5G network mode has been disabled after the latest software update, despite previously working.
rows.Severity Reason: The device no longer supports 5G connectivity after an update, rendering a key network function inoperable.
rows.R&D Comment: Require CP silent logs to investigate the root cause and validate the failure.

rows.Title: Ghost touch observed while typing
rows.Problem: Ghost touch observed while typing, issue happens during input and logs are available
rows.Summarized Problem: Ghost touches occur when typing on the device's screen.
rows.Severity Reason: Ghost touches during typing interfere with basic device operation and user input, making the device unusable for text entry.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Modes and routines not working properly
rows.Problem: Modes & routines are not working well, properly
rows.Summarized Problem: Routines are not working properly after the latest update.
rows.Severity Reason: The core functionality of routines is not working, making it unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Calendar widget cannot be expanded vertically
rows.Problem: Calendar events widget issue
rows.Summarized Problem: The calendar events widget cannot be expanded vertically.
rows.Severity Reason: The widget has a partial malfunction as it cannot be expanded vertically, but functionality otherwise remains intact.
rows.R&D Comment: The size of the widget is templated since OneUI 7.0, and 2X3 size is not supported; this is a known limitation in the current design.

rows.Title: Sound going through mic instead of earbuds during gaming
rows.Problem: While playing free fire max, the voice teammates hear comes from phone mic instead of earbuds
rows.Summarized Problem: During gameplay, sound is routed to the phone's microphone instead of the earbuds, causing teammates to hear the wrong audio source.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue results in incorrect audio being transmitted to teammates, making communication ineffective during gameplay, which severely impacts user experience and usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause and countermeasure both indicate missing microphone logs; further investigation needed to identify root cause and improve log capture during gameplay.

rows.Title: Increased resolution makes picture darker
rows.Problem: When increasing image resolution after cropping, the image becomes darker than original
rows.Summarized Problem: Increasing image resolution after cropping causes the image to become darker than the original.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects image quality but does not cause device malfunction or data loss, and only occurs during a specific feature use case.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Notification panel remains same in dark mode
rows.Problem: The notification panel and quick settings/action bars are not correctly applying dark mode. They remain in light/normal mode when dark mode is enabled.
rows.Summarized Problem: The notification panel and quick settings action bars fail to apply dark mode and remain in light mode when dark mode is enabled.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects the visual consistency of the UI in dark mode but does not cause device malfunction or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Dark mode and light mode share the same design for inactive quick settings tiles; this is considered normal operation and will be kept as is.

rows.Title: Battery drain
rows.Problem: Battery draining issue
rows.Summarized Problem: The device is experiencing excessive battery drain, particularly when screen is off.
rows.Severity Reason: Battery drain prevents device usability and leads to frequent shutdowns or rapid depletion of power.
rows.R&D Comment: Provided logs have insufficient duration; request QA to provide correct logs for further investigation.

rows.Title: Navigation bar overlaps with display in Google Pay
rows.Problem: Keyboard issue when entering password on Google Pay
rows.Summarized Problem: The navigation bar overlaps with the display when using Google Pay, causing a keyboard issue during password entry.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue interferes with the core functionality of entering a password, making the app unusable during authentication.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue raised via https://partnerissuetracker.corp.google.com/issues/397546576

rows.Title: App list overlaps
rows.Problem: Application list is overlapping in battery history
rows.Summarized Problem: The application list in the battery history section overlaps improperly.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes visual overlap but does not prevent device usage or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause and countermeasure are identical and refer to B OS Ver 16 behavior; further investigation needed

rows.Title: Unable to see S pen battery percent
rows.Problem: Unable to see the battery percentage and charging symbol for the S pen on Galaxy S9 FE tablet. Tried advanced S pen settings but no resolution.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot see the S pen battery percentage or charging indicator on the Galaxy S9 FE.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects functionality of S pen status visibility, which is essential for users relying on S pen features, but does not cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Tools in Notes app not working properly
rows.Problem: Samsung notes is not working properly
rows.Summarized Problem: The selection tool in the Notes app does not function when selecting text, requiring users to switch to text mode and manually adjust the selection area.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of a core text interaction feature, preventing smooth text selection but not rendering the app unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: The selection tool is available when selecting handwriting or other content, but the text itself is not available. Instead, press the text mode button to press and hold the text itself from text mode to span to select, and you can adjust the selection area by moving the selection handler.

rows.Title: Now brief not shown on lock screen
rows.Problem: Now brief is not displayed on lockscreen even after enabling it
rows.Summarized Problem: The Now Brief feature is not displayed on the lock screen even when enabled.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature fails to display after enabling, but the device remains usable and core functions continue to work.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Color correct option in gallery not found for videos
rows.Problem: Color correct option for log videos is missing in gallery on latest OneUI8, while available on other S24 phones.
rows.Summarized Problem: The color correction option is missing for videos in the gallery on OneUI8.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing in a specific use case but does not prevent device operation or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Now Bar not shown on Lock Screen
rows.Problem: Now bar issue on lock screen
rows.Summarized Problem: The Now Bar is not displayed on the lock screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The Now Bar is a core feature on the lock screen, and its absence renders a key part of the user interface non-functional.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Unable to install Whatsapp
rows.Problem: Cannot install WhatsApp messenger; app says 'This app can't be installed'. Both Play Store and WhatsApp support indicate the issue is with the phone.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot install WhatsApp due to a version downgrade error during app installation.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to install a critical communication app due to a version downgrade error, preventing user access to a core application.
rows.R&D Comment: Version downgrade detected during installation; requires CP silent logs for deeper analysis.

rows.Title: Jio 5G not supported
rows.Problem: Device does not support 5G even when 5G preferred is enabled, Jio not showing 5G support
rows.Summarized Problem: The device does not show 5G support despite 5G preferred being enabled, indicating a network registration issue with Jio.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to register for 5G services, resulting in no 5G indication, which prevents users from accessing 5G connectivity.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Network registration rejected due to N1_MODE_NOT_ALLOWED; Countermeasure: User should check My JIO App for 5G support and contact operator to activate 5G.

rows.Title: Video keeps lagging in YouTube
rows.Problem: Video keeps lagging in YouTube
rows.Summarized Problem: Video streaming in YouTube lags due to app version issues and outdated media player handling.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes intermittent lag during video playback, affecting user experience but does not render the app unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: App version is outdated; updating the YouTube app resolves the issue.

rows.Title: Sports from Google option not found in live notification
rows.Problem: No option of Google sports in Now bar
rows.Summarized Problem: The Google Sports option is missing from the Now Bar on the Lock Screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing from a key notification area but does not prevent device usage or cause crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Adaptive clock not working
rows.Problem: User is unsure how many times to send the report and mentions attaching video and log file
rows.Summarized Problem: The adaptive clock on the lock screen is not functioning properly.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is not working correctly but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Samsung Pass not available
rows.Problem: Unable to sign in to Samsung Pass after four months of device ownership
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot sign in to Samsung Pass after four months of device ownership, preventing access to its features.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents access to a feature that may affect user experience but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: User must withdraw and reinitialize Samsung Pass data via official site; no current technical fix available.

rows.Title: Unable to increase blur of notification panel
rows.Problem: Unable to increase blur of notification panel. No options available in settings or lock screen to adjust blur.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot increase the blur effect on the notification panel due to lack of adjustment options.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of a visual setting, with no options to adjust blur, but the device remains otherwise functional.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by the Blur Reduction option being enabled; users can disable it via Accessibility settings under Vision enhancements to adjust transparency and blur.

rows.Title: Sports from google option not shown on Now Bar
rows.Problem: Now bar not showing sports from google option
rows.Summarized Problem: The Now Bar on the Lock Screen is not displaying the sports option from Google.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing a specific option, resulting in partial functionality failure on the Now Bar.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Suggestive Replies not working
rows.Problem: No suggestive reply appears in messaging app after enabling the feature. The feature was not added in the messaging app following UI 8 update.
rows.Summarized Problem: Suggestive replies do not appear in the messaging app after enabling the feature.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing post-UI 8 update, but the messaging app still functions otherwise, indicating partial malfunction.
rows.R&D Comment: Insufficient logs prevent analysis; no evidence of implementation in messaging app post-UI 8 update.

rows.Title: people recognition feature not working
rows.Problem: The people recognition feature within the Gallery application has ceased to function after One UI 7 and One UI 8 updates. Troubleshooting steps, including clearing data for Gallery, CMHProvider, FaceService, and Samsung Media Storage, have been attempted without resolution.
rows.Summarized Problem: The people recognition feature in the Gallery app is not working after One UI 7 and One UI 8 updates.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is malfunctioning after updates, but users can still use other functions and the issue does not render the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by an engine update in One UI 8 that requires reconnection to the analysis database; clearing data is not recommended. The system will eventually link back to existing data and operate normally when the connection process completes.

rows.Title: Issues with Samsung DeX
rows.Problem: Minimised apps not showing in task bar or recent apps; upper taskbar not appearing when opening apps, causing full screen app experience.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Samsung DeX interface fails to display minimised apps and the upper taskbar, resulting in a poor user experience during app switching.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects key navigation functionality but does not cause device crash or data loss, and partial app functionality remains available.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Weather background theme not found
rows.Problem: Weather background theme not available in stable UI 8 version after update from beta
rows.Summarized Problem: The weather background theme is missing in the stable UI 8 version after updating from beta.
rows.Severity Reason: The theme is absent in a stable version after an update, affecting user experience but not rendering the device unusable or causing crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: The theme functionality appears to be working correctly; user may be confused by character changes based on weather conditions.

rows.Title: Adaptive clock on lock screen not working
rows.Problem: Clock features not working
rows.Summarized Problem: The adaptive clock feature on the lock screen is not functioning properly.
rows.Severity Reason: The clock feature is not working, but the lock screen remains usable and other features are not reported to be affected, indicating a partial malfunction.
rows.R&D Comment: The nowbar feature is available in settings, but no live notifications are sent, so the clock does not display; users should be guided to share steps to reproduce the issue.

rows.Title: Now Brief not loading on Lock Screen
rows.Problem: The brief functionality is no longer working after a device restart. When attempting to access the brief, a blank screen is displayed.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Now Brief feature fails to load, showing a blank screen after a device restart.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature fails to display content, resulting in a blank screen, making the Lock Screen unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Brief UI entity was empty; creation occurs upon time change or manual adjustment, but no logs are available. Logs need to be attached for reproduction and root cause analysis.

rows.Title: Low battery backup after Instagram update
rows.Problem: Phone has very low battery backup after Instagram update. It charged from 3% to 17% in 2 minutes, which is extremely unlikely. Phone switched off randomly, battery dropped to 4% and then to 0%, first time after updating to UI8. Phone has never had this issue before.
rows.Summarized Problem: Phone experiences severe battery drain and erratic charging behavior after the Instagram update, leading to sudden power-offs and incorrect battery level displays.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes unusable due to sudden power-offs and incorrect battery level readings, with charging behavior that is physically implausible and indicates a critical system malfunction.
rows.R&D Comment: High current consumption during low battery voltage causes FG reset, initializing raw SOC to 5000, leading to incorrect UI SOC display. Recommend reboot and service center check for persistent cases.

rows.Title: Camera stutters at 1x
rows.Problem: Camera is unstable when switching from 0.6x wide angle to 1x, showing flickering and screen shake with a mechanical rattling sound during preview
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera preview becomes unstable and flickers when transitioning from 0.6x wide angle to 1x, with visible screen shake and mechanical rattling.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes consistent instability in the camera preview, leading to a degraded user experience and potential device malfunction during use.
rows.R&D Comment: UV Damper peeling and misalignment cause AF oscillation and driving force error; improved jig and OVS inspection will mitigate the issue.

rows.Title: Widgets on lock screen change its color automatically
rows.Problem: Lock screen widgets change color randomly
rows.Summarized Problem: Lock screen widgets change color randomly.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves random color changes, which disrupt user experience but do not cause device failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Battery drain
rows.Problem: battery issue
rows.Summarized Problem: The device is experiencing excessive battery drain.
rows.Severity Reason: Battery drain can lead to device becoming unusable due to rapid power loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Standby current is 35mA, RUT is 27.3 hours; no abnormal apps detected.

rows.Title: Camera blur at 1x and 2x
rows.Problem: Video quality is blurry from 1x to 2x on camera, but is fine at 3x
rows.Summarized Problem: Video quality is blurry at 1x and 2x zoom levels on the camera.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects video quality at specific zoom levels but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The blur is due to the wide camera lens being dirty or misaligned; cleaning the lens resolves the issue.

rows.Title: Lock app automatically option not available for Secure folder
rows.Problem: Secure folder issue
rows.Summarized Problem: The lock app automatically option is not available in the Secure folder.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing in a secure folder setting, which partially limits user functionality but does not render the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Battery charging notifications not showing
rows.Problem: Battery charging notifications not showing
rows.Summarized Problem: Battery charging notifications are not displaying on the device.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of battery-related notifications, preventing users from being informed about charging status.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Couldn't copy update pop up while updating the buds
rows.Problem: still same issue
rows.Summarized Problem: A pop-up message appears when attempting to update the buds, indicating a copy update failure.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue persists despite logs and video evidence, indicating a partial malfunction in the update process.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Lock the app automatically option not found
rows.Problem: Secure folder issue
rows.Summarized Problem: The 'lock the app automatically' option is missing in the secure folder settings.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing, but the device remains usable and core functionality is not disrupted.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Fingerprint sensor not working
rows.Problem: Fingerprint sensor not working
rows.Summarized Problem: The fingerprint sensor is not functioning properly.
rows.Severity Reason: The sensor failure prevents user authentication, making the device unusable for secure access.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by incorrect sensor status reporting during authentication; a countermeasure has been implemented in OneUI 8.0 to treat zero status as normal.

rows.Title: UI issue in multi window
rows.Problem: App screens do not fit properly in split-screen, causing device lag multiple times a day
rows.Summarized Problem: App screens do not fit properly in split-screen, causing device lag.
rows.Severity Reason: Device lags multiple times a day, impacting usability during app usage in multi-window.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Widgets on home screen not loading
rows.Problem: Widgets on home screen not loading
rows.Summarized Problem: Home screen widgets are not loading properly.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents widgets from displaying, which affects usability but does not cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Poor image quality
rows.Problem: After updating to Samsung One UI 8.0, camera image quality has degraded. The optimization is not good, and image quality is worse compared to previous version.
rows.Summarized Problem: Camera image quality has degraded after the One UI 8.0 update, with poor optimization and reduced image clarity compared to previous versions.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera's image quality has significantly degraded, affecting user experience and device usability after a software update.
rows.R&D Comment: The HDR trigger is based on saturated pixel ratio, which is very low in the current environment, leading to suboptimal image optimization.

rows.Title: Magenta tint observed in the pictures
rows.Problem: Magenta tint observed in the pictures
rows.Summarized Problem: Photos show a magenta tint, indicating a color aberration in the camera image output.
rows.Severity Reason: The magenta tint affects image quality and appears in actual photos, leading to a visibly distorted color output that compromises user experience and image accuracy.
rows.R&D Comment: Color aberration occurs due to defocus and small pixel issues in the reused 3X tele lens; hardware defocus deviation causes intensity differences in image color, leading to magenta tint.

rows.Title: Now bar live score not shown on lock screen
rows.Problem: Now bar live score not showing
rows.Summarized Problem: The Now Bar on the lock screen is not displaying live scores.
rows.Severity Reason: The Now Bar is a core feature on the lock screen, and its failure to show live scores prevents users from accessing real-time information, making the device unusable for sports updates.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Notification UI glitch on lock screen
rows.Problem: Notification issue
rows.Summarized Problem: There is a UI glitch when notifications are displayed on the lock screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects the visual presentation of notifications but does not cause device failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Unable to change widgets font size
rows.Problem: Widgets font size issue after update
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot change the font size of widgets after a system update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of widget customization, but does not prevent device usage or cause crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: The problem is caused by incorrect size update of stacked widget items, not included in the app update; a temporary fix is to maintain current state and verify in next OneUI8.5.

rows.Title: Jitter observed while expanding/collapsing the quick panel
rows.Problem: Quick panel issue
rows.Summarized Problem: Jitter is observed when expanding or collapsing the quick panel.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes intermittent visual instability during panel interaction but does not prevent device usage or cause crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Left and right earbud charging issue
rows.Problem: The left earbud charges fully, but the right earbud stops charging as soon as the left one reaches 100%
rows.Summarized Problem: The right earbud stops charging when the left earbud reaches 100% charge.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents the right earbud from charging, which is a major functional failure affecting device usability.
rows.R&D Comment: It seems that the buds have a leakage current after full charge. HW analysis is required to determine the exact cause.

rows.Title: PDF files are not opening properly
rows.Problem: Files are not opening properly
rows.Summarized Problem: PDF files are not opening properly in the My Files section.
rows.Severity Reason: Users cannot open PDF files, which are essential for document access, leading to a major functional failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Video stuttering in streaming apps
rows.Problem: Video playback stutters across all streaming apps including Jio Hotstar and YouTube, occurring consistently regardless of video quality. Stutter is noticeable during background motion and object movement. UI scrolling remains smooth; no UI lag. Issue affects content consumption and is consistently reproducible.
rows.Summarized Problem: Video playback stutters consistently across all streaming apps during motion, affecting content consumption without UI lag.
rows.Severity Reason: Playback stutter occurs in multiple apps and during motion, impacting user experience but does not cause device freeze or data loss or render the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Image becomes darker when switching lens
rows.Problem: Black screen appears when switching from main camera to telephoto lens
rows.Summarized Problem: The image becomes darker when switching from the main camera to the telephoto lens, resulting in a black screen during the transition.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a partial malfunction during camera switching, but does not render the device unusable or result in data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The telephoto lens has a larger F number and is naturally darker in low light; this behavior is normal under maximum exposure and gain settings.

rows.Title: Widgets getting cropped from edges
rows.Problem: Widgets size issue
rows.Summarized Problem: Widgets are being cropped at the edges of the display.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects widget visibility but does not cause device malfunction or crash.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Sync with ringtones won't work with 3rd party ringtones
rows.Problem: Sync with ringtones won't work with 3rd party ringtones even if they have the vibration pattern
rows.Summarized Problem: Ringtone sync fails when using third-party ringtones, even if they include vibration patterns.
rows.Severity Reason: Users cannot sync ringtones with third-party apps, which prevents consistent device functionality and user experience.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Unable to select option in call forwarding feature
rows.Problem: facing an issue with enabling the call forwarding feature on my Samsung S24 Ultra
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot select options when enabling the call forwarding feature on the Samsung S24 Ultra.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from enabling a core communication function, making it unusable during calls.
rows.R&D Comment: Device fails to register in CS RATs during call forwarding due to missing SS_REGISTER logs and network rejection; full CP logs required for root cause.

rows.Title: Notifications overlapping quick panel
rows.Problem: Notifications and the quick panel opening together issue
rows.Summarized Problem: Notifications and the quick panel open simultaneously, causing overlap.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes visual overlap but does not prevent device usage or cause crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Poor image quality
rows.Problem: Camera facing issue
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera facing function produces poor image quality.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects image quality but does not completely disable camera functionality, indicating partial malfunction.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Lock when exit the app not available in secure folder
rows.Problem: After UI 8 update, in secure folder - one option is missing ie. Lock when exit the app

rows.R&D Comment: The Wi-Fi to mobile data switch is triggered only when there is traffic and based on multiple link state metrics, not just RSSI; the current behavior is not a bug but a design limitation, suggesting the feature is not properly exposed to users in poor conditions.

rows.Severity Reason: The front-facing camera is failing to function, which prevents basic device usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Camera sensor or connection issue; recommend user to visit service center for sensor replacement.

rows.Title: Task bar showing too small in UHD state
rows.Problem: Task bar is too small at UHD resolution even with maximum screen zoom and larger font size. Home screen icons are misaligned from top and left edges
rows.Summarized Problem: The task bar appears too small at UHD resolution and home screen icons are misaligned with screen edges.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects display layout and usability but does not cause device failure or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Notification panel lags in landscape mode
rows.Problem: Notification panel lags when switching from portrait to landscape mode and expanding the panel
rows.Summarized Problem: The notification panel experiences lag when transitioning from portrait to landscape mode and expanding after rotation.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction during UI transitions, affecting user experience but not rendering the device unusable or causing data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The lag occurs due to failure to reset tile listening when layout changes; a fix should ensure the panel resets related settings on mode transitions.

rows.Title: Fingerprint recognition not working
rows.Problem: Fingerprint recognition is not working
rows.Summarized Problem: Fingerprint recognition is not working on the lock screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The fingerprint function is completely failing, preventing secure authentication and device access.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue may be related to missing enrollment logs; further investigation is needed with detailed logs and immediate authentication attempts.

rows.Title: Camera focus and edge definition issues
rows.Problem: The camera struggles to properly focus and define edges, especially in object portraits like bottles or non-human subjects. The background blur behaves inconsistently, and subject edge detection looks soft and unstable. Even in good lighting, the device fails to maintain clarity and accurate depth separation.
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera fails to properly focus and define edges, particularly in non-human subjects, resulting in soft and unstable edge detection and inconsistent background blur.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects core camera functionality, leading to poor image clarity and inaccurate depth separation, which directly impacts user experience in portrait mode.
rows.R&D Comment: Close-range black texture-less subjects are difficult to focus on; focus should be adjusted by touching textured parts of the subject to ensure sharpness and accurate edge detection.

rows.Title: Front camera showing blur
rows.Problem: Front camera visible blurred. Screen recording video attached plz check
rows.Summarized Problem: The front camera displays a blurred image when in use.
rows.Severity Reason: The front camera fails to capture clear images, making it unusable for basic photo-taking functions.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by a hardware fault in the wide module AF drive due to shock and vibration damage, and requires physical inspection at an A/S center.

rows.Title: Adaptive clock on lock screen not working
rows.Problem: Cx facing clock face on lock screen not working properly
rows.Summarized Problem: The adaptive clock feature on the lock screen is not working properly.
rows.Severity Reason: The clock face fails to display correctly, rendering a key functionality of the lock screen unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Previous version of LockStar lacked DB field to support Stretch font. Countermeasure: Distribute updated LockStar version with Stretch font support.

rows.Title: Share option disappears when selecting more than 1 files
rows.Problem: Cannot select 2 or more files at once and share them. The share option disappears when selecting multiple files.
rows.Summarized Problem: The share option disappears when selecting two or more files in My Files, preventing users from sharing multiple files.
rows.Severity Reason: Users cannot share files at all when selecting multiple items, making a core functionality completely unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: The share menu is hidden because selected files report zero size; users need to verify file details to confirm integrity before sharing.

rows.Title: Lag observed in recent bar
rows.Problem: Home screen transition lag
rows.Summarized Problem: The transition from home screen to recent apps is laggy and abrupt, with a sudden jump instead of a smooth shift.
rows.Severity Reason: The transition is abrupt and causes a noticeable jolt in user experience, making navigation feel unresponsive and unstable.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue not reproducible in latest APK; further investigation needed

rows.Title: Multi-Window
rows.Problem: Media player gets stuck on the later opened app when both apps are in use.
rows.Summarized Problem: Media player gets stuck on the later opened app in multi-window mode.
rows.Severity Reason: The media player functionality is partially malfunctioning when switching between apps in multi-window mode.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Unable to edit lock screen widgets
rows.Problem: Lock screen option and edit clock settings not working

rows.Title: Bixby not working
rows.Problem: Bixby not working

rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely non-functional, preventing users from using voice commands.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Pictures clicked are in low brightness and faded
rows.Problem: Camera facing issue with low brightness and fading
rows.Summarized Problem: Photos taken with the camera appear in low brightness and faded, especially when the subject is close or during hand motion.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction in photo quality, affecting user experience but not rendering the device unusable or causing data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The fade and low brightness are due to longer shutter speed and shallow depth of field in high-resolution sensor; comparison with 12MP photos is needed to validate the issue.

rows.Title: WiFi calling issues
rows.Problem: wifi calling issue
rows.Summarized Problem: WiFi calling is failing due to server not responding to IKE SA INIT requests, leading to negotiation failure.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes WiFi calling to fail completely, preventing a key communication function from working.
rows.R&D Comment: Server does not respond to IKE SA INIT requests, leading to negotiation failure; requires operator-side investigation.

rows.Title: Internet only works when any call is initiated
rows.Problem: Internet starts working when calling any number
rows.Summarized Problem: Internet connectivity only works when a call is initiated.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to maintain internet access without initiating a call, making basic internet usage unreliable and potentially unusable in normal operations.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause and countermeasure both point to the need for CP silent logs to investigate the root cause of the issue.

rows.Title: Chat assist not working

rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes partial malfunction of app layout on the home screen, but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.

Also, could you please explain in more detail whether this only happens on a specific app or service or not on all apps or services?

rows.Title: Lag when dragging down quick panel in landscape mode

rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of a core UI function during screen rotation, affecting user experience but not rendering the device unusable or causing data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The delay occurs due to improper reset of tile listening settings when screen orientation changes; a platform-level update is needed to ensure panel state is correctly reinitialized on rotation.

rows.Title: Battery drain after UI update

rows.Summarized Problem: The phone experiences rapid battery drain after the One UI 8 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The battery drain is not confirmed in actual usage data; reported issue may be user perception or minor performance impact.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Wifi keeps disconnecting
rows.Problem: Wi-Fi keeps disconnecting automatically after 15 to 20 minutes
rows.Summarized Problem: Wi-Fi connection drops automatically after 15 to 2-than minutes of use.
rows.Severity Reason: The Wi-Fi firmware crashes when connecting to a specific network, causing repeated disconnections and potential loss of connectivity.
rows.R&D Comment: Need to verify if the issue occurs with other access points; if so, investigate hardware aspects.

rows.Title: Dolby Atmos does not working with Buds
rows.Problem: Dolby Atmos does NOT work with Buds. Yes, SAMSUNG Buds
rows.Summarized Problem: Dolby Atmos audio effect does not work when connected to Samsung Buds.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is not fully functional on Galaxy Buds but does not render the device unusable or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: The system now supports 360 audio instead of Dolby Atmos on Galaxy Buds; users should be guided to use 360 audio for immersive sound.

rows.Title: Device restarts automatically
rows.Problem: Device facing restart issue
rows.Summarized Problem: The device restarts automatically due to watchdog or PF resets, indicating a potential hardware issue with the AP or DRAM.
rows.Severity Reason: The device restarts repeatedly, causing it to become unusable, which is a major functional failure.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is likely due to AP or DRAM hardware malfunction, and a hardware-level investigation is required.

rows.Title: BGMI game lags
rows.Problem: Playing game lagging in A36 5g Bgmi and free fire 45 minutes game start lag
rows.Summarized Problem: The BGMI game experiences significant lag during gameplay, especially at the start of a match.
rows.Severity Reason: The game lags severely during gameplay, which can lead to poor user experience and potential device unresponsiveness.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: End call button takes time to disconnect
rows.Problem: Tapping the red end button does not instantly end a phone call
rows.Summarized Problem: The end call button fails to instantly terminate a phone call.
rows.Severity Reason: The call does not end immediately upon tapping the end button, causing a delay in call termination, but the call is still ultimately ended.
rows.R&D Comment: Call flow shows disconnecting initiated correctly; insufficient log coverage prevents full analysis of delay cause.

rows.Title: Sim UI in Samsung messages seems different
rows.Problem: sim icon circled inside the native samsung messages app
rows.Summarized Problem: The SIM icon appears circled within the native Samsung Messages app.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue is a cosmetic UI change that does not affect device functionality or usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Notifications not shown on display
rows.Problem: The display does not turn on automatically when receiving a message or notification, so no visual alert is shown.
rows.Summarized Problem: The display fails to turn on automatically when receiving notifications, preventing users from seeing visual alerts.
rows.Severity Reason: Users cannot receive visual alerts, making it impossible to know when notifications are received, leading to potential missed communications.

rows.Title: Rear camera showing horizontal lines in every photo

rows.Summarized Problem: The rear camera is now showing horizontal lines in every photo taken.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects all photos and results in visible defects, making images unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause and countermeasure both point to missing logs when Samsung camera opens; further investigation needed to identify root cause and reproduce issue.

rows.Title: Call background appears for all contacts

rows.Title: The device freezes randomly for 30 seconds to 1 minute

rows.Severity Reason: The device freezes for extended periods, making it unusable during those intervals.

rows.Title: proximity sensor not working
rows.Problem: Proximity sensor does not respond properly during calls, screen remains black when phone is removed from ear, takes 5-6 seconds to return to display after call ends.
rows.Summarized Problem: The proximity sensor fails to detect phone removal during calls, causing screen to remain black for 5-6 seconds after the phone is taken out of the ear.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to respond to a basic call interaction, resulting in a screen that remains black during use, which prevents user from seeing the screen when speaking or listening.
rows.R&D Comment: To identify the exact issue point, please record a video during reproduction and attach matching logs.

rows.Title: WiFi gets disconnected automatically
rows.Problem: WiFi automatically gets disconnected and then fails to reconnect. The device crashes immediately upon connecting to a router, and during testing, it only occurs with the "Quantum_5G" router. After the update to Android 16 OneUI 8, the device enters a restart loop on power-on, which was not present before.
rows.Summarized Problem: WiFi connection drops automatically and the device crashes upon connection, particularly with the 'Quantum_5
rows.Severity Reason: The device crashes immediately upon WiFi connection and enters a restart loop on boot, rendering the device unusable until resolved.
rows.R&D Comment: We should check if the issue reproduces with other routers; if so, investigate hardware; if only with 'Quantum_5G', gather router vendor and model details.

rows.R&D Comment: The issue is due to digital gain in low-light environments and is a known phenomenon in smartphones; no improvement is currently possible within hardware limits.

rows.Title: Phone restarting sometimes

rows.Summarized Problem: The phone restarts intermittently, possibly due to a router firmware issue.

rows.R&D Comment: The issue may be caused by a missing field in the TP-link router firmware; updating to the latest firmware (1.0.4 build 20240904 rel.35419) is recommended as a countermeasure.

All Samsung Pass and autofill features are up to date.
