rows.Title: Fingerprint not working
rows.Problem: Fingerprint unlock not working properly
rows.Summarized Problem: Fingerprint unlock is not working properly due to poor image quality from the sensor.
rows.Severity Reason: Fingerprint unlock is a critical biometric function that fails to work, preventing device access.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Poor image quality from fingerprint sensor due to thick protective film, dry fingers, or improper finger placement. Countermeasure: Users should remove thick protective film and use the center part of their fingerprint for enrollment and verification.

rows.Title: Intelligent optimisation is shrinking the photo after capture
rows.Problem: cx facing camera issue
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera's intelligent optimisation feature is shrinking photos after capture, particularly when the face is near the edges of the frame.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a partial malfunction in photo quality, affecting visual accuracy but does not prevent device operation or cause crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by Wide Distortion Correction applied during video processing, which inadvertently shrinks photos when faces are near edges; a countermeasure is already defined to maintain correction effectiveness.

rows.Title: Galaxy Buds 3 Pro not working with wearable application
rows.Problem: Wearable application issue with Galaxy Buds 3 Pro
rows.Summarized Problem: Galaxy Buds 3 Pro fails to connect or is not detected by the Galaxy Wearable application.
rows.Severity Reason: The device cannot be recognized by the wearable app, preventing core functionality such as pairing and synchronization.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause and countermeasure both indicate that the user must reconnect the device and run the Galaxy Wearable app after proper Bluetooth pairing; further investigation needed for root cause of disconnection.

rows.Title: Texts overlaps in S Health app
rows.Problem: Popup windows in Samsung Health have a clear background, causing text to overlap with background text
rows.Summarized Problem: Text in popup windows of Samsung Health overlaps with background text due to a clear background.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes visual overlap but does not prevent functionality or cause device failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Ear speaker sound issue during phone call
rows.Problem: Ear speaker sound issue during phone call voice after update 8.0
rows.Summarized Problem: The ear speaker fails to produce sound during phone calls, especially after updating to version 8.0.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents users from hearing the call, making the device unusable during communication.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Unable to Open Camera
rows.Problem: camera function issue
rows.Summarized Problem: Users are unable to open the camera after the ONE UI 8 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera function fails to open, preventing basic device usage, and is caused by a hardware communication failure between the sensor and host AP.
rows.R&D Comment: Camera sensor hardware fault; recommend customer visit authorized center for inspection and replacement.

rows.Title: Mobile over heated after update
rows.Problem: Device experiencing heating issue after update
rows.Summarized Problem: The device overheats after a software update, particularly during boot-up.
rows.Severity Reason: The heating occurs during normal operation after an update, indicating a partial malfunction rather than a complete failure or device unusability.
rows.R&D Comment: The observed temperature is within normal range; overheating is not a valid concern, and the issue is likely a misperception or user expectation mismatch.

rows.Title: Device heat up during normal usage
rows.Problem: Device facing heating issue
rows.Summarized Problem: The device heats up during normal usage, reaching 41-42 degrees Celsius when playing a heavy gaming app, which is within expected temperature range for such scenarios.
rows.Severity Reason: The heating occurs during typical usage and is within expected limits for high-CPU gaming, but may still be concerning for user comfort and long-term device health.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Network issue after One Ui 8 update
rows.Problem: After One Ui 8 update, my M34 is constantly loosing network
rows.Summarized Problem: The device is constantly losing network connection after the One Ui 8 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The device loses network connection entirely, making it unusable for basic communication functions.
rows.Resolve Type: Issue Fixed(Fixed automatically by Main branch)
rows.R&D Comment: Connection fallback procedure is stuck because MM_RRC_FALLBACK_IND is not sent in Rel15; the fix is to send MM_RRC_FALLBACK_IND regardless of current protocol version.

rows.Title: Camera
rows.Problem: Camera stops and hangs device after 0.6 zoom, repeatedly
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera stops and hangs the device after reaching 0.6 zoom, repeatedly.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera function completely fails and causes device hang, making the device unusable during use.
rows.R&D Comment: Rear ultrawide and front camera sensor failure due to i2c issue; recommend replacing sensors and further hardware analysis.

rows.Title: Unable to connect Galaxy Buds 3 Pro
rows.Problem: Cannot connect Galaxy Buds 3 Pro despite efforts; device paired to Galaxy S24 Ultra but connection fails
rows.Summarized Problem: Galaxy Buds 3 Pro fails to connect to the device despite being paired, indicating a Bluetooth connection issue.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction in Bluetooth pairing, preventing successful connection but not rendering the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Customer believes Buds did not connect; need to verify user experience and get logs during actual connection attempt.

rows.Title: Whatsapp notification is messed up
rows.Problem: WhatsApp notification is messed up, getting same profile picture for two different people
rows.Summarized Problem: WhatsApp notifications display the same profile picture for two different contacts.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction in notification display, affecting user experience but not rendering the device unusable or causing data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: WhatsApp is not correctly forming contact icon drawings due to backend errors in Google SDK usage; countermeasure includes app-side fix in WhatsApp.

rows.Title: portrait video edge detection was worst
rows.Problem: portrait video edge detection was worst and not properly blur the background, one side was not blurred and other side was blur not properly detect edge
rows.Summarized Problem: Portrait video edge detection is not working properly, with inconsistent background blurring and partial edge detection.
rows.Severity Reason: The background blurring fails inconsistently, affecting video quality and usability for content creators who rely on proper edge detection.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue may stem from Single Cam AI misrecognizing background elements as foreground; providing sample videos will help validate and fix the problem.

rows.Title: Pictures not shown in secure folder

rows.Summarized Problem: Photos in the Secure Folder are missing without any user action.
rows.Severity Reason: The disappearance of photos in a secure folder suggests data loss, which renders a key feature unusable.

rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by SPI communication failure, possibly due to FPCB or sensor damage; a restart is recommended, with replacement required if the issue persists.

rows.Title: Network shows full bar but neither internet now call gets connected

rows.Title: Unable to use internet and calls after UI 8 update

rows.Summarized Problem: After UI 8 update, the device shows 5G connectivity but fails to establish internet access, indicating a network registration issue.
rows.Severity Reason: The device shows 5G signal but cannot connect to the internet, making basic functionality like browsing and calling unusable.
rows.Resolve Type: Issue Fixed(Fixed automatically by Main branch)
rows.R&D Comment: Connection fallback procedure is stuck because MM_RRC_FALLBACK_IND is not sent in Rel15; this has been resolved by sending MM_RRC_FALLBACK_IND regardless of protocol version.

Even budget phones have better text alignment and notification expansion.

rows.Title: Google Play Store keep stopping popup occur
rows.Problem: App not opening issue
rows.Summarized Problem: The Google Play Store app is crashing and failing to open on the device.
rows.Severity Reason: The app crashes immediately upon launch, preventing users from accessing the app store which is essential for device functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by a runtime error in Android constraints handling; a code modification is required, and the app developer has advised against addressing low-frequency or non-critical issues.

rows.Title: Banking apps unable to register due to SMS not received in Secure Folder
rows.Problem: Banking apps are unable to register because they cannot access SMS messages within the Secure Folder, preventing two-factor authentication and essential verification processes required by these apps.
rows.Summarized Problem: Banking apps cannot access SMS messages in the Secure Folder, preventing two-factor authentication and disrupting secure app functionality.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents essential security verification processes for banking apps, making it impossible to authenticate and access financial services securely.
rows.R&D Comment: The root cause is that OneUI 8's private profile structure restricts access to messages in the Secure Folder; a countermeasure is to allow banking apps to send SMS verification intents directly to the device with appropriate SIM configuration.

rows.Title: Lock type for secure folder changed to pin after update
rows.Problem: After the One UI update, the Secure Folder only shows PIN option and no longer allows fingerprint or pattern login. User has important files inside and needs help unlocking it.
rows.Summarized Problem: After an update, the Secure Folder no longer supports fingerprint or pattern authentication and only shows PIN option.
rows.Severity Reason: The user can no longer use familiar authentication methods, which affects usability, but the device remains functional and can still be unlocked with PIN.
rows.R&D Comment: Starting with B OS, fingerprints for general and secure folder areas have been separated. Users must register fingerprint in Secure Folder settings to unlock it; if issue persists, reproduce video and dump log are needed.

rows.Title: Image quality is very low and lack of details

rows.R&D Comment: The low image quality occurs when using telephoto lenses with high-frequency scenes like trees and grasses under AI zoom; the issue is due to sensor mismatch and image enhancement behavior, not hardware failure.

rows.Severity Reason: The device is unable to access 5G, a core connectivity function, resulting in complete loss of high-speed data capability, making the device essentially unusable for mobile data.
rows.R&D Comment: This is a network-side issue caused by failure in registration requests; countermeasure requires CP silent logs for further analysis.

rows.Title: Device often goes to No svc

rows.R&D Comment: RX difference is very high, signal strength is very poor and PDN_DISCONN_REJ - esm_cause(UNKNOWN_EPS_BEART_CONTEXT=43). This is a network issue.

rows.Title: Smart Tyre and Bike App Bluetooth force fully shutsdown
rows.Problem: Issues connecting to 'Smart Tyre and Bike' app by JK Tyre causes device to fully shut down when accessing the app. Same issue occurs with Android Auto on a new car with latest infotainment system.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device fully shuts down when attempting to connect to the Smart Tyre and Bike app via Bluetooth.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fully shuts down, rendering it unusable during app access, which is a critical failure in device operation.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause and countermeasure both point to a missing BLUETOOTH_SCAN permission in the app, leading to a SecurityException during Bluetooth scan registration; requires app-level permission fix.

rows.Title: Network problem with Jio SIM card
rows.Problem: Jio SIM card is experiencing connectivity issues despite functioning correctly in other devices. Other carrier SIM cards work properly, but Jio SIM fails to establish network connections. Attempts to resolve via customer support have been unsuccessful.
rows.Summarized Problem: Jio SIM card fails to register on the network, preventing connectivity while other SIMs work normally.
rows.Severity Reason: The SIM card cannot establish network registration, which prevents any connectivity, making the device unusable for calls or data.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: NR5G and LTE registration rejected due to illegal ME and GPRS services not allowed. Countermeasure: Same logs indicate ongoing rejection; no change in behavior, suggesting configuration issue in network registration.

rows.Title: App Blocked popup window occurs when try to open App

rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes intermittent app access failure but does not result in device crash or data loss, allowing partial functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: User can manage app access through Family Link app settings; current issue is a UI popup during theme launch, not a core malfunction.

rows.Title: Gallery not visible in Secure Folder when uploading images

rows.Severity Reason: Users are unable to access essential file functionality in Secure Folder, preventing image uploads and file management.
rows.R&D Comment: This issue needs to be checked in Google Documents UI; registered in Google issue tracker.

rows.Title: Network showing full bar but unable to make calls
rows.Problem: Network shows full tower symbol but unable to make calls; only emergency calls work. Issue persists even after removing SIM and testing on another device. Appears to be a software bug.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device displays a full network tower symbol but fails to establish regular calls, only allowing emergency calls.
rows.Severity Reason: User cannot make regular calls, rendering the device unusable for basic communication functions.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: LTE and GSM attachment rejected due to no suitable cells or IMSI unknown in HLR. Countermeasure: Same logs indicate recurring rejection; software-level fix needed to handle network registration properly.

rows.Title: Noise observed on subject's face
rows.Problem: Camera facing issue
rows.Summarized Problem: Noise is observed on the subject's face when using the front-facing camera.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction in image quality during front-facing camera use, affecting visual clarity but not causing device failure or crash.
rows.R&D Comment: It is difficult to get enough brightness to make low noise and good quality of photo in all condition. To get the optimal exposure in all condition, it has to use High ISO and It makes more noise. Maintaining the right level of sharpness and noise is the process of image quality tuning. We updated a new ISP firmware, but there is only a little improvement.

rows.Title: Extremely high battery drain
rows.Problem: After updating my device to One UI 7 and then One UI 8, I have been experiencing extremely high battery drain. My screen-on time is now reduced to a mere three hours for 60% battery consumption. This issue is paired with frequent device heating, which is quite frustrating for a flagship device barely a year old. I am keeping all non-essential services off when not in use, my background app usage is also minimal, and I don't use any CPU-intensive apps such as games, editors, etc.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device experiences extremely high battery drain and frequent heating after updating to One UI 7 and One UI 8, despite minimal background app usage and disabled non-essential services.
rows.Severity Reason: The battery drain is severe, reducing screen-on time to three hours for 60% consumption, and is accompanied by device heating, making the device unusable for daily use.

rows.Severity Reason: The audio distortion renders calls unusable, significantly impairing communication functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: USB headset sends incorrect data to audio subsystem, causing playback noise; patch available from vendor but cannot be applied due to vendor freeze policy.

rows.Title: Downloading and uploading problem on Samsung members app
rows.Problem: Downloading and uploading problem on Samsung members app, YouTube, Facebook and others platform
rows.Summarized Problem: Users experience issues with downloading and uploading content on the Samsung Members app and other platforms.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects core functionality across multiple platforms, impairing user access to content and services.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Camera stuttering after One UI 8 update
rows.Problem: Camera stuttering after One UI 8 update
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera experiences stuttering after the One UI 8 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction of camera performance during video capture, causing stuttering but not complete failure or device crash.
rows.R&D Comment: We can see OIS hardware failure but as there are no initial logs it is difficult to confirm if OIS acquire has failed. Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Getting shutters while recording video
rows.Problem: Getting shutters while recording video. Dropping frames.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users experience shutters and dropped frames during video recording.
rows.Severity Reason: Dropped frames and visual shutters during recording impair usability and video quality, making content unwatchable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: System UI Not responding
rows.Problem: System UI not responding
rows.Summarized Problem: The system UI is not responding, causing user interface unresponsiveness.
rows.Severity Reason: The system UI is unresponsive, making the device interface unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Smart switch is not working
rows.Problem: Smart switch is not working
rows.Summarized Problem: The smart switch is not functioning properly.
rows.Severity Reason: The smart switch is not working, but the issue is tied to device policy rather than a core system failure, indicating a partial malfunction that can be resolved through administrative configuration.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Navigation bar overlapping
rows.Problem: After the recent One UI 8.0 update, navigation bar at the bottom is overlapping over the buttons making it impossible to click the buttons on that page
rows.Summarized Problem: The navigation bar at the bottom is overlapping over buttons, making them impossible to click.
rows.Severity Reason: Users cannot interact with buttons on the page due to overlapping, rendering key functionality unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Apps are getting automatically closed
rows.Problem: Apps that are slated for deep sleep are being automatically closed from recent apps after about a minute of inactivity in the background, following the UI 8 update. This behavior was not present before the update.
rows.Summarized Problem: Apps are being automatically closed after a minute of inactivity in the background following the UI 8 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes apps to disappear from recent apps, leading to loss of functionality and user frustration, especially for frequently used apps.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Samsung native apps not showing on Gemini
rows.Problem: Samsung native apps are not showing up on Gemini in galaxy s24 snapdragon variant which is newly launched in india during flipkart sale
rows.Summarized Problem: Samsung native apps are not appearing in the Gemini app launcher on the galaxy s24 snapdragon variant.
rows.Severity Reason: The app launcher fails to display native Samsung apps, which are essential for core device functionality and user experience.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Phone's renderer is misbehaving after One ui 8.0 update
rows.Problem: The phone's renderer is misbehaving after One UI 8.0 update, with some screens and texts appearing in white or light mode despite dark mode being enabled. Text on the home screen that was previously white is now dark, and dark text on app lists has become white. This occurs during typing in the search bar.
rows.Summarized Problem: The phone's display renderer is malfunctioning after the One UI 8.0 update, causing incorrect color rendering in dark mode.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes incorrect display of text and UI elements in dark mode, leading to a visible and inconsistent user experience across screens, which compromises usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Now brief not available
rows.Problem: Now brief application is not available after one ui8 update
rows.Summarized Problem: The Now Brief feature is missing after a UI8 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely unavailable after an update, rendering a key functionality of the lock screen non-functional.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Swiping up from middle of screen to go to recent apps
rows.Problem: When swiping up from the middle of the screen to go to recent apps, the active app disappears from the recent screen, though it does not close in the background. The app reopens when clicked, and the issue occurs randomly across multiple apps like Instagram and Brave Browser.
rows.Summarized Problem: Swiping up from the middle of the screen to access recent apps causes the active app to disappear from the recent screen, though it remains open and can be re-opened via app icon.
rows.Severity Reason: The active app disappears during a core navigation action, making it impossible to access the app after swiping, which renders the device unusable for app switching.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Smart View Not working
rows.Problem: Unable to mirror screen on PC/laptop from device while other mobiles connect easily
rows.Summarized Problem: Smart View fails to mirror screen to PC/laptop due to incorrect pre-shared key between device and peer.
rows.Severity Reason: Screen mirroring fails completely, preventing core device functionality such as remote access and usage.
rows.R&D Comment: Connection failure due to incorrect pre-shared key; resolution requires resetting Smart View and Wi-Fi settings on both mobile and peer devices.

rows.Title: Poor quality sound in Dolby Atmos
rows.Problem: issue with equalizer problem
rows.Summarized Problem: The sound quality in Dolby Atmos is poor, likely due to an issue with the equalizer settings or audio processing.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects audio quality but does not cause device crash or complete failure, and may be resolved with equalizer settings adjustment.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Apps inside Secure Folder cannot see or select files in Secure Folder storage for uploads
rows.Problem: File picker inside Secure Folder shows only main phone storage and does not display files from Secure Folder storage, preventing uploads from apps like Brave or Chrome installed within Secure Folder.
rows.Summarized Problem: Apps installed inside Secure Folder cannot access or select files from Secure Folder storage due to a broken file picker.
rows.Severity Reason: The file picker failure prevents users from uploading files, making secure folder functionality unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: This issue needs to be checked in Google Documents UI and has been registered in Google issue tracker.

rows.Title: Tried to remove a card in the quick access but it shows up again and again
rows.Problem: There is a bug in Samsung wallet, when I tried to remove a card in the quick access
rows.Summarized Problem: A bug causes a card to reappear after being removed from the quick access in Samsung Wallet.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves partial malfunction of a feature, where the card reappears after removal, but the device remains usable.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Samsung Calendar App keeps disappearing
rows.Problem: After updating to One UI 8 (Android 16), the Samsung Calendar app shows up briefly after a factory reset or software flash, then vanishes again after restarting. Resetting the phone and multiple software reflashes did not resolve the issue.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Samsung Calendar app disappears after restarts following an OS update, despite factory resets and software reflashes.
rows.Severity Reason: The app fails to remain accessible after restarts, making it unusable for users who rely on it daily.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by a heavy dex2oat process running post-update, which may interfere with app stability; a solution requires optimizing the process or updating the system to improve stability post-upgrade.

rows.Title: Low network coverage
rows.Problem: Galaxy A16 shows only 2 or 1 signal bar indoors, with poor data connection. Same issue occurs with different SIMs in the same location. Vivo V21e shows good signal and data strength under same conditions.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Samsung Galaxy A16 shows weak signal and poor data connection indoors, even with multiple SIMs and same network provider, while a different device shows good performance under identical conditions.
rows.Severity Reason: The device fails to provide adequate network signal and data connectivity indoors, rendering basic functionality (like internet access) unreliable, which is critical for daily use.
rows.R&D Comment: The issue is caused by poor signal reception on the Galaxy A16, and the countermeasure is to provide CP silent logs for further analysis.

rows.Title: Slow Uploading and downloading problem on A35 5G device
rows.Problem: Slow Uploading and downloading problem on A35 5G device
rows.Summarized Problem: The WiFi connection on the A35 5G device experiences slow uploading and downloading.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects core network functionality, leading to poor user experience and potential device unresponsiveness during data transfer.
rows.R&D Comment: The root cause is insufficient log time coverage; the countermeasure is to provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Notification panel pops up suddenly without animation when pulled from edge of screen
rows.Problem: Notification issue when pulling notification panel from edge of screen
rows.Summarized Problem: The notification panel appears suddenly without animation when pulled from the edge of the screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a jarring user experience but does not prevent device operation or cause data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Notifications bar not pulling down when on other apps
rows.Problem: Notifications bar not pulling down when on other apps
rows.Summarized Problem: The notifications bar fails to pull down when the user is on other apps.
rows.Severity Reason: The notifications bar is a core feature of the lock screen, and its failure to function prevents users from accessing notifications, making the device unusable in key scenarios.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Device got stuck/hang
rows.Problem: Screen got stuck
rows.Summarized Problem: The device screen gets stuck, indicating a display freeze during idle states.
rows.Severity Reason: The device screen is completely stuck, making the device unusable and preventing user interaction.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Keyboard functions not working
rows.Problem: Keyboard functions are not working, like swipe to type and suggestions
rows.Summarized Problem: The Samsung keyboard fails to function properly, particularly with swipe typing and suggestion features.
rows.Severity Reason: The keyboard has partial functionality issues, affecting user experience but not rendering the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: This is normal operation due to reduced preloaded languages in OneUI 8.0; users can enable predictive text by downloading language models via settings.

rows.Title: Adaptive clock style not working on lockscreen
rows.Problem: Clock wallpaper issue on lockscreen
rows.Summarized Problem: The adaptive clock style is not functioning on the lock screen.
rows.Severity Reason: The clock style fails to display properly, rendering the lock screen interface unusable or inconsistent.
rows.R&D Comment: Cause: Previous version of LockStar lacked DB field support for Stretch font. Countermeasure: Distribute updated LockStar version with Stretch font DB field support.

rows.Title: Wi-Fi / Bluetooth unresponsive button
rows.Problem: Clicking on Wi-Fi and Bluetooth options does not work; resetting the devices has not resolved the issue, preventing connection to Wi-Fi and hindering office work.
rows.Summarized Problem: Wi-Fi and Bluetooth buttons are unresponsive, preventing device connection to networks and disrupting office work.
rows.Severity Reason: The device cannot connect to Wi-Fi, which is essential for basic office operations, making it unusable for work tasks.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Camera photo quality poor, focus missing, colour dropping
rows.Problem: Samsung S25 Ultra camera has poor photo quality, no focus, colour dropping in both photos and videos, photos are very low quality compared to expectations for a flagship phone
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera on the Samsung S25 Ultra produces low-quality photos with missing focus and colour dropping in both photos and videos.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera fails to deliver basic functionality expected of a flagship device, resulting in unusable photos and a major deficiency in core image capture performance.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Quick Panel spacing set to narrow with quickstar but quick panel shows as default
rows.Problem: Quickstar button spacing resets to default and seconds display in quick panel also resets to default
rows.Summarized Problem: The Quick Panel's button spacing and seconds display reset to default settings after user adjustments.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature partially malfunctions by resetting user preferences, but device remains usable and other functions operate normally.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Charging notification and navigation bar overlapping

rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes visual clutter but does not prevent device operation or cause functional failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Game open in mini window mode

rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Create routine with Get Date and Time and use in Samsung Notes causes hang
rows.Problem: Creating a Samsung routine with Get Date and Time and using the same as variable in Samsung Notes causes hang
rows.Summarized Problem: Creating a routine with Get Date and Time and using it as a variable in Samsung Notes causes the device to hang.
rows.Severity Reason: The device hangs during routine execution, making it unusable until the issue is resolved.

rows.Severity Reason: The feature is not functioning, but the device remains usable and users can switch to alternative audio modes.
rows.R&D Comment: Dolby Atmos Auto mode may have different effects depending on the content. Please select another mode and try it.

rows.Title: Search window opens automatically when attaching book cover keyboard
rows.Problem: Search window opens automatically when attaching book cover keyboard via pogo pins on tab s7 fe one ui 6.1. happens even after cache clear and factory data reset. please resolve the issue its so annoying.
rows.Summarized Problem: The search window opens automatically when the book cover keyboard is attached, even after clearing cache and performing a factory data reset.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes the device to behave unexpectedly upon a common input action, leading to an annoying and disruptive user experience that persists after resets.

rows.Title: Wi-Fi Calling feature has completely failed
rows.Problem: Wi-Fi Calling Not Working: It will not activate, or it drops calls/fail

rows.Severity Reason: The feature fails to activate or drops calls, making voice communication over Wi-Fi unusable.

rows.Title: Battery Drain during Voice Call
rows.Problem: Battery usage during voice calls is high and consistently drains the battery quickly.
rows.Summarized Problem: Battery drains rapidly during voice calls.
rows.Severity Reason: The device experiences significant battery drain during calls, which can lead to rapid depletion and render the device unusable during extended usage.
rows.R&D Comment: Issue scenario logs and battery dumps are missing; future occurrences require immediate log capture and reporting.

rows.Title: Significant noise in video recording
rows.Problem: Noise in video recording when using the camera in Super Steady Video Mode
rows.Summarized Problem: Video recording produces significant noise when using Super Steady Video Mode due to high ISO and short shutter speed.
rows.Severity Reason: The noise occurs during specific usage conditions and affects video quality but does not cause device crash or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Noise occurs in Super Steady Video Mode due to high ISO and short shutter speed; no immediate countermeasure implemented beyond explanation.

rows.Title: Light sensor and magnetic sensor not working
rows.Problem: Light sensor and magnetic sensor not working in galaxy m35 device after receiving the update of one ui 8
rows.Summarized Problem: The light and magnetic sensors are not functioning on the Galaxy M35 after the UI 8 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The sensors are not working, but the issue does not render the device unusable or cause data loss, and appears to be limited to specific sensor functions.
rows.R&D Comment: After reviewing the attached log, all sensors appear to be functioning normally. Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Lockscreen Clock changes location automatically
rows.Problem: Clock style issue
rows.Summarized Problem: The clock on the lock screen changes its location automatically.
rows.Severity Reason: The clock style issue affects appearance but does not cause device malfunction or crash.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: unable to share photos and videos from the secure folder to WhatsApp or any other app outside the secure folder
rows.Problem: I am unable to share photos and videos from the secure folder to WhatsApp or any other app outside the secure folder. If I want to send any photos or videos, I have to first take the photos and videos out of the secure folder, then share them, and then put them back into the secure folder. It's very irritating. Whenever I am selecting any file, any photo, any video and sharing it, this error is coming again and again. This isn't just happening on WhatsApp.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users cannot share photos and videos directly from the secure folder to external apps like WhatsApp without first removing them from the secure folder.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents direct sharing of media from a secure folder, forcing users to manually move files, which disrupts workflow and creates a major usability barrier.
rows.R&D Comment: This issue needs to be checked with Google Documents UI; it has been registered in Google Issue Tracker (https://partnerissuetracker.corp.google.com/u/0/issues/446997790). We will update after Google's review.

rows.Title: 15% battery drain in 1 hour
rows.Problem: Battery drains rapidly during YouTube playback, even with no background apps running. Battery consumption increases when fast forwarding or skipping videos. Previously, background app registrar was enabled and caused higher drain, but it is now disabled.
rows.Summarized Problem: Battery drains quickly during YouTube playback due to high speaker volume, 5G network usage, and high-resolution video playback.
rows.Severity Reason: The device shows significant battery drain in a short time under normal usage, indicating a major power consumption issue that affects usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Battery drain is likely caused by high speaker volume, 5G network, and high-resolution video playback; further investigation needed to confirm environmental factors and validate under consistent conditions.

rows.Title: Bluetooth S Pen cannot rewind or fastforward videos on Amazon Prime, Netflix, Hotstar
rows.Problem: Bluetooth S Pen cannot rewind or fastforward videos on Amazon Prime, Netflix, and Hotstar when flicking left or right. Other functions work, but these specific functions do not.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Bluetooth S Pen fails to rewind or fastforward videos on streaming platforms when using left or right flick gestures.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects specific functionality (rewind/fastforward) during video playback, but does not prevent overall device usage or cause crashes or data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Unable to make call through swipe option

rows.Severity Reason: The feature to make calls via swipe is missing after an update, rendering a key functionality unavailable.

rows.Title: Dolby Atmos feature not working

rows.Summarized Problem: Dolby Atmos feature is not working on Samsung devices with mono speakers after UI 8 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature fails on unsupported hardware (mono speaker) but does not cause device crash or data loss, only affecting audio experience.
rows.R&D Comment: Dolby Atmos is supported only on stereo speaker models; the setting remains unchanged from Android 15, and the issue is hardware-dependent.

rows.Title: Gesture navigation with hints off has blank space at bottom of screen

rows.Title: Lock screen icon colour background issue

rows.Title: Device Wipes All User Data After Power-Off at 0% Battery
rows.Problem: Device erases all user data when battery reaches 0% and powers off, resulting in unexpected factory reset upon recharging and rebooting. This has occurred over 10 times despite troubleshooting.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device deletes all user data when the battery reaches 0% and it powers off, leading to an unexpected factory reset upon restart.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue results in complete data loss, making the device unusable without user data recovery, which is a critical failure.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: video glitching or stuttering while using earphones
rows.Problem: video glitching or stuttering occurs when using streaming applications like Netflix, JioHotstar, and Crunchyroll on earphones, but not on other applications
rows.Summarized Problem: Video stuttering and glitching occurs during streaming on earphones, but not on other apps or when using other devices

rows.Title: Device stopped showing 5g network after UI8 update
rows.Problem: Phone stopped showing 5g network after updating to One UI 8 with Android 16. Despite trying airplane mode, battery saver, removing and reinserting SIM, and rebooting, the device only shows 4g. Data pack for unlimited 5g is being consumed. No 5g connection persists.
rows.Summarized Problem: Device fails to connect to 5g network after One UI 8 update, showing only 4g despite multiple troubleshooting attempts.
rows.Severity Reason: Device cannot connect to 5g, which is a critical network function leading to data loss and user frustration, rendering the device unusable for 5g services.

rows.Title: Camera is failing while open

rows.R&D Comment: Rear Ultra Wide(x0.6) camera has I2C and MIPI errors; CS center should inspect the camera module or related hardware.

rows.Title: System UI crashing and charging stuck

rows.Severity Reason: The system UI crash and charging instability prevent normal device operation and may lead to data loss or device unresponsiveness.

rows.Title: Unable to restore Secure folder backup

rows.Title: Unable to register on YONO SBI app

rows.Severity Reason: The app fails to function entirely, preventing users from accessing banking services, which are essential for device usability.

Countermeasure: Users must contact the app developer directly; this issue should be moved to the 3rd Party App folder and assigned to Mr. Song.

rows.Title: Access to Samsung Gallery for Gemini editing gets stuck

rows.Summarized Problem: 5G internet connection is running slowly on the device.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue involves a partial malfunction of the 5G internet speed, affecting performance but not rendering the device unusable.
rows.R&D Comment: Please provide CP silent logs for the issue.

rows.Title: Photos and videos not present in secure folder after device restart
rows.Problem: Photos and videos saved in the secure folder are missing after clearing cache and restarting the device
rows.Summarized Problem: Photos and videos saved in the secure folder are disappearing after cache clearing and device restart.
rows.Severity Reason: Data loss occurs as user photos and videos vanish, which are critical user content.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Youtube picture quality drops
rows.Problem: youtube picture quality drops
rows.Summarized Problem: YouTube video quality drops to low resolutions such as 36 or 480p.
rows.Severity Reason: Users experience significantly reduced video quality, which impacts viewing experience and usability of the YouTube feature.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Camera app is not working
rows.Problem: My camera is not working and diagnostic test shows an error
rows.Summarized Problem: The camera app is not working and diagnostic tests show an error.
rows.Severity Reason: The camera app is completely non-functional and fails diagnostic tests, preventing basic device usage.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Google search widget not visible on the home screen
rows.Problem: The Google Search widget is no longer visible on the home screen. When tapping and holding the space where it was placed, the widget is selected but does not appear on the screen.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Google Search widget is missing from the home screen and does not display when tapped.
rows.Severity Reason: The widget is not appearing despite being selectable, indicating a partial malfunction in its display function.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Wrong count shown for whatsapp messages in notification
rows.Problem: User facing whatsapp issue with incorrect message count in notifications
rows.Summarized Problem: WhatsApp notifications display an incorrect message count.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes a partial malfunction in message notification display, affecting user experience but not rendering the device unusable or causing data loss.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Adaptive Clock function stops when modes are turned on
rows.Problem: The Adaptive Clock feature in One UI 8 stops working whenever the system changes Modes. As soon as a Mode activates (such as Sleep, Work, or Driving Mode), the Adaptive Clock no longer updates or switches wallpapers. Even after the Mode ends, the Adaptive Clock does not resume functioning automatically.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Adaptive Clock feature stops updating or switching wallpapers when system modes are activated and fails to resume after mode is deactivated.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature completely stops working during mode activation and fails to recover, rendering the lock screen functionality unusable in those scenarios.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Wifi calling turns off automatically
rows.Problem: I have attached a screen recording
rows.Summarized Problem: WiFi calling turns off automatically.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue causes intermittent failure of a key connectivity feature, but does not completely disable device functionality.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Clock animation not working
rows.Problem: Clock animation is not working in Samsung A56
rows.Summarized Problem: The clock animation on the lock screen is not functioning properly in the Samsung A56.
rows.Severity Reason: The clock animation is missing or malfunctioning, which affects visual feedback but does not prevent device usage or cause crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Dual SIM functionalities not working
rows.Problem: Dual-SIM issue after latest software update: when only SIM 1 is inserted, mobile data and SMS do not work; when both SIMs are inserted, SIM 1 shows 'No service' and 'Mobile Networks' and 'SIM Manager' settings are greyed out. Both SIMs work in other phones. Factory reset and software recovery did not fix it.
rows.Summarized Problem: Dual-SIM functionality is failing after a software update, with SIM 1 showing no service and settings being greyed out when both SIMs are used.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue prevents full mobile network functionality and renders the device unusable for dual-SIM operations, including calls and data on one SIM.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Portrait filters missing
rows.Problem: Portrait filters missing in Galaxy A35
rows.Summarized Problem: Portrait filters are missing in the Galaxy A35 device.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is missing in a specific device variant, but the device remains usable overall.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Battery drain
rows.Problem: Battery drain fast after ONE UI 8 update on Galaxy A35. Reset settings, software update, visited service center twice, remote access to Samsung customer support twice. Issue persists.
rows.Summarized Problem: Galaxy A35 experiences rapid battery drain after the ONE UI 8 update.
rows.Severity Reason: The device becomes unusable due to rapid battery drain, significantly limiting functionality and user experience.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Black vertical lines appear in low light
rows.Problem: Vertical black lines appear on the screen during video recording, photo capture, and while viewing through the camera app, especially in low-light conditions. The lines appear randomly and affect both video and image quality.
rows.Summarized Problem: Vertical black lines appear randomly in low light during video and photo capture, affecting image and video quality.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects both video and photo quality in low light, impairing core camera functionality and usability.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Unable to download the update
rows.Problem: The software update fails to start and pauses every time, eventually showing 'couldn't update'. Attempts to resolve via network changes do not work.
rows.Summarized Problem: The device fails to start and complete a software update, resulting in a 'couldn't update' error despite network changes.
rows.Severity Reason: The update process fails to start and complete, preventing the device from receiving critical software updates, rendering the device non-functional until resolved.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Run Linux terminal on Android
rows.Problem: The option for enabling "linux development environment" on my samsung phone is not responding. I can see the ui but it is not responding.
rows.Summarized Problem: The Linux development environment option on the Android settings screen is not responding and fails to function.
rows.Severity Reason: The feature is completely unresponsive, preventing users from accessing a core development tool on the device.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Fingerprint sensor not responding
rows.Problem: Fingerprint sensor not working
rows.Summarized Problem: The fingerprint sensor is not responding and not working.
rows.Severity Reason: The fingerprint sensor is completely non-functional, preventing user authentication and device access.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Lock Screen transition effect not working
rows.Problem: Good lock app issue
rows.Summarized Problem: The transition effect in the lock screen is not working.
rows.Severity Reason: The issue affects the visual experience but does not prevent device usage or cause crashes.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed

rows.Title: Photos lost when moving from secure folder gallery to private album
rows.Problem: User loses photos when attempting to move them from secure folder gallery to private album, receiving 'unable to move' popup.
rows.Summarized Problem: Users lose photos when moving them from secure folder gallery to private album due to an 'unable to move' popup.
rows.Severity Reason: Users lose photos, a critical data loss event, making the issue high severity.
rows.R&D Comment: Further investigation needed
